column17: Arrests: Sixty young men were arrested by Imbonerakure between August 18 and 19 in Kayogoro capital, and taken to the municipal police station. Local sources said the group was sent down from the buses leaving for Tanzania where they claim to work in tobacco plantations.

Six people were beaten up and injured by a group armed with rifles and machetes. Local sources said the victims could recognise three of their attackers: protesters against the third term which had been delivered to the police.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A man was beaten up by Imbonerakure. Imbonerakure accused this CNDD-FDD militant of treating them badly while jogging. Local sources said, after the beating, the attackers forced him to repeat 30 times that he was a dog before being released.

Arrests: Fifty-four people were arrested by police in a bar calls ""Kukaguru"". Local sources said those arrested are all members of a group named Whatsapp RPA in reference to African Public Radio. Police accused them of disseminating rumors and insults against the institutions on social networks. 46 people were released on August 21.

Six people were injured, 3 seriously, in a grenade attack that occurred near a bar. Local sources said the perpetrators and the reasons for this attack are still unknown at this time. Furthermore, they pointed that this same bar, mostly frequented by opposition activists, was the target of a similar attack in February, leaving two dead and three seriously injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 men were assaulted by the Imberonakure with rifles and clubs. 2 were hospitalised and the third died on 24 August.

Property destruction: A house was set on fire by unknown people at 3am. The family was able to escape, but their belongings that were in the house went up in smoke. The reasons and the perpetrators of this incident remain unknown.

The bodies of two young men were found. According to local sources, the victims had their arms tied behind their backs. Also, one of the victims had injuries due to machete blows to the head while the other had rope marks around his neck.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 4 men returning from purchasing food in Rwanda were assaulted by Imbonerakure and local leaders. Their clothes and possessions were also stolen.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 9 people were assaulted on the Butobwe and Karehe hills for failing to join the CNDD-FDD. Their assailants, 6 Imbonerakure, were led by the municipal accountant and the chief of the area (a former FAB member who is intolerant of people who do not join the CNDD-FDD). 1 of the victims is in poor condition and has been transferred to the Kiyanza Health Centre.
A girl was killed and her sister injured in an armed attack carried out by unknown armed men with guns who burst into their home. Investigations are underway.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A resident of Bigwa Hill was beaten, robbed and shot at by a group of gunmen, believed to be Imbonerakure.
Residents of the Kibogoye Hill area trussed and arrested a young man, accusing him of involvement in an armed group. He is being held in the jail in Gihinga.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: During a demonstration in Rugombo, the Imbonerakure chanted slogans against Burundians exiled in Rwanda.

Two people, including a police officer, were kidnapped on August 21 by a group of armed men wearing military uniforms in Nkanga, on the Burundian-Congolese border near Mutimbuzi. The attackers returned to the DRC later on.
Security measures: The police conducted a search of the houses of Kigwati district. No weapons were found.
A decomposed body was discovered in the Vyanda Gitsibo area. Police buried it before it was identified.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure assaulted a man in a bar when he sang about deploying foreign troops in Burundi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security measures: An Imbonerakure militant established a roadblock to stop and check the identities of passers-by. Many victims had money and mobile phones illegally confiscated.

A body that had been killed was discovered. Local sources confirmed that the victim was the beekeeper. Although the perpetrators are unknown, local sources suspect that he was killed by the armed groups in the area.
Non-violent activity: Explosions and gunshots were heard. The local residents panicked, they are afraid of the ex-FAB.

column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Security measures: Police and SNR agents raid the cell of coup suspects in the prison of Gitega. According to local sources, they seized storage disks containing data on the criminal trial on the coup, a radio, a mobile phone and liquor bottles.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man whose goats had been in the eucalyptus plantation of the Commune Administrator. The neighbours intervened but he is in serious condition.

column9: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); Women (Burundi)
column17: Military forces assaulted 2 women and forced them to confess that they facilitated the flow of weapons for the rebels. One of the women is the widow of an ex-FAB who was killed in the attack on Mujejuru Camp on 11 December 2015.

A seventeen-year-old was killed on Thursday in the municipality of Donzi. It was suspected of being involved in the assassination of an Imbonekanure in the same area some weeks ago, while his father is detained on charges on collaboration with armed groups.
A young man disappeared from Musaga. He is believed to have been abducted, although the identities of the perpetrators are unknown.
A young woman who has been accused of collaborating with the police was abducted from her home and shot dead by unknown assailants.
A hairdresser was found dead in Mubuga region.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 men were beaten and stripped of their property by Imbonerakure as they returned home
Security measures: Police prevented people from gathering in groups larger than 4 because of a rumour that rebels had infiltrated the city.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 5 Imbonerakure assaulted a police officer and stole 10,000BIF. One of the Imbonerakure has been arrested.

column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: A young man was arrested and beaten by the Kiganda police. He was then handed over to the intelligence service agents, who further beat him with iron bars. He is accused of being an FNL militant.
A grenade was thrown. No injuries were reported.

Rwandan soldiers shot and killed 2 Burundians who were attempting to cross the river into Rwanda to sell vegetables. The traders were with 9 other people, 8 of whom are currently in custody in Rugombo.
Security measures: Police conducted a household search on 2nd Avenue. No weapons were seized.
An old man was beaten by his neighbours for allegedly practising witchcraft. 2 other men took flight for fear of being lynched

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure gathered in the streets of Rugabano, singing songs denigrating the Rwandan president and saying that Burundi is a sovereign country
A man was beheaded by his neighbours, who believed that he was a witch. Police arrested 3 alleged culprits

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure gathered and sang songs to intimidate the local population
Hundreds of women marched to demand peace and protest the presence of foreign troops

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 2 members of the CNDD-FDD were shot on their way to Mpanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A grenade was thrown at a kiosk, injuring the kiosk owner, and setting the two neighbouring houses alight. This is the second time that this kiosk owner has been targeted. 2 Imbonerakure have been arrested

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: At least 10 people were assaulted by Imbonerakure for violating the curfew by moving around after 6pm.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 youth were beaten by the police officers who came to arrest them. The police were with an Imbonerakure, who denounced the youth for participatinng in anti-Nkurunziza protests. A police officer opposed their arrest.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: 3 women were assaulted by Imbonerakure for supporting the FNL in the elections. 2 of the women recently returned home, having fled during the election.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure searched the house that had welcomed 2 visitors from Kinyinya, and then assaulted the 2 visitors, accusing them of being rebels.
An unidentified armed group killed and mutilated a man with machetes. His wife indicated that one of the men had previously been arrested for investigation.
A man was stabbed while returning from the market

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure forced all traders to contribute BIF500 to contribute to the celebrations for the victory of CNDD-FDD

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure are forcing residents to contribute to the CNDD-FDD celebrations

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure are forcing residents to contribute to the CNDD-FDD celebrations

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Arrests: A FRODEBU militant was arrested for refusing to pay a contribution to support the CNDD-FDD party

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure are forcing residents to contribute to the CNDD-FDD celebrations

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure are forcing residents to contribute to the CNDD-FDD celebrations

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure are forcing residents to contribute to the CNDD-FDD celebrations

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure are forcing residents to contribute to the CNDD-FDD celebrations

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: The local Imbonerakure leader went from household to household forcing people to contribute to the celebrations for the victory of CNDD-FDD. (Contributions ranged from BIF500-BIF2000)

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure are forcing residents to contribute to the CNDD-FDD celebrations

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted an FNL activist, saying that he had no right to speak up in a debate.
On 11 September 2016, a security guard accused of witchcraft was murdered with a knife and machete. 7 people have been arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure are forcing residents to contribute to the CNDD-FDD celebrations
Security measures: Police and soldiers cordoned off an area and searched households for former FAB soldiers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The local Imbonerakure assaulted a beer seller with a belt and sticks when then beer seller was unable to give him money

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat an UPRONA member with sticks because his receipt of payment for the CNDD-FDD contribution was partially torn.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted an FNL activist, saying that he had no right to speak up in a debate.

When police came to arrest a man accused of participating in protests last year, the residents gathered and threw stones to chase the police away. The police fired into the air to try and disperse the rioters.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A Rwasa FNL activist wass arrested, assaulted, and then held in solitary confinement by the Imbonerakure and municipality administrator, who accused him of having said that the presidents mandate was over.
The head of the Rwisabi municipality was assaulted by an unknown group.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Detonation: While the National Intelligence Service were interrogating an NCO, he committed suicide using a grenade.
A grenade was thrown at the family of a senior military official, injuring his wife

column9: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: A grenade was thrown into a household, killing 2 adults and a 2 year old. It is believed that this household was targeted because the head is suspected of recruiting youths for the security forces and National Intelligence Service. The youth in the area have panicked and are fleeing the area because they are afraid of the indiscriminate arrests that follow acts of violence.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security measures: Imbonerakure erected a roadbloack, where they stopped people to ask for proof that they contributed to the CNDD-FDD celebrations and a provincial building project. People without receipts were held until someone could bring them their contribution.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: The head of the CNDD-FDD threatened Pentecostal Christians to make them pay their contributions to CNDD-FDD.
A young man was shot in the early hours of the morning. His body was discovered covered in blood with rope marks.
Employees of the German NGO GIZ were beaten and jailed by the police for not havinng up-to-date household registers. They were released on the following day.
A man from Gisezerana, in Ndora, wass killed by a group of 4 people. One of the killers has been arrested.
A man was shot at by unidentified gunmen while returning home. He is uninjured.
A woman was killed by an unidentified group. They hacked her with machetes, then dragged her into a bush and burned her.
Security measures: The police searched the houses on Nkizi Mujama hill for weapons, following a shooting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was beaten by Imbonerakure because he hid his neighbour, who was wanted by the Imbonerakure.
A grenade was thrown at an empty police car. Another grenade was thrown to disperse the crowd

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure assaulted a couple who refused to raise the CNDD-FDD flag on their property. The local leader intervened and said that they should be allowed to not raise the flag.
Security measures: Police conducted a search of the households between 3rd and 7th streets after grenades were thrown the previous day. No weapons were discovered.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: The head of Murambi hill established a roadblock manned by Imbonerakure and police on the road to Kibago market. Only passers by who had proof that they had contributed to the construction of the Makamba provincial office could pass.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure assaulted a motorcyclist who did not stop at their roadblock.
Prison inmates rioted when police searched their cells. The police fired into the air. 2 policemen were injured

column8: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Arrests: A FRODEBU activist was arrested by the police and taken to the Nyanza-Lac police post.
Residents of Ngozi protested the UN human rights report.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 3 young men attending a party were arrested by National Intelligence Service agents and beaten in a secret dungeon and accused of being fighters with the FDD.
Residents of Ruyigi marched to protest the UN human rights reportr. The march was led by the town and provincial officials.
Parliamentarians and senior executives marched to protest the UN report on human rights in Burundi. All traffic was suspended for the march

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Police and Imbonerakure marched to protest the UN human rights report and the Mahama refugee camp in Rwanda, and Paul Kagame

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Residents of Nyabitsinda and Imbonerakure marched to protest the UN human rights report.
Residents of Marangara protested against the UN human rights report.

Thousands of people, including government officials, MPs, and civilians, staged a march in Bujumbura to protest a report released by the UN condemning the Human Rights abuses committed by the Burundi government and security forces
Residents of Kamaramagambo demonstrated against the UN human rights report. The head of the area forced all businesses to close so that everyone could participate in the march.
A grenade exploded at the house of a former military commander, killing him, his wife, and child.
A grenade was thrown into a house, however there were no injuries.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Residents of Rukeco Mihigoont protested against the UN human rights report. Imbonerakure sang songs saying they need to impregnate girls to bear more Imbonerakure.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Residents of Butezi and Imbonerakure marched to protest the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure protested the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Residents in Gitega protested against the findings of the UN report on human rights violations. The residents were ordered to attend the protest and traders were forced to close their shops by the Imbonerakure.
Residents of Kinyinya protested the UN human rights report. They were forced to participate by the police.
Residents of Nyanza-Lac demonstrated against the UN human rights investigation.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Residents and Imbonerakure protested against the UN report on human rights in Burundi. The Imbonerakure forced traders to close their shops and attend the march.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 Imbonerakure went through the Bitobe hill closing bars and beating people who lingered after the bar was forced to close.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Property destruction: The home of the deputy head of the Imbonerakure was the target of arson

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa militant was assaulted by a group of 7 Imbonerakure because of a political feud.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The head the former FNL combatants was beaten and jailed. He was accused of opposing the Imbonerakure activities in his neighbourhood.

column8: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Arrests: A FRODEBU activist has been detained in the communal jail.
Demonstraters gathered outside the UN headquarters to protest a report criticising Burundi for human rights abuses
Non-violent activity: The headmaster of the school told his students that it was mandatory to participate in the protest against the UN human rights report.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Recruitment: The leader of CNDD-FDD registered Imbonerakure for the police force. Most have been through paramilitary trainning in the eastern DRC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The CNDD-FDD militants marched to demonstrate against resolution HRC33.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An UPRONA militant of the Nditije wing was injured when he was attacked with a machete by 2 Imbonerakure militants.
Corporal Nestor Negamiye was kidnapped from a bar in the Vyuya Zone. His body was discovered on 18/10/2016
Property destruction: Rwandan soldiers demolished a home on an island which both Burundi and Rwanda claim
Protesters demonstrated outside the EU delegation in Bujumbura

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 October 2016, Imbonerakure abducted a university student in Ngozi (Ngozi, Ngozi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure assaulted a man in a local bar. They tried to arrest him for not having his ID card, but a human rights defender and police officer intervened.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A motorcyclist was assaulted by Imbonerakure for interrupting their sports day. They demanded BIF100,000 but he was allowed to leave after paying BIF40,000

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure had erected a roadblock to demand contributions to the Makamba provincial office. Some Tanzanians asked not to pay because they are not from the province, so the Imbonerakure beat them with sticks.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An inhabitant of Coga hill was wounded by an arrow from a patrolling Imbonerakure

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security measures: Imbonerakure carried out a census of people who fled the capital after the anti-Nkurunziza protests. They went from house to house, recording details and photographing the people, who were very afraid.

Non-violent activity: The 2nd Vice President of the National Assembly met the heads of the Ruyigi commune and called on them to be vigilant against people who have fled the country who would seek an opportunity to destabilise the the country.
A man was blindfolded and killed, then left in a palm tree plantation in Rumonge.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure on night patrol were beaten by a group of policemen who were guarding Senator Edward Nduwimana.
A man was strangled and then left near the Kayanza commune. The residents could not recognise him

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: More than a thousand Imbonerakure demonstrated against the UN in Kayanza
Protesters, led by the mayor of Bujumbura and the spokesperson for the Interior Ministry, demonstrated outside the EU and the UN Human Rights Council offices.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 6 young people were beaten and taken to the police cells by Imbonerakure when they returned home late.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Movement of forces: The Imbonerakure of Manga, Rukere, Karama and Ryamukoma hills reportedly received rifles from the authorities to secure the border with Rwanda

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Recruitment: A soldier registered 4 youths as army recruits in the CNDD-FDD party office.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 young men returning home at night were beaten by Imbonerakure, who also stole their cellphones.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 policement beat an Imbonerakure until he lost consciousness after he asked them to pay for a ride on his motorcycle.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The local Imbonerakure leader was stopping and beating passers-by who he decided were opponents and rebels. 3 opposition party members, including an UPRONA activist, were beaten.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A CNDD-FDD party activist was wounded when he was stabbed by strangers.
Some soldiers intervened when an unidentified group shot at civilians, chasing the armed group into the Rusizi National Park. A civilian was wounded.
Non-violent activity: Burundi has banned 3 UN investigators who warned that the country is in danger of genocide.

5 men armed with 3 rifles attacked traders who were returning from the Tora cow market. The inhabitants called the military to their rescue. In the confrontation, thhe soldiers killed 2 of the attackers and captured a third.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Recruitment: CNDD-FDD were making lists of Imbonerakure who will enter the security forces,

A group of about 5 men attacked a bistro in Ruteme. They threw a grenade and fired guns into the room, killing 3 people and injuring 4 people. One of the victims is a communal councilor, who has had death threats

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young man was beaten and detained for failing to attend the commemoration celebrations.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security measures: 50 Imbonerakure blocked off the road for the passing of the senate president.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An ex Fab was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Recruitment: The zone head Imbonerakure called on the Imbonerakure to join the police and military. Many were registered at the meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A FRODEBU militant wass beaten by 2 Imbonerakure under the orders of the chief, who has demanded that he be flogged until he admitted returning from the rebellion in Tanzania

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The Imbonerakure and the area chief beat up a man fromm Mugera in Mishiha. He is accused of denigrating authorities.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure struck a man who he called his opponent with a bottle. He was arrested by other Imbonerakure.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Local officials and residents demonstrated against the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Hundreds of people gathered to demonstrate against the UN human rights report and in support of Burundis decision to withdraw from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Inhabitants of Gitega marched against the UN human rights report and in support of Nkurunzizas decision to withdraw from the ICC. Several government authorities were in attendance.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Hundreds of people gathered to demonstrate against the UN human rights report and in support of Burundis decision to withdraw from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Some 50 CNDD-FDD activists demonstrated against the UN human rights report

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Residents and CNDD-FDD activists marched against the UN human rights report and to support the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC
Unidentified gunmen ambushed a bus of Hope Africa University students. However no one was injured becausee the bus drove away rapidly.
A student was abducted by 2 men in military uniform.
A man was killed and put in a bag. His body was discovered on 17/10/2016. The administrator forbade residents to talk about the discovery of the body.
Looting: A fuel transport vehicle was attacked by an unidentified group. There were no injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa activist was beaten by 5 Imbonerakure because he returned at 20.50, after the 20.00 curfew.
A soldier was beaten and wounded all over his body with bayonets while he was returning from a bar. A soldier has been detained in relation to the incident.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An UPRONA militant wass injured by 2 Imbonerakure in a dispute about politics. He filed a complaint, but nothing has been done.
Gunmen staged an ambush for the vehicle of a local trader in Nyagasasa. The police and army intervened and broke up the ambush. No one was injured

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 people were injured when Imbonerakure came to a neighbourhood to hunt down FNL Rwasa militants.
A grenade was thrown into the truck station in Rutegama hill, Gitega. There were no recorded casualties.
A trader from Mpotsa hill was abducted by men in police uniforms driving a civilian vehicle. He is accused of supporting rebel movements.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a youth and threw his meat on the ground. The youths father fought the Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young man was beaten and robbed of BIF100,000 by Imbonerakure
A 6-year-old was killed for unknown reasons. His body was discovered on 19/10/2016

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 4 Imbonerakure assaulted a man and confiscated his bike to punish him for being out at 21.00, after the curfew. He reclaimed his bike by paying BIF20,000 the next day.
A young man was beaten and died in a latrine on the Mukoro hill. He is believed to have been targeted for having participated in the protests against Nkurunzizas 3rd term

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: An FNL Rwasa activist was tied up and beaten to death by Imbonerakure fromm the Rwandagaro hill in the presence of local CNDD-FDD leaders. They accused him of belonging to a rebel movement.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure beat a man with a stone, accusing him of being a bad Tutsi
Security measures: Police searched the house of a police deserter.
A grenade was thrown by an unidentified group between 1st and 2nd avenues. There were no injuries.

1 person was killed and 1 person was wounded when an unidentified group armed with rifles attacked a bistro. 1 of the victims is head of this hill. 2 people, including an ex-FAB, were arrested for investigation.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The Imbonerakure threatened the displaced people in Tangara by demonstrating on the street with clubs.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Bakenyarerugamba: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Bakenyarerugamba Faction)
column17: A girl was beaten by the women's league of the CNDD-FDD for returning after the curfew. The female wing has been encouraged to ""correct"" women
A policeman raped a young girl. He has been detained in Cibitoke.
A grenade was thrown at a Gihanga villager as he was walking home. The perpetrators have not been identified, although local people suspect the Rice Growers Association, of which he was president.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa activist was beaten by 3 Imbonerakure. He believes that he was targeted because he spoke out against the recruitment of Imbonerakure into the police. 2 of the Imbonerakure have been arrested, the 3rd is a relative of the head of Rugenge hill

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A young CNDD was tied up and beaten by 8 Imbonerakure youth

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 UPRONA activists were beaten by 7 Imbonerakure who wanted them to pay a fine with a crate of beer. One was executed, the other was beaten all night.
A 6 year old was killed and decapitated. Her body was found in a valley.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Men (Burundi)
column17: A young man was beaten and stripped by Imbonerakure who accused him of failing to stop for their patrol.
A youth was called away from his home and then shot by unidentified gunmen. It is believed that the killing is in response to his involvement in either the FNL or the Imbonerakure

The military from the Burundi Tea Office Plant were chasing students who were accused of participating in demonstrations against Nkurunzizas 3rd term. An old man was beaten for not revealing the location of the students. Local residents heard weapons fire during the chase.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure was beaten by the other Imbonerakure at the order of the communal leader for having said that patrols are unnecessary.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Teachers (Burundi)
column17: A CNDD-FDD militant and teacher went missing on 25 October when he returned fromm Tanzania.
10 armed men attacked 5 households on the Mweya sub-hill. They beat the heads of households. The victims claim that the perpetrators were wearing military uniforms.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Burundi)
column17: Non-violent activity: The head of the Gitara municipality prevented the Red Cross from distributing food for destitute returnees, accusing the Red Cross of supplying the rebels.
A woman was killed by unidentified assailants. She has been accused of witchcraft

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted an Imbonerakure to punish him for failing to attend a patrol to find a young man alleged to have participated in the anti-3rd mandate demonstrations.
Security measures: The police carried out a search of households in the Swahili district of Makamba, no weapons were found.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted people with belts and batons to force them to attend the opening of a medical centre and a school by the president. 2 seriously injured people are being treated in hospital.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure were searching FNL Rwasa militants homes in Matongo, accusing them of stealing solar panels. They tortured 6 men. 1 has died from the wounds, the other 5 are in prison.
Security measures: Police conducted a search in Nyakabiga 1.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 FNL Rwasa militants were beaten (1 to death) by 5 Imbonerakure, who accused them of stealing solar panels. 5 people have been jailed although human rights defenders claim that the real culprits remain untraceable.
A Burundian was shot dead by the Rwandan military on Lake Rweru.
An alleged thief wass beaten and killed by a group of people in Muzenze in an act of vigilante justice.
A woman and her daughter, Sylvie and Sabelle Kamana, were stabbed by unidentified assailants. 3 men have been arrested.
2 church leaders were kidnapped by an unidentified group, which claims to be fighting the power of Nkurunziza. They are reportedly being held in the Rukoko nature reserve.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Non-violent activity: The president of the CNDD-FDD on Kejari hill held a meeting in which he threatened all people who are not members of CNDD-FDD with violence and accused them of plotting a coup.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 young Imbonerakure went missing. Investigations are underway to find them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The head of the Makamba Imbonerakure assaulted a man, accusing him of stealing his cellphone and refusing to join the CNDD-FDD party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure intimidated and threatened a man with death to force him to reveal information about a family who had fled into exile.
8 policemen picked up 2 youths and tortured them while they drove around Gitega.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD party member entered the home of an FNL Agathon Rwasa member and assaulted him and his family. He was then arrested.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: The head of the FRODEBU on Kibasi hill was attacked by unidentified assailants wielding a machete. He was rescued by his neighbours.
Security measures: Police conducted a household search starting at 5am. They threatened domestic workers to intimidate them into revealing the hiding places of Rwandan rebels.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: An FNL Agathon Rwasa activist was beaten by members of the ruling party who are her brothers-in-law.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A Rwandan shepherd was abducted by 5 Imbonerakure while following a stray cow.
A cell leader was stabbed in the throat by unidentified men. It is believed that the incident is as a result of a land dispute.
A 12 year old Twa boy was hanged. The reasons for his death are unclear, but the Twa and Hutus live in a constant state of tension on the Kayange Hill. 3 suspects have been arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young Twa man was tied up and beaten by 3 Imbonerakure. The police untied him, but the chief of the hill did not intervene.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a demonstration to commemorate the death of an Imbonerakure during the May 2015 demonstrations. There was high police protection for the protesters.
An unidentified youth who had been arrested and trussed up by the police fell out of the car and injured his head.
Non-violent activity: The Governor of the province has ordered the heads of sectors and services to collect BIF2000-5000 from all civil servants, traders and growers to welcome the president.
A man and his son were attacked by armed assailants. The man was beheaded and the son is in hospital suffering from stab wounds. This family was the target of a grenade attack last year.
An armed group, believed to be the FNL Nzabapempa based in Easter DRC, attacked Kagwema village at 20.30. The police quickly intervened.
A widow and her 2 children were murdered by assailants armed with knives. 5 people have been arrested.
The head of Makamba was beaten by the provincial police sub-commissioner, who was securing the presidents route to the senate.
A man was beaten to death by unidentified people.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure severely assaulted a man over a domestic dispute.
A man was killed and his body left in a sugar cane field. The provincial governor and police commissioner are making enquiries.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a demonstration to commemorate Imbonerakure deaths during the May 2015 demonstrations. There was high police protection for the protesters.
An ex-FAB who lives secretly in Burambi as a driver was abducted by men in police uniform, who blindfolded, beat him, and dumped him in an alley.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The director of Gitega and 5 other CNDD-FDD officials beat a woman who is the civil status officer in Mukoro.
A man was stabbed in the face repeatedly. His body was discovered in Murwi.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Several hundred Imbonerakure staged a protest to commemorate the deaths of 6 Imbonerakure during the protests against Nkurunzizas 3rd term.
A civilian was shot and then decapitated by a machete by an unidentified armed group. It is believed that he was targeted in a land dispute.
Non-violent activity: Local officials are required to use force to collect the money needed to build the provincial office
A group of unidentified armed men attacked residents of Musha hill with machetes. 2 people are being treated at the hospital.

Non-violent activity: The Makamba provincial governor charged BIF40,000 for his signature on a document and another resident was forced to pay BIF20,000 for permission to open a health centre. These contributions will go to the building of the provincial office.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who they accused of being a rainmaker.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Authorities went from household to household to collect a sum of BIF5000 per household for the construction of the office of the head of the hill. They were accompanied by ruling party activists

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A FRODEBU activist was beaten by the provincial police commissioner when he refused to hand over his phone.
A group of people beat a 15 year old to death.
Non-violent activity: Teachers at Makamba schools complain that they are being forced to pay BIF2,500 contribution to the celebration of the fighter.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A FRODEBU activist was assaulted by 2 Imbonerakure who accused him of insulting the head of the hill. These Imbonerakure were briefly arrested on the following day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure dressed in military fatigues assaulted 3 people who are Twa.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure and 3 policemen extorted money from motorcycle owners.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A pupil died after being beaten by Imbonerakure at a public meeting held by the administrator for pacification.
A student went missing on 21/11/16.
An old man was found decapitated. His neighbours believed he was a rainmaker.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure on night patrol arrested and beat an employee of FVS, accusing him of being a rebel. He has complainned to the OPJ, but they have not taken any action.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure beat the leader of the hill because he had deviated from the standard training routine. He was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure threatened and tortured a member of UPRONA, forcing him to swim in the river for 3 hours.

5 men were attacked by a group of unidentified men wielding machetes. 1 man has died from the injuries. People in the area believe that they were rebels, but the Administrator claims that they were sheep-stealers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security measures: The chief of Rubimba hill and 2 Imbonerakure force-searched an UPRONA activist.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Burundi)
column17: The Manasseh appointed member of the Burundi Red Cross was beaten by Imbonerakure for not putting children on the list of beneficiaries of CRB.
Non-violent activity: The governor and his advisors enforced the collection of taxes from vendors in the market place.
Non-violent activity: The Provincial Director of Education demanded a list of all teachers with their ethnic and regional background. This has caused consternation.
2 police officers assaulted a man who they accused of insulting them. He is being held in custody.
Security measures: Police carried out a household search early in the morning.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 23 November. SNR agents forcibly disappeared a civilian from Kajaga, Bujumbura Rural.
The head of the Bweru police arrested and beat a man who did not have his identity card. He was accused of belonging to a rebel group. He was eventually discharged after paying BIF30,000
Men in civilian clothes in an unregistered truck abducted a man in Cibitoke.
A group of people tried to force the police to release a detainee arrested after a mob beat a 15 year old. Police fired on the crowd, injuring a woman and a child

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in the company of a police officer beat people who were caught at an illegal brewery. The brewery manager paid the Imbonerakure BIF7,000 so was not beaten. The policeman was later arrested.
Property destruction: The governor ordered the destruction of the house of a merchant becauee he no longer contributes to the CNDD-FDD party
Non-violent activity: Teachers have been required to provide details about their name, ethnic group, and political party affiliation.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD members demonstrated against the UN report denouncing Burundi. The Secretary General of CNDD-FDD blamed Belgium.
People were forced to attend a demonstration against the sending of foreign experts to Burundi.
Arrests: A former military commander was arrested and his home was searched.

column7: Government of Burundi (2005-); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the government and CNDD-FDD held a demonstration against the arrival of foreign forces in Burundi. Shops and kiosks were forced to close.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An UPRONA activist was beaten up by 3 Imbonerakure who accused him of planting the UPRONA flag in an inappropriate place.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An imbonerakure attacked a local administrator with a primus bottle. They have been arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat people who they accused of being absent from the protests against the UN in Burundi.

column7: Government of Burundi (2005-); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The mayor organised a demonstration against the arrival of foreign forces in Burundi. Participation was compulsory
Members of the government of Ruyigi province held a demonstration against the arrival of foreign forces in Burundi. Shops and kiosks were forced to close.
The governor held a protest against the arrival of foreign forces in Burundi. All shops were forced to close.
Members of the government of Ruyigi province held a demonstration against the arrival of foreign forces in Burundi. Shops and kiosks were forced to close.

column7: Government of Burundi (2005-);Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: The administration organised demonstrations to protest the UN investigation team. Traders were forced to attend by the police

Thousands of people, led by the mayor of Bujumbura, protested in support of Nkurunzizas opposition to the UN human rights probe. Sources indicate that many of the protesters attended because they feared retribution if they were not present.
Protesters held a sit-in outside the Belgian embassy to protest a meeting between Belgium and Burundian opposition party members.
A man who was pleading for the release of citizens was shot by the police.
A man living on Rwasazi hill was attacked by unidentified men in unoform.
A citizen was assaulted by a police officer for not having participated in community service.
An FNL Havyarimana was cycling when he wass attacked by unidentified assailants.
Arrests: Following rumours of the presence of rebels, a search was conducted. 30 people were arrested, some were tied up and taken to the police station for questioning.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure raped a 10 year old girl. He has been arrested and detained by the police.
Non-violent activity: The municipal director of education gave an order that all teachers would be forced to donate 3% of their salary for the building of a municipal stadium.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: An FDD veteran was tied to a tree and beaten for having brought a summons from the OPJ

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A member of the CNDD-FDD was attacked by 4 people. He died of his wounds.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 men and 2 women who had travelled to Rwanda were ambushed by 3 Imbonerakure at the border. They were beaten up and accused of collaborating with the Rwandan rebels.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Recruitment: Imbonerakure conducted a paramilitary training exercise in town, singing intimidating songs
A shopkeeper was abducted by unidentified agents.
A cow seller, Nzorabande, was killed by unidentified people. His body was found the next day.
The senior communication adviser, Willy Nyamitwe, was attacked by gunmen in an ambush near his home. He was injured and a bodyguard was killed.
A young man was attacked, forced to lie prone and shot by unidentified assailants.
Non-violent activity: The governor of Makamba summoned all motorcyclists to Makamba town and forced them to pay BIF2,000 to assist with the building of the provincial office

Non-violent activity: The Municipal Director of Education forced a school headmaster to fire a teacher who is not a member of the ruling party. He has said that all teachers in local schools must be members of the ruling party
A grenade was thrown and shots were fired at the military post in the Kayero market. No injuries have been recorded.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure bullied and intimidated people ar the mass sport event. They continue to patrol every night

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 12 Batwa activists beat CNDD-FDD activist who were returning from demonstrations against Rwanda and Rwandan President Kagame.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure beat an UPRONA activist unconscious when he was leaving a bar. He was accused of insulting the ruling party youths.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: The FNL Rwasa leader was arrested, beaten and detained by 2 Imbonerakure, who accused him of spending the night with prostitutes. He was released when his family paid BIF200,000
A young student in uniform was abducted by men in police uniforms driving a pick-up.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man returning from Rwanda was severely beaten by the Imbonerakure leader, who accused him of fleeing. He was rescued by another inhabitant.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: The leader of the FNL Agathon Rwasa was beaten by the head of the imbonerakure, who accused him of opposing the regime.
Security measures: A search was conducted early in the morning on the 55th Armoured Commando of Makamba. The search targeted the barracks of former FABs and members of the FNL.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 7 December 2016, police SNR forceably disappeared a Rwandan civilian in Ngagara (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Police and Imbonerakure tied up and assaulted the 12 men who had been arrested the previous day (and one other man). They were then carried to an unknown destination.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: Imbonerakure forced a traveller to pay BIF10,000 to pass through the Kigeri border.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An imbonerakure assaulted a man who he accused of being a sorcerer. The chief of the hill intervened to stop them.
Security measures: A search on all households was carried out very early in the morning. The object wass to find rebels from Rwanda, but none were discovered.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service; Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: Security measures: Police, military and SNR conducted a search of a former peacekeepers house, where they found grenades and ammunition.
The Womens Friends Association organised a march to protest violence against women.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy; Men (Burundi)
column17: An MSD supporter was assaulted and stripped by imbonerakure on his way home in the evening.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: Remy Ntishumbushwa was kidnapped by the Intelligence forces in downtown Bujumbura. His family have established that he is being held in the dungeons of the presidential palace.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The Gitwe hill councillor was severely assaulted by Imbonerakure. He had been in hiding because he was afraid of being attacked, but was lured out of his house by a neighbour.

column7: AJAP: Association for Progressive African Youth
column17: AJAP youth held a demonstration in support of the government and security forces. All participants had to have their attendance signed for by the group presidents.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man and a woman were arrested and beaten by 4 Imbonerakure at around 7pm because they broke the curfew. The Imbonerakure took BIF10,000 from the woman.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure demonstrated against Belgium, Rwanda, the EU and the UN in Cankuzo. They reminded people to fight anyone who tries to take power from CNDD-FDD

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man and his wife were beaten by Imbonerakure because they were working in their fields instead of contributing to the communal construction project.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure assaulted a man in a bar. They accused him of being an opponent of the regime. The police came to investigate and took the man to the police station.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure disrupted a group of Rwasa supporters in a house. They tied them up and asssaulted them with clubs and machetes. The Rwasa supporters were held in custody for 2 days and then released.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa activist was assaulted by the head of the communal police in a bar. The policeman demanded to know whether the activist supported Nkurunzizas 3rd term. When the activist was silent, the policeman began to beat him.
A man called Nyandwi was found decapitated in the bush. He had disappeared 2 days previously.
Security measures: Police conducted an early-morning search on the house of a man who is currently in prison for presumed collaboration with the rebels.
A policeman fired shots to stop speeding motorcyclists. They then attacked him.
A young woman was assaulted by police officers who were attempting to arrest her over a payment dispute. A journalist who witnessed the scene was threatened with violence if he reported the incident.
The body of Nimbona, a man imprisoned because he is believed to have killed General Nshirimana, was discovered. He had been tied up and hit on the head.
Security measures: Police and Imbonerakure cordoned off a school and conducted a search of all the students.
Unidentified men assaulted a man. Police say they are investigating the incident.
Security measures: The governor of Makamba shut the bar run by a military official on the grounds that it is used to hold clandestine meetings. The governor is cracking down on bars in Makamba.
The warden of Ngagara was abducted and detained by 2 men driving a landcruiser vehicle. It is believed that he is considered to be disrespectful of the authorities.
On 15 December 2016, a group of people armed with clubs and machetes attacked a household at midnight, accusing the household of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man in the street, who they accused of stealing.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure entered a household at 7.30pm, saying they were searching for weapons. They assaulted the inhabitants, so severely that one has lost a finger.
Security measures: The governor of Makamba stopped a car and intimidated and threatened the passengers for an hour.

2 armed men broke into the Phoenicia Hotel in Bururi, where they threw grenades and fired at people. The attack left 7 injured, including 3 policemen. 20 people have been arrested following the attack.
A group of unidentified armed men attacked the Musha Hill Market on the night of 17/12. They went into the market and started shooting, seriously wounding 2 people.
Unidentified men armed with pistols abducted an unidentified boy outside the US Embassy.
A woman was killed when a grenade was thrown at her family while they were resting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A bicycle taxi driver was arrested, tied up, and beaten by Imbonerakure because he was not carrying his ID. They accused him of belonging to a rebel group.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A small-trader who was collecting a debt from another person was delivered to the Imbonerakure, who beat him. He was then imprisoned for 2 days.
Unidentified people set off grenade at 10pm in Rureng. A man and a woman riding a motorcycle were caught in the blast. The woman was killed and the man seriously injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: A member of MSD was assaulted by a member of the CNDD-FDD. His assailant threatened to kill him if he did not adhere to CNDD-FDD

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was tortured and imprisoned by Imbonerakure. He was accused of criticising the administration.
The governor of Makamba discovered 11 people watching a video together during a curfew patrol. He had them severely beaten.
A woman was abducted and tortured. Her arm was cut off and she was killed. Her body was found two days later near her home.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A woman was attacked by a CNDD-FDD, then later in the evening her house was burned down.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Benoit Sindayigaya wass arrested by the SNR in Rutana and tortured for 2 hours. When his mother protested about his torture, she and her other children were assaulted by the SNR and Imbonerakure.
A Batwa man was beaten to death.
3 youths were arrested and put in a common cell. One was tortured with sticks.
A man who had fought a policeman in a bar was arrested and detained. In the police cells he was assaulted by 2 policemen

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man and threw his unconscious body in a cornfield because he is not a member of CNDD-FDD

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A 17 year old boy was beaten by 3 Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A woman was assaulted by Imbonerakure at around 7pm.
Unidentified people detonated 2 grenades in a road in Kamenge at 22.00. There was no traffic, so no one was injured.
A man, his wife, and their child were attacked and killed by an unidentified group armed with machetes as they returned home at 20.00

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who had argued with his wife. She pleaded that they not arrest him because their quarrel was domestic.
A man who had been accused of being a rainmaker was killed because of the lack of rains.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A restaurant waiter was beaten by Imbonerakure until he lost consciousness
29 December. Police forces forcibly disappeared a civilian in Gitega province.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was arrested and beaten up because the police accused him of stealing the deputy head of the commune's kepi. The police and imbonerakure threatened to shoot him in the head and made him pay BIF300,000 to avoid going to prison.
A young girl was attacked by unidentified assailants and seriously wounded.
30 December. An unidentified armed group abducted a civilian from Rutana province.
A shopkeeper was abducted.
One man killed by unknown gunmen in a car driving through Nyakabiga.
Boy wounded by bullet in Buterere.
8 people were injured when a grenade exploded in the Church of Heaven. The pastor has been arrested.
The Burundi Minister of the Environment, Emmanuel Niyokuru, was killed by gunmen on his way home.

A transmission agent for the local police commissioner assaulted 2 men with his belt and fined them BIF100,000. He accused them of having been at a clandestine meeting because they were returning from a bar. The next day the police returned the money to the men so that would not file a case.
A woman disappeared from a Gikungu bar. 4 days later her body was found on the shores of Lake Tanganyika.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure staged a march to protest against Rwanda.
A policeman shot at 2 young boys who were herding cattle, killing one and injuring the other.
A staff member of the NGO CARE was abducted by policemen and driven to Bugarama in a civilian car.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a man until he lost consciousness because he refused to buy them a drink.
A student detonated a grenade at school, which killed him.
On 10 January 2017, 2 people suspected of witchcraft were killed by their neighbours, who wielded clubs and machetes.
Construction workers discovered a mass grave in Rusaka. 6 skulls have been found.
3 families were attacked by unknown assailants wielding cudgels. The families were told that they were attacked because they were known to support General Niyombare.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An imbonerakure assaulted the head of the hill who had demanded a fine.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD party activist was attacked by unknown assailants.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 men were decapitated and dismembered by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure accused a man of stealing a goat and beat him to death. They were arrested but released soon after.
A woman was killed by villagers, who believed that she was a witch.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man and a woman and locked them up. The imbonerakure accused them of adultery, but it is believed that they were targeted because the woman is from Musaga, a hot spot during the anti-Nkurunziza protests.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD militant was killed by unidentified assailants. His body was found on 14 January
Unidentified armed men killed 2 men and a child in a shooting in Muyira. 6 people have been arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In January 2017, Imbonerakure members abducted a man in Rumonge province. He has not been seen since and is assumed dead but not confirmed.
A man was arrested by the police. His body was discovered the next day by the cowherds. The local authorities issued an urgent order to bury the boy without an investigation.
A man was arrested and beaten by order of the head of the police post, who heard him insulting the police while drunk.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure attacked an FNL Agathon Rwasa member with machetes. They accused him of having left the CNDD-FDD.
The police carried out a household search. They assaulted a man who resisted them when they attempted to enter his house.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Unidentified armed men attacked the household of a member of FNL Rwasa. He was injured. One of the attackers was also injured, when neighbours came to his rescue.
A man accused of witchcraft was killed. 10 people have been arrested.
2 brothers were attacked by people throwing grenades at around 11pm. 1 died on the spot and the other was wounded.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure attacked a couple who support UPRONA with machetes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was attacked in a bar for resisting joining the ruling party.
When soldiers discovered a grenade on a plot, they beat the girl who lived there with their rifle butts until the Deputy Head of the hill intervened.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure clubbed a man to death when he was caught in an act of robbery in a field of beans.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The administrator of the commune was attacked by Imbonerakure in his home.
Police assaulted a young man near the Musaga market. When onlookers attempted to help him, they chased them away.
A shepherd was killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 9 youth who did not have identity documents were assaulted by Imbonerakure and then taken to the communal police station.

Unidentified gunmen attacked Mukoni Military camp in the early hours of Tuesday morning. Following this incident a patrol went out and burned the savannah where the gunmen were reportedly hiding to flush them out.
A woman's body was found in her home, hacked by machetes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An imbonerakure raped a 14 year old school girl as she returned home.

Following the an attack on the Mukoni camp, Warrant Officer Francis Nkunzimana and around 30 other soldiers were arrested and handed over to the police. The next day Nkunzimana's body was found on the savannah, riddled with bullets, along with two other bodies. One of the other soldiers arrested was beheaded. The other soldiers complained of severe torture.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: The CNDD-FDD leader of the Baziro area beat an FNL Rwasa supporter at around 7pm for opposing the payment of contributions to the party building project.
Between 7pm and 8pm police overturned stalls and forced traders to close their shops. The traders grew angry and threw stones at the police. The police fired into the air to disperse the crowd.
A body was found on 28/1. The victim was wearing handcuffs and had been shot in the head.
Major Dieudonne Karashira was killed at Cankuzo Military camp. A man has been arrested in response.
Agreement: The government of Burundi released 2,500 prisoners (nearly a quarter of the prison population)

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure marched to demonstrate against the EU report which criticised the Burundian government.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.
A retired banker was attacked by people wearing military clothes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure detained and assaulted a policeman. He was advised by the local head of the police not to report the incident in order to keep the peace.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.
The head of the Kivyuka Police Station arrested and beat passengers on a taxi travelling at around 7.15pm. He was angry that they were travelling so late, and accused them of possessing weapons.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
