column17: 5 Imbonerakure assaulted an UPRONA supporter who they accused of participating in the assassination of a chief.
8 policemen entered a household and attempted to arrest 6 people. When one of the men resisted arrest, they beat and tortured him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure ambushed a man returning from a bar and accused him of trafficking drugs. They forced him to undress and beat him for 2 hours.
2 men were attacked by a group of 15 unidentified armed men, wielding machetes.
A woman whose husband had left for Tanzania and her 5 year old child were killed by unidentified assailants.
A man was stabbed to death by unidentified armed forces. His body was found in a field.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure had erected a roadblock to check that all travellers had paid the mandatory contribution to building the stadium. A minibus attempted to get past the barrier and was assaulted by the Imbonerakure. He called the police, who came to break up the roadblock.
An armed group attacked the shops in Rukaramu. Soldiers apprehended and fought them. The armed group fled, abducting 3 people.
A man from Kiranda hill was wounded in a machete attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The head of the Imbonerakure on Gatabo Hill beat and arrested a former CNDD-FDD leader from the region. He accused the CNDD-FDD leader of disrupting security by speaking loudly inside his house.
A man was shot by unidentified gunmen.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A FRODEBU activist wass beaten to death by a crowd of residents who accused him of having stolen a bag of rice.
2 people were killed and another seriously injured in an attack by unidentified gunmen in Gatumba. In the same attack another 6 people were abducted and reportedly taken to the DRC.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure created a roadblock to carry out identity checks on passers-by. They confiscated people's bicycles and made them sit on the ground. 6 people who resisted the Imbonerakure were beaten.

column7: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo); Aid Workers (Burundi)
column17: Refugees from Kavumu Camp demonstrated against the delay in food delivery. They began to throw stones at the WFP and UNHCR workers. Police disrupted the demonstration by firing into the air.
A man who was recently released from prison was attacked. He was wounded in the head and left to die.
A military major in civilian clothing was arrested by a policeman at a roadblock. When he demanded to know why he had been arrested, the policeman beat him and confiscated his phone.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The police and Imbonerakure carried out an identity check. 50 people without identity cards were arrested. The Imbonerakure beat them and accused them of being thieves and criminals.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A group of Imbonerakure assaulted a man who had attempted to preempt a thief.
A man was beaten to death.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: The communal head of FRODEBU was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure, wielding metal whips.
A demonstration against the human rights report was led by the Governor of Gitega Province and other MPs.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A member of the FRODEBU party was assaulted in a bar by the National Intelligence Service. They accused him of launching bombs.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march at 3am, they ran through the streets singing intimidating songs. Residents were afraid that they were being attacked.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the human rights report. Imbonerakure assaulted passers-by.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 Imbonerakure who had noticed that a man had been taking photographs of a demonstration on his cell phone confiscated his cell phone and assaulted him.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Students (Burundi)
column17: A demonstration against the human rights report was held in Rutegama after the Saturday community work. The students from the Lycee Communal were forced to attend both the community work and the demonstration.
A local official and MPs led a march against the human rights report. Residents were threatened with fines of BIF50,000 if they did not participate in community work and the march.
After Saturday community work, everyone was forced by the authorities to participate in a demonstration against the human rights report.
The authorities and heads of departments organised a demonstration against the UN report. Attendance was compulsory for high school students and government workers.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a demonstration to protest against the EU.
A security guard for Tanganyika Sugar Company in Gihanga was abducted from his post. His mutilated body was discovered 2 days later.
A caretaker of the Tanganyika Sugar Company was abducted. His decapitated body was discovered 2 days later.
A motorcyclist was arrested and beaten by 2 policemen. When they dumped him at the IDP camp in Bugendana, people were outraged over his condition. The police fired into the air to disperse the crowd.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man who was accused of embezzling money was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa activist was abducted by Imbonerakure. He was beaten and then held in the police cells. He is in critical condition
A man who the CNDD-FDD had been pressuring to join the party was attacked in his home. His wife and neighbour were killed. The family believes that the perpetrators are CNDD-FDD militants
A man was hacked to death by a machete.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure was beaten by other Imbonerakure for missing the protest on 11 February.
A man was kidnapped by unidentified assailants. He was discovered 2 days later.

column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: The head of the Rutegama police post beat up an FNL Rwasa supporter who tried to intervene in a dispute between the police chief and some motorcyclists.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A young man was abducted by Imbonerakure. He was held by the SNR, but has subsequently disappeared.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.
Civil Society organisations close to the CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure assaulted a disabled person and stole his wheelchair.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 30 members of FML Rwasa who were meeting were attacked by Imbonerakure.
An ex-FAB disappeared from his home.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: In late February 2017, the 28-year-old wife of a well-known FNL member in Ngozi province was raped when she was seven months pregnant by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD leader was assaulted by Imbonerakure, who accused him of causing divisions amongst the Imbonerakure youth.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure forced shops to close and destroyed kiosks. Clashes broke out when the shopkeepers rebelled. The head of the hill had to intervene.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted 2 men and fined them BIF240,000. They were accused of robbery.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat and arrested a man. They accused him of stealing manioc because he had been looking for his goats.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A girl at the Matana hospital was assaulted by Imbonerakure for breaking curfew. 2 students who attempted to defend her were also assaulted.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was tied up and beaten by 4 Imbonerakure, who accused him of stocktheft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was beaten publicly by Imbonerakure, who accused him of witchcraft.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: When military forces in Butihinda discovered military uniforms they carried out mass arrests of Imbonerakure. One of the Imbonerakure arrested was beaten and taken to an unknown location.
A man was injured when unidentified armed men opened fire in a bar.
A grenade went off at 8pm, injuring a woman and her 2 children.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Members of FNL-Rwasa were beaten by 7 Imbonerakure as they returned from a meeting at around 8pm.
A family was victims of a grenade attack. 2 of the children died.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 people who were arrested and severely tortured by police and Imbonerakure while in custody. 2 died from their wounds.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Students (Burundi)
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to protest the Arusha protest. Students from local schools were forced to attend.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: The CNDD-FDD Women's Forum held a march to protest the Arusha dialogues.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: The CNDD-FDD Women's Forum held a march to protest the Arusha dialogues.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: The CNDD-FDD Women's Forum held a march to protest the Arusha dialogues.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: The CNDD-FDD Women's Forum held a march to protest the Arusha dialogues.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A butcher was beaten by Imbonerakure as he was returning home at 10pm.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 February 2017, the 17-year-old niece of an opponent of the CNDD-FDD was raped in Rumonge province.
A man was blindfolded and tied up, and then killed and dumped in a river. His body was found near the Gitega market.
A grenade was thrown in the Kumpuzumahanga market. There were no injuries. President Nkurunziza was due to give a speech nearby the following day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A youth who refused to join the CNDD-FDD was beaten by the area chief and imbonerakure and then detained in solitary confinement.
A man was arrested by the head of the Karuzi police and beaten until he spit blood and lost consciousness.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: The FNL Rwasa Party Secretary was assaulted by 5 Imbonerakure as he returned home at 9.15pm.

column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency; CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Students (Burundi)
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest the UN report on Burundi. The march was lead by the local head of the National Intelligence Service. Students at the Lycee Communal refused to participate in the march, to the displeasure of the headmaster.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march to demonstrate against Belgian interference in Burundi

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: CNDD-FDD members held a demonstration to show their support for the government and to denounce the UN report on Burundi. Imbonerakure present threatened outsiders who tried to approach the march.
Several thousand people protested in the streets of Burundi's capital Bujumbura against UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres and the facilitator in the inter-Burundian crisis.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man who was visiting Kanyinya from Kanyagu was arrested and beaten by 2 Imbonerakure at a roadblock when he refused to give them money.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); UPRONA: Union for National Progress
column17: 8 members of FNL Rwasa and 2 members of UPRONA were arrested and beaten by the police and Imbonerakure. They had gathered to comfort an FNL Rwasa colleague who had lost a family member, but were accused of holding a clandestine meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was assaulted by Imbonerakure when he failed to return home before the curfew. He was forced to pay a 5000BIF fine.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The head of the national intelligence service and the head of the police assaulted 6 CNDD-FDD members using an iron whip. The CNDD-FDD members had been discovered with a grenade in a bar.
An ex-FAB went missing as he was returning from Rumonge. His body was discovered the next day.
Students who have been on strike since 6 March, came under fire from Police in Bigomogomo. No reported injuries.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: A member of the MSD was assaulted by police at a bar and then arrested. He was accused of blaming the police for the issues in his commune.
2 bodies suspected to be ex-FAB were discovered on Mutara colline.
2 dead bodies were found in the Siguvaye river.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 6 Imbonerakure beat a man, who died shortly after he made it to hospital. 3 of the Imbonerakure have been arrested.
Soldiers assaulted 5 men from Manga colline who were on their way to Viro Market in Rwanda. They beat the men with sticks and whips and detained them.
A former member of the public security police went out to buy fertiliser. His body was discovered on the banks of the Mubarazi River later in the day.
A shopkeeper was beaten to death by unidentified people. They looted nothing from his shop.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure assaulted 2 children for playing near the CNDD-FDD monument.
A man who was accused of witchcraft was attacked by his neighbours. He died from his injuries.

The head of the police station and his transmission agent assaulted a trader. They accused the trader of having knocked them down, however, witnesses claim that the police simulated the accident in order to extort money from him.
A young student was raped at gunpoint by a policeman.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: The head of the National Intelligence Service assaulted a man. He later died in hospital

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A member of FRODEBU was assaulted by Imbonerakure. They accused him of spying on them.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 30 people were beaten by the Burundian police when they arrived in Gisuru. They were part of a group of 80 Burundian refugees sent back from Tanzania by the Tanzanian police, who claim that they cannot stay in Tanzania because there is no war in Burundi.
A policeman was beating a man for belonging to the wrong ethnic group. A woman tried to intervene, so he turned on her and beat her until she passed out.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa motorcyclist was assaulted by 2 Imbonerakure and then arrested when he refused to buy beer for them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A member of FNL Rwasa was assaulted with a machete by men who he recognised as Imbonerakure. He was accused of refusing to contribute to the CNDD-FDD building projects.
A body was found on Nkehe hill.
A man was killed and his body dumped in the river Siguvyaye
The body of three people were found in Walubondo in the province of Cibitoke. The people had been shot dead.
A teenager was injured in a grenade attack.
Residents of Rukoba colline killed a man who they caught in the act of stealing a goat.
Inhabitants beat a man to death when he was discovered stealing.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure was severely injured when he was attacked by 4 other Imbonerakure, who accused him of trying to usurp their authority.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 young men were beaten by Imbonerakure who had demanded to know what they were talking about.
4 men in military uniform attempted to abduct a civilian. He realised what was happening and shouted for help. They shot and wounded him and then ran away.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure assaulted a shopkeeper.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure used cudgels to assault 3 young people who were out past the curfew time.
A man was attacked and beheaded by unknown assailants
A woman was assaulted by her neighbours, who believe that she is a witch.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused him of being recalcitrant for not foining the ruling party.
An unidentified man was killed by a blow to the head. His body was found near Nyabitare.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: UPRONA: Union for National Progress; Women (Burundi)
column17: An UPRONA member was assaulted by Imbonerakure. They accused her of damaging a CNDD-FDD calendar.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A member of FRODEBU was arrested by Imbonerakure, who took him to the CNDD-FDD, where they ordered him to lie down and whipped him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure sexually assaulted a teenage girl in the pasture behind her family home.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: When a man failed to buy an Imbonerakure a beer, he was beaten until he spit blood.
A guard was hit on the head and killed by unidentified assailants.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 Imbonerakure armed with clubs beat a man and a woman who they accused of making and selling a prohibited drink. The pair were then taken to the police station.
A woman's body was found in the Ruzira neighbourhood of Cankuzo. She is believed to have been killed by a soldier from the Mutukura Camp.
An ex FAB soldier who had travelled to Bujumbura to collect his allowance was abducted by an unknown group.

column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-); Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: Police Officer Simon Masumbuko was abducted. The Police Chief of Kobero and a National Intelligence Officer have been arrested.

The University of Burundi authorities demanded to see the leaders of a proposed student strike individually at their offices. 170 students held a sit-in at the offices in solidarity with the student leaders.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who was visiting family in Saswe. They accused him of witchcraft.
A student was arrested by the police and held in the Mpimba Central Prison, where he was tortured.
An UPRONA supporter was found dead on Murambi Hill. 8 people have been arrested.
14 people who are suspected of being rebels were arrested in Kazirabageni. They were tortured in custody by the local police and then transferred to the National Intelligence Services in Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat 4 men who they found during a patrol. They accused the men of being thieves
An elected MP accused a child of stealing building materials from him. He tied up the child, hung him upside down, and whipped. When the child's mother arrived, he also whipped her.
A group of armed men in military uniforms invaded bars and beat the patrons in Muremera before heading to the Mashitsi Forest.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a protest in Matongo, where they sang songs to intimidate the opposition.
A crowd of residents beat and stoned a man to death. He had been caught in the act of robbing an elderly woman.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat 2 men who they accused of being thieves.
Police officers undressed and beat a man who crossed a police barrier.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A grenade was thrown at the house of an influential CNDD-FDD member. His wife was wounded in the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A man accused of delivering secrets to a family member in Rwanda was arrested and tortured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The area chief ordered Imbonerakure to assault a young woman who was arrested en route to join her husband in Tanzania
An employee of a local NGO was killed by unidentified assailants.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A housekeeper was raped by Imbonerakure because her employer is a member of the FNL Rwasa movement.
A man was assaulted by the Chief of the Zone, who accused him of attempting to flee the country. The man died in custody.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who they accused of being a thief. He died from his wounds.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure assaulted a man who a senior member of the CNDD-FDD had accused of stealing a cellphone.
FNL forces entered a village and looted shops. The military confronted them and the forces fought from 2100h until 0400h. 4 people were abducted by the FNL, but 1 of them escaped.
An elderly woman was severely injured when a grenade was thrown in Mabanda. The motives for the attack are unknown.
On 8 April 2017, a 52 year old man was hacked to death by a crowd wielding machetes when he was discovered in a potato field.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 8 April 2017, the driver of the Catholic Diocese, who had transported soldiers from the Ngozi camp, was abducted by Imbonerakure. He was tortured by Imbonerakure and military figures and then killed.
A man who was discovered to have been stealing a goat was beaten to death by inhabitants.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man in a bar because he was discussing the elections.
Armed men ambushed a bus in the Mutimbuzi commune. A woman was shot and wounded.

9 April 2017, a bus was attacked by an unidentified armed group in Gatumba. 2 people were injured, a woman was shot and some passengers abducted. The Gatumba Parish Priest was one of the people abducted. He died a few days after his release.
Unidentified armed men threw a grenade at people returning from work. 1 person was killed and 1 person was injured.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Unidentified assailants attacked a member of FNL-Rwasa in his home. They beat him and dragged him onto the street, believing that they had left him dead. He is recovering in hospital.
4 people were wounded when undifentified armed men opened fire near the St Joseph School.
A man was attacked at 1am by a group of men wielding machetes.
An NGO worker was killed and thrown under a vehicle in Musaga.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A youth was arrested and held by the National Intelligence Service for standing too close to the president's cavalcade. He was beaten by the SNR.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure and an official detained and assaulted a Rwandan. They also confiscated RWF40,000 from him.

column8: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: Non-violent activity: The government has suspended opposition party MSD. The party is accused of using armed combat against the government.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The head of the local Imbonerakure assaulted an inhabitant of Bucana hill, accusing him of sorcery.
Armed men attacked a family in Shombo with machetes. 1 person was seriously injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted 2 men. 1 died, the other was badly injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A member of the Gishubi Communal Council was assaulted by Imbonerakure for having criticised them.
An ex-FAB was arrested at a bar. When he resisted his arrest, he was beaten up by the police.
A man was killed by members of a community, who accused him of stealing cassava.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure assaulted a woman who wass returning home. He accused her of having an extra-marital relationship.
A man from Kabumba was stoned by community members who caught him in the act of robbery.
A man from Kigarama was assaulted by police officers, who accused him of trampling a baby during a food scramble. He died from the injuries.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A Frodebu member's body was found in the Jiji River.
A man was killed in a simulated car accident.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A member of FNL-Rwasa from Nyakazi was riding a bicycle in Vugizo when he was stopped by Imbonerakure. They took his identity card and saw he was not from the area, so the assaulted him.

A former CNDD-FDD Senator, Oscar Ntasano, who had quarrelled with senior officials was abducted. The car that took him has been discovered in a ditch in the north of the country. His family fears that he is dead.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who had returned from Tanzania. They accused him of being a member of an armed group.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure demonstrated in Gisagara, running through the streets singing aggressive songs. People in the town were frightened.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man who was caught in the act of stealing mobile phones was tied to a tree and beaten by imbonerakure.
A young man was executed by Sergeant Major Gaspard Nimbona, who is notorious for having tortured and executed various activists since the beginning of the crisis.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD party member was killed by soldiers, who pulled him off a bus and shot him. He had been involved in the demonstrations against Nkurunziza
After the Saturday Community Work a march was held to protest the granting of immunity to 2015 coup-plotters.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a demonstration to protest the granting of immunity to 2015 coup-plotters

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march in Gashoho to demonstrate their support for the government of Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a demonstration in Butaganzwa after the community work.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march in Cankuzo to demonstrate their support for the government of Burundi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat passers-by and shopkeepers in Makamba town to force them to participate in community work.
2 men were arrested, beaten, and placed in solitary confinement for insulting the head of state.
Pro-government demonstrators gathered in Bujumbura to protest the granting of immunity to 2015 coup-plotters

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to demonstrate their support for the government of Burundi.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 23 April. SNR agents forcibly disappeared a civilian from Kamenge neighbourhood of Bujumbura.
Residents stoned to death a woman who they accused of being a 'rain-maker'
A woman was beaten by unidentified men carrying clubs. She was scolded for not joining the CNDD-FDD
A man riding a motorbike threw a grenade through a car window in Kamenge. 1 person was killed and 4 were injured.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 25 April. SNR forces forcibly disappeared a civilian from Mutanga Sud neighbourhood of Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A resident was beaten by 3 Imbonerakure, who accused him of visiting Rwanda.
A man was strangled and tied to a tree.
A man was killed using a machete
A group of veterans were assaulted by police.
A man was strangled and dumped in Kizingwe.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD activist was arrested by an SNR officer near his home in Kamenge. He was tortured for 3 days and then killed. His body has not been found.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A member of the CNDD-FDD sexually assaulted a student.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD activist was arrested in Mutanga by an Imbonerakure leader and handed over to the SNR. He was tortured for 3 days and then killed. His body was dumped in a mass grave.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 2 grenades were thrown at the house of a CNDD-FDD senator. There were no injuries.
A man was killed using a machete. It is believed that he was accused of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted 2 men in the Kubuyezi neighbourhood because they did not have identity cards.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a cook in Bandaga during a nightly patrol. Citizens of Bandaga say that they hold these patrols each night. Citizens who are caught out late are beaten or detained. All shopkeepers are obliged to pay BIF6,000 to operate.
Police officers dumped a man on Dama Avenue. He had been tortured in custody.
A 60 year old man was shot and killed by 2 policemen. The reasons for this attack are unclear.
Arrests: Police and military conducted a household search in Ntahangwa. 32 people were arrested. They were released if they could pay a BIF3,000 fine.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Women (Burundi)
column17: Imbonerakure wanted to arrest FNL Rwasa supporters from Rubira Hill. The Rwasa supporters had already fled, but the Imbonerakure beat the wife of one of them, when she attempted to prevent them from stealing his motorcycle.
Arrests: Police conducted a household check in Gihosha. 30 people with irregular papers were arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Twa men were arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused them of stealing bananas.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD supporter was attacked by 3 unidentified men, wielding machetes and knives. It is believed that he was targeted for political reasons.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man who refused to pay the fine for not participating in Saturday community work. Every Saturday Imbonerakure in this area intimidate people to make them participate in community work.

On 7 May 2017, the residents of Gabaniro in Gitaza thought that a man passing through their area was a thief and killed him. They cut off his ears and testicles and gouged out his eyes. 5 people have been arrested.
A body was found in Mwenya. He had been killed by machete blows.
A young girl was raped and strangled.
Local residents accused a man of robbery. He was attacked, beaten, and burned. He died 3 days later. 7 people have been arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: 3 men who were detained for participating in the protests against Nkurunziza have been put in solitary confinement. At night they are taken from the solitary confinement cells and beaten by prisoners who are Imbonerakure, on the orders of the prison authorities.
The body of a young girl was found on the banks of the Nyangombe River.
05 November. A civilian was abducted by an unidentified armed group in Kamenge, Bujumbura.
A man was killed using machetes. His body was found the next day.
A policeman shot and killed a coltan miner who did not pay a fine that he tried to impose. 2 other people were wounded.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a protest to celebrate 2 years since the coup failed. They beat up people who failed to close their shops or businesses for the protest.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously. Shopkeepers were forced to close their shops and participate.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously. The march in Gitega was mostly made up of the women's branch.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a march to celebrate the failure of the coup 2 years previously. Shopkeepers were forced to close their shops and participate. Some people carried kalashnikovs and bayonets.
There were clashes between the military and General Nzabampema's FNL in the Rukoko Nature Reserve. An FNL militant was killed and a soldier was wounded.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A soldier from the Rweru Hill Military position was tied up by Imbonerakure and beaten severely.
A trader was attacked and hacked to death by machetes. Nothing was stolen from him.
A man was killed under suspicious circumstances

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Butanuka assaulted 3 youths who refused to join the Imbonerakure. 1 youth was hospitalised, the other 2 are being held in the communal police station.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In May 2017, Imbonerakure attacked the home of a man who refused to participate in nightly patrols with them in Cibitoke province. During the attack, an Imbonerakure member raped the man's 35-year old wife.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man who had recently been released from Mpimba Prison was killed by Imbonerakure. He was accused of robbery, but people believe that he was targeted because he had been a political prisoner.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 men who had recently been released from Mpimba Prison were killed by Imbonerakure. They were accused of robbery, but people believe that they were targeted because they had been political prisoners.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure in Giheta handcuffed and beat a soldier, who they accused of being a putschist.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat an elder UPRONA supporter in Murambi, leaving him injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 2 Imbonerakure accused a FRODEBU supporter in Rurambira of being a thief, although there was no evidence of him stealing. They arrested the FRODEBU supporter, beat him, and held him for 3 days.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 6 Imbonerakure in Bujondi tied a woman to a tree and whipped her to punish her for starting a fire. She did not start the fire, so she was released.
A girl from Rugunga was abducted. Her dead body was found in the nearby river a few days later.
3 youths were killed in a grenade attack in Gikoto, a neighbourhood known to be an opposition stronghold.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Burundi)
column17: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Red Cross worker at his house in Mahande.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 4 Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Senga, Rutegama. He was accused of having stolen the handle of a hoe.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure, including the leader of the Imbonerakure, were killed when a grenade was thrown outside a bar in the Musaga district of Bujumbura. 3 by-standers were wounded

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A businessman, Mohamed Hilal, was murdered in Gatumba. 7 Imbonerakure and National Intelligence Service officers have been arrested in relation to the murder.
An elderly man was injured in a grenade attack on Nzozi hill.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter from Rubuga hill in Gitaramuka was arrested and beaten up by Imbonerakure and the communal head of the CNDD-FDD. He was accused of having complained that the fuel shortage was Nkurunziza's fault.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a merchant in Sehe. He was targeted because he often refuses to pay contributions to the ruling party

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 May 2017, an Imbonerakure member killed a resident in the Rukaramu area in the Kajaga district. The reason for his murder is not clear.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A grenade exploded outside the home of the CNDD-FDD area chief in Kamenge, Bujumbura at 7.30pm. 8 people were injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD supporter was attacked and beaten by 2 Imbonerakure armed with clubs.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A man from Yaranda hill was beaten by Imbonerakure who accused him of holding illegal FNL Rwasa meetings (he is a member of a savings and credit group).
The police chief, in civilian clothing, attempted to rape a young girl. He was surrounded by angry residents, who beat him up.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a person they accused of stealing. When the head of the hill intervened to protect the civilian, they assaulted the head of the hill as well.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A former member of the Armed Forces (ex-FAB) from Buvyuko hill in the area, commune and province Bubanza was nearly killed by an Imbonerakure member on 22 May 2017. Since then, the victim has not been able to exploit his land and has received further threats from machete-wielding Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column9: Prisoners (Burundi); Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: 2 ex-FAB being held in Mpimba Prison were assaulted by Imbonerakure and prison guards.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A crowd rioted at a WFP food distribution point in Gihungwe. Imbonerakure intervened and assaulted the rioters, leaving three severely injured.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A member of FNL Rwasa who has refused to join the CNDD-FDD was abducted by the SNR. His family has been unable to find him.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD militants beat a young man and confiscated his bike when he did not pay a contribution to the party. The CNDD-FDD has been conducting an intensive forced fund-raising exercise in Kinama.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The head of Village 2 was assaulted by Imbonerakure, who accused him of hindering the activities of Regideso.
A man was killed by an unidentified group in Ngagara.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Police beat a Frodebu official to death during an intensive search in Musaga. Police have been conducting nightly searches in Musaga, targeting opposition supporters and Rwandans, since the explosion of a grenade which killed the leader of the Imbonerakure. People report that the searches are often violent.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 May. Police forces arrest and forcibly disappeared two Imbonerakure members in Kanyosha, Mboza.
Residents of Ruhanza assaulted a couple accused of sorcery. The woman died during the attack, her husband was rescued by neighbours and taken to the clinic.
Unidentified men aboard a vehicle threw a grenade at a man near the Bujumbura town hall. He has been evacuated to hospital.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD supporter who had participated in demonstrations against Nkurunziza's 3rd term disappeared. His family believes that he was abducted.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An ex-FAB and his wife were beaten by Imbonerakure because they refused to pay a contribution to a CNDD-FDD building project.
An ex-FAB was found hacked to death by machetes in Kazagayanga, Rutongo.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was tied up and thrown in the river in Gakungu.
A businesswoman was injured when an unidentified gunman exploded a grenade near her at 8pm in Bujumbura.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: An intelligence agent beat prisoners at the Muramvya Prison. The motives behind the beating are not known.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat an inhabitant of Musenyi because he was walking around the hill after the 10pm curfew.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 6 Imbonerakure assaulted a trader from Nkoronko hill as he was returning from the market. They tried to tear out his tongue so that he could not scream.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An FNL veteran was beaten by Imbonerakure and the police when it was discovered that he was in possession of a rifle. He is being held in the Matana jail.
A man suspected of witchcraft was beaten to death by people in his village, Karagara. His house was also burned down.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: The SNR beat a chief and held him in custody. He does not know why he was targeted.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A teacher was held up by a group of Imbonerakure. They demanded to see his identity card. When he did not have it, they beat him severely.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march to demonstrate their support of the government.
A woman was killed in an attack on her home in Gishunzi. Her neighbours believe that she was attacked because she has refused to join the CNDD-FDD.
A woman from Kirambi was murdered. Her neighbours believe that Imbonerakure murdered her.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure in Gihanga beat a man and charged him BIF20,000 for disturbing the peace. He was left injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: 2 young MSD supporters were beaten and arrested by Imbonerakure and police. They were accused of insulting elected officials.
A man was killed by an unidentified group in Gihosha.
2 streetchildren were arrested and beaten by police officers, who accused them of destabilising Bujumbura. No one knows where the streetchildren are being held.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted and tried to drown a man from Mbuye. They accused him of being a rebel.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was abducted by the head of the Imbonerakure in Rugombo. He was strangled and his body was thrown in the river.
A police officer was killed in a gunfight between police officers in Bujumbura.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3,500 couples attended a mass event to formalise their marriages, according to the new law. When they realised that the Imbonerakure had turned the ceremony into a party event and that there was no food, the participants rioted. 3 people were killed in the scuffles between Imbonerakure and rioting newlyweds.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Kirambi was murdered. The neighbours believe that he was killed by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Rugwiza was beaten by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure. His spine was damaged.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure leader beat a young mandazi seller on Bigwa hill in Ruyaga. He accused the youth of spying for the Imbonerakure's enemies. He was left injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter and his servant were attacked by people wielding machetes. The neighbours believe that the attack was carried out by Imbonerakure.
3 people accused of witchcraft were killed by vigilante militias in Mugina.
A grenade was thrown into a crowd of people near a bus station in the opposition stronghold of Musaga. 2 people were killed and 9 people were injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a Rugabano resident with clubs. They were suspicious of his political allegiance because he has not participated in CNDD-FDD activities. The man is currently recovering in hospital.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 groups of Imbonerakure clashed in Ntunda. There had been an argument about which group had the rights to 'tax' civilians in the neighbourhood.
A total of 12 bodies were found in the Ruhwa River between June and September 2017.
A man was shot dead at his door by unidentified armed men, who followed him home.
A man was shot dead by police officers in Kamenge.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A veteran of the CNDD-FDD was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of being an opposition member. He has since fled Gatagura hill.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire in a bar in Kiganza, killing 1 person.
The deputy chief of police beat a member of the youth orchestra with his rifle butt.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was beaten and trampled by Imbonerakure.

Scuffles broke out between Musaga bus drivers, who wanted to attend the funeral of a fellow bus driver killed in a grenade attack on 14/6, and police and council authorities, who tried to force the drivers to attend community work instead. 4 bus drivers were arrested during the scuffles.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A grenade was thrown in a bar in Rwiri, Murwi. No one was injured. Imbonerakure beat and arrested 2 people who fled from the bar in fear when the grenade was thrown, as they suspected them of being the assailants. They released them a few days later.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: More than 20 Imbonerakure beat up a group of 7 people who had gathered near a bar in Bucana. The Imbonerakure accused them of holding an FNL Rwasa meeting. The victims were forced to pay fines to the police.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 men were beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused them of being enemies of the nation because they are Tutsi.
On 19 June 2017, an elderly man in Nyempundu was accused of witchcraft and killed with a machete.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter who had just returned from exile in Rwanda was attacked and choked in a bar in Gitongo. He survived the attack.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure were trying to force people to 'donate' their harvest to the ruling party. The people in Yaranda rioted against the Imbonerakure's imposition, injuring 3 of the Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Rurira was killed in Ruhororo colline by 3 Imbonerakure because they believed he was a Tutsi. He was in fact a Hutu.
Arrests: 30 Pentecostal worshippers in Jimbi were accused of insurrection and arrested.
A man was killed by unidentified assailants and dumped between Mishiha and Gisagara.
A girl in Kivoga was raped and murdered by unidentified assailants.
Rwandan soldiers fired shots at 2 fishermen on the Ruhwa River. One of the fishermen fled, the other one was kidnapped by the soldiers.
On 22 June 2017, a man from Bugwana in Gitobe was believed to be a wizard. He was killed with knives and machetes.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The deputy head of the CNDD-FDD was abducted by unidentified agents from Butavuka in Muzinda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat and drowned a man in Rukere because he sold coffee to a man from a neighbouring region.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a demonstration, where they sang songs threatening to kill Rwandans and people who had fled to Rwanda.
A girl was kidnapped by an unidentified group in Mungwa, Gitega.
A policeman on patrol was attacked and killed by an unidentified armed group near the Musigati Post Office.
A soldier on leave was arrested and beaten. It is believed that he was arrested over land conflicts.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 men from Mutobo were arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused them of stealing.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: An imbonerakure beat up 2 CNDD-FDD members and a human rights monitor, who he found in a bar, accusing them of opposing the CNDD-FDD policies.
A policeman was beheaded by unidentified assailants while he was guarding the post office.
A man was beaten to death by an unidentified group in a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure abducted a prisoner from the Buhiga prison and beat him to death.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 400 Imbonerakure held a march in Mwakiro. They waved branches and sang that the ruling party would never leave power.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure tied up and beat a person in Mutwazi who had not paid a party member.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Ngoma was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of failing to pay the animal tax.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat 2 FNL-Rwasa activists. The police then arrested the 2 activists and accused them of treason. The Imbonerakure also beat the wife of one of the Rwasa activists.
A woman in Gihanga was stabbed and beheaded over a land conflict.
A man was stabbed to death in Rweza. His body was dumped in the river.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure conducted a round-up of women in the streets of Makamba. The women were accuseed of being prostitutes and jailed, where they were beaten and sexually assaulted by the Imbonerakure.

Eight killed and 40 wounded in a grenade attack at Shinya, Gatara restaurant. No one has so far claimed responsibility for the attack but authorities have ""categorically rejected a political motive"" and ""prefer to link this to an act of terrorism.""
Residents of Kiderege gathered with machetes to protest the land distribution between residents and returnees. The crowd clashed with returnees, and had to be broken up by the police.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Nyagitika was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of spreading rumours about an attack on Burundi on whatsapp.
Four policemen were injured as a result of a grenade attack that occurred at 9pm in central Bujumbura. Perpetrators not known.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A 16 year old in Kayogoro was beaten by Imbonerakure until he lost consciousness and then abducted. His family has not been able to locate him.
A man was decapitated and dismembered by unidentified attackers.
A man was beheaded and maimed by unidentified perpetrators.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat up and intimidated 3 teenagers in the Jene market.
A man was killed near Rumonge. Police claim that it was a suicide, but human rights organisations have expressed their concern about the death.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade in Ruhehe. A woman and her 3 children were injured in the attack. 12 people were arrested by the SNR following the attack.
On 13 July 2017, two suspected thieves were hacked to death with machetes by a crowd in Ndava.
A total of 12 bodies were found in the Ruhwa River between June and September 2017.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Kirundo held a demonstration where they wielded sticks and sang songs in support of Nkurunziza.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Kirambi held a demonstration to protest the EU and to demonstrate their support for Nkurunziza.
Non-violent activity: A mass grave containing more than 100 bodies was discovered near Mabanda town. Witnesses believe that the mass grave dates back to the 1972 pogrom.
A man who went to water his field was attacked by unidentified men wielding machetes and sticks in a village of Gihanga, leaving him severely injured.
A widow and her son were seriously injured by unidentified assailants, who stabbed them in their house over a land dispute.
A woman and her son were attacked in their home by unidentified assailants in relation to a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man in Gihehe was not carrying his identity card, so Imbonerakure arrested and beat him.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Kirundo held a demonstration where they wielded sticks and sang songs in support of Nkurunziza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man and a girl who had missed the curfew in Ngugo. The girl has been hospitalised.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A soldier was stopped and beaten by a group of 12 Imbonerakure, who accused him of collaborating with thieves.
7 people were injured in a grenade attack in Mukaza.
An unidentified group threw a grenade out of a car at the patrons of the Kubajandarume bar, in Bwiza, Bujumbura. 7 people were killed and at least 30 people were injured.
Scuffles broke out at the Musenyi market, when the police tried to shut down the stalls. A mob of traders tore the uniform of the police chief.

Burundian soldiers in the Rukoko Nature Reserve shot and killed a soldier. According to some sources, one of the soldiers had embezzled a weapon. According to other sources, a soldier was killed as he was fleeing.

column6: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A CNDD-FDD supporter was beaten up by FNL Agathon Rwasa supporters in Mubanda, Mpanda.
Prisoners in Rutana Prison rioted, drumming, banging pans, ripping down doors, and throwing stones at the police. The police fired gunshots to suppress the prisoners. No injuries have been reported.
A man from Muriza was killed for witchcraft.
A young man in Nyabibuye was stabbed to death with a bayonet.
A man in Nyakibanda was strangled.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The head of the Ruzingati sub-hill tried to extort money from a student. When the student refused he got the Imbonerakure to beat the student.
A former FAB soldier was kidnapped by the military and taken to the marshes north of Bujumbura, where he was tortured and shot dead.
Unidentified armed men attempted an ambush in Gihanga, but were prevented by the police.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A member of the CNDD-FDD was kidnapped by unidentified attackers in Maramvya.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An imbonerakure raped a 13 year old.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Up to 10,000 Imbonerakure demonstrated in Bujumbura to deounce the opposition.
Unidentified gunmen ambushed a minibus at Kagunuzi. Security forces intervened and shots were exchanged. It is believed that the gunmen then escaped to the DRC.
Gunmen ambush a civilian minibus and execute the driver.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD organised a march to demonstrate their support for Nkurunziza in Gitobe.
On 23 July 2017, a man accused of stealing in Kabogi was killed by a group wielding machetes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a trader with clubs at the Kirambi market.
A man in Muhanga was beaten to death by a group who accused him of stealing a lemonade.
Unidentified gunmen ambushed a car on the Bujumbura road in Gihanga. A person was killed and another injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a mill owner in Rugeyo.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 2 men were beaten and arrested by the National Intelligence Service. They are being held under suspicion over the grenade attacks in Bwiza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A member of the Batwa community was arrested and beaten by the Imbonerakure and police.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The chief Imbonerakure on Rugazi hill held a man who he accused of fleeing the country at his house. He tied him up and tortured his genitals.
Police in the Musenyi market accused a man of insolence and beat him with batons and then held him for 4 hours.
A grenade was thrown into a home in Kibonde. 1 person was seriously injured and was taken to hospital.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A man and his son were arrested and beaten by the police and CNDD-FDD because they had returned from Rwanda unofficially, which made the police suspicious that they were plotting against the CNDD-FDD.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A man living in Nkonyovu was beaten by an SNR agent for not participating in CNDD-FDD activities.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A servant in Rubimba was beaten by Imbonerakure because he failed to produce a receipt proving that he had contributed to a town development project.
A youth in Ngagara was beaten by policemen, who accused him of standing in the wrong place.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Batwa in Vumbi were beaten by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was beaten by Imbonerakure in Mutobo because he refused to pay them.
A Batwa man was beaten to death and thrown into a river in Butaganzwa.
3 civilians were killed by unidentified attackers. Their bodies were dumped in the Ruhwa.
03 August. A Rwandan student was abducted by an unidentified armed group in Ngozi province.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A student at Mushikano school in Rutegama was beaten by an SNR agent when he went to look for an identity card.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A peace activist was beaten by Imbonerakure in Shinge common.

column9: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: Fights broke out between prisoners at Rumonge Prison. The police and prison guards used force to control the prisoners, leaving 21 people wounded.
2 children were killed in a grenade attack on their home in Munagano, in Muyinga. The authorities do not know the identities of the perpetrators.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Patrolling Imbonerakure came across an FNL Rwasa supporter and attacked him with machetes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A trader who had been a FRODEBU member was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of denigrating them.
A man living in Maramvya was beaten and attacked with machetes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was beaten by Imbonerakure in Mugongomanga
2 civilians were killed and 5 civilians were injured in a grenade attack on a bar in Buyenzi, Bujumbura. It is believed that the attackers were targeting police officers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Monge, Ntega, was beaten by Imbonerakure.
A man was injured by gunshots fired into his house. His family believes that he was targeted because of a land dispute.
A person was killed and dumped in the Ndurumu River

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man fromm Kagege was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of burning down the forest.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man
The head of the Rutegama police station beat 5 prisoners when he returned to the station drunk.
Burundian security forces were ambushed by an unidentified group in Gatumba. 1 soldier was killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure were beaten by their fellow Imbonerakure, who accused them of sympathising with the FNL Rwasa party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A policeman was injured because Imbonerakure who had seen him entering a widow's house fired bullets at him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 7 citizens were publicly beaten by Imbonerakure during a town security meeting in Vugizo. They were accused of starting a wildfire.
A man in Rugeyo was killed when 2 grenades were thrown through his window. The attack is believed to be related to a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Nkonyovu was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure and police over a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A woman was beaten by Imbonerakure in Busyana because she had returned home too late.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A youth from Mabanda was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: An FNL organiser in Nkonyovu was arrested by the SNR and beaten.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man in Gahago, in Vugizo, was beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused him of stealing apples.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
