column17: A year 7 pupil was beaten by Imbonerakure.
A total of 12 bodies were found in the Ruhwa River between June and September 2017.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the convoy of the governor of Bubanza, leading to clashes with his bodyguards. No injuries were reported.
A man was strangled in Gahoma.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A grenade was thrown into the house of a CNDD-FDD leader in Ruramba. There was some property damage.
A person was killed and dumped in the Ruhwa River.
A woman was beaten and strangled in Nyavyamo. It is believed that she was killed by the police.
A man in Gitongo was hacked to death using a machete by unidentified assailants.
A woman was tied up and killed. Her body was dumped in the Jiji River.
A woman was beaten and killed and then dumped in the Ruvyironza River in Makebuko.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A Tutsi student at the Mutanga campus of the university was beaten up by Imbonerakure with clubs and forced to walk across campus on his knees. This is part of ongoing harassment of students at the Mutanga campus by groups of club-wielding Imbonerakure. Date unclear - report dated 18 August.

Arrests: 36 young people, including 24 from the Ruhoro displacement site, were arrested by police as they were traveling to Tanzania from Ruhororo. Two days before, on 14 August, 21 young people were also arrested at Kinyinya commune in Ryigi province for seeeking to make their way to Tanzania for work.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A grenade was thrown into the house of a CNDD-FDD supporter. There were no injuries
An unidentified group exploded grenades in two bars in Buyenzi, killing 1 person and injuring 29.
Around 17 August 2017 (as reported), police attacked and killed a civilian in Marambya zone (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). His body was discovered in this location wrapped in sheets.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A group of butchers were attacked by Imbonerakure, who accused them of having occupied their space without permission from the Imbonerakure.
A policeman fired at a cowherd, who he accused of returning from Rwanda. The victim was injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD activist was beaten, tied up, and left in the rain by Imbonerakure.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a protest to demonstrate their support for Nkurunziza.
A former FAB was abducted from his house.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In Murwi Imbonerakure beat and arrested a man who they accused of insulting the president.
A grenade was thrown in the Shatanya district of Gitega. 6 people were injured.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade at a volley ball ground in Rusaka. 2 people were injured.
A man was beheaded by unidentified assailants in Kiganda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure attacked a motorcyclist in Mugongomanga with a machete.
A grenade was thrown into a home in Kinyami. No injuries were recorded.
A man was beaten to death in Gitongo.
An off-duty soldier was injured when he was attacked by Agents of Transmission in Makamba.
An UPRONA supporte was arrested, tied, and beaten.
Residents in Vugizo demonstrated in front of the police station to protest the intimidation and extortion of money by the police. Around a hundred demonstrators were arrested.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A member of the Imbonerakure was beaten and then arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted 2 young men in Mugozi as they returned home.
A family in Rushubi was attacked, and their home and livestock were burned because they were accused of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: After a trader complained to the Bitare Hill Chief, the Chief ordered Imbonerakure to assault him. The Imbonerakure beat him to death.
An unidentified group attacked a watchman with machetes in Gahombo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A resident of Marangara was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of witchcraft.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A taxi driver was arrested and beaten by police and military on the Bubanza-Bujumbura road. He is accused of having escaped to Rwanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 people were arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused them of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter in Giheta was beaten by Imbonerakure for refusing to join the CNDD-FDD.
A military officer was assassinated by another military officer, who believed that he had been abusing former-FAB officers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 men were arrested by Imbonerakure. 1 of the men was then beaten by the Imbonerakure.
A youth was strangled by unidentified attackers in Ruyange.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure intimidated and beat 2 sisters in Gitaba, who had sought the assistance of the head of the hill over a legal dispute.
An unidentified group torched the Mukengezi Bridge in Kiderege, following a judgment about property rights.
2 men in Rutegama were beaten by the police because they were Tutsi and because they are originally from Musaga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man travelling to Bujumbura was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure in Mubarazi, Muramvya. They accused him of participating in a rebel gang.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a shop keeper with an iron bar because he asked them to leave his shop.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a motorcyclist in Murama who was out after the 8pm curfew.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man accused of being a thief was beaten by Imbonerakure wielding thorn-embedded whips.

column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: Arrests: 45 people holding a meeting in Ntobwe were arrested. They were accused of holding a suspicious meeting, which had not been cleared by the police.
Residents in Vugizo demonstrated in front of the police station to protest the intimidation and extortion of money by the police. Around a hundred demonstrators were arrested.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A man was arrested by the SNR for selling beer at an inflated price and tortured in custody.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An ex-FAB was beaten and thrown into the mud by 3 Imbonerakure in Musongati. They accused him of being too closely associated to General Niyombare.
A taxi-driver in Ngagara was beaten by policemen for stopping too close to them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure attacked a couple with machetes because they did not participate in a community effort to put out a widlfire.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a fellow imbonerakure, who they accused of reporting their abuses to the authorities.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a man in Bururi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a man in Gatohwe, who they accused of being insolent towards them. They then arrested him.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A crowd of Imbonerakure disrupted a meeting in Kizuka, triggering a brawl, which was broken up by the military.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure attacked a group of policemen in Mpungwe with a machete, injuring 5 policemen and 3 civilians. The police overpowered him, beat him up, and arrested him. The Imbonerakure was angry with the police for not participating in community work in Mpungwe.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A Batwa man was beaten by 2 Imbonerakure. They accused him of cutting wood in the wrong place.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: An SNR officer shot a woman during a raid on a business.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A woman from Kibago was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused her of witchcraft.
A butcher was strangled to death in Muriza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 men were beaten by Imbonerakure because they returned home after the curfew.
A woman was killed by unidentified assailants in Nyanza-Lac.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure kidnapped and beat a man who had recently returned from Tanzania. They accused him of being part of a rebel group.
API Police officers beat a youth in Buhiga who did not stop for passing authorities.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure armed with clubs and knives beat the manager of a bar to force him to close it 'for security reasons'.
Civil Society organisations held a demonstration in Bujumbura to protest the conclusions of the UN Human Rights report.
The head of the municipal police in Kibago tortured a teacher until he urinated blood.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a man who they accused of acting smarter than them. Imbonerakure in Ngozi have been encouraged to 'correct' civilians.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march in Kinyinya to protest the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march in Matongo to protest the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march in Nyabitsinda to protest the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march in Gahombo to protest the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march in Makamba to protest the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march in Matana to protest the UN human rights report.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march in Ngozi to protest the UN human rights report.
A bar owner in Butaganzwa was assassinated by unidentified attackers wielding machetes. As nothing was stolen, it is believed that the murder was political.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure assaulted a civilian in Kiyange. When a police officer tried to intervene they assaulted him as well.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure attacked a man in Murwi with clubs and machetes. This man was accused of failing to pay his debts to the Imbonerakure.
A woman was arrested and tortured because she was accused of lying.
A man in Kabizi was killed and thrown into the Nyakabanda river.
A man in Kivuruga was killed and his body dumped in a field.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man in Buhiga, who they accused of scratching their car. They yelled that diry Tutsis must not drive in their parking lot.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure, led by a tax collector, beat a man in Nyamitwenzi until he lost consciousness.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat 2 policemen in Shanga when the policemen intervened to try to protect a civilian.
Police officers beat a young domestic worker.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: An ex-FAB officer was abducted by SNR officials.
A cameraman for the Radio Television Nationale de Burundi was beaten by police officers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure attacked and beat 2 young men, who they accused of failing to report a dead goat.

A family in Muyange was ambushed and attacked by an unidentified group wielding machetes. 2 people were killed and another was wounded. It is believed that they were attacked because of a land dispute.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure was held and tortured by a military commander until he urinated blood. He was accused of stealing from a field, however it is believed that he was targeted to set an example that the CNDD-FDD is improving its image.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march in Rutegama to protest the UN human rights report. Local shopkeepers were forced to close their stalls and participate.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat vendors and trampled their vegetables to force them to participate in the community service in Gisuru.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat 8 funeral participants in Rwahirwa, Kibago.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a march in Kirundo to protest the UN human rights report.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: A group of Imbonerakure armed with clubs and machetes tried to attack the bistro of a local MSD politician in Rubimba. Residents rallied to protect the bistro and fight off the Imbonerakure. 8 of these residents were arrested.
Detainees of Kibago prison were tied up and beaten by the police chief.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a student because they heard him expressing an unfavourable political opinion.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A Frodebu official who owns a bar in Kirambi was beaten by police for refusing to serve them free drinks.
A man from Nyabitsinda was beaten by undentiifed attackers.

column9: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
column17: A UPD Zigamibanga official was abducted by men in police uniforms driving a car with tinted windows. Neither his family nor the UPD has any information about his whereabouts.

column9: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
column17: The treasurer of UPD-Z was abducted by police officers as he walked down the street in Mutanga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Rutegama was beaten by Imbonerakure for criticising the youth league.
Security measures: Several unidentified gunmen forced their way into the UN offices in Bujumbura. No one was harmed.
A man was decapitated and his body was dumped in Cishwa.
A man was killed by unidentified attackers. His body was dumped in a septic tank in Ntahangwa.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A man who had supported FNL Rwasa and protested against Nkurunziza's third term was killed and dumped in Gitega.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 5 members of FNL Rwasa were beaten and arrested by Imbonerakure in Mayange for meeting at a bar.
A man was stoned to death by his neighbours because he won a land dispute in the court.
Police beat a man in Rutegama for failing to pay a bribe.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD staged a demonstration in Bujumbura to protest the UN report on Burundi human rights abuses.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man in Butihinda for refusing to join the CNDD-FDD.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD staged a demonstration in Matana to protest the UN report on Burundi human rights abuses.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused himm of listening to radio broadcasts from Rwanda.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD staged a demonstration in Gihanga to protest the UN report on Burundi human rights abuses.
An unidentified armed group attacked civilians with machetes in Kanyosha, leaving 2 people injured.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A former Imbonerakure chief was beaten by unidentified attackers at his home at night.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure raped a young girl in Kivoga.
In Mwakiro unidentified attackers killed a man and his wife, and injured their daughter. The family had been accused of practising witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat and attempted to drown a man in Kiganda. He was accused of failing to pay a fine.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Ntega was beaten by Imbonerakure after he was falsely accused of domestic abuse.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Kigina attacked a student, beat him, broke his phone, and threw him in a lavatory. He was accused of having FNL Rwasa songs on his laptop.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat and strangled a woman in Buhiga. She shouted for help and the neighbours intervened.
4 people, including a police officer were injured in a grenade attack in Rusaka. The grenade was launched at a popular coffee place.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a protest in Makamba to intimidate people who do not support the ruling party.
A man in Rugari was stabbed to death by unidentified assailants.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A former CNDD-FDD member was beaten and robbed by Imbonerakure for not contributing to the party donations.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A youth from Makebuko was beaten with sticks and robbed by Imbonerakure. He was left injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat 3 men. 1 lost consciousness, so they set him alight to ensure that he died.
The inhabitants of Kiziba began to beat a man who was accused of robbery. A local official intervened to save him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man who had questioned the authorities about a fine was attacked at his house by 3 Imbonerakure and 3 elected officials. They destroyed his door and then beat and arrested him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a student from the Lycee Communal in Nyabitsinda to force her to return to school. The Imbonerakure in Nyabitsinda are attacking truant students because they believe it tarnishes the image of the ruling party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 5 Imbonerakure beat a man in Mwendo, who they accused of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: An environmental protection officer was beaten by CNDD-FDD officials in front of local fishermen, to punish him for confiscating fish from them.
An unidentified group attacked the home of a Gitega Prosecutor's Assistant, beat the servants and seized the documents in the house. The attack is believed to be related to a political trial.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure demonstrated in Kinyinya against Niyombare, a general accused of plotting a coup.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure attacked and beat workers at a building site in Gikoto because the builders were not CNDD-FDD supporters, leaving them injured. One Imbonerakure was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Mugera accused a man of stealing and beat him, although there was no proof.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD and taxi drivers held a demonstration in Bujumbura against the EU.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a demonstration in Busoni against General Niyombare and against Rwanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Kabari was beaten to death by 2 Imbonerakure.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a demonstration in Kinyinya against the UN human rights report on Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a demonstration in Muramvya against Rwanda.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a demonstration in Ngozi against the EU and Rwanda.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a demonstration in Nyabitsinda against the EU and Rwanda.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a demonstration in Tangara to protest the opponents of the Burundi government.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a demonstration in Gitobe against the EU.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure held a demonstration in Kirundo to protest against the EU.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a demonstration in Mabayi against the UN human rights report on Burundi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was ambushed by Imbonerakure, who beat him with a broken bottle.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man accused of stealing was beaten and arrested by 2 Imbonerakure.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A teacher in Rutegama, who had been detained for failing to honour the president correctly, was beaten by the SNR. They broke several of his ribs.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A woman was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused her of stealing cassava.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 2 October 2017, a group of Batwa youths patrolling Mbasi, in Vumbi, clashed with Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man in Buhiga was stabbed by Imbonerakure, after he criticised them for being drunk in public.
4 men in Gihanga were beaten by police wielding guns, sticks and belts. 3 of the men were arrested and held in Gihanga prison, the 4th has been taken to an unknown location.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 4 October 2017, an unidentified armed group abducted a FNL-Rwasa supporter in Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). He has not been seen since the abduction.
A man was strangled by unidentified attackers and left in a construction site in Kigoma.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A group of civilians, including a soldier on leave, were attacked by Imbonerakure wielding machetes in Makamba. They were then arrested and accused of leading an insurrection.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 men travelling to Rwanda were arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure at the Kanyaru River. The Imbonerakure accused the men of joining the FNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young farmer was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of stealing a goat, with no evidence. He was warned not to report his incident.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was tied up and beaten by Imbonerakure, who wrongly accused him of stealing bananas. They told him that they would lynch him if he does not leave the community.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A Batwa man was beaten by Imbonerakure in Vumbi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A group of Imbonerakure accused a man coming from the Kirundo market of stealing because he was carrying beans. They tied him to a tree and beat him to death.
Unidentified armed men wielding machetes attacked and killed a cow trader in Butaganzwa.
Unidentified armed men wielding machetes attacked and killed a woman in Nyanza, Marangara.
On 9 October 2017, 6 people, accused of witchcraft, were hacked to death by machetes in Rweya.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: The head of the SNR in Muramvya beat a man who questioned the arrest of a motorcyclist who had been accused of enlisting youth to travel to Rwanda and join a rebellion.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a man who had criticised the curfew that they had imposed in Ngoma. He was hospitalised.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man in Kagege, who they accused of burning charcoal.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat the traders in the Ngoma market. They accused the traders of disrupting security by keeping their stalls open late.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In Rukiga, 6 Imbonerakure tied up a woman and her 4 children and beat them for some hours because one of the children was accused of stealing bananas.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Kibuye. He was accused of destroying produce

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A CNDD-FDD supporter beat an FNL Rwasa supporter who had blamed the CNDD-FDD for the violence in Burundi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man was injured when he was attacked by an evening patrol in Gatabo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD supporters protested in front of the Belgian embassy in Bujumbura.
Soldiers from Musave arrested and beat an ex-FAB. They accused him of insulting the military.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 8 Imbonerakure accused 2 carpenters in Muzinda of causing public violence. They beat them and tried to arrest them, but passers-by intervened.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An UPRONA supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure for refusing to contribute to the construction of the local CNDD-FDD headquarters.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure wielding clubs held a demonstration in Gitobe.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a demonstration in Jimbi.

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nkurunziza Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure in Munanira was beaten by the Chief of the Hill, who accused him of insulting him.
Armed men attacked a house with a grenade, killing 1 person and injuring 5 others. The inhabitants had been accused of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A member of the Gitongo Joint Security Committee was tied up and beaten by the other members of the committee after he denounced them for abusing the local population.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A local focal point person in Matongo was beaten by Imbonerakure, she was accused of using women's activities to discourage people to vote for the CNDD-FDD.
A man was killed in Sehe.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A motorcyclist was beaten by Imbonerakure in Gitega after he refused to pay a tax to them.
19 October. An unidentified armed group abducted a police officer from Bugarama, Muramvya. No reports of clash, assumed to be acting in a civilian capacity at the time of abduction.

column9: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: A police officer who is a former FNL fighter went missing on 19 October from Muramvya police station.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: The head of the SNR in Gasenyi abducted a man and took him to an unknown destination.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 21 October 2017, SNR attacked and killed 4 members of the Popular Forces of Burundi at the SNR office in Muyinga (Muyinga, Muyinga). They had previously been arrested in Tanzania before being handed over to Burundian SNR agents.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure was attacked and beaten in his home in Kibago by 3 other Imbonerakure, who accused him of leaking strategic plans.
A man in Bumba was attacked in his home by men wielding machetes.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure and police officers beat and manhandled students in Kayanza who were holding a strike to demand that the goverenment provide teachers for technical subjects.
Attackers killed a man in Musongati to use his head for witchcraft.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was strangled in Rurambira.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Inhabitants of Nyanza-Lac report that they were beaten by Imbonerakure and forced to contribute to the president's visit. The visit lasted three days between 24-26 October.
A trader was beheaded in Butaganzwa by unidentified attackers. As no money was stolen, it is believed to be a political murder.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 4 youths in Rutegama were beaten by Imbonerakure because they have not registered for the CNDD-FDD.
2 men in Kibago were beaten by police officers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a man in Nyagisozi because he has not attended the CNDD-FDD party meetings.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD party members carried out a demonstration in Busoni to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure demonstrated in Gitega to celebrate the withdrawal from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Students (Burundi)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march in Kibago to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC. Students from local high schools were forced to participate.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march in Bubanza to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD held a march in Bujumbura to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march in Cankuzo to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march in Gitobe to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD held a march in Kirundo to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a march in Muramvya to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure demonstrated in Muyinga to celebrate the withdrawal from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD held a march in Mwaro to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD held a march in Rumonge to celebrate the withdrawal of Burundi from the ICC. Taxi drivers say that they were forced to participate.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure demonstrated in Ruyigi to celebrate the withdrawal from the ICC.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young man accused of arguing with a police officer was beaten by Imbonerakure in Kirundo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The deputy head of the Mishiha Imbonerakure was beaten up in a bar by other senior provincial Imbonerakure and then arrested. He was told that the assault was punishment for not carrying out his duties correctly, but it is believed to have been because the head of the Mishiha Imbonerakure wants to replace him.
The head of the Port and Rail Maritime Authority in Rumonge was beaten by police officers when they realised that he was filming them taking bribes from merchants in the port.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a student in Murwi and sliced the veins in his arm because they saw him walking home with a bag of cassava, which they accused him of stealing.

When Cankuzo police tried to clear a group of soldiers from Mutukura Camp out of a Cankuzo bar, the soldiers retaliated, resulting in violent clashes. The police chief dispersed the crowd by firing into the air, and then the police pursued the soldiers back to the camp.
A man was clubbed to death in Mikoni, Gahombo.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The body of an Imbonerakure from Mwumba was found in Gitega town. He had been hacked to death by machete.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure came to arrest an FNL Rwasa supporter in Rohero. Another FNL Rwasa supporter fought the Imbonerakure to defend his comrade. Both FNL Rwasa supporters and another 2 FNL Rwasa supporters in the same district were arrested and handed over to the SNR.
A mob of people in Gahwazi rioted and chased a man down the street until the chief of the hill intervened and stopped them. The man was accused of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A street vendor in Kirundo was beaten by Imbonerakure for opening his stall during President Nkurunziza's visit to Kirundo (the Imbonerakure had ordered all businesses in the area to close).
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade into the house of an agronomist in Kigoma. He was injured but not killed. He is believed to have been targeted in a land conflict.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure, who were doing night patrols in Kiremba, raped 2 women.
A student was kidnapped by men dressed in security force uniforms from a graduation party in Kamenge. His family fear for his life.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was strangled to death by Imbonerakure in Bwambabarangwe.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure severely beat a man in Gasana when he tried to prevent them from forcing his wife to do night-patrol with them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 4 Imbonerakure attacked a woman who was selling fruits and beat her. The Imbonerakure then beat a military officer who tried to intervene.
A police officer in Matutu, Rutana, attacked a group of people who were out after curfew. He beat them and opened fire to scatter them. This police officer is known in the area for his violence.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Following a targeted FNL Rwasa killing by Imbonerakure, an unidentified person was killed in Bwambarangwe.
2 landowners in Gitaba were attacked by armed men in police uniforms.
Unidentified attackers killed a woman in Nyabiraba.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A woman who runs a local cooperative in Gitega was arrested and beaten by SNR officers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure attacked and beat a nearby family in Jimbi over a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a woman in Karinzi because she resisted paying a contribution to the ruling party.
A man accused of stealing bananas in Kinyonga was beaten to death by members of the community.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Bubanza.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Buhiga.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Bujumbura.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Bururi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Cankuzo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Kigozi.
Police arrested and beat 2 men in Kigozi because they had not participated in the march against the ICC.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Makamba.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Muyinga.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the ICC in Mwaro.
Unidentified men armed with machetes and clubs attacked 4 households in Giheta, wounding 4 people.
Unidentified men armed with machetes and clubs attacked households in Ndava wounding 5 people.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Some CNDD-FDD members in Cumba were beaten by Imbonerakure for not having participated in the demonstrations against the ICC.
A watchman was attacked and killed by unidenitified attackers in Mutaho. As nothing was stolen, it was speculated that the killing might be political.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A Frodebu member was beaten by Imbonerakure in Mutobo. The Imbonerakure were angry that he had not contributed to the CNDD-FDD party.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: The head of the SNR in Muyinga found people vending goods in a carpark. He stripped them of the goods and beat them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 people in Cumba were beaten by Imbonerakure for failing to participate in CNDD-FDD protests against the ICC.
A former soldier was ambushed and attacked by unidentified assailants in Masango. The attackers accused him of hoarding grenades.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: When a man criticised Imbonerakure for refusing to pay at a bar, they beat him and broke his ribs.
A man in Masango was killed over a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Gipfuvya.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: CNDD-FDD held a march in Cankuzo to protest against putschists. The marchers carried machetes.

20 November- 20 December. Three additional grenade attacks reported in the Bujumbura Marie and Muramvya provinces between these dates. Coded as 2 grenade attacks in Bujumbura Mairie and 1 in Muramvya at various points during the period.
Women in Muyinga held a demonstration to protest against the release of a rapist. The police defended the state offices from the crowd of women.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Buhiga.
Families evicted for the construction of the Presidential Palace staged a sit-in outside the Ministry of the Environment.
A person suspected of witchcraft was killed in Mabanza.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The head of the Jimbi Imbonerakure was arrested and beaten because he had given negative reports about his superiors.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A grenade was thrown into the house of an Imbonerakure in Musenyi, causing injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Nyambuye. They accused him of theft and of failing to join the ruling party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A member of the CNDD-FDD in Rutegama was beaten by the local Imbonerakure because he had not participated in nightly patrols.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure on a night patrol in Nyakabiga beat a woman who had broken curfew. When they were disturbed by a man returning from a bar, they beat him as well.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Mungwa.
24 November. Burundian police reported that military forces of Rwanda kidnapped fishermen on Lake Rweru in Muyinga province. They were later released. The reason for the abduction is not known.
A young man in Rushubi was beaten by residents, who accused him of stealing. He died of his injuries the following week.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 youths were beaten by Imbonerakure in Kibago. They had failed to contribute to the building of the CNDD-FDD office in Kibago.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: The local MSD leader in Kibaya was arrested and beaten by the police. He was accused of rebellion because he has not been encouraging his members to attend CNDD-FDD meetings.
A person suspected of witchcraft was killed in Mirango.
A policeman guarding a gas station in Karonda beat a civilian who resisted paying a bribe with a stick, leaving him severely injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: An MSD member in Bweru was beaten repeatedly by Imbonerakure and the head of the police. They accused him of participating in Tutsi military training in Rwanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man who was the former chief of the Imbonerakure in Munyika. They accused him of failing to support the party. They held him underwater and whipped him all over his body.
The former administrator of Kirundo, an UPRONA supporter, was killed by unidentified attackers at his home in Nyange.
An UPRONA Nditjie member was assassinated by unidentified attackers in Kirundo.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: SNR agents in Muyinga beat a youth, whom they accused of walking too close to their post. He was saved by people near the scene who called for injustice.
On 28 November, a BUCECO employee was kidnapped in Bujumbura.
Unidentified attackers beheaded a man and left his body on a hill in Kayanza. His body was found on 30 November - precise date of death unclear.
Unidentified attackers tied up and killed a civilian and then left his body in the Kibira forest. His decomposing body was found on 29 November - precise date of death unclear.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A gas station attendant was beaten by SNR agents, who discovered that Imbonerakure had been extorting fuel at that gas station. She was critically injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: A member of the MSD Butaganzwa committee was killed by Imbonerakure in his home in Busokoza because he continues to hold MSD meetings in his neighbourhood.

20 November- 20 December. Three additional grenade attacks reported in the Bujumbura Marie and Muramvya provinces between these dates. Coded as 2 grenade attacks in Bujumbura Mairie and 1 in Muramvya at various points during the period.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure tied up and beat a 60 year old FNL Rwasa supporter. When he tried to complain to the police, the police accused him of having demolished a bridge, and arrested him. He was released soon after due to his health condition after the beating.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Teachers (Burundi)
column17: The police in Muramvya arrested and beat the headmaster of a local school and a member of the FNL Rwasa. The police accused the men of instigating the attack on civilians by a machete-wielding assailant a few weeks previously.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: Imbonerakure beat an MSD supporter from Rutambiro. He was accused of opposing the CNDD-FDD party.
A grenade was thrown in a bus parking lot in Bwiza. A number of people were seriously injured.
The chief of the Mpishi hill was attacked in his home by unidentified attackers. One of his visitors was hit by a bullet.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: A youth from Bwiza was arrested by the SNR and detained for 10 days. He was tortured by the SNR. He was arrested because he took a photograph of a person wounded in the attack.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Vigilante Group (Burundi)
column17: CNDD-FDD supporters in a neighbourhood in Buhayira attacked and nearly killed one of their neighbours, who they accused of bewitching a CNDD-FDD supporter.
A Burundian deputy in the East African Legislative Assemby was injured when gunmen fired at him in Kigobe.
A man was caught stealing sweet potatoes in Mishiha, the community attacked him with machetes and hacked him to death.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade into a house in Buyenzi. One person was injured. The neighbours believe that a policeman's family was being targeted.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade at people waiting in a bus station in Musaga. 3 people were injured.
An elderly man from Buyaga, Muzye, was killed by unidentified attackers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter from Cewe was attacked and beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused him of fishing in the lake.
Police officers rounded up bicycle taxi drivers in Cibitoke. They were forced to pay a tax 2000-5000BIF. If they could not pay, they were beaten and their bicycles were confiscated.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A Frodebu supporter was beaten by 4 Imbonerakure in Rango. He was accused of failing to pay a contribution to the CNDD-FDD.

Police officers raided a church in Rutegama. They accused the churchgoers, who were conducting an all-night prayer service, of meeting to plan to destabilise the government. They beat all the attendants, including the women and children.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: The school secretary in Buganda was abducted by the head of the National Intelligence Services.

20 November- 20 December. Three additional grenade attacks reported in the Bujumbura Marie and Muramvya provinces between these dates. Coded as 2 grenade attacks in Bujumbura Mairie and 1 in Muramvya at various points during the period.
A grenade was thrown at the Hotel Passos in Kayanza. There were no injuries.
A group of people in Muyinya, Kabuye, beat a man to death when they found him stealing from a shop.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The Imbonerakure chief in Minago beat youth who attended the screening of a football match. He accused them of breaking the curfew, although the youth claim that there is no official curfew in Minago.
A grenade was thrown into a bar in Bwiza at around 8pm by unidentified attackers. 3 people were seriously injured.

Arrests: 30 people were arrested in relation to a grenade thrown in the Hotel Passos. The people were passers-by who had run when they heard the explosion. They were detained for 15 days with no charges.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A teacher was arrested, publicly humiliated, and then taken to the Muyinga jail and beaten by a group of Imbonerakure. They accused him of sexually abusing his servant, but it is believed that he was targeted for having criticised the ruling party.

column8: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: Bike taxi drivers protested in Nyakabiga, they clashed with the SNR.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure tied up a man from Gasave and beat him. He was accused of stealing.

column8: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Bike taxi drivers protested at the Cotebu market in Ngagara after an Imbonerakure had confiscated a bike. The SNR tried to suppress the protest and clashed with the protesters.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A businessman in Makamba was severely beaten by Imbonerakure and local officials. They accused him of stealing a phone battery, however, he believes that he was beaten because he was overheard saying that he would not vote in support of Nkurunziza's constitutional referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure beat a man in Mugozi. They accused him of disrupting security by arguing with his wife, but he is believed to have been targeted for political reasons.
2 people died and 3 people were captured in an exchange of fire between police and an armed group in Mpishi. The police also captured weapons which had been stolen from police earlier in the year.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In December 2017, a resident of Rumonge province was beaten by Imbonerakure for refusing to pay money for the May 2018 referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An UPRONA supporter was killed by 2 Imbonerakure in his home in Musema.
A family in Nyarutovu, near Gitaramuka was attacked by an unidentified armed group wielding machetes. The wife was killed and the husband badly injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The Imbonerakure beat the chief of Kamaramagambo hill during the nightly curfew patrol.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An elderly man was detained for 3 days and severely beaten by Imbonerakure because he refused to put up a poster supporting the president.

column6: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 18 December. Police arrested five members of the FNL-R in the Ruyigi province for holding an unauthorized meeting

2 young men in Mutobo were arrested by a police officer, who accused them of attempting to steal his rifle. The police beat them and then the military transported them to Bujumbura in a military vehicle, beating them while the vehicle was travelling. Aother youth from Mutobo disappeared on the same day. He is believed to have been abducted by the same security forces. The police commander is trying to force the youths to admit that they are stealing weapons to join a rebellion against Nkurunziza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young man in Nyabigina was beaten by Imbonerakure on patrol.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A young FNL Rwasa supporter in Rutambiro was abducted by SNR officials. His family has not seen him since the abduction.

column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: The head of the Rutegama police station and the local SNR had 3 people publicly beaten. They accused them of stealing a radio from a bar, although there was no evidence for the crime. 2 of the victims were then incarcerated in the jail.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa activist was arrested on Nyarurambi hill by the Kayanza SNR. He was beaten and held in custody for several hours. He was accused of holding meetings to plot to vote against Nkurunziza in the referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure beat a teacher in Bumba because she did not have her identity card. When the teacher complained to the headmaster, he instructed her to obey the Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa activist living in Kabizi was attacked and seriously injured by an Imbonerakure patrol, for breaking the curfew.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: The SNR in Rutegama had 2 prisoners beaten. The prisoners were arrested the previous day.

The head of the police in Nyabiraba beat a local shopkeeper. When the administrator of the commune intervened, the police blamed the shopkeeper, saying he should be punished for refusing to pay contributions to the police.

A man from Murengezi was killed by unidentified attackers and his body was dumped in the Mpanda river. He is believed to have been targeted because he refused to sell his land to the president's wife.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Journalists (Burundi)
column17: An influential Imbonerakure in Mubuga, working with the police, arrested and beat an FNL Rwasa supporter. He was accused of sending information to radio stations based in Rwanda.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: The youth leader of the MSD was kidnapped by the SNR in Muzinda. He had recently returned from Kenya, where he had been exiled.

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column17: FNL Nzabampema militants attempted to ambush the Route 5 near Gihanga, but were repulsed by soldiers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A 20 year old was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure in Rutegama.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A trader from Bugenyuzi was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused her of robbery, although there was no evidence that she had stolen anything, causing observers to think that she was targeted for political reasons. She was held for 9 days.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure manning a checkpoint in Butarugera stopped a group of men. The men had kalashnikov rifles, with which they attacked the Imbonerakure.
A security guard in Gihofi was killed by unidentified attackers.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 5 FNL Rwasa supporters were arrested on 28/12 in Gihanga. They were detained for 2 days and beaten in the police cells. They are accused of instructing people to vote against Nkurunziza's constitutional reform referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A teenager from Jimbi hill was beaten by Imbonerakure because he has not joined the Imbonerakure.

column6: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: FNL Rwasa supporters beat an Imbonerakure in Musenyi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: A pastor in Nyabibuye was stabbed by 2 Imbonerakure because he belongs to the MSD party. He was seriously injured.
A family in Murwi was attacked by unidentified men wielding machetes. The reasons for the attack are unclear.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure attacked and beat the guests attending the new year's eve party of a local FNL Rwasa supporter in Ntega. They accused the party guests of holding a clandestine meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure was severely injured in a fight between 2 factions of Imbonerakure in Gifurwe. He was left to die on the banks of the river.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man in Kinindo who broke curfew, and then beat a man who tried to intervene.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Ntunda attacked and beat a bartender.
Arrests: Between 12 December and 18 January, 42 members of the Amizero y'Abarundi (""Burundian Hope"") political coalition have been arbitrarily arrested.
The residents of Karambo beat a man to death. They accused him of stealing. The police have taken no action against the vigilantes.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure youth and police officers clashed when the Imbonerakure taunted the police. The police fired on the youths, injuring one of them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure wielding machetes attacked a man as he returned to his home in Kinindo. He was hospitalised for 2 days.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure wielding machetes attacked a man in Kinindo.

A man from Ruhinga was found hanged. Although the authorities claim it is a suicide, his relatives insist that it was a political death, because the family was active in the protests against Nkrunziza's 3rd term.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Bucana hill was beaten by Imbonerakure, using clubs and wires. The imbonerakure accused the man of bewitching the local head of the imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A group of 4 students were beaten by 5 Imbonerakure on Burenge hill because they had been overheard saying that they would vote no in the constitutional referendum.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: The head of the SNR in Muyinga arrested 12 youths in downtown Muyinga. 8 were released a few hours later, the other 4 were driven out of Muyinga in an SNR vehicle. They were beaten by SNR officers in the vehicle. On the same day, SNR in Muyinga arrested and severely beat a man. They accused him of being involved in a murder.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: An imbonerakure demanded a beer from an MSD supporter and then beat her and dragged her onto the street when she refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Teachers (Burundi)
column17: Astere Tumukunde, an FNL Rwasa supporter and a teacher at a school in Busoni, was arrested by Imbonerakure in front of his students. He was held in Busoni prison, where he was beaten. He is accused of telling people to vote against the constitutional referendum. Tumukende is one of many FNL Rwasa supporters targeted for voter education in recent weeks.

On 12 January 2018, a family living on Rambo hill, in Gikuyo town, were victims of a grenade attack. The wife and her 3 year old died on the spot, the husband died in hospital shortly afterwards. The attackers are unknown, but it is speculated that the attack was either revenge against the husband for his role in the 1993 massacres, or to do with suspicions of witchcraft.
Staff at the Kinyinya Hospital organised a protest against the contributions paid to the ruling party. The following day, 12 nurses were arrested for participating.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A teacher at Gasenyi School in Musonge was beaten by several young Imbonerakure. They accused him of punishing the students unfairly, but apparently he was targeted because they suspect he is a rebel.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 imbonerakure tried to block the governor of Nyabitsinda commune. The governor had his police guard beat the imbonerakure, and accused them of threatening his authority.

A woman and her 3 year old were killed by unidentified attackers in Gikuyo. The head of the family was also seriously injured in the attack. The police claim it was land conflicts, but the neighbours believe it was a political attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Nyanza-Lac beat and raped a woman.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure beat and raped a woman in Bogogwa.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In January 2018, the zone chief and local Imbonerakure pulled a man out of his car at a roadblock in Karusi province and beat him with sticks and clubs after he did not have his receipt for registering to vote.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In January 2018, a person was killed by Imbonerakure and his body thrown to Bishisha, not far from a Burundian military position near the border. Reports indicate that he was a Tutsi.
A group of unidentified armed men attacked a military patrol in Gihanga. The gunfire lasted more than twenty minutes, before the attackers retreated into the Rukoko Nature Reserve.
A policeman was killed by unidentified attackers on Kiyazi hill. This policeman had fled Makamba town because he had been threatened by Imbonerakure.
2 policemen in Mungwa tied up and beat a man who they accused of theft. Local peace officials intervened.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 20 January 2018, the communal president of Rwasa FNL and another Rwasa FNL member were arrested by police accompanied by Imbonerakure in Gasorwe.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 January 2018, a man was lynched by the Imbonerakure in Ruranga after murdering his wife the day before.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 January, an FNL member was assaulted in a bar by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man in Bukemba murdered his wife and then fled his house. The local imbonerakure chased him down and beat him to death.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure raped a 16 year old girl in Bubanza.
On 22 January 2018, a grenade was exploded in the town of Gitega in the middle of a road. No injury was reported.
Unidentified attackers set off 2 grenades in Munyika, near Rugombo. A 5 year old child was killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 young students were beaten by imbonerakure in their school.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure beat a man to death. This man had been caught trying to steal from an FNL Rwasa supporter's house. The police arrested the FNL Rwasa supporter and are accusing him of murder.
A man who had participated in the protests against Nkurunziza's third term was killed by unidentified attackers, who clubbed him to death.

When police came to arrest people from Kizina village, in Gihanga, the villagers surrounded the area and refused to allow the police in. Once the police had left, they attacked the people who they believed had informed the police, damaging their houses and beating them. The village is part of a land dispute.

On 23 January 2018, unidentified armed men attacked and killed a man and his wife using machetes and clubbed their baby to death. It is believed that the attack was because of accusations of witchcraft.
On 23 January 2018, a retired former soldier was found half-dead at the CNDD-FDD party headquarters on Tankoma hill in Gitega.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Kirundo rural. He was caught trying to steal courgettes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure beat a supporter of UPRONA. They accused him of hoarding weapons.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure moved around the market place in Kayogoro with sticks and batons, beating people to force them to close their stalls and participate in a party meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: At a public meeting in Mpanda, a girl complained that the Imbonerakure threaten and intimidate the population, with the support of the local MPs. After the meeting the Imbonerakure surrounded her and beat her up.
3 men armed with machetes beheaded a trader as he travelled to Gasenyi, near Makebuko.
A former FAB member was killed by unidentified attackers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 4 Imbonerakure beat a man to death and threw his body into a marsh. He was accused of stealing.
A man in Ngagara was killed by unidentified attackers

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A member of UPRONA in Butaganzwa was killed by Imbonerakure over a land dispute.
A girl who was visiting Gitanga went missing. Her body was discovered 8 days later.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: At the end of January, a Muyinga driver was beaten by the zone chief and Imbonerakure at a roadblock after he failed to produce a receipt of registration for the vote.

31 January-1 February 2018, Burundi military forces and FNL fighters clashed in the Rukoko forest. The fighting continued until the next day. 3 people including two Burundi military forces were killed (coded across 2 events) and many others were injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
