column17: Imbonerakure beat and arrested a group of young men in Rweza. The men were officially accused of cultivating cannabis, but their families believe that they have been arrested because they refused to participate in ruling party activities.

31 January-1 February 2018, Burundi military forces and FNL fighters clashed in the Rukoko forest. The fighting continued until the next day. 3 people including two Burundi military forces were killed (coded across 2 events) and many others were injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Kiyove, in Masango, was beaten and arrested by 2 imbonerakure. They accused him of illegally owning a grenade. The man claims that the Imbonerakure planted the grenade in his house during the search.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was attacked and beaten by Imbonerakure in his home in the Gikomero area. They accused him of telling people to vote no in the referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 2 February, an FNL member was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure in front of his wife and children because he was suspected of telling people to vote 'no' in the constitutional vote.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was strangled by unidentified attackers in his home on Nkago hill, in Butaganzwa.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: More than a hundred Imbonerakure gathered in Mishiha. They protested outside the houses of people known to be anti CNDD-FDD and threatened them with violence.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A former FAB in Jimbi asked the Imbonerakure leader to move his cow from the communal field. The Imbonerakure beat him and then held him in the jail.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by 2 Imbonerakure youth in Ruyaga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: The head of the Imbonerakure in Gatete beat an MSD supporter with a stick in the Gatete jail. The MSD supporter is accused of failing to pay a debt, however, his family believes that he was targeted because he is an MSD supporter. The victim was severely injured and has been hospitalised.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young man who runs a restaurant in Gihogazi locality, zone and commune was beaten Tuesday, February 6th by Imbonerakure led by their leader in this locality.

Three people, two men and a woman, from the Buzige locality in Ruyaga zone of Kanyosha commune, were arrested, beaten and stripped of all their possessions by a group of four men armed with guns around 8:30 pm on Tuesday, February 6th. As these three people were going back home, the assailants in civilian clothes arrested and beat them. They kept them for almost an hour before letting them go

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure youth in Buhayira. He was accused of calling people to vote no in the referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A young FNL Rwasa supporter was abducted by 5 Imbonerakure. They beat him severely and then took him away. The villagers believe that his body was thrown in the river. The Imbonerakure have told the villagers that he fled to Rwanda.

An unidentified individual threw a grenade around 8:20pm in the courtyard of the bus station. This information has been confirmed by the police, who indicated that the explosion broke the window of a trailer truck. A second grenade that did not explode was defused. Some people in the area were arrested for questioning.

The chief of the Kirundo rural district and province was attacked by unidentified individuals in Kavomo. 2 men threw a grenade at his motorcycle, which wounded his leg. They pursued him with guns, but did not catch him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The local Imbonerakure leader beat students at the Gihanga Communal High School. He accused them of being loyal to FNL Rwasa.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from the Murama locality in Nyabihanga Commune of Mwaro Province was seriously injured by an Imbonerakure youth leader on Thursday, February 8th. The perpetrator was arrested and taken to the Nyabihanga police station before being relieved for a few moments after members of the ruling party pressured police.
08 February. An unidentified armed group abducted two women from Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa leader in Mwaro, Nyabihanga, was attacked and beaten up by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A member of the Nyamwera hill council, in Maramvya area was seriously injured when the Imbonerakure chief attacked him with a knife. Imbonerakure also conducted a registration campaign in Maramvya. They closed down all shops and trading points and ordered everyone to register for the referendum. Anyone who failed to comply was beaten.
A couple were injured in a grenade attack on their home. The husband died from his injuries. Neighbours believe that they were attacked in a land dispute.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Supporters of the ruling party protested against the UN report on Burundi in the streets of the capital city.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure carried out a voter registration exercise in Buhiga. All passers-by on the Buhiga National Road had to produce proof that they had registered to vote in order to continue along the road. All markets were ordered closed, and all shoppers and stall keepers were asked for proof of registration. People who resisted the Imbonerakure at the road block or in the market were beaten.
A grenade was thrown into the crowd in a part of Kinanira commonly known as Chechnya. 11 people were injured. The police do not know who the attackers were.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Bugarama was beaten and then arrested by Imbonerakure, who overheard him saying that he would not vote in the constitutional referendum.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: An ex-FAB was kidnapped by the National Intelligence Service near Musaga. He was tortured.
2 men were killed by unidentified attackers near Buganda and dumped in the Rusizi river. The bodies then disappeared. The residents suspect that the police disposed of them to hide the evidence.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Bugabira carried out a voter registration campaign. They moved through the streets with clubs checking every person's registration number. The people who did not have registration numbers were taken to a nearby hill and made to lie on their stomachs, where the Imbonerakure beat them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A seasonal worker who had returned home to Karinzi was beaten by Imbonerakure, when someone reported that he had said that the constitutional referendum would not solve Burundi's problems.

Hundreds of people from Ngoma held a sit-in in front of the office of the Murwi administrator on the week of 12 February to protest the administrator's decision to demolish houses following a property dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Gihanga carried out a voter registration campaign. They closed markets and daily activities and beat anyone who could not produce a voter registration slip.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Teachers at the Nzewe School in Rukago were beaten with sticks and batons by 2 Imbonerakure because they did not have proof of voter registration.
A man driving home in Kibenga was shot dead by unidentified attackers.
Residents on Mungwa hill, in Ruramba attacked a family accused of witchcraft. They tied the wife, husband, and son up and beat them. Then they lynched the husband.
A grenade was thrown at the Wallis Centre in Musaga by unidentified attackers. There were no injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: A FRODEBU supporter in Murwi was beaten by an Imbonerakure for failing to register to vote.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Property destruction: On 13 February, five Imbonerakure destroyed the house of a resident of Rutamba Hill in the Muzye area in Giharo commune of Rutana province. They accuse the resident of ignoring a call to join the CNDD-FDD party.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 14 February, local authorities in Cendajuru commune (Cankuzo province), beat a man with an iron bar because he refused to register to vote. He later died in hospital on 18 March due to beatings he suffered during detention.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 Imbonerakure went from household to household in Gihanga, checking that everyone had registered to vote. They beat a youth who could not produce proof of registration.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 2 men travelling through Kayero on their way to work were intercepted by Imbonerakure conducting a voter registration check. When they admitted that they had forgotten their registration slips, they were arrested and beaten.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In February 2018, three people were killed by Imbonerakure operating in Bukorocco near the Rwanda-Burundi border. Reports indicate they were all Tutsis.

25 policemen carried out voter reigstration checks in Makamba. Citizens without registration slips were marched to the registration centre, to be forced to register. A policeman used a rope to beat people who had not registered.
The body of a Twa man, who had been tied up and killed, was found in the Taba marsh in Maramvya.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter from Rukago was picked up by Imbonerakure and brought to the CNDD FDD headquarters, where he was tortured. The CNDD-FDD wanted to punish him for saying publicly that no one should be forced to register to vote.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Gihanga hold nightly patrols where they beat anyone who is out after the curfew. Start date unclear - report dated 01/03.
A group of people in the Musenyi part of Tangara stoned and beat a man in his house who was accused of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 February 2018, Imbonerakure checked the enrollment card of people for the constitutional referendumin Teme Hill, Bugenyuzi. Those who did not have an enrollment card and could not pay the fine were beaten up.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 4 youths from Bujumbura attempted to cross into Rwanda. They were turned back by the Rwandan border guards and then arrested by the SNR. The SNR held and tortured them in their offices leaving two allegely in a bad health situation, and then handed them to the police, who are still holding them in custody.
On 18 February 2018, a grenade was thrown into the police station in Musaga. No damage was reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Gitsiro, in Vyanda, carried out a voter registration check. Everyone was required to produce proof that they had registered to vote. Those who had not were beaten and harassed.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade on Murambi hill, in Gitaba. One woman was killed and one was seriously injured. It is believed that the attack was because of witchcraft.
On 19 February 2018, police and military carried out a household search in Musaga. More than 200 people were arrested and forced to pay to be released. Some detainees were beaten by police.
On 19 February, a man was tortured by police forces using burning rubber in Murengeza, Mpanda commune in Bubanza province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure in Munazi began a campaign where anyone who had not registered to vote would receive 40 lashes (30 for females). It is unknown how many people have been punished in this way.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: When the presidential motorcade passed through Gifurwe, Imbonerakure beat a man who did not get far enough off the road, and the police arrested a man who tried to cross the road on his motorcycle.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure carried out a voter registration check on Teme hill. People without voter registration proof were beaten and fined BIF250-500.
Tea growers and police clashed in Kiyege, Rusaka, when the police tried to force the tea growers to sell their tea to the Burundi Tea Board.
2 people were killed in a grenade attack on the Muhenga hill in Buvyuko. It is believed that land disputes were the source of conflict.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A cowherder in Mitakataka was beaten by Imbonerakure because his cows got in the way of the presidential motorcade.

column9: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: Clashes broke out between tea growers of Nyamurenge hill, in Makamba, and the police and SNR. The police interfered with trucks from a tea factory to force them to reload the tea onto the Burundi Tea Board vehicles (the farmers are resisting selling their tea to the Burundi Tea Board). 2 farmers were arrested in the riot.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure strangled a man to force him to vote yes in the constitutional referendum.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 21 February 2018, police SNR abducted a FNL supporter in Kamenge (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 February 2018, two dead bodies in a state of decomposition were found near a position of Imbonerakure in Bukoroco, a few meters from the border between Burundi and Rwanda. Reports indicate that they were Tutsis.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 February 2018, Imbonerakure officials on the various hills of Kirundo commune began collecting receipts for every citizen who had enlisted for the constitutional referendum. Anyone, who tried to show any resistance, was threatened and beaten to snatch the receipt.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure held a demonstration march around different neighbourhoods of Mwakiro, to declare that no one will dislodge the CNDD-FDD from power.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten with sticks by Imbonerakure, who were conducting a house to house check of voter registrations. When they discovered that he had not registered, they beat him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: An FNL Rwasa supporter in Gahise, Butaganzwa, was beaten to death. The man's wife and neighbours believe that the murder was committed by Imbonerakure during a voter registration check.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 24 February 2018, an IWACU journalist-reporter was severely beaten by Imbonerakure in Giheta for allegedly spreading bad news about Giheta commune. They then stole his cellphones and money.
On 24 February 2018, a young man was taken out of his cell by unknown people at the Kamenge police station after being arrested and spending a few hours in detention. His whereabouts is unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Karinzi was beaten by Imbonerakure, who overheard him openly criticise the regime. He was also forced to pay a BIF30,000 fine.
On 25 February, a grenade was thrown at a main road called Kurya Kanyoni in Cibitoke Zone. Three people were seriously injured.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A senior CNDD-FDD official was shot when a group of military officers raided a bar in Mutoyi. He refused to obey the military officers so they fired 15 bullets at him, killing him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 Feb, the body of a young man who had been killed by Imbonerakure, was found in Gatete. The victim had been in the Mahama refugee camp in Rwanda, but returned to visit his family in Gatete and was arrested by Imbonerakure at the border.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 Feb, Imbonerakure beat a man on Ntunda hill. They accused him of saying that he had worked for the General Niyombare. The head of the hill made the man pay a BIF13,000 fine.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 Feb, 3 unidentified assailants armed with machetes attacked an Imbonerakure in Kabere. He was seriously injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 February 2018, two bodies were found in Busoni. The family of one of them was alerted on 23 February that he had been arrested by the Busoni Imbonerakure.
On 27 Feb, a man was attacked and killed by unidentified assailants in Murehe, in Minyare.
On 27 Feb, a person accused of robbery was attacked and killed by a mob of people in Kigutu.
On 27 Feb, a mob in Kigwena beat an accused thief to death.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 February, a Muyinga resident was hit by an Imbonerakure after he was overheard saying he would vote no to the constitutional revision. He was arrested and spent three days in prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 Feb, the head of the Gitaramuka Imbonerakure beat a teacher for criticising the ruling party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 Feb, Imbonerakure beat a man in Rwibikara. He was accused of saying that he would vote no in the constitutional referendum.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 February 2018, two young Imbonerakure (assumed unarmed) were seriously beaten by locals in Rugogwe center in Vyanda.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 02 March. 5 civilians forcibly disappeared by SNR agents in the Buyenzi neighbourhood of Bujumbura.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 03 March. A civilian was detained and forcibly disappeared by SNR agents in Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 4 March, Imbonerakure on a patrol in Buhiga beat a hill councillor. They accused him of disobedience to the ruling party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 March, Imbonerakure beat a Batwa man in Murwi. They accused him of practising witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 March, 8 Imbonerakure beat a man in a bar in Nyabisaka. They extorted BIF27,000 out of the man.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 March, Imbonerakure beat the wife and daughter-in-law of a man they arrested in Burambana Hill in Muramvya district.

On 7 March, a Twa communal woman from Mubuga in Ngozi, was found dead in Jimbi. She had visited a relative in Jimbi and been arrested for not carrying her national ID card. The community in Jimbi believed that she was killed while under arrest and then her body was dumped in the neighbourhood.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 8 March, the head of the Imbonerakure in Kibago beat an FNL Rwasa supporter. The FNL Rwasa supporter could not provide proof that he had paid the provincial building tax, so the Imbonerakure accused him of being a 2015 troublemaker.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 March, 2 Imbonerakure beat a man for more than two hours in Karinzi. They were angry with the man for not providing them with money for drinks.
8-9 March, Twa residents of Jimbi held a sit-in outside the jail to protest the death of a visiting Twa woman.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 8 March, Imbonerakure beat 2 FNL Rwasa supporters, who were accused of planning a campaign against the referendum no vote.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 March, 10 Imbonerakure abducted a man from his house and took him to the nearby Nyakabanda River, where they tortured him. They accused him of stealing.
On 9 March, a man accused of witchcraft was beaten by his neighbours and family members. He escaped death by fleeing into the nearby lake.
On 9 March, a body in a state of decomposition was found near the Kabirizi Lake in Bubanza. The date of the killing and the attackers are unknown.
On 10 March, a body was found on Nyamirambo hill, in Masango. The killers and date of death are unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 10 March, an FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Bihanga. This FNL Rwasa is frequently targeted because he refuses to support the CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 March, nine young men from the Kiyonza area in Bugabira commune of Kirundo province were arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure. They are accused of wanting to join a rebel movement based in Rwanda. They were taken to the SNR prison in Kirundo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 March, a young man from Musagara Hill was beaten by young Imbonerakure. He was blamed for insulting them and was beaten as he opposed the exploitation of family land.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 March, a young man from the Muzye area in Giharo commune of Rutana province was beaten by a group of five Imbonerakure on the orders of the party leader. The party hit him stealing 20,000 BIF so that this party leader would sell him his plot.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: On 12 March, a FRODEBU Nyakuri party member from Rukago Hill in the Gahombo area was beaten by an Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In the night from 11-12 March, more than a dozen young Imbonerakure from Murama Hill in the Kirundo-rural area in Kirundo commune attacked the family of a woman member of the UPRONA pro Charles Nditije. They destroyed property but no injuries were reported.
On 13 March, the dead body of a man was found at the Rwaba river bank on Mugerama hill in the Nyanza-Lac area and commune in Makamba province. He went missing two days earlier.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 14 March, a Burundian man who refused to register to vote was beaten, tortured and hospitalised. He died on 18 March. He had been arrested by Imbonerakure in the Cendajuru commune. On the same day (14 March), Imbonerakure also beat a man who was returning from a bar he owns in Cendajuru in Cankuzo for being out after curfew.
14 March. An unidentified armed group abducted a civilian from Nyakabiga neighbourhood in Bujumbura.
On 15 March, an army retiree was beaten by an army major in Kivoga before being taken to a place not yet known.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 15 March, an FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by patrolling Imbonerakure in Mayuyu area in Mukike commune of Bujumbura-rural after he was out during curfew.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 March, a 13-year-old child from the capital of Murwi commune in Cibitoke province was beaten and taken to the communal jail by two young Imbonerakure. He was accused of stealing.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: On 16 March, a member of the FRODEBU party in Bukinanyana commune of Cibitoke province was beaten by three young Imbonerakure. They broke his arm.
Agreement: On 16 March 800 prisoners were pardoned by Nkurunziza and released.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, demonstrations took place by CNDD-FDD members in the 18 Burundian provinces against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, CNDD-FDD members in Gitega held a demonstration march against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, CNDD-FDD members of the Mabanda commune in Makamba province held a demonstration march against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.
Defusal: On 17 March, a grenade was found on Gasave hill in the Nzewe area of Gahombo commune in Kayanza province. The equipment was handed over to the police.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 17 March, a demonstration against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi was held in Rumonge. The protest was poorly attended with most participants being Imbonerakure.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, around 300 members of the CNDD-FDD party in Kirundo demonstrated against ""false"" reports of UN experts on human rights in the country. Protesters were surrounded by police who secured the procession but did not engage.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March, CNDD-FDD members in Kayanza held a demonstration march against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 March, three young Imbonerakure from Rutegama, Muramvya Province assaulted a man to ""correct him"" as he was fighting with his wife. The three men from the ruling party were arrested and taken to the communal jail on 19 April before being released the following Tuesday.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 19 March, a FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member in the Rurwiza area of Nyabikere commune of Karusi province, was beaten and injured by two young Imbonerakure.
On 19 March, two young men from Nzove hill in the Rwisabi area of Mutahode commune in Gitega province attacked a soldier and stole his rifle.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 20 March, two FNL members were seriously beaten by Imbonerakure and stripped of their property in Mukerwa hill of Busoni commune in Kirundo Province.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Movement of forces: On 20 March a group of around 50 armed men from Interahamwe joined the Imbonerakure forces in Buganda commune, Cibitoke. The reason for their arrival in the town is unclear.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 20 March, an Imbonerakure from Rukago Hill in the Gahombo area and commune of Kayanza province beat a pro-FNL from Agathon Rwasa.

On 20 March, the dead body of a young man was found floating on the Kagoma River of the Mushikanwa Hill on Mutaho Hill Zone and Commune of Gitega Province. He had been beaten in the head with an unidentified object.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 16 March, a resident of the Musaga zone was arrested by the national intelligence service and detained in Bujumbura. Sources indicated he was tortured between 16-28 March to denounce any opponent of CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 March, the Imbonerkaure chief and members killed a former soldier by beating him with iron rods in Buhinyuza commune, Muyinga.
23 March. A civilian was detained and forcibly disappeared by the police in Rugombo, Cibitoke.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 23 March, the head of the National Intelligence Service (SNR) in Cankuzo province kidnapped three men including two FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa members and a Rwandan man from Lacolline Mburi in the Camazi area in Gisagara commune of Cankuzo province.
On 23 March, a 40-year old woman was killed by two unidentified men in Ndemeka area in Gisuru commune, Ruyigi.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 24 March, soldiers beat an FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member in Mukike Commune, Bujumbura-rural.
26 March. An unidentified armed group abducted a soldier, who was not on duty at the time, from Bujumbura.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 March, a policeman beat a youth leader Imbonerakure on Kibasi Hill, Gitega who asked him to share fine money between them and policemen.
On 26 March, a woman from the capital of Buhiga commune in Karusi province was arrested, beaten and put in the police station.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: RANAC: National Rally for Change; CDP: Council of Patriots
column17: On 26 March 2018, Aloys Baricako, chairman of the RANAC party and Pierre Kugirwa of the CDP were arrested by SNR in Gitega. They were released the next day.
On 27 March, a man from Buhiga commune in Karusi was beaten and taken to prison by a soldier.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On the night of 28 March, a woman was raped by Imbonerakure in Mubanga area in Ruhororo commune, Ngozi.
3 people were reported killed, 2 others abducted and missing and 19 arrested during the week from 26 March to 1 April 2018. Two fatalities recorded on 1 April. No further details provided.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 March, a student at ITAB Kigamba in Kigamba commune from Rusagara Hill and a hairdresser were beaten and taken to the prison by young Imbonerakure. They were accused of fornication.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 30 March, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Cimba Hill in the Nyabiraba area of Gishubi commune of Gitega province was beaten by an Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 March, a nurse from the Buraniro health centre was beaten by the head of the youth Imbonerakure in Matana commune, Bururi.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Weapons seizure: on 30 March, weapons and and drugs were seized at an Imbonerakure's home in Munzenze Hill, Mishiha commune, Cankuzo. The Imbonerakure was arrested.
On 1 April, a grenade was thrown in the town of Gitega killing two including a student and injuring fifteen. The attackers and the motive of this attack remain unknown.

On 1 April, a group of armed men ambushed a vehicle on the RN5 between the 7th and 8th crosses of Gihanga locality, Bubanza. The vehicle targeted was registered in the DRC. One passenger was shot and wounded, but the car continued on its way to Bujumbura. The attackers were not identified and vanished in the Rukoko Forest.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 1 April, a rancher was wounded by a knife by two young Imbonerakure in Murwi in Cibitoke province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 1 April, a man in Gitobe commune in Kirundo province was beaten and taken to the jail by Imbonerakure. He was accused of theft but no compromising object was found on him. The victim is an FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member.
An eldery woman in Ndemeka was killed by unidentified assailants. She is believed to have been targeted because she has been accused of witchcraft.
On 1 April, a Congolese car was ambushed by an unidentified armed group in Bubanza. One person was shot but it was not confirmed if they were killed.

On 2 April, the dean of Bweru communal high school, Ruyigi, was beaten by the communal police in a pub. The head of the CNDD-FDD told the victim he was accused of not mobilising the local population for the party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Property destruction: on 2 April, two young Imbonerakure vandalised a home and stole from a local resident in Buhiga. No injuries reported.
On 2 April, the body of a woman was found decapitated in Kirungu locality, Ruyigi. She was attacked by armed assailants while she was managing her field.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Students (Burundi)
column17: On 2 April, a pro-Rwandan FNL member Agathon Rwasa, who is also a student of the Bweru Communal High School, was slapped by the head of the communal police station in a bar in the Kirambi hill and zone.
On 3 April, 5 people were injured when a grenade was thrown into a bar in Ntahangwa, north-west of Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 3 April, an unidentified body was found in a gutter in the Masango area in Bukinanyana commune, Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 3 April, a 13-year-old shepherd was seriously injured by three Imbonerakure with machetes from Rabiro locality, Camazi zone and Gisagara commune.
On 3 April, five people were injured in a grenade attack near a pub in Carama neighbourhood, Kinama zone, Ntahangwa commune of Bujumbura.

On 3 April, the body of a man was found in Mutakura district in the Cibitoke area in Ntahangwa commune of Bujumbura Town Hall. The perpetrators and motives of this assassination remain unknown. Twelve men were arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Property destruction: on 3 April, Imbonerakure destroyed a woman's bean field in Mwenene locality, Nzewe, Gahombo commune for refusing to join the presidential party.
On 3 April, a police officer residing in the Musama district in the Kanyosha district of Muha commune of Bujumbura town hall fired on an inhabitant, wounding him on the shoulder.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 April, a soldier from Taba neighbourhood in Mwoya locality, Buhiga commune, was beaten and seriously injured by the neighbourhood chief and Imbonerakure. He was charged with domestic violence for burning his wife's possessions. The neighbourhood chief was arrested and put in the Buhiga zone jail.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 April, the police commissioner in Bweru commune of Ruyigi province arrested, beat and put in jail a transport driver. He was accused of having participated in the protests against Bujumbura's 3rd mandate in 2015.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 April, Imbonerakure from Rwibaga locality, Ijenda zone and Mugongo Manga commune, beat two young brick makers for not enlisting for the referendum and for refusing to contribute to the CNDD-FDD party. The victims were rescued by soldiers who were patrolling the area.

On 5 April, the body of a woman was found in Kirama locality of Mudende zone, Buyengero commune. She had stick marks on her body and locals believe she was the victim of mob justice following a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 April, a teacher from Murambi hill in the Gatabo area of Kiganda commune of Muramvya province was beaten by two young Imbonerakure for suggesting to the police not to drive to the prison of the commune.
On 7 April, a grenade was thrown in a cafeteria in Ceru-Gitamo locality, Gitega-rural zone and Gitega commune. No damage was reported.
On 7 April, three construction workers were seriously injured after a grenade exploded at a construction site in Gasenyi zone, Buganda commune, Cibitoke.

Arrests: On 7 April, law enforcement officers checked the registers of different households on 12th, 13th and 14th Avenue in Cibitoke zone, Ntahangwa commune. Twenty-five people were arrested in this operation but only two were taken to prison. The rest were released on the way after paying a sum ranging from 5,000 and 10,000 BIF.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 April, three members of the Imbonerakure from Nyarusange locality, Rango commune, broke a man's arm. They beat him for saying that he will not participate in the upcoming referendum.
On 7 April, the body of an unidentified man was found near a stream between Rusengo and Kwibuye localities in Muyinga Zone.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 April, a UPRONA member from Nkago locality, Butaganzwa zone and commune, Kayanza was murdered by unknown assailants. The perpetrators and motives are not known, but some of the victim's neighbours suspect that the Imbonerakure members were behind it.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: On 8 April, the head of the National Intelligence Service (SNR) in Karusi province detained four men in a cell of the SNR Karusi in Nyamugari hill in the Buhinyuza area of Buhiga commune. They are accused of recruiting rebels. Reports of torture during detention.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 8 April, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Rubavu Hill in the Busoro Zone in Bweru Commune of Ruyigi Province was beaten by three Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: On 8 April, two Imbonerakure members from Rwibaga locality, Ijenda zone and Mugonga-Manga commune, and a soldier from Mujejuru Camp beat an MSD member with beer bottles. They accused him of not registering for the upcoming elections.
On 8 April, the body of a man was discovered in Runyinya locality, Muzenga zone and Buyengero commune. The reason for his death is unknown.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 April, about a hundred young Imbonerakure from the Rutegama commune in Muramvya province launched intimidation slogans against members of the opposition. Holding cassava branches and clubs in hand they chanted that they will now monitor all the rebellious opponents who would seek to oppose the revision of the Constitution.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Arrests: on 9 April, twenty-one (21) members of a Tennis Club, one soldier, two police officers, and a 14-year-old, 16-year-old and 25-year-old from the Carama district in the Kinama area of Ntahangwa commune of Bujumbura were arrested by the SNR. They were charged with ""having visions of disrupting security"".

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 April, a man from Kirambi Hill in the Kirambi area of Bweru commune, Ruyigi province, was beaten by three Imbonerakure. He was accused of not paying the 20,000 BIF fine that they had asked him after having disputed with his wife the day before.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 April, Imbonerakure from Gitaramuka commune in Karusi province arrested, tied up and beat a man they accused of being a wizard.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: On 9 April or 10 April, one Rwandan and one Ruhororo Hill resident, were arrested, tied up and beaten on the Manga Hill in Jene Zone in Kabarore Commune of Kayanza Province by a National Service Agent (SNR) accompanied by a soldier.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: From 9-10 April, four Imbonerakure arrested, bound and beat a FRODEBU member in Nyankara, Makamba.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 April, an Imbonerakure youth leader was beaten and taken to prison by his colleagues in Kibenga locality, Gitaramuka zone. He was accused of disrupting security by fighting with another Imbonerakure member.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 10 April, a Rwandan man was kidnapped by people in civilian clothes. He was handcuffed and blindfolded and taken to the National Intelligence Service in Rohero.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 10 April, a man from Sehe Hill in the Masango Zone in Bukinanyana Commune of Cibitoke Province was beaten at home by three young Imbonerakure. He was blamed for not joining the Imbonerakure youth league and for refusing to join the CNDD-FDD party.

On 10 April, the body of a 70 year old was found in a bush at Village 5 in Gihanga Commune in Bubanza Province. They were reportedly killed because of accusations of witchcraft. The victim received several blows from their attackers before being strangled.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security Measures: on 10 April, a curfew was imposed in the commune of Bugabira in Kirundo province for 8pm. Young Imbonerakure patrolled in the evening, ordering the owner bistros, restaurants, shops to close and urging people to return before 8pm.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 10 April, a disabled teacher at Gatonde High School was beaten by two young Imbonerakure from Ruhuma Hill in the Rugwiza area of Nyabikere commune of Karusi province. He was criticized for not participating in their activities. The mother of the victim was also beaten.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 10 April, a woman and a man residing on Nyanza Hill in Marangara commune of Ngozi Province were beaten by Imbonerakure after being caught in the act of adultery.
Defusal: on 11 April, a man from Gahwazi Hill 2 in Mutanuka District in Mpanda Commune of Bubanza Province discovered a grenade in his field. Soldiers defused it.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 11 April, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Rubimba Hill in the Kibago area of Makamba province was beaten by three Imbonerakure youths.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency; CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Arrests: on 12 April, military and police officers carried out a search with Imbonerakure youth in Rugari and Gitamo on Cerudans hill in the Gitega-rural zone in Gitega commune and province. 70 people who did not have National Identity Cards (NICs) were arrested and 80 litres of prohibited beverages seized.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Between 12-13 April, a group of women who follow the prophetess Eusebie were abused by Imbonerakure in Rukago locality, Gahombo zone, Kayanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: Amizero yAbarundi; FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 13 April, Imbonerakure members beat a deputy of the Coalition of Indigenous Peoples of Hope (Abigenga Mizero y'Abarundi) and members of the FNL pro Agathon Rwasa in the Kizingwe district, Kanyosha area, Muha commune in Bujumbura. They were badly wounded.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 13 April, young members of the pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL party were beaten by Imbonerakure in Ntega commune, Kirundo.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 13 April, a pro-Rwandan FNL member from Kivoga Hill in the area of Gahombo in Kayanza province was beaten and threatened with death by the head of the communal police. He was accused of selling a prohibited drink.
On 13 April, the body of a UPRONA member was found in Murambi locality, Bukeye zone, Kibago commune. He had been strangled to death. Motives remain unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On 13 April, two teachers from the FNL party from Mupfumya High School were beaten by a group of Imbonerakure. A few days later, one of them was arrested by police.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 14 April, the secretary of the CNDD-FDD party in Kigamba commune of Cankuzo province and young Imbonerakure beat a bicycle mechanic. The party members accused him of seeking to attack members of the CNDD-FDD party. He was released on Monday, April 16th.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 14 April, a member of the FNL party was seriously beaten by two Imbonerakure members after he was accused of saying he will vote ""no"" in the referendum. The assault took place on Gatare Hill in Kabuye area of Rango, Kayanza province. His right arm and glasses were broken.
On 14 April, a man from Banda, Mubanga zone, Ruhororo commune was shot dead in an ambush by armed men. His death is linked to land disputes.
Defusal: on 14 April, a grenade was found in the courtyard of the governor's house in Bubanza province. Police carried out a controlled explosion.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: On 14 April, a member of the MSD party was beaten by the CNDD-FDD party secretary and Imbonerakure members in Rusagara locality, Kigamba commune, Cankuzo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: On 14 April, an MSD member from Busago locality, Murago zone, Burambi commune, Rumonge was beaten by members of the Imbonerakure after being unfairly accused of taking pictures. The leaders of the Imbonerakure accused him of contempt towards them and the President.
On 15 April 2018, a grenade was thrown into a house in Magara locality #2, Magara zone, Rumonge. No damage reported and attackers not identified. The target was a man accused of witchcraft.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 15 April, the family of a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member was assaulted by the neighbourhood chief and police in Kizingwe neighbourhood of Kanyosha zone, Muha.

Defusal: on 15 April, two grenades were discovered on a tree located near a police position in Kiguhu locality and zone, Mpinga-Kayove commune, Rutana. The police quickly defused these explosive devices.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 April, a girl was tortured at the house of a Rugasa locality leader in Kigoma zone, Bugabira commune by Imbonerakure. She was accused of helping three friends flee to Rwanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In April 2018, a man from Taba Hill, Ruhororo commune, Ngozi province was killed by Imbonerakure after being accused of witchcraft.

On 16 April, gunmen in military uniforms attacked Kagwema village in Bubanza province killing at least two people and burning houses before fleeing. A truck carrying cement was also reportedly ambushed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 April, a man from Lacolline Nyakiga in the Muriza district of Butaganzwa commune of Ruyigi province was beaten and forced to pay 40 000 BIF by young Imbonerakure. He had been confused with his brother, a member of the UPRONA party.

On 16 April, two people driving to Cibitoke were shot dead, and four others were wounded, in an ambush carried out by an armed group on the RN5 highway (Bujumbura-Cibitoke), Gihanga commune, Bubanza. The perpetrators of this attack are unknown. Alternative report mentions five people killed, three wounded and three others were kidnapped. The three abducted are Imbonerakure members of CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Security Measures: on 16 April, Imbonerakure imposed a curfew in Kiyonza, Kigana and Kigoma zones, Kirundo from 8pm. They set up barriers to regulate traffic.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 April, a member of the Imbonerakure from Nkonyovu locality, Mushikamo zone and Rutegama commune in Muramvya, beat a mentally challenged man for being out late at night.
On 17 April, an owner of a restaurant in the chief town of Rutegama commune in Muramvya province was beaten by the head of the communal police station for refusing to give money.

On 17 April, soldiers in the Gihanga commune of Bubanza shot a mentally disturbed man when he refused to stop when commanded. He was an ex-member of the FNL party. Report did not specify whether he died.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 17 April, three members of the Imbonerakure from Mayuyu locality and zone in Mukike commune beat a UPRONA activist. The activist had refused to show his national identity card to one of the Imbonerakure.
On 18 April, several people were arrested in a raid in Gituro neighbourhood, Kamenge, Bujumbura. Some of those arrested were beaten up.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 April, gunshots were heard on the Kibande hills (Kumabuye locality) of Mabayi commune in Cibitoke province when soldiers on patrol fired on a group of Imbonerakure also on patrol. The two groups would not have recognized each other. Four injuries reported.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 18 April, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member was abducted by the National Intelligence Service in Musenyi zone, Mpanda commune, Bubanza.
Security Measures: on 18 April, the lower house of Burundi's parliament voted to allow security forces to conduct night raids without a search warrant.

column9: Amizero yAbarundi; FNL: National Forces of Liberation
column17: On 18 April, 8 Amizero Y'Abarundi coalition and FNL members were arrested in Mutimbuzi commune. Two arived in prison in a critical condition.
On 19 April, A 60-year old from Kanyemerwe Hill in Giharo commune in Rutana province was found dead at her home. Land conflicts are at the base of this assassination.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 19 April, a sixty-year-old CNDD-FDD party member from Bukeye locality and zone, Nyanza-Lac commune, Makamba was found dead in her home. The attackers had strangled her.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 20 April, two pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL members were abducted by the National Intelligence Service in Musenyi zone, Mpanda commune, Bubanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 20 April, an FNL-R activist who attempted to murder the head of the Imbonerakure in Nkanda locality, Gasezegwa zone, Tangara commune in Ngozi was arrested and beaten to death Imbonerakure.
On 20 April, the body of a farmer was found in Mugombwa locality, Giharo commune. The victim had been strangled by his attackers.

On 20 April, a policeman from the Muhwazi position in Nyabitsinda commune wounded a man with the bayonet of his gun after the man intervened to stop the policeman from stabbing a mentally challenged person.

Arrests: on 20 April, over 100 people were arrested in the Mutakura neighborhood, Cibitoke commune Ntahangwa area, which is in the town of Bujumbura during police and military searches for identity cards.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: 21 April. The treasurer of the FNL party of the Amizero y'abarundi coalition was found on 23 April in critical condition in the Kizuka area in Rumonge province. She had been kidnapped by young CNDD-FDD affiliates on the night of Saturday, April 21st.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 21 April, three Imbonerakure of Mufigi hill in the Kiremba commune Musasaen area of Ngozi province beat and extorted money from a man on the order of the leader of the CNDD-FDD party. He was accused of teaching the population to vote ""No"" to the Constitutional Amendment. The victim was ordered to pay 50,000 BIF.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 21 April, Imbonerakure members held demonstration marches in the chief towns in all municipalities in Cankuzo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 21 April, Imbonerakure members held demonstration marches in the chief towns in all municipalities in Cankuzo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 21 April, Imbonerakure members held demonstration marches in the chief towns in all municipalities in Cankuzo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 21 April, members of the CNDD-FDD party from all over Muyinga province held protests. Aggressive slogans were seen targeting opponents of the referendum.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 21 April, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member was found dead in Gaterama locality, Bitare, Bugendana commune, Gitega. The family had recently received death threats from unknown people for leaving the CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 21 April, an Imbonerakure member was beaten to death in Buhiga commune, Karusi, by other Imbonerakure after being charged with theft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 21 April, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member was beaten by Imbonerakure and arrested in the Kiryama locality, Butaganzawa commune, Kayanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: On 21 April, an MSD activist was beaten by four Imbonerakure members in Rubungu locality, Rango commune, Kayanza. His leg was broken.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 21 April, Imbonerakure members beat four members of the UPRONA party, accusing them of mobilising the population to vote ""No"" in the upcoming referendum. The beating took place in Kiyonza locality and zone, Bugabira, Kirundo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 21 April, Imbonerakure members held demonstration marches in the chief towns in all municipalities in Cankuzo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 21 April, Imbonerakure members held demonstration marches in the chief towns in all municipalities in Cankuzo.

On 21 April, two people were killed and 35 injured in an explosion of a grenade in Gasenyi village, in Gahombo district in Kayanza Province. The fatalities later rose to six dead. 4 people, including a police officer were arrested.
On 22 April, a grenade was thrown in a bar in the Nyakibingo area of Gitega province. Light damage reported but no deaths or injuries.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 April, a police officer fired two shots at a group of Imbonerakure in Nyakibingo locality, Ntega commune, Kirundo. No exchange of fire was reported.
On 22 April, three dead bodies were found floating on the Kanyaru River in Ntega commune of Kirundo province. They had been tied up and were recovered by Imbonerakure members.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Since 24 April, a man from Ruhuma hill in the Rugwiza area, Nyabikere district, Karusi province has been missing after he escaped an armed attack by a man accompanied by two young Imbonerakure. The attack was related to a land dispute.
On 24 April, the body of two men and one woman were removed from Kanyaru river in Kinyovu locality, Mugendo zone, Ntega commune. Their hands were tied behind their backs.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 24 April, a woman from Kayunga village in Kiyonza area in Bugabira commune of Kirundo province was beaten by young Imbonerakure. They accused her of exceeding the curfew.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 25 April, a man from Rukere Hill in the Jene Zone, Kabarore in Kayanza Province was beaten by young Imbonerakure. They blamed him for trying to run his palm oil in Rwanda.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 25 April. SNR forces forcibly disappeared a civilian from Rohero, Bujumbura.
On 25 April, men armed with clubs attacked a family in Mahande, Murwi commune of Cibitoke. The motive was connected to witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In the week of 22-28 April, Imbonerakure students at Musema High School in Kayanza Province beat some their classmates when they forcibly collected money for election contributions.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 26 April, a grenade was thrown at the house of a CNDD-FDD member in Gacokwe locality, Ndemeka zone, Gisuru commune, Ruyigi. Only the gate was damaged.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 April, two men were arrested and beaten in Kizuka locality of Rumonge commune and province by young Imbonerakure. They were accused of campaigning for the ""No"" vote in the referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 April, one Imbonerakure wounded another Imbonerakure with a machete in Buhiga Hospital, Karusi Province.
Non-violent activity: on 27 April, a soldier who extorted miners fired his rifle in the air after they had tried to resist him in Cunyu locality, Gasneyi zone, Buganda commune of Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 27 April, a pro-Rwasa Agathon FNL activist was beaten with sticks by five Imbonerakure in Kiramahira locality of Rango zone. They blamed him for saying a ""yes"" vote in the referendum would cause the nation to ""disappear"".

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 27 April, a pro-Rwasa Agathon FNL activist was beaten by two Imbonerakure in Rango commune, Kayanza. He was beaten until he vomitted blood after speaking against the referendum.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 April, a young member of the Imbonerakure went missing. His body was found on 28 April in the Butamuheba locality, Mungwa zone, Gitega commune with knife wounds.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 April, a resident in the Murwi commune of Cibitoke was tortured in his home by four Imbonerakure members for not paying a debt to another resident.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 April, a man residing on Kinama Hill in the Gisuru area and commune of Ruyigi Province was beaten and wounded in the head with a machete by Imbonerakure for making a prohibited drink.
On 27 April, a Metallubia Company employee was abducted by three men - two in police uniform and one in civilian clothing from Ntahangwa commune, Bujumbura Mairie.
On 28 April, a dozen armed men in military uniform arrested and beat a man in Ruzingati locality, Gahombo commune, Kayanza.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 April, members of the Imbonerakure held a public demonstration in Rohero zone, Mukaza commune, Bujumbura Mairie. They chanted support for President Nkurunziza.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 April, the lifeless body of a young Imbonerakure was found on the Nyabuhira River from Butamuheba Hill in the Mungwa area in Gitega commune and province.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 April, CNDD-FDD members most composed of Imbonerakure held a demonstration in Kirundo. They chanted ""we must consolidate our strength because the 'putschist' general Niyombare has gone crazy.""
28 April. A civilian was abducted by an unidentified armed group in Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 April, four students were seriously beaten by a group of Imbonerakure on the Mutanga campus. The Imbonerakure said the students did not have reason to be in the campus. They were given to security forces who detained them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 April, a young UPRONA member in Bugendana IDP camp was beaten by Imbonerakure members.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 April, a man was stabbed in the face by young members of the Imbonerakure in Cumba locality, Rutegama commune. The victim was accused of breaking the curfew.
On 29 April, the head of the Kanyosha police station arrested and beat up a youg man and a girl from Ruyaga locality. The young man had refused to show his identity card.
On 30 April, 15 people were injured in a grenade attack on Karurusi hill in Gatara commune, Kayanza. Two people, including a soldier were arrested.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 April, a soldier was beaten and disarmed by Imbonerakure members in Rutongo area, Muhuta commune.

column9: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 30 April, a soldier from the former FNL movement disappeared from Muzinda in Bubanza province. It was not confirmed if he was abducted but his political affiliation suggests he was target for opposition to the referendum.
On 1 May, two people were killed and five wounded in a grenade attack in the village of Kabuyenge in Gisuru district, Ruyigi.
On 1 May, in Kanyosha commune in Bujumbura-Rural, two monuments of the presidential party were ransacked.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 1 May, the youth leader of Imbonerakure on Ruhororo hill in Jene area in Kabarore commune of Kayanza province attacked a FNL pro Agathon Rwasa member.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Property destruction: property belonging to a man with links to the CNDD-FDD party in Ruzingati in the Gahombo area and commune in Kayanza province was destroyed by unknown people.
On 1 May, policemen providing security at the Lycee Scheppers of Nyakabiga in Bujumbura-Mairie beat the workers who tried to return before the end of the ceremonies of the Labor.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 1 May, a man from the Nabubu sub-hill on Shari Hill in the area, commune and Bubanza province was beaten by a young group Imbonerakure who were on a night patrol. They drove him to an uninhabited house and started beating him.
From 2-3 May, two CNDD-FDD party flags were burned in front of the party headquarters in Ngozi commune.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 2 May, members of the FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa party in Rango commune of Kayanza province were beaten by Imboneraure with sticks at the capital of the commune near the market of Rangopar. They were returning from a meeting with Coalition of Independents of Hope (Mizero y'Abarundi) in Ngozi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 3 May, an FNL party member who is part of the Amizero Y'Abarundi coalition was kidnapped by Imbonerakure and National Intelligence Service from Kanyosha commune.
After a man was killed by Imbonerakure, inhabitants of the locality besieged the communal office of Giheta to claim that the culprits be punished according to the law.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Around 3 May, a man was beaten to death by Imbonerakure youth of the ruling party in the presence of some hill elected officials. The attack took place at Kibimba hill in Giheta commune of Gitega Province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 3 May, a former pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member was beaten in Muhanga commune, Kayanza Province as he was returning home by a group of young Imbonerakure led by the head of the CNDD-FDD party in the Muramvya area. He was accused of teaching people to vote ""No"" to the constitutional referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 4 May, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member and supporter of the Coalition of Independent of Hope was beaten by the Gasave hill chief and Imbonerakure in the Ntega district and commune of Kirundo province. They accused him of having openly declared that he would vote ""No"" in the referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 May, a resident of Rukere Hill in Jene Zone in Kabarore Commune of Kayanza Province was arrested, tied up and beaten by Imbonerakure youths in the commune jail.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 May, a man was arrested and beaten with iron wires by CNDD-FDD Imbonerakure on his way home from Bueheka in Nyanza-Lac commune, Makamba. Another man was also seriously beaten on the same hill in Buheka.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 5 May, an FNL pro Agathon Rwasa member of the Kigomero hill in the area and Tangang commune in Ngozi province was tied up and beaten by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
