column17: A dozen people including Imbonerakure, traders and a communal environmental officer, all from Kigina and Ruhehe hills in Bugabira commune of Kirundo province, were tortured on 24 July 2018 by CNDD-FDD party officials and the police in order to confess and denounce their accomplices in recent cases of robbery and armed attacks in Kigina area.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Labour Group (Burundi)
column17: A dozen people including Imbonerakure, traders and a communal environmental officer, all from Kigina and Ruhehe hills in Bugabira commune of Kirundo province, were tortured on 24 July 2018 by CNDD-FDD party officials and the police in order to confess and denounce their accomplices in recent cases of robbery and armed attacks in Kigina area.

Two anti-personnel mines were discovered on the 15th direct road in Maramvya area in Mutimbuzi commune of Bujumbura-rural province on 25 July 2018. The police and soldiers disposed of the mines safely. It is not known by whom they were planted.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A man from Gitongo hill in Bitare area of Bugendana commune in Gitega province was tied up and beaten by Imbonerakure youth on 25 July 2018. The assailants reproached him for beating his wife who made a donation to the 2020 elections.

Soldiers from a position on Buringa hill in Buringa area of Gihanga commune in Bubanza province shot and wounded a woman with mental health problems on 25 July 2018 as she refused to follow their order.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On the week of 25 July 2018, a man was beaten by Imbonerakure in a bar in Karehe, Muyinga. He later died in a hospital.
The body of a woman was found in Butezi hill and area of Giharo commune of Rutana province on 26 July 2018. The body bore signs of strangling. The woman was allegedly killed due to a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Between 22-28 July, suspected armed Imbonerakure with machetes was reported in the Nkenga-Busoro district of Kanyosha in Bujumbura Town Hall. Residents in this area report that two people were injured with machetes in separate attacks on that week by this group. Coded as two separare events at different points between July 22-28.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: FNL-A: National Forces of Liberation (Abarundi Faction); Prisoners (Burundi)
column17: On 26 July 2018, three FLN Abarundi faction members were arrested and tortured in the prison of Bwambarangwe police station in Kirundo province. They are accused of forming rebel groups.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 July, a FNL militant was beaten by 6 Imbonerakure youths in Bibara, Mutumba.

column7: Vigilante Group (Burundi); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD member from Kahirwa hill in Buhindo area of Murwi commune in Cibitoke province beat up and seriously wounded his neighbour on 28 July 2018. The CNDD-FDD member accused the victim of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: FNL members of Taba sub-hill on Bweru hill in Mubavu area of Bweru commune of Ruyigi province were attacked and then put in jail by Imbonerakure members on July 29, 2018. They were accused of holding an illegal meeting despite having an authorisation of the local government.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young woman from Shari-Gisovu Hill in Bubanza area, commune and province was raped by a group of men on 30 July 2018. The rape may have been committed by young Imbonerakure while on their daily patrol, but it is unknown.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A grenade was thrown at the home of a CNDD-FDD leader on Ceru Hill in Cewe area of Kirundo commune and province on July 31, 2018. No harm was done. The perpetrators are unknown.

A woman from Murehe Hill in Nyabitsinda area and commune of Ruyigi province was nearly killed on 31 July 2018 by her former neighbours who accused her of witchcraft. The incident occurred as the victim was returning from Tanzania on a UNHCR bus that was targeted with stones by the perpetrators. The victim has previously fled a popular justice act when her neighbours buried her alive.
31 July. An unidentified armed group abducted a civilian from Ngozi province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Non-violent activity: On 31 July, some Imbonerakure placed checkpoints in Gihanga, Bubanza, harassing people to pay their contribution to 2020 elections.
A man from Kahirwa hill in Buhindo area of Murwi commune of Cibitoke province beat up and critically wounded his neighbour on 2 August 2018. He accused the victim of witchcraft.

The body of a man was found on Kibaya hill in Ndora area in Bukinanyana commune of Cibitoke province on 02 August 2018. The victim was known as a holy man/ witch doctor in his community. His body wore stabwounds.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young Imbonerakure from Gashoho Displacement Site in Muyinga province was kidnapped by agents of National Intelligence Service (SNR) on 2 August 2018 from a bar at a junction with Kirundo province. He had been accused by his kidnappers of spreading rumors about a possible attack on Burundi by Rwanda. His location is unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On 3 August, three FNL pro-Rwasa militants were beaten up by ten Imbonerakure in Bibara, Karuzi.

Men dressed in military uniforms belonging to an armed group attacked three bistros on Ruzibazi Hill in Mayuyu area of Mukike commune in Bujumbura-rural province on 3 August 2018. Three men died on the spot and one was wounded. Soldiers from Musinzira position intervened, killing one of the attackers and capturing another one. The armed group comes from Mugamba commune in Bururi province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: Farmers (Burundi); FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: The secretary of Kabarore commune in Kayanza province together with other young Imbonerakure beat, arrested, tied up and extorted 60,000 BIF from a coffee farmer and a member of Sahwanya FRODEBU party on 3 August 2018 on Randa hill in the area. They accused him of selling green coffee to Rwanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Young Imbonerakure from Mbizi hill of Kibago area and commune in Makamba province raped a widowed woman on August 03, 2018. The assailants also humiliated her and the man whom she paid a visit to by driving them naked to the police station.

The commander of Mujejuru camp in Mugongo-Manga commune of Bujumbura-rural province and his guard tortured on 3 Aug 2018 a member of an armed group that had attacked three bistros on Ruzibazi hill in the province. The victim was gravely wounded.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Women (Burundi)
column17: A woman who is member of FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa from Mufumya hill in Butaganzwa area of Kayanza province was shot dead during the night from 3 to 4 August 2018. Young Imbonerakure were suspected of being behind the incident.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 August. Imbonerakure clashed with a soldier from the Mudubugu base (location of clash not reported). One person was killed and three others sustained injuries.

column6: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure youth from Butamuheba hill in Mungwa area in Gitegaa commune and province was beaten by two FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa members on August 04, 2018.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: The deputy leader of CNDD-FDD party in Rango commune of Kayanza province beat and wounded, with a bicycle chain, a member of Sahwanya FRODEBU party of Rama hill in Rango area on 4 August. 2018. The assailant reproached him for not participating in a national holiday celebration of the communes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The secretary of Kabarore commune, Kayanza province accompanied by an Imbonerakure arrested, beat and extorted money from two men at Randa hill in Jene area on August 04, 2018. The secretary reproached the victims who are pig owners from for sending pigs to Rwanda.

column6: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Armed men ambushed a military truck near Rukoko Natural Forest in Gihanga commune of Bubanza Province on 05 August 2018. Three army soldiers were killed and two wounded. The attack was allegedly perpetrated by FNL fighters of Colonel Nzabampema, who had claimed a similar attack two weeks ago.
On 7 August, Lumitel employees protested nationwide against the dismissal of 63 of their colleagues. Detail of locations not reported.
A group of five men in police uniforms looted three kiosks in a small center on Gerangabo hill in Rwisabi area of Mutaho commune in Gitega province on August 07, 2018.

During two weeks around 8 August 2018, gunmen carried out attacks in Gihanga commune, killing three Burundian soldiers and injuring more than five others (3 fatalities and 2 injuries coded in separate event).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 August, a resident of Karire locality, Bitare zone, was killed after being humiliated and tortured by members of the Imbonerakure who accused him of theft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 August, the members of the Imbonerakure from Magara, Bujumbura beat and arrested a resident of Magara locality, accusing him of assaulting one of their friends.

A young man from Ngugo hill in Maramvya area of Nyabikere commune in Karuzi province was seriously wounded by unknown assailants on August 08, 2018. Some sources say that the attack was carried out by members of the Batwa community as a vengeance for a recent killing of one of their peers.
08 September. A civilian was abducted by an unidentified armed group in Ngozi province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Looting: Report of regular lootings and harassment by Imbonerakure youth and police in Cibitoke zone (source dated August 10th).
On 10 August, a shopkeeper was beaten and seriously wounded by policemen in Magara, Bujumbura, as he didn't close his shop during the presidential parade.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-A: National Forces of Liberation (Abarundi Faction)
column17: On 11 August 2018, the president of the FNL Abarundi faction in Makamba, Rusaka commune was arrested by Imbonerakure led by the Makamba zone police chief on Nyamugogo Hill. He is accused of selling prohibited drinks. Although it is mainly believed that it is because of his political affiliation.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD party member of Gatagura hill in Butanuka area of Mpanda commune in Bubanza province raped a teenage girl on August 11, 2018.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: A young teacher who was a member of CNDD-FDD party from Rubindi hill in Mukungu area of Nyanza-Lac commune of Makamba province was found dead in the local area on 11 August 2018. The attackers strangled him to death in Mabanda commune. The perpetrators and motives of the killing are unknown.
On 12 August, the explosion of a grenade left on a field killed a child and wounded another at the Rutegama hill, Muramvya.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD party member from Kigozi Hill in Bikanka area of Mukike commune in Bujumbura-rural province was beaten and seriously wounded by a group of young men armed with stones and clubs on 12 August 2018. The perpetrators are unknown and it is unclear whether the attack was motivated by the victim's political affiliation.

Unidentified assailants attacked and destroyed an entire house of an elderly man of Kiramira neighbourhood of Murwi town and commune in Cibitoke province on 12 August. The man and his family were able to flee. The victim had previously been accused of witchcraft.
On 12 August, a grenade detonated after it was picked up by children, killing one of them and wounding the other in Gitega.

A man from Munzenze sub-hill of Murama hill in Kirundo-rural area of Kirundo commune and province died in a grenade attack on August 13, 2018. Unknown assailants threw two grenades at his home. His wife was reportedly abducted by the FDD as she was pregnant with another man, which might have motivated the attack.

An officer of Judicial Police of Kigezi post on Rushubi hill and area of Isare commune in Bujumbura Rural province was found dead at his home on 13 August 2018. The perpetrators and motives for the attack are unknown.

Unknown persons destroyed a house under construction in Murwi town of Cibitoke province on August 14, 2018. The inhabitants did not want the owner, who had been accused of witchcraft, to move to this hill.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member from Bibara hill and area in Mutumba commune of Karuzi province was beaten by a group of Imbonerakure youth at a bar in Mwahihwa sub-hill on 14 August 2018. The assailants accused him of opposing the party in power.

Unknown assailants burned the house of an elderly woman of Nyagumba hill in Masango area of Bukinanyana commune on August 14, 2018. No-one was hurt as the woman did not spend the night at home. The motive for the attack was a land dispute between the woman and her neighbour.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: The secretary of Kabarore commune in Kayanza province together with an Imbonerakure beat up and extorted money from three inhabitants of Ruhororo hill in Murago area on August 15, 2018.

The body of a man was found in Kajoro valley near Gasenyi hill and area of Buganda commune in Cibitoke province on August 15, 2018. The victim was killed by local farmers while he was in the act of stealing.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A grenade was thrown on the home of the CNDD-FDD administrator of Gihanga commune in Bubanza province on 16 August 2018 in Gihanga town. No-one was hurt. The author and motives of the attack are unknown.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: The house of the deputy head of Rukago hill in Gohombo area and commune of Kayanza province was torched by unknown assailants on 16 August 2018. The deputy head, a CNDD-FDD member, was accused of being an accomplice in a clandestine abortion, hence she became the target of people's anger.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure from Kibati hill in Masango area of Bukinanyana commune in Cibitoke province hit and wounded a resident of the hill on August 17, 2018. The assailant reproached the victim for insulting him when he demanded a contribution for the 2020 elections.
A post office worker from Murwi town and commune in Cibitoke province was beaten by a Judicial Police officer on probation on August 17, 2018.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Two CNDD-FDD members from Kigwati neighbourhood of Nyakazi hill in Bukeye area of Kibago commune in Makamba province were attacked by a grenade on August 17, 2018. The victims were severely wounded. The motive for the incident is unclear yet it is suspected to be linked to a land conflict.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member from Nkago hill in Butaganzwa area and commune of Kayanza province was beaten and wounded by a group of Imbonerakure on August 18, 2018. They accused the victim for refusing to contribute to the 2020 elections.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD party member raped a 9-year-old girl on 19 Aug 2018 on or nearby Mudaturwa hill of Bigina area in Kayogoro commune of Makamba province. The chief of the hill helped him flee to Tanzania the following day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A young woman from Buhiga hill, area and commune of Karuzi province was beaten and wounded by a young Imbonerakure on 19 August 2018. He blamed the woman for not stopping as he ordered.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure member was beaten and gravely wounded by clients of a local bar in Bubezi hill of Kayanza area, commune and province on August 19, 2018 while on his nightly patrol. The owner of the bar was later arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 August 2018, two unidentified bodies who were executed and thrown into the Kamatoshwa Natural Forest near the border were found. They were most likely killed by Imbonerakure and security forces.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member from Munazi Hill in Gatare area of Busoni commune in Kirundo province was beaten and severely wounded by two Imbonerakure youth on 20 August 2018.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure of Nkurubuye hill in Gisuru area and commune of Ruyigi province beat up and abused a local woman on August 20, 2018. The Imbonerakure assaulted her thinking she was an opponent of his party. The victim was pregnant and nearly suffered a miscarriage.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An off-duty soldier from the position at Gihanga hill and commune in Bubanza province was beaten and gravely wounded by a group of Imbonerakure led by one of the hill's chiefs on 20 August 2018. The assailants accused him of violating a recent curfew after a grenade was thrown on the house of the administrator of the commune.
21 August. A police officer in Rutegama beat a man then tied him to a tree for being near a road that the president was set to be traveling on.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Imbonerakure from three areas of Mwakiro commune in Muyinga province demonstrated and marched with war slogans on August 21, 2018 in their areas of the commune. The demonstrators sang that they are ready to face any invasion by an enemy.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: The chief of Kigwena area of Rumonge commune and province ordered for a Shawanya FRODEBU member to be caned and tortured by Imbonerakure youth on August 22, 2018. The chief had a land dispute with the victim.
23 August. A civilian was abducted from Bujumbura by an unidentified armed group.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: UPD: Union for Peace and Democracy; Prisoners (Burundi)
column17: A UPD pro-Mugwengezo leader was beaten and severely wounded by Imbonerakure youth as he was trying to escape from detention at Makamba police station, where he was placed on 23 Aug 2018. He had been arrested by National Intelligence Service (SNR) agents in an orchestrated case.

The body of a man was found on Muruta hill in Muyange area of Gashoho commune in Muyinga province on August 23, 2018. The victim is a Twa who was lynched by people when he came to steal in a household.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: An Imbonerakure from Kanyange hill in Buhinyuza area of Buhiga commune in Karuzi province cut off the genitals of a 9-year-old child with a machete on 24 August 2018. The victim died on the way to the hospital.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi); Islamic Group (Burundi)
column17: The body of a teacher of the Islamic High School who was a CNDD-FDD member was found near the victim's house on Nyagasebeyi hill in Musenyi area of Tangara commune in Ngozi province on 25 August 2018. He was killed by a machete by unknown perpetrators. It is unclear whether his political affiliation played a role.
26 August. A civilian was abducted by an unidentified armed group in Bugendana, Gitega.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 August 2018, Imbonerakure ordered members of the opposition parties to leave the bar in Gitaro hill, Kiremba commune of Ngozi. Imbonerakure group then beat every person who did not leave. When an Imbonerakure asked the group to stop, they beat him as well.
On 26 August 2018, a person was nearly killed by police forces in Bujumbura. The police accused him of trying to disarm them.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Burundi)
column17: A driver of Burundi Red Cross was shot in the leg by a police officer of the Anti-Riot Brigade (BAE) on August 26, 2018 in Kinindo area of Ntahangwa commune in Bujumbura Mairie. The BAE agent shot the victim as he was arguing with another man in a bar.

An elderly farmer was killed by five men at his home on Rushanga hill in Mugera area of Bugendana commune in Gitega province on 26 August 2018. It is suspected that the case might be linked to accusations of witchcraft yet the motive was unconfirmed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member from Burangwa hill in Magara area of Bugarama commune in Rumonge province was beaten by Imbonerakure members on August 26th, 2018 in Nyamwari Valley. The victim was seriously wounded.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: A MSD member from Bugendana Displaced Persons Camp in Gitega province was abducted in a vehicle of the provincial police from Mukoro on 26 August 2018.
A police officer tortured a prisoner at Bubanza police station on August 26, 2018. The victim was severely wounded. The policeman assaulted the victim due to an alleged extramarital relationship.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A resident of Murama hill was beaten by Imbonerakure youth on Gasave hill of Ntega area and commune of Kirundo province on August 26, 2018. The victim was accused of witchcraft because of a dental apparatus he had been carrying with him.

Three radio journalists were detained and severely beaten by the police in Ngagara area of Ntahangwa commune in Bujumbura Mairie on August 27, 2018 as they reported on a land dispute between the local community and the administration.
On or around 27 August. Local human rights sources report that two people were killed in Ngozi province in the week of 27 August (no information on circumstances).

A man from Mugendo hill of Muhuta area in Rumonge province was stoned by residents of the hill on August 27, 2018. The assailants accused him of having killed a woman and her child through bewitchment.
Residents of Ngoma area of Murwi commune in Cibitoke province destroyed the home of a family accused of witchcraft on August 28, 2018. The family managed to escape.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: An Imbonerakure member from Murehe hill in Gisuru area and commune of Ruyigi province killed a neighbour, who was fighting with his wife, with a hammer on August 28, 2018. The victim, a CNDD-FDD member, died of his wounds the following day.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: A CNDD-FDD member from Myave Hill in Ndora area of Bukinyana commune in Cibitoke province was killed by knives and bludgeons by a group of men on 29 August 2018. The perpetrators and motive for the killing are unknown. It is unclear whether the political affiliation of the victim played a role.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: Five FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa members from Jani hill in Bwasare area of Gasorwe commune of Muyinga province were tortured by Imbonerakure youth on August 30, 2018. These assailants accused them of voting ""No"" in the referendum.

31 August. A man was killed when unidentified attackers threw a grenade into the victim's home in Ngozi. According to local human rights sources, he was the third person killed in the province during the week (no information on the other deaths).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: A group of Imbonerakure manhandled a lawyer based on the orders of Kiyange hill chief in Kiyange area of Kibago commune in Makamba province on August 31, 2018. The lawyer was on a field visit in order to prepare a defense for a land dispute case.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: A group of Imbonerakure nearly killed a FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member from Muhagaze hill in Mugaruro area of Gishubi commune in Gitega province on August 31, 2018. The assailants accused him of encouraging the population to vote ""No"" in the referendum.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 September. Two members of the Imbonerakure beat up a man for missing community work in Cibitoke, Bukinanyana commune. They then sent him to prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 September (on or around). Five Imbonerakure attacked a man in Karehe for allegedly speaking ill of the CNDD. The victim was hospitalized for two weeks due to the severity of the injuries. The attackers were arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Two Imbonerakure from Rwimbogo hill in Masango area of Bukinanyana commune of Cibitoke Province beat up a CNDD-FDD man from the locality on 1 September 2018. They blamed the victim for being absent from community work.

Soldiers on patrol discovered a bag of ammunition and RPG bombs on September 1, 2018 in a forest on Rusabagi hill and area of Burambi commune in Rumonge province. The weapons seized included three RPG bombs, over 200 Kalashnikov cartridges and over 400 machine gun cartridges.
Weapons seizure: 02 September. Police announced the discovery of bombs, a Kalashnikov, and ammunition in Rummonge.
02 September. A man in a police uniform and another armed accomplice shot two people in Ngozi. The reason for the attack is unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 September. A member of the Imbonerakure abducted and raped a 16 year old girl. She was held for two days before being freed.

column8: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 04 September. A CNDD-FDD member was shot and wounded by by unknown attackers using arrows in Mika. The motive for the attack is unknown, however, it was reported that the CNDD-FDD suspected him of helping the political opposition.
On or around 4 September 2018, security guards working for a Chinese company beat a displaced IDP from the site in Rukaramu, Mutimbuzi commune in Bujumbura province which led to his hospitalization.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 September. Military forces and Imbonerakure were reportedly arresting opposition members in Kivumu. Local police mistook the military for criminals and went to intervene. The military forces then shot the police officers, killing one and injuring another.
05 September. Two armed men from Tanzania reportedly attacked the town of Gisuru. Locals and the military intervened and the armed men retreated across the border into Tanzania.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; FNL-A: National Forces of Liberation (Abarundi Faction)
column17: 07 September. Three members of the FNL opposition party were beaten and detained by Imbonerakure in Kiremba. At least two of them are members of the FLN Abarundi faction.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: 08 September. A MSD supporter was assaulted by Imbonerakure for not participating in a CNDD communal event.
08 September. Police forces reportedly clashed with three unidentified armed men in Kayogoro. The assailants left a motorcycle, with a Tanzanian license plate.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 09 September. A UPRONA supporter was abducted and beaten by Imbonerakure for not donating to the CNDD party. They abandoned the victim, who was later discovered and taken to the hospital.
10 September. The body of a local man was found in Gatoke. Neighbors believed he was killed the night before. The perpetrators and motive for the attack are unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-A: National Forces of Liberation (Abarundi Faction)
column17: On 10 September 2018, a member of the FNL party Abarundi faction was beaten up by Imbonerakure in Shembe hill, Giharo commune in Rutana province. He was then incarcerated in the police cell in Giharo.
12 September (on or around). The body of a man was discovered in Migera. It appeared that he had been stabbed. Date, perpetrators and motive remain unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 September. A member of the Imbonerakure beat a man in Muzingi. The reasons for the attack are unknown.
14 September. A soldier raped a local woman in her 50s in Matongo. He was later apprehended by local police.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 14 September. An unidentified group from the DRC attacked military and police forces near the border, in Gatumba. One attacker was killed and one police officer was wounded. Local witnesses, however, claim a higher casualty. Local officials reported the group intended to rob a bank.
15 September. Protesters gathered across Burundi to voice their opposition to the recent UN report on human rights abuses in the country. Specific locations of protest were not named.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 15 September. Suspected Imbonerakure members attacked a FNL-Rwasa supporter with clubs in Mutobo. Police intervened to help the victim.
15 September. Police stopped civilians and assaulted them before forcing them onto a bus which took them to participate in anti-UN protests.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 September. The head of the Imbonerakure in Gahwazi, assaulted a resident for not attending community work.

On the weekend of 15 September 2018, a military soldier and ex-FAB who had recently been transferred to the Burundian-Rwandan border of Ruhwa disappeared; it is unclear whether he was taken while on-duty. According to RPA, he is among those abducted by Burundian security forces.

15 September. The local administration in Mabayi is forcing civilians to patrol along the border with Rwanda at night. The decision was reportedly taken to prevent rebels from crossing the border into the country. Locals have spoken out against the order, saying it is the job of the military and the police and they are not capable of patrolling the borders if they are unarmed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 September. Imbonerakure members beat-up the Municipal Vice-President of the y'Abarundi coalition. He was treated with light injuries.
16 September. An old man was stabbed and severely injured by unknown perpetrators in Munyinya. The motive is unknown but some speculate the attack stemmed from witchcraft accusations.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 16 September. Two men threw a grenade into a CNDD-FDD members house in Nyabigabiro, seriously injuring one. The attack was reportedly part of a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 September. While on a night patrol in Nyabiraba, an Imbonerakure member attacked a civilian with a machete for walking at night. The man protected himself with a barrel and escaped uninjured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 September. A member of the Imbonerakure beat a pregnant woman, causing her to miscarry. He reportedly attacked her for selling drinks without the permission of the Imbonerakure.
17 September. An unidentified armed group abducted a civilian in the Ngozi province.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 September. The house of an Imbonerakure member in Bugenyuzi was set on fire by unknown perpetrators.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 September. Imbonerakure broke into the house of two sisters members of their party in Gatete and demanded them to pay a bribe. When they refused, the Imbonerakure assaulted them, breaking the arm of one of them.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 September. An unidentified armed group killed a member of the Imbonerakure and his wife in Kabarore, decapitating the man and keeping his head. Some suspect the perpetrators came from Rwanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 19 September. Imbonerakure beat and detained 16 members of FNL-Rwasa in Musenyi. The members had gathered at a house for a meeting. After beating the members, the Imbonerakure took them to the police station.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 September. Imbonerakure attacked a bar in Muyinga, injuring several people, three severely. The attackers reportedly targeted the bar as the owner had not paid the group.

On or around 19 September 2018, an (assumed off-duty) soldier and ex-FAB was abducted on his way to Ngagara camp; his motorcycle was also stolen. According to RPA, they are among those abducted by Burundian security forces.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 September. The body of an Imbonerakure member was found in Rusengo. The blood had been drained and the murder is believed to be linked to witchcraft.
On 20 September 2018, a customs declarant was kidnapped by people in police uniforms when he was going to take his child to school in or near Kabondo.
On 20 September 2018, military forces attacked people in a bar in Kibezi and beat them. Three of the victims were seriously injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 21 September 2018, an off-duty soldier was beaten by Imbonerakure of the CNDD-FDD party in Musaga after he tried to collect debt from a woman.
21 September. Residents of Butahana demonstrated against a Russian mining company in the area. The demonstrators threw stones at the police who fired shots into the air to disperse the demonstration.

22 September. Demonstrators marched in Bujumnbura to call on the government to withdraw from the UN Human Rights Council, following the organization's recent report on human rights violations and abuses within the country.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 September. Imbonerakure entered the home of the local FNL leader in Rango, beat him, stole his money and abducted him. He was released soon after.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 September. Imbonerakure and police reportedly beat up and elderly woman in Mabayi. The woman had opposed the construction of a road through her tea plantation and was seeking compensation for it.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 22 September. Five members of the Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa member.
22 September. A grenade struck the outside of the Police Commissioner's home. He escaped unhurt. Police arrested 10 people in a bar soon after.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 September. Imbonerakure beat a civilian in Gashikanwa.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 24 September. An Amizero man was beaten in Buganda by a member of the Imbonerakure and National Intelligence agency for not attending the protest against the UN.

24 September. Men armed with explosives and machetes threw a grenade in a family home in Mugina. At least one child was killed (other sources indicate a woman was killed as well). Locals suspect they were targeted due to witchcraft accusations, others indicated it was due to a land dispute.
24 September. Attackers burned down a home, while the owner was still inside. The man was seriously injured. The attackers reportedly believed the man was a witch.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 September. Soldiers and Imbonerakure in Rukina reportedly raped a woman.
25 September. The body of a woman who appears to have been murdered was discovered in Mugina. No details on when she might have been killed (time precision coded as 3).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-A: National Forces of Liberation (Abarundi Faction)
column17: 26 September 2018, two members of the FNL Abarundi faction in Marangara commune, Ngozi province, were beaten by Imbonerakure. They were imprisoned the next day when they went to the police station to file a complaint.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 26 September. A FNL-Rwasa member was stabbed to death then his house was set on fire in Sampeke. According to the victim's daughter Imbonerakure were responsible for the attack, however, others indicated it was the result of witchcraft accusations.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 September 2018, five Imbonerakure members attacked a civilian with machetes and robbed him while the Imbonerakure were on night patrol. He was left injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 September. Imbonerakure in Kayogoro beat two youth for being out at night.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 September. A teacher from the Mizuga school in Muyinga was beaten by Imbonerakure then arrested for maintaining a stock of food supplies for the students.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 September. While on patrol, soldiers from the Rukina base and Imbonerakure reportedly raped a woman.
28 September (on or around). The body of a slain woman was discovered in Mikore. The body appears to have been dumped in the location after she was killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 September. Imbonerakure and the local chief of Marembo beat a man for not paying CNDD party dues.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 September. A man was beaten with clubs and machetes by Imbonerakure in Rugombo. The attack was reportedly over a land dispute between the man and his brothers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 30 September 2018, an FNL member who had just returned from exile in Tanzania was beaten by Imbonerakure in Munzenze and then arrested and handed over to the head of the national intelligence service in Cankuzo. His whereabouts is unknown.
30 September. A woman was beaten to death by her neighbor who accused her of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 October. Imbonerakure assaulted a man for the shirt he was wearing.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 October. Imbonerakure assaulted a man for not giving them alcoholic drinks.
01 October. A man was killed by unknown assailants after he was accused of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 October. Imbonerakure members killed a woman in Nyabibuye. They accused her of witchcraft. The perpetrators were later arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 October. A woman in Kinzanza was beaten by Imbonerakure members who accused her of having a lover.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 October. Imbonerakure tried to lynch a thief but the military intervened.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 03 October. Police in Yaranda beat a FNL-Rwasa supporter. They accused him of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: 03 October. Six Imbonerakure members assaulted a MSD supporter in Ninga for not donating to the 2020 elections.
04 October. A grenade injured two people in Musaga. It is suspected that the attack was intended for police who often patrol the area at night.
04 October. A man in Kirambi was killed after being accused of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 October. Imbonerakure members assaulted a UPRONA supporter in Kivoga. They accused the victim of not paying a communal tax.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 October. A member of the Imbonerakure assaulted a woman in Murwi after she went to repay a debt.
05 October (on or around). An angry mob lynched a taxi driver in Rumonge. He died from his injuries at the hospital.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 06 October. Imbonerakure tied up and beat up two FNL Rwasa supporters in Rango. After assaulting the victims, the perpetrators threw them into a small river.
07 October. An armed group believed to be from Rwanda attacked two households in Mugina. One woman and two children were killed during the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 07 October. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL Rwasa supporter in the Mungwa area. The attackers were arrested.
07 October. A woman was killed by unknown assailants in Mutaho. She had been accused of witchcraft.

On 7 October 2018, a Burundian soldier who was a former FLN member disappeared in the Musaga zone of Muha commune in Bujumbura town hall. He left his home that day saying that he would meet with a colleague.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 October. A woman was assaulted by two Imbonerakure members in Bwoga. The victim tried to collect payments owed to her by one of the assailants before they beat her.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 October. Imbonerakure tortured a man who had recently returned home after seeking refuge in Rwanda. They then took him to a facility for ""correction and recovery.""

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 October. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Nyabikere for not paying his bar tab.
08 October. Locals in Bukwavu caught a thief and tried to set him on fire. Police intervened.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column9: Teachers (Burundi); MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: On or before 9 October 2019. CNDD-FDD party officials, along with Imbonerakure and local police beat up some teachers and detained one who was an MSD supporter in Matongo. The teacher has not been seen since. This attack and disappearance coincides with a larger persecution of teachers who support opposition parties in Matongo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 09 October. An Imbonerakure member in Muzya killed a man over a land dispute. He was later arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 October. Imbonerakure attacked a trader who was returning to Bugwana from Muyinga. They also robbed him.

column8: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: 11 October. Prisoners in Gitega began revolting over the food in the prison and threw rocks. The prison guards utilized tear gas and live ammunition to restore order.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 October. Imbonerakure in Kivoga assaulted a man and his wife for having visitors.
13 October. A UPRONA supporter in Munyinya was killed by unknown assailants.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 October (on or around). Military forces, along with Imbonerakure and police have been patrolling the border with Rwanda around Ruhwa.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 October. A civilian motorcyclist was beaten and arrested by police in Rusaka. He was a member of the Imbonerakure and was was accused of having criticised new police officers the previous day.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 19 October. An armed group crossed into Nyamitanga from the DRC and attacked a military base. Four soldiers were killed and six were injured during the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 20 October. Imbonerakure members assaulted a FNL Rwasa supporter in Rango. They attacked the man for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD. They then forced him to sell his livestock and give them the money.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 20 October. Imbonerakure in Rutambiro beat and detained a member of the FRODEBU. The police intervened and made arrests. The victim was later released.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Women (Burundi)
column17: 20 October. Women from the CNDD-FDD held a march in Makamba to show their strength.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 21 October. A civilian was detained and disappeared by SNR agents in Cendajuru, Cankuzo.
21 October. Two police officers attacked a bar in Kagoma. They fired their weapons and assaulted the customers, injuring one person. The attackers were later arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 21 October. A man was beaten by the local head of the CNDD-FDD in Gitaramuka before being taken to the local detention facility.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 October. A member of the Imbonerakure broke into the house of a widow in Murama and attempted to rape her. He then beat her.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: FNL-A: National Forces of Liberation (Abarundi Faction)
column17: On 21 October 2018, former leader of the FNL Abarundi faction in Gisagara commune was arrested by Imbonerakure in the center of Cendajuru commune and taken to the SNR office in Cankuzo. Reports indicate that he was tortured. His whereabouts is unknown.
22 October. During the night, soldiers mistakenly shot and killed two fishermen in the Rukoko forest. They mistook them for rebels.
22 October. A man beat an eighty year-old to death, accusing him of witchcraft.
23 October. A man was killed by a vigilante group after stealing a goat in Senga.
23 October (on or around). The body of a young woman was found hung on a tree in Ndemeka.
24 October. A mob in Rubaragaza beat a man who was allegedly trying to steal a goat. Police sent the suspect to a hospital for treatment.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 24 October. During the night, a CNDD-FDD member in Kibaya was killed. The motive for the attack is unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 October. Imbonerakure assaulted two FNL-Bigirmana supporters, and another man who attempted to intervene in Bwasare.

25 October. Police assaulted five people in Gihanda for violating curfew. They were beaten with riffle butts before being arrested. Senior officers took them for medical treatment the following morning.
25 October. A police officer in Ngoma was caught raping a mentally handicapped girl.
25 October. A woman's house was burned down in Murwi following accusations that she was a witch.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 October. Imbonerakure assaulted two UPRONA supporters for not donating to the CNDD 2020 election campaign.
26 October. Police officers beat up a beer vendor in Gisuru and discharged their weapons. The officers accused him of belonging to an armed group. Another police division intervened.
26 October. A woman was killed in Muyange, following witchcraft accusations against her.
27 October. The chief of Rutegama in Munanira zone in Gihogazi commune tied up and assaulted a girl. He accused her of involvement in the disappearance of another girl.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 27 October. A FNL-Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Gaheta, Rango commune in Kayanza.
27 October. Armed men assaulted three civilians near the border with Tanzania.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 October. A man was assaulted by Imbonerakure after his boss brought him to the group and accused him of stealing at the mine where he worked.
28 October. A man was abducted and stabbed by unknown assailants before being left in the bush.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 October. Imbonerakure beat and stripped a suspected thief in the Mwegereza market. Locals intervened and the man was taken to the hospital for treatment before being sent to jail.

29 October. The Busoni Administrator was ambushed while traveling back from Kirundo. The attack took place at Kamirampfizi (no coordinates available). One of the official's police guards were injured during the attack.
30 October. A body was found tied to a tree in the Nyamiyonga area of Kirama. Residents believe the man was killed elsewhere then dumped in Kirama.
30 October. A local Red Cross leader was killed in Mitakataka.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 October. The police intervened when a prominent Imbonerakure tried to sexually assault a woman in Kinyinya. The assailant fought with the police and attempted to steal their weapons.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 October. A prominent Imbonerakure member attempted to rape a pregnant woman in Kinyinya. When locals intervened the assailant began beating the woman. Police responded and were eventually able to detain the preparator. Locals indicated that this was not his first attack against women.
31 October. A civilian was abducted from Mutanga Nord neighbourhood of Bujumbura by an unidentified armed group.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Former FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Private Security Forces (Burundi)
column17: On 1 November 2018, an unidentified armed group abducted a private security guard, former FNL and current CNDD-FDD member in Nyamabere (Mpanda, Burundi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 01 November. A group of eight Imbonerakure members beat a FNL-Rwasa supporter in Kibungo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 November. One of the Imbonerakure chiefs of Kinyinya commune attempted to rape a woman. Police arrested him.
02 November. Two bodies were dumped in the Kigobe area (no coordinates available) of Ntahangwa.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 02 November. The pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL leader in Kayongozi area was arrested by Bweru police on the governor's orders and taken to the Ruyigi provincial police station. He was accused of clandestine meeting of his party FNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 02 November. Imbonerakure assaulted a teacher from Rusagara, who was a FNL-Rwasa supporter. Another teacher, who was a member of the CNDD-FDD tried to intervene was also beaten.
03 November. A woman was seriously injured after a grenade attack in Mugina. It is suspected that she was targeted due to witchcraft accusations.

03 November. Military forces intercepted a group of armed bandits who had committed a robbery in Tanzania and were crossing back into Burundi, at Nkurubuye. The groups exchanged fire and one soldier was killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 November. A member of the UPRONA party pro Charles Nditije who is also a member of the communal council was beaten by a young Imbonerakure in Gisagara.

04 November. Two salesmen were arrested at the border in Kanyaru, while traveling to Uganda to purchase goods for their business. After being detained over night they were placed on a truck to an unknown location. Relatives received a call that the detainees were being released but have been unable to locate them or determine where the truck took them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 November. A suspected robber was killed by Imbonerakure.
04 November. A man was beaten by police before they arrested him for insulting government institutions.
05 November. Heavy troop deployment of Burundian army around Kabarore commune.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 05 November. A Congolese soldier was arrested at Rumonge port and taken to the cell of the provincial head of the National Intelligence Service (SNR). The Congolese soldier was arrested while selling fish being in civilian clothes.
Assumed on November 7, near Busoni commune (Kirundo), eight bodies of people killed and dumped were found floating on Lake Rweru. The attackers have not been identified.
07 November. A woman accused of witchcraft was killed with a machete in Gitwenge.
09 November. During a dispute, a soldier shot and killed a corporal and wounded another soldier before shooting himself.
09 November. Citizens of Rutegama protested against the chief of Rutegama commune to demand that a man who had just been beaten be taken to the hospital

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 10 November. Two FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa members were abducted by unknown persons in Butaganzwa.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On November 11, in Murwi commune (Murwi, Cibitoke), thousands of Imbonerakure youths staged a demonstration and sang intimidating songs and blocked traffic during the opening ceremony of the CNDD-FDD party's communal office, demanding that recalcitrant opponents be wounded.
On November 11, in Kigina town (Kirundo, Kirundo), an armed communal group attacked and killed two people for allegedly practicing witchcraft.
On November 11, in Bugabira commune (Kirundo, Kirundo), a villager killed a man and his wife with machetes, condemning them of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On November 12, in Gisenyi town (Busoni, Kirundo), Imbonerakure youth assaulted a local resident stating that they did not want relationship between Burundi and Rwanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On November 12, in Ntega town (Ntega, Kirundo), Imbonerakure youth assaulted a resident, accusing him of walking in their center at night when he is not even member of their party CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 12 November. A pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Musongati Commune was assaulted by a Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 12 November. A FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member was beaten by an Imbonerakure in Busoni.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 November. A cow trader from Kigamba was seriously wounded by knives and machetes by Imbonerakure. The victim was rushed to the Cankuzo hospital. The Imbonerakure were arrested and taken to Kigamba jail before being transferred to the provincial police station.
12 November. A soldier on leave raped a 7-year-old girl in Murwi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 November. A man from Nyabitsinda commune was beaten by the youth leader of Imbonerakure in this commune.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 November. A woman from Makamba was arrested, abused and insulted by an Imbonerakure.

On November 13, in Bururi city (Bururi, Bururi), unidentified men abducted a Magistrate named Nicaise Niyungeko from his office at the prosecutor's office of the Republic of Bururi. The Magistrate was working on an anti-corruption case.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 November. A tomato grower from Nyanza-Lac was tortured by youth leader of the local Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 November. A civilian was beaten and seriously wounded by a young Imbonerakure in Mishiha commune.
14 November. A civilian was arrested and beaten by police officers in Kamenge. The identity of the victim, the motive for arrest and his fate are not yet known.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On November 16, in Rango town (Kayanza, Kayanza), CNDD-FDD members subjected two Amizero y Abarundi to torture after arresting them.
16 November. Three civilians were abducted from Kanyosha, Mboza by an unidentified armed group.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On November 16, in Mpanda town (Mpanda, Bubanza), Imbonerakure youth beat a policeman and warned of reprisals if he dared to shoot them.
On November 16, in Muzenga town (Rumonge, Rumonge), a group of armed villagers killed their cousin over a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On November 17, in Mufunya town (Butaganzwa, Kayanza), Imbonerakure youth assaulted three party members FNL Agathon Rwasa over party criticism.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: On November 17, in Mayuyu town (Mukike, Bujumbura Rural), Imbonerakure youth assaulted a party member of FNL Agathon Rwasa over party criticism.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 17 November. Three members of FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa from Butaganzwa commune were beaten by young Imbonerakure

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 17 November. A pro-FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member in Mukike commune was beaten and seriously injured by an Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 17 November. A FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member in Mishiha was beaten and seriously injured by Imbonerakure.

18 November. A young man from Nyabihanga commune was seriously injured by a police officer. The policeman was supposed to intervene to stop a fight in a family but shot directly and hurt the young man. The victim was transported to the Gitega hospital. The policeman was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 November. Imbonerakure beat and hunted farmers of Gihanga commune. They were ordered to attend the Presidents visit in the area.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 November. The Mpanda police and the Imbonerakure beat and wounded citizens in their attempt to clear the road for the arrival of the President. He opened the academic year of the Mitakataka Police Academy.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 November. Two Imbonerakure from Mpinga-Kayove Commune beat and humiliated a retired former Burundian Armed Forces.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 November. The Deputy Chief of Imbonerakure in Mukike Commune raped a girl of about 17 years old. The man wanted to punish the father of his victim who is a member of the UPRONA party. The rapist was arrested and released the next day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 November. Imbonerakure erected road barriers to collect money for 2020 elections from civilians in Mutaho

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 23 November. A member of the CNDD-FDD party in Nyanza-Lac commune beat and wounded his wife because she is of Tutsi ethnicity and refused to join the CNDD-FDD party. This man is detained in the communal cell. The victim was taken to the Nyanza-Lac Hospital.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 November. A member of the UPRONA in Butaganzwa commune was beaten at his home by Imbonerakure. He was blamed for refusing to contribute to the CNDD-FDD party. The victim was hospitalized.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 24 November. Two Imbonerakure beat and arrested pro-FNL leader Agathon Rwasa member over declaring that the CNDD-FDD should be replaced in power in the elections of 2020. His cornfield was also destroyed.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 25 November. Three civilians were kidnapped by the head of the National Intelligence Service in Kigamba commune. One in Shinge colline, one in Saswe and the other at an unclear location in Kigamba. Coded as three events.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 25 November. Three civilians were kidnapped by the head of the National Intelligence Service in Kigamba commune. One in Shinge colline, one in Saswe and the other at an unclear location in Kigamba. Coded as three events.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 November. Three members of Imbonerakure attempted to amputate the hand of a neighbor. The victim was caught stealing bananas. They were stopped by the local chief.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 25 November. A FRODEBU member was beaten and severely injured by two Imbonerakure (the local leader and his deputy) in Gishubi commune. They were later arrested and brought to the police station

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 25 November. Three civilians were kidnapped by the head of the National Intelligence Service in Kigamba commune. One in Shinge colline, one in Saswe and the other at an unclear location in Kigamba. Coded as three events.
25 November. A military patrol shot 14 alleged miners dead in Bukinanyana for illegally mining in the Kibira Natural Reserve. Others fled.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 25 November. At least 17 supporters of FNL-Rwasa were beaten by Imbonerakure youth in Giharo and later transferred to a police station. They were accused of holding illegal meetings.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 26 November. A pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member in Vugizo commune of Makama province was arrested and put in jail before the National Intelligence Service (SNR) brought him to an unknown destination.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 November. Police and Imbonerakure clashed with the students of the Fundamental School in Mpanda Commune. These students protested against the arrest of their teacher by the police and Imbonerakure. Both sides threw stones

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 26 November. A grenade was thrown through a window of the house of a member of the CNDD-FDD party in Gisuru commune. The grenade was dropped into a bucket of water and did not cause any damage. The chief of this area said land issues were causing this incident.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 27 November. The pro-FNL Agathon Rwasa leader in Giharo commune was arrested and put in police custody by the police. He was accused of complicity with 15 members of his party who had been arrested for clandestine meeting the day before.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 November. A man in Mpanda was tortured by Imbonerakure youths. The Imbonerakure wanted him to recognize a child that a women accused him of being the biological father.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 November. A civilian got arrested, beaten and taken to the prison by Imbonerakure in Buhiga commune. They accused him of murder because of the blood on his shirt that was in his bag that they had searched.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 30 November. A sixty-year-old FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa official was murdered with spears and six bullets in Bubanza province. Six Imbonerakure and a policeman, alleged perpetrators, were arrested and taken to the provincial police station for investigation.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 November. A civilian was beaten by Imbonerakure in Nyabitsinda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 December. A civilian was beaten by Imbonerakure in Gatumba. Reasons are not yet known.
01 December. Citizens of Gatumba protested against the recent incident of Imbonerakure violence against civilians on the same day. They urged the local administration to intervene.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 December. Imbonerakure led by their leader in Busoni commune hit the streets and showed their support for President Nkurunziza.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 December. The youth leader and another Imbonerakure fought with locals in Gashoho at a local drinking spot.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 December. An Imbonerakure from Kamaramagambo area in Butihinda commune of Muyinga province was murdered by other Imbonerakure. The perpetrators reportedly caught the victim in the act of adultery and the victim did not have money to bribe them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 03 December. Two FNL-Rwasa supporters were beaten at home by Imbonerakure in Giharo commune.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 December. Imbonerakure of the capital of Bururi province arrested and beat four alleged thieves.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 03 December. A FNL-Rwasa supporter was beaten at home by Imbonerakure in Gishubi commune of Gitega province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 04 December. A FNL-Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Giharo Commune. The FNL is suspected of contributing financially to the FNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 December. A man from Bukinanyana Commune was beaten by two Imbonerakure
05 December (on or before). A soldier in Mabayi was caught raping a six year-old child. He was arrested by police.
05 December (on or before). Four decomposing bodies were found near Rehembe. It appears that the victims were illegally searching for gold when they were killed.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 08 December. Members of CNDD-FDD demonstrated in Muyinga to show their support of the Burundian government to bring to justice the former authorities of the country in the case of the assassination of President Ndadaye

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 08 December. Members of the CNDD-FDD party of Ngozi protested in Ngozi against AUC Chairperson Faki

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 08 December. Members of the CNDD-FDD of Cankuzo marched to show their support to support the decision to reopen the case of the assassination of the President Ndadaye.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 08 December. Members of the CNDD-FDD party and some members of the UPRONA marched through Muramvya and demanded the truth about the assassination of President Ndadaye.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 08 December. Members of the CNDD-FDD protested in Bubanza to support the decision of the justice to issue warrants against the alleged perpetrators of the assassination of President Ndadaye.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 08 December. A member of the FNL Rwasa from Rango was beaten by Imbonerakure and injured. The victim was sent to the Gasenyi health center.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
