column17: 08 December. Members of the CNDD-FDD of Kirundo marched to show their support to the decision to reopen the case of the assassination of the President Ndadaye.
08 December. A state organized demonstration took place in Bujumbura. Protesters marched against the AUC Chair Faki who blamed Burundi for the failed EAC Summit

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 09 December. A local FNL-Rwasa member was beaten and seriously injured by Imbonerakure

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 09 December. An Imbonerakure was severely beaten by a police officer in Matana commune. The officer got fired after the incident.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a FROLINA member in Busembwa (no coordinates available) over a political arguement.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 10 December. Imbonerakure beat-up six FNL-Rwasa supporters in Mura. The attackers threatened the victims to go into exile or join the CNDD-FDD.
11 December. Police assaulted a man in Gihogazi for refusing to pay their debt. The officers were later arrested.

12 December. Three male Burundian youths were repatriated from the Rwandan border crossing at Kanyaru due to their age. After crossing through a military station in Cendajuru, they were detained by the military. They were beaten and questioned on their travels then loaded onto a SNR vehicle. They have not been seen or heard from since.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 December. A grenade was thrown at the home of an Imbonerakure member in Gihanga. Police arrested two Amizero y' Abarundi members in connection to the attack, but the local population reports that they were not the perpetrators.
13 December. A woman was beaten and raped by a group of men in the Banda area of Kibuya village.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 December. Two Tutsi members of the Imbonerakure in Mutobo severely assaulted a Hutu motor bike driver when he refused to move his bike. The incident raised tensions among the ethnic groups in the area.
13 December. Locals in Muyange caught a thief and beat him to death. Police arrested three of the perpetrators.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 13 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a taxi driver who did not stop at their checkpoint in Busebwa (no coordinates available). The group accused the driver, a member of FRODEBU, of supporting gangs.
13 December. A dead body with a head injury was discovered in the Ndurumu river between Buhiga and Bugenyuzi.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Bujumbura protested against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. The protest was organized by the Ministry of Interior and other government agencies.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Buvumbi for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD election fund and insulting the party. After they beat the man and took him to the local jail.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Gitega protested against the BBC's report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Kirundo demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. They objected to any bystanders on the side of the road, to prevent anyone from taking pictures.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Muramvya demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Ngozi demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Cankuzo protested against the BBC's report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Makamba demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. Many of the protesters were forced to participate.
15 December (on or before). Two male bodies were discovered in Gafumbegeti (no coordinates available). They had been killed and tied to trees.
16 December. A 50 year-old man was killed with machetes by unidentified attackers. The attack is reported to have stemmed from witchcraft accusations.

16 December. Heavy military movement was seen around Musigati. Locals indicated that the forces were deployed into the forest to search for armed groups. A local official reported that it was they were carrying out routine operations.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 December. According to local sources, Imbonerakure were deployed in Bukinanyana to carry out night patrols between Nyamitanga and Bukinanyana. The Imbonerakure were armed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 December. Imbonerakure and police assaulted two men for breaking curfew in Gihanga. One of the men was detained until he paid a fine the following day.
18 December. An armed group decapitated a man in Mpanda. Arrests were made.
19 December. A police officer was abducted in Ruhororo. The zone chief and eight others were arrested in connection with the abduction.
19 December. A woman and three of her children were killed by a grenade in Kavomo. Three other children were injured. The attack stemmed from witchcraft accusations and a suspect was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: 20 December. The president of the MSD party in Ngoro was assaulted by the Imbonerakure chief.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 December. Imbonerakure assaulted two civilians in Hamure.
21 December. Two suspected thieves were caught by locals in Kavumwe. The group beat one to death and police intervened to save the other.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 21 December. An unidentified group killed a CNDD-FDD member and injured the man's wife.
23 December. A man stealing sweet potatoes was killed by an unknown group. Assumed mob violence.
24 December. A body, which showed signs of torture and bullet wounds, was discovered on the shore of Lake Tanganyika in Bujumbura.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 December. A police officer shot a member of the Imbonerakure (assumed unarmed) in Kinyinya.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 27 December (on or before). A Rwandan trader was apprehended by Imbonerakure in a Cibitoke market. The Imbonerakure beat the man and stole his money before taking him to the SNR police. The police then tortured the man before taking him to an unknown location.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 29 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa member in Gatabo for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 29 December. Imbonerakure beat a CNDD-FDD member to death for not participating in communal work in Nyamirambo (no coordinates available), in the Masango area. The perpetrators were arrested but were released by the area chief.
29 December. Protesters gathered in Rumonge, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.
29 December. Protesters marched in Bujumbura, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.
29 December. Protesters gathered in Muramvya, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.
29 December. Protesters demonstrated in Bururi, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.
30 December. The body of a man was discovered in the Mubarazi river in Bugendana. The victim had been tied up with a rope.
31 December (on or before). A group of residents destroyed a man's home in Gashanga, suspecting him of witchcraft. The police arrested the victim and leader of the perpetrators.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 31 December. A merchant, who belonged to the CNDD-FDD, in Ryamukona was beaten by police before they detained him and transferred him to an unknown location. The police alleged the man had possession of firearms, but locals report that the beating and arrest were done to avoid debts.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 31 December. A FNL-Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in the Ruremba are of Nyakazi for being out past the curfew.
01 January. Police assaulted and arrested a merchant in Murwi for raising his prices.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 01 January. Imbonerakure tortured a 14 year old boy, who was a CNDD-FDD member, in Kigoma, in an attempt to get the boy to confess to raping a child. They later took the boy to the police.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 January. Imbonerakure stabbed and robbed a man in Rugombo. Another man was also beaten-up by Imbonerakure on the same night.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 January. A man was beaten with wood planks by four Imbonerakure in Bubanza. One perpetrator was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 02 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa supporter in Kigoganya, then took him to the prison where he was held until the following day hen he paid a fine and promised to join the CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a motorbike driver in Nyakibari. The local chief tried to intervene but was assaulted as well.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 January. Imbonerakure from Musenyi fought with Imbonerakure and a police officer in Mpanda, after the police officer had arrested one of their friends.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 January. Imbonerakure beat a man accused of witchcraft in Bugera, then turned him over to the police
03 January. Two men cut the throat of a university student, as they suspected his father of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.
03 January (on or around). A body was discovered in Gihosha. A local official indicated the person had been killed elsewhere before the perpetrators left the body in Gihosha.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 January. Imbonerakure assaulted two members of the Amizero yAbarundi in Rugajo (no coordinates available), Buganda.
05 January. A grenade was thrown into a house in Kavomo, injuring three people - including children.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 January (on or before). Imbonerakure and police in Rugombo have robbed and assaulted the local population. One man was beaten by the police for not giving them a beer, while another man was robbed by the group.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 05 January. Members of the CNDD-FDD destroyed the home of a FNL-Rwasa supporter.
05 January. Armed men beat a woman suspected of witchcraft. They also destroyed her home.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
column17: 05 January. The UPD-Zigamibangaen leader in Butaganzwa was assaulted by Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 January. Imbonerakure beat a woman in Mudaturwa, accusing her of witchcraft. After her husband filed a complaint, the Imbonerakure and local chief fined the man. When he refused to pay, they stole materials from his home to sell.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 January. Imbonerakure beat and stabbed a man who was crossing from DRC into Burundi during the night, near Rugombo. Two arrests were made following the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 January. Imbonerakure assaulted four members of theAmizero yAbarundi in Nyamitanga.
08 January (on or before). A 60 year old man was killed in Mukoma over a mining dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 January. Imbonerakure with clubs, bows and arrows beat a man in Buhiga for being out during the night and took him to the police station.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a merchant in Munyika for selling their coals without repaying them for the product.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 09 January. Armed men in military fatigues killed a CNDD-FDD member in Bukinanyana, after stealing money from him and his wife. Unknown identity of perpetrator coded as UAG.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 09 January. Imbonerakure members attacked a soldier in Kiyonza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a teenager in Rambo with clubs.

On or before 01 October. A dead body was found near the Rweru river in Nyagisozi, Kirundo. Local residents say the SNR carried out the attack, as they saw a leader of the SNR in the area just before the body was found. This is speculation and has not been confirmed. The body was quickly buried without an investigation.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 January. Imbonerakure severely assaulted two brothers during a patrol in Muhweza.
11 January. Military forces stationed near Munibhere (no coordinates available), between Sehe and Nyagumba shot at suspected rebels in the Kibira forest.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 January. After catching suspected robbers in Rugabano, Imbonerakure and security forces tortured the suspects.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 January. Imbonerakure detained and assaulted the chief of the Busaga neighborhood in Kinzanza for being out during the night. Police intervened, securing the release of the chief.
12 January. A member of Amizero yAbarundi was arrested and tortured by police in Nyamitanga. As of 15/12 he remained in police custody. The police have denied torturing the detainee.
13 January. A group of youth in Mugoboka (no coordinates available, located in south Mutanga) accused a man, suffering from psychological problems, of being a rebel and beat him to death.
13 January. Two men were killed in Nyaruganda by locals (assumed unarmed) who suspected them of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 January. Soldiers assaulted two Imbonerakure members in Kiyonza in retaliation for an attack on a soldier by Imbonerakure on 09/01.
14 January (on or before). A body was discovered in Bugiga, the victim had been tied up and strangled. According to locals, the body had not been deceased long as it had no signs of swelling.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Women (Burundi)
column17: 14 January. A CNDD-FDD leader assaulted a female Rwasa supporter in a shop in Cimba.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 January (on or before). The body of an Imbonerakure member, who worked for the aviation authority, was discovered in Bujumbura. The victim appeared to have been strangled to death.
15 January. A Tutsi was abducted from Ngozi by unknown perpetrators on 15/01. His body was discovered in Kayanza on 16/01. Local sources suspect the victim was targeted due to his ethnicity.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and detained a school director in Gasenyi until a ransom was paid.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted the chief in Nyakibari. The perpetrators were later arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a man with clubs in his home in Mugimbu. They targeted the man over witchcraft accusations.
16 January. Angry residents in Butaganzwa beat a man to death with clubs. They believed he was responsible for stabbing two locals earlier in the day.
16 January. A man and his son were stabbed to death in Butaganzwa. Local leaders suspect they were killed over a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 January. Imbonerakure assaulted two women in the Kamege area of Murwi. They then took the women to the police, who detained them for two days.
19 January (on or before). A resident of Kinzanza was killed by his neighbors following a land dispute.
19 January. A grenade was thrown at a group of people, including a police officer, in Mutakura. Three people were killed and others were injured.
20 January. Police arrested a youth in Kabanga. They accused him of supporting rebels and repeatedly beat him. On 21/01 they transferred him to a prison in Busoni.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 January. An Imbonerakure member in Jimbi beat a man over the head with a bottle. The perpetrator was arrested.
21 January. Police in Kabanga arrested a youth, they suspected of supporting rebels. They assaulted the youth in the prison and later transferred him and another suspect to a prison in Busoni.
21 January. Residents in the Birimba neighborhood of Rumonge, caught a robber and killed him. Three of the perpetrators were arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a woman in Nyamutobo. The perpetrators said that Tutsi were not permitted in the chief's bar.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 January. A member of the Imbonerakure raped a teenager in Rwamvura. The perpetrator was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 January. Imbonerakure assaulted, detained, and extorted money from a woman in Gashingwa.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 25 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a member of the FRODEBU in Mirango. They accused him of adultery.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 25 January. A FNL-Rwasa member was beaten to death in his home in Kigarama by suspected Imbonerakure members

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 25 January. A grenade was thrown into the home of a FNL Rwasa member in Cewe. Local sources believe the family was targeted over witchcraft accusations.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and stripped a man in Ngugo. They also stole his phone. The perpetrators were arrested.
26 January. Police and the local chief tied-up and tortured a man in Butamuheba. They held the man over night while they tortured him to confess to impregnating a woman.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 26 January (on or around). The body of a CNDD-FDD member was discovered in Busimba. The victim's arms and tongue had been cut off.
26 January. A man was killed in Gisuma (no coordinates available), in the Rugabano district. The attack is believed to be related to witchcraft accusations.
26 January. A mob destroyed the home of a family accused of witchcraft in the Gihwanya neighborhood of Rumonge.
26 January. A grenade was thrown into the Gifurwe market. Five suspects were later arrested.
26 January. A grenade was thrown into a market in Mpanda.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 27 January. Three armed men attacked a CNDD-FDD member near the Nyabikere dam. The victim was stabbed in the face but managed to escape.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 January. Unidentified perpetrators threw a grenade into a bar in Buterere. The local Imbonerakure leader and his wife were injured in the attack, along with six others.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 27 January. An unidentified armed group from the DRC attacked a military position in the Rukoro forest, near Gihanga. Three soldiers were killed.
27 January (on or before). A body was discovered in the Ruvyironza river near Giheta. The victim appeared to have been killed then dumped into the river.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 27 January. Military forces were ambushed by rebels from the DRC in the Rukoko forest, Gihanga. Three soldiers were killed and others were seriously injured. Additional soldiers were deployed to the Rukoko Nature Reserve following the attack, while access to the reserve was banned.
28 January. Police raided the home of an FNL member in Gabaniro and seized grenades.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 30 January (on or before). Imbonerakure seriously assaulted a FNL-Rwasa supporter with sticks and drowning for refusing to join the CNDD-FDD.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 30 January. Two members of the political opposition were arrested and tortured by the national intelligence service in Gatete, Rumonge. The detainees were involved in a land dispute with a CNDD-FDD leader and the intelligence officers accused them of conspiring with armed groups.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 31 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and stole the weapons of two police officers in Kibati, Cibitoke. The military intervened and detained the Imbonerakure.

column9: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
column17: 31 January. A grenade was thrown into the home of a FNL-Rwasa member in Cewe, Kirundo. Some speculate that the family was targeted over their political affiliation, while others believe the attack was due to witchcraft accusations.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 February. Imbonerakure from Musanga attacked a group of herders from Vugizo, whom they believed were responsible for bush fires. The two groups clashed (both sides assumed armed).

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 02 February. A contingent of Burundian soldiers crossed back into the Cibitoke province from the DRC, where they had carried out operations against Red TABARA and other Burundian armed groups.
03 February. A grenade was thrown into a bar in Kaburantwa, injuring seven people.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 February. A group of Imbonerakure assaulted a police officer and stole his weapon in Matongo. Other police officers responded by firing into the air to disperse the attackers. Nine Imbonerakure members were arrested over the incident.
03 February. A woman was severely beaten by locals after she was accused of stealing potatoes in Biganda. The woman suffered a miscarriage as a result of the attack.
03 February (on or before). A female body was discovered along the Ruvubu river in Shombo. Local sources believe the victim had been killed elsewhere before being dumped into the river.
03 February (on or before). A grenade was thrown into a home in Rugasa, injuring two people. The perpetrator is believed to be a local resident who fled after the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 04 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNDD-FDD member in Butezi for not following their instructions on assaulting and intimidating the civilian population. The police did not take any action after the victim filed a complaint against the Imbonerakure members.

05 February (on or before). A motor-taxi resisted a bribe to a police officer, who then attempted to seize the drivers' bike. At which time, other drivers reportedly threw stones at the police officer, who responded by shooting and killing the driver.
06 February (on or before). Residents of Kinyankonge and Nyabagere protested in Bujumbura over land seizures by the government.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 February. Imbonerakure assaulted an elderly man, accused of witchcraft, in Bugabira. They also demanded money from the victim.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a child who was selling food items in Bubanza, after the child asked them to pay for the goods they consumed.
06 February. An unidentified group threw a grenade into a home in the Kararire neighborhood of Kagege. The attack is reported to stem from witchcraft accusations.
07 February. A mob of people attacked a man accused of being a witch doctor in the Nkayamba neighborhood of Rumonge. The attackers wounded the man with a machete.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a Rwasa (CNL) supporter in Mirombero, Murwi. The attackers accused the victim of fighting with his wife. Rwasa just formed a new party called the CNL.

08 February. An unidentified armed group killed a man during an attack on the Lumitel communication company in Muyange (no coordinates available, located in the Nyarusange area). The perpetrators also destroyed a generator.
09 February (on or before). The head of an unidentified man was found in Carama. Military socks and boots were found at the location. Police launched an investigation.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 09 February. An unidentified group set fire to the home of a man (who was a member of the CNDD-FDD) accused of witchcraft in Burimbi, Cibitoke. The man and two of his children died in the fire.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 02 September. A CNL supporter was found dead in Kivoga, Mutimbuzi. Local sources believe Imbonerakure conducted the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 September. 25 Imbonerakure beat up a civilian CNL supporter in Yoba area of Gitega city.

column7: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Students (Burundi)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Students (Burundi)
column17: 02 September. Disagreements between CNDD-FDD and CNL student supporters erupted into violence at the University of Burundi, Nzega campus. CNL supporters said that University administration has reduced their stipend because of their political affiliation. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 February. Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Kaguhu, Gasorwe. The perpetrators had ordered the victim to pay them a fine but he did not have the money to do so.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 October. Imbonerakure destroyed two plantations of a CNL zone leader in Kananira zone, Tangara for his refusal to leave the CNL party.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 February. During the night, an unidentified armed group attacked Buramata, Gihanga. The group attacked a civilian, looted a bar, and fired shots at a church and a civilian vehicle. Imbonerakure and police attempted to respond but the armed group had superior fire power.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 February. During the night, Imbonerakure broke into a house in the Nyamugari neighborhood of Gitega. The homeowner stabbed one of the intruders, injuring him.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 February. The Muramvya police chief's driver assaulted an Imbonerakure member in Nyarunazi after the police chief accused him of taking his cigarette.

column7: COMIBU: Islamic Community of Burundi; Islamic Group (Burundi)
column9: COMIBU: Islamic Community of Burundi; Islamic Group (Burundi)
column17: 14 February. COMIBU members assaulted another member, who they accused of witchcraft, in Makamba. The elites of COMIBU reportedly mistreat members who belong to the political opposition and those who are not affiliated with political parties.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 February. An Imbonerakure member raped a 13 year-old girl in Gihinga.

column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 14 February. A military officer and SNR agent detained two refugees who were returning to Nyanza-Lac (unclear where they were detained). The security officers bound and beat the returnees, accusing them of being rebels. Residents of Musenyi went to the police, who secured the release of the returnees.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 14 February. The SNR detained a former FDD rebel in Bubezi, Kayanza. The security forces reportedly accused the man of belonging to a rebel group in the DRC. The victim's family cannot locate the man in any detention facility.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 February. Imbonerakure assaulted three civilians in Cumba for being out at night. They then took the civilians to the prison where they were held over night.
15 February. Police assaulted a man before arresting him in Bujumbura Marie (no town reported).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Month of February. A CNL regional representative is abducted by Imbonerakure in Cibitoke province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 February. Imbonerakure abducted a man in Murama. The perpetrators were suspicious of the abductee who was not from the area. After interrogating him for seven hours they released him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 February. Imbonerakure assaulted an UPRONA supporter in a bar in Mabanda. Two of the perpetrators were arrested, while the third drove the victim to the hospital.
16 February. Two grenades went off near the home of an opposition member in Nyamaboko. The police and Imbonerakure detained four opposition members from the targeted party following the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 February. During the night, a Rwasa (CNL) supporter was assaulted by Imbonerakure in Bweru.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 17 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNDD-FDD party member in Butezi before taking him to the prison. The victim was accused of not actively participating in party activities.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 February. Imbonerakure militia members assaulted a CNL supporter in Mubavu, Ruyigi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 February. Imbonerakure militia members assaulted a man, whom they accused of adultery. Another civilian attempted to intervene and was also attacked. The assailants took the original victim to a swamp where they severely beat him and left him for dead. The victim was found the following day and taken for medical attention.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 17 February. A CNDD-FDD member raped a 13 year-old girl in Ruvumu, Cankuzo. The local Imbonerakure waited a day before going to arrest the assailant, during which time the perpetrator fled.
18 February. Unidentified assailants killed an elderly man with a machete in Gisuru. The attack is believed to stem from witchcraft accusations.
18 February. A witch doctor was beheaded by a group who posed as customers in Ntende, Ruyigi. According to local sources, the attack stemmed from his profession or a land conflict.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 February. An Imbonerakure raped a teenage girl in Shari, Bubanza. The local CNDD-FDD officials reportedly allowed the perpetrator to flee.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 February. Imbonerakure abducted two men who were crossing back into the country from Rwanda at the border crossing in Gasenyi.
20 February. Police violently assaulted a man before arresting him in Mugara. Local residents had accused the man and three others of witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 February. Imbonerakure militia members beat a CNL member to death with clubs in Gahise, Kayanza.

22 February (on or before). Five bodies could be seen in Lake Rweru, four were visible from Gatare and a fifth was seen at Nyagisozi. Two of the bodies had been stabbed through by a piece of wood. Locals in the area were prohibited by officials from retrieving bodies in the lake.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 February. Imbonerakure seriously assaulted a CNL party supporter in Mukike.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 February. Imbonerakure militia members assaulted two women for being out at a bar in Murwi, Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 22 February. A CNDD-FDD party leader in Bubanza, seriously assaulted four students over theft allegations. One of the students was hospitalized in critical condition.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 February. SNR agents along with Imbonerakure assaulted an off-duty soldier in Muha. Local residents forced the assailants to take the victim to the hospital. The victim was arrested after receiving treatment at the hospital.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 February. Two unidentified assailants beat the local Imbonerakure leader with clubs in Gitongo. The attack was carried out in retaliation for abuses committed by the Imbonerakure. [size=3]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 February. An Imbonerakure member raped a 13 year old girl in Murwi, Cibitoke. He was not arrested despite the families efforts to press charges.
24 February. An unidentified armed group fired shots and threw a grenade at police in Mpanda. The assailants also looted stores next to the police.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 24 February. Four Imbonerakure militia members attacked a CNDD-FDD party member who came to collect a debt owed to him by one of the Imbonerakure in Gitanga, Karuzi. Two of the assailants were later arrested.
24 February. A grenade was thrown into a home in Kadende, Muyinga. One person was injured. A relative of the victim was later arrested.
24 February. A man beat his neighbor with a club over a land dispute in Ruhuma. [size=2]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 February. Police and Imbonerakure clashed at a checkpoint in Vyanda, Bururi. The clash followed a dispute between the groups on who would receive a bribe at the checkpoint. Injuries were reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a man, whom they accused of not participating in communal work, in Cimba, Gitega. Following the assault they took the victim to the prison where he was held over night.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 February. Police and Imbonerakure detained and assaulted a CNL party member in the Kibaza neighborhood of Gahwazi, Mpanda. The CNL member was arrested on accusations of holding party meetings.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 February. Imbonerakure and the local administrator of the Mugera district in Mishiha assaulted a man in Kaniha, Cankuzo. The attackers also assaulted those who attempted to intervene. The victim was accused of organizing an insurrection in the community, however, it is reported that he was targeted over a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 February. Imbonerakure and an off-duty police officer attacked a farmer with machetes in Bihororo, Gitega. The victim was accused of purchasing stolen fertilizer. The attackers were not arrested.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 February. Imbonerakure and soldiers detained illegal miners in the Kibira forest in Mabayi. They stole the minerals from the miners then shot and killed them. The bodies of four miners were discovered near Gafumbegeti. However, some sources indicate six victims.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 February (on or around). Over 70 Imbonerakure received paramilitary training by the military in Mugerama and Bukeye in Nyanza-Lac. The Imbonerakure are reportedly receiving the training before being deployed to fight Burundian rebels in the DRC.
27 February. A police officer accidentally shot and wounded a man in a bar in Kara, Muyinga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 February. An Imbonerakure militia member stabbed a school administrator who caught him stealing in Kirundo. The population attempted to catch the attacker but his brother, who is also an Imbonerakure member, helped him escape.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 February. Imbonerakure detained and assaulted two women, accused of illegally selling alcohol in Yagumba, Cibitoke (no coordinates available). Angry locals were ready to attack the Imbonerakure but soldiers intervened. The women were taken to the prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: 01 March. An Imbonerakure militia member in Rutenderi, Makamba attempted to kill his wife with a knife because she was a CNL party member. The perpetrator was arrested.

01 March (on or around). Two bodies were found floating the Rweru Lake, near Sigu. Several bodies have been spotted in the lake during the past few weeks. The government claims they are coming from Rwanda, which also borders the lake, and prohibits the locals from recovering them.
02 March. Unidentified armed men threw a grenade at a man in a bar in Ngarama, Rutana. The man was injured.
02 March. A police officer opened fire in a bar in Gatumba following a disagreement. Three people were killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 March. Imbonerakure assaulted a porter in Nkonyovu, Muramvya for arguing with one of his colleagues.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 March. Imbonerakure cut a street vendor with a blade in Kirundo. The assailants wanted to confiscate the vendor's goods.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 March. Imbonerakure assaulted and detained a CNL party member in Nyabiyogi, Kayanza. Following the assault the perpetrators took the victim to prison.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 March 2019. Police arrested and tortured four Imbonerakure who had allegedly stolen a weapon from a police officer in Ruhehe.
04 March 2019. During the night, an unidentified armed group launched a grenade at a man in Ngarama, Rutana - seriously injuring him.
04 March 2019. A police officer assaulted a detainee at the Bubanza prison. The detainee was arrested over a conflict with an Imbonerakure member.
05 March 2019. An unidentified armed group, wearing military fatigues, looted shops in Gerangabo, Mutaho. The assailants stole money and goods.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 March 2019. CNL party members and Imbonerakure members fought with rocks and bottles in Gisuru. The street fight occurred over a job payment dispute. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 March. Imbonerakure seriously assaulted three CNL members, whom they accused of holding a secret meeting, in Cunya, Cibitoke. The assailants also stole property from the victims. The victims were severely injured from the attacks.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 March 2019 (on or around). A CNL party member, who drove a motorcycle went missing. His body, which appeared to have been beaten to death, was discovered on 12/03/2019. An Imbonerakure member and former employee of the victim's family admitted to the attack.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 09 March 2019. CNL and Imbonerakure militias clashed with knives, machetes, and clubs in Gerangabo. The clash occurred when the CNL members tried to prevent the Imbonerakure from holding a meeting. One Imbonerakure died from his injuries. 11 CNL members were arrested.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 September. An Imbonerakure was killed by CNL supporters in Mutimbuzi commune, Bujumbura Rural. This may have been a revenge killing for the death of a CNL supporter the day before in the same commune.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 March 2019. Four Imbonerakure and a local leader assaulted a CNL party member in Rugenge, Bubanza (no coordinates available - in the Musenyi area).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 March 2019. During the evening, Imbonerakure attacked several residents of Kakibogo, Ngozi (no coordinates available, in the Nyamurenza area). The residents were beaten for their support of the CNL party. One woman suffered a miscarriage as a result of the attack.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 March 2019. Police arrested 34 CNL members from Bukemba and Gitandu, as they were preparing to attend a party event in Bujumbura. The Imbonerakure alerted the police to the CNL members. The detainees were released later that day.
11 March 2019. An unidentified group assaulted the Matana CNL party leader in Bihanga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 March 2019. Imbonerakure in the Ngagarade neighborhood of Ntega assaulted a man for being out late at night. The victim was seriously injured. The assailants were held by police for one night, then released.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 March 2019. During the night, Imbonerakure attacked two CNL supporters with machetes. They accused the victims of being thieves, while the victims said they were out watering their fields. One of the victims was seriously injured and taken for medical treatment, while the other was taken to prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 12 March 2019. Imbonerakure and the head of the CNDD-FDD in Gisekuro assaulted a CNL supporter, who they alleged was secretly teaching about the CNL party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 March 2019. Imbonerakure in Burenge assaulted a few community leaders from Giheta for being out in the evening in a community where they were not known.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 13 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL supporter because of his political affiliation in Gisekuro.

column8: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 14 March 2019. Locals in Kirundo threw rocks at the court in a demonstration against the trial of six female students accused of drawing over a picture of President Nkurunziza in a school book. The SNR was deployed to the court house and the demonstrators dispersed. [size=no report]

15 March 2019 (on or before). A body, which appeared to have been stabbed to death, was discovered in Butara. Locals report seeing the victim in the local prison, but officials deny that they ever had custody of the victim. Coded as VAC by police pending further information
15 March 2019. Military forces fired shots at a man who refused to stop for them in Nyavi (no coordinates available; in the Ndora area). The military would not confirm if the man was shot.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 March 2019. A SNR officer, who was also an Imbonerakure, allegedly abducted a 50 year-old man. His body was discovered five days later near the Kajeke River in Kadirigiri (no coordinates available; in the Buvyuko area).
15 March 2019 (on or before). Three bodies, which had been tied up, were discovered in Bihembe, Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a merchant in Buhiga, when he refused their extortion attempt.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two civilians in Bucana.
17 March 2019. During the night five homes in Nyamurenge were set on fire by unidentified assailants. The local administrator reportedly was aware that the home were going to be attacked.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two members of the militia for being too soft on the opposition. The assailants were arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Mutaho, Gitega. The assailant was later arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 March 2019. Imbonerakure clashed with each other in Musenyi, Bubanza following a dispute over a leader. Police intervened by firing into the air. Injuries were reported.

18 March 2019. A man was detained by police, in the Gitega territory. He was later released to his family, with signs of serious assault. His family attempted to take him for medical care but were prevented from doing so by the police, who took the man back into custody. Upon trying to visit the detainee, the family were told that he had been transferred to another prison. The mans body was discovered on 04/04/2019.
18 March 2019. Two men were abducted while riding on a motorcycle in the Gitega area.

19 March 2019. Two police officers were killed in an ambush along the Muzazi River, near Muzinda. There are conflicting reports on if the officers were pursuing an armed group or responding to a reported abduction when the ambush occurred. The unidentified assailants stole the officer's weapons.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two elderly men in Mubanga, Rumonge. The Imbonerakure accused the victims of witchcraft and took them to prison after the assault.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a soldier in Jimbi, Makamba after he attempted to intervene in a dispute.
20 March 2019. A police officer threw a grenade into a home in Cibitoke, seriously injuring one man. The attack reportedly stemmed from a land dispute.
20 March 2019. An unidentified armed group fired shots at a man in Kavumwe, Ruyigi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted three CNL party members then took them to the prison in Gatare, Ngozi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 21 March 2019. Imbonerakure, along with the local CNDD-FDD leader, assaulted a male youth in Ruramba, Ngozi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted an elderly displaced Tutsi woman in Rwandagaro. Others intervened to stop the assault.
22 March 2019. After a police officer shot a man in a bar in Kinoso, angry residents assaulted the officer. [size=no report]
22 March 2019. A police officer shot and injured a man in Kinoso, Makamba following a dispute in a bar.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 23 March 2019. An angry mob in Sagara, Karuzi killed a male CNDD-FDD member, after he killed his girlfriend. [size=no report].

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 March 2019. An Imbonerakure militia member assaulted two CNL party members in Rwibaga, Bujumbura Rural.
24 March 2019. An unidentified armed group threw a grenade at civilians allegedly over their CNL affiliation or witchcraft. Two people were seriously injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 March 2019. Imbonerakure members assaulted a CNL supporter. The location of the incident is unknown but the victim received treatment in the Rango district.

25 March 2019. A CNL party member was killed in Sigu, Kirundo. According to local sources, the culprit targeted the victim due to his political affiliation. However, local police reported it was a criminal matter.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi; Women (Burundi)
column17: 25 March 2019. Imbonerakure seriously assaulted a female FRODEBU supporter in Mara, Makamba. The assailants blamed her for not joining the CNDD-FDD.
25 March 2019. A CNL party member and his sister were injured by a grenade attack by unidentified perpetrators in Runyonza, Kirundo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Ryarunyinya, Ngozi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 March 2019. Imbonerakure killed an elderly CNL party member, whom they accused of witchcraft in Gitanga, Bubanza. The victim's son managed to escape the attackers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Gihororo, Kayanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 March 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted three CNL party members in Village 2, Gihanga (no coordinates available). The assailants accused the victims of holding a political meeting.
31 March 2019. Merchants demonstrated in Busoni, celebrating the dismissal of the communal administrator. Police dispersed the demonstrators. [size=approximately 50]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 April 2019 (on or after). During the week, locals in the Ruhororo and Mugina districts observed the movement of suspected Interahamwe forces crossing into and retreating from the border with Rwanda, within the Nyungwe forest. Similar movements were observed in the week of 7 April.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 01 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a FRODEBU member in Santunda, Kirundo.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 01 April 2019. A CNDD-FDD member raped a female youth in Buhiga, Karuzi. The assailant was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted six CNL party supporters in Minago, Rumonge.

02 April 2019 (on or around). An angry mob tried to attack a man accused of witchcraft in Vumbi, Kirundo. Police forces intervened and the mob attempted to steal their weapons. The police responded by firing their weapons, killing two people. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 April 2019. Imbonerakure and police assaulted an eight year old child, while searching for his parents. The family are CNL party members. Locals intervened to stop the assault.
03 April 2019. A grenade was thrown at an elderly man in Rudaraza, Karuzi. He was only slightly injured. The attack is suspected to stem from a land dispute. A suspect was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted an UPRONA party member in Nyagumba, Cibitoke (no coordinates available; in the Masango area). Three of the perpetrators were arrested.
04 April 2019. Police assaulted a young street vendor in Gifurwe, Bubanza. Locals attempted to intervene, but police officers fired into the air to disperse them.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 April 2019. During the night, suspected Imbonerakure launched three grenades and opened fire on a home in Burara (no coordinates available, in the Buhinyuza district). A woman and child were killed. One Imbonerakure combatant was arrested but released after one day.

On 4 April 2019, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into the home of a man working for an INGO in Butihinda (Butihinda, Muyinga). His wife and another staff member in the home were shot and injured. No fatalities reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 05 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNDD-FDD party member, accusing him of relaying party information to the CNL. After the assault they handed the victim over to the SNR.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party leader in Rugenge, Bubanza (no coordinates available; in the Musenyi area).
05 April 2019. Police assaulted civilians in Mpanda, Bubanza as they cleared a road for a government convoy. One person was injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 April 2019. Imbonerakure severely assaulted a CNL party member in Butihinda, Muyinga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 March - 19 April 2019. Approximately 200 Imbonerakure militia members spent the month camped out in the Kibimbi area (no coordinates available), in Bururi undergoing paramilitary trainings.
06 April 2019. An unidentified armed group, who came from the Rukoko forest, attacked police in village 5, Gihanga (no coordinates available). Six police were injured during the clash.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 April 2019. An Imbonerakure militia member raped a 16 year old girl returning from fetching water in Rweya, Karuzi. The assailant was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Men (Burundi)
column17: 06 April 2019. Imbonerakure tortured a CNL party member, including his genitals, in Kiryama, Kayanza. The victim was targeted after he refused to contribute money to the CNDD-FDD party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 April 2019. An Imbonerakure combatant killed a CNL party member in Rukwega, Cankuzo.
07 April 2019. An unidentified armed group killed a police officer in Mutara (no coordinates available), between Maramvya and Mutimbuzi. The assailants stole the officer's clothing and weapon.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 07 April 2019. During the night, a CNDD-FDD party member was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators in Nyamirambo, Cibitoke (no coordinates available, near Masango).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a man accused of theft in Kayogoro, Makamba. Police were present during the attack but did not intervene. The assailants later took the victim to the police station.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 09 April - 11 April 2019. Imbonerakure, who worked as security guards at the hospital in Makamba, detained and tortured a man who they accused of stealing money from a patient. The victim had reported losing the money on his way to the pharmacy.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 09 April 2019. A CNDD-FDD party member killed a CNL party member in Mugoboka, Gitega after a political dispute. The perpetrator was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two CNL party members in Gisovu, Kanyosha. Bystanders intervened to secure the release of the victims.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Bihanga, Gitega. After the attack, they took the victim to jail.

10 April 2019. During the night, approximately 20 men armed with machetes, suspected to be from a neighboring area in Cibitoke, attacked zone 4 and 5 in Ngagara, Bujumbura Marie. Three people were injured and property was looted.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two CNL party members in Bugendana, after accusing them of having a prohibited meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 April 2019. Four Imbonerakure militants attacked a 50-year old with machetes in Mugenda, Cankuzo. The perpetrators accused the victim of witchcraft. A police officer intervened and the assailants were arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 April 2019. Imbonerakure killed a man in Muha, Bujumbura after accusing him of stealing. The assailants reportedly buried the victim's body to conceal their crime.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 April 2019. Imbonerakure severely assaulted a man in Kavugangoma, Mwakiro.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted three CNL party members in Marembo, Kirundo. The assailants accused the victims of holding a political meeting.

12 April 2019. A group of people locked an elderly man inside of his home and set it on fire in Kabere, Cibitoke, accusing the man of witchcraft. Neighbors freed the victim and three perpetrators were arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Kiganda, Muramvya. The victim was hospitalized for two days, after which point, the police arrested the victim.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 13 April 2019. Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD militants detained and assaulted CNL members in Kivyeyi, Muramvya. The perpetrators took the victims to the Kiganda prison following the assault.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 13 April 2019. Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD militants detained and assaulted CNL members in Nyagisozi, Muramvya. The perpetrators took the victims to the Kiganda prison following the assault.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 April 2019. Imbonerakure leader attempted to detain a man in Bujumbura. The man refused their attempt, citing that they had no legal right to detain him. The man punched one of the Imbonerakure, who hit their head on the ground and died. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 14 April 2019. Imbonerakure detained the vice-president of the CNL in party in Butihinda, along with three other party members, in Kamaramagambo. The assailants took the man to the head of the CNDD-FDD at the communal party headquarters, where he was tortured and later released. The other three CNL party leaders remain missing.

14 April 2019. Two bodies, in military uniforms, were discovered in Ngara, Cibitoke (coded as gunmen). Locals suspect the deaths are related to armed groups, who have been crossing the border to attack Rwandan forces recently.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 14 April 2019. CNDD-FDD militants assaulted a CNL party member in Butihinda, Muyinga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 April 2019. Two women and one man were beheaded in Nkaramanyenye (no coordinates available, located in the Gatabo area). Locals suspect the attack was carried out by Imbonerakure who were monitoring the house.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 April 2019. An Imbonerakure militia member assaulted an UPRONA party member in Murama, Kirundo.
15 April 2019. A police officer shot and killed a man after a dispute in Mugina, Cibitoke. The officer was arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Month of April. Imbonerakure beat CNL supporters in Ngozi province with sticks, barbed wire and cable. Later, they were arrested for two weeks.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted the Mutaho CNL leader in Gerangabo, Mutaho.

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 16 April 2019. During the night, FNL-Nzabampema fighters killed a member of the CNDD-FDD political party in Nyaruhisha, Cibitoke (no coordinates available). Locals caught the perpetrators and handed them over to the police.
16 April 2019. A police officer shot and killed a student in Musaga, Bujumbura. The student had been arguing with a friend, when a group of police officers on patrol approached them.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 16 April 2019. SNR detained and assaulted three members of the CNL in Mutumba, Karuzi. The security officials took the detainees to a prison in Karuzi, according to a police source, the detainees were assaulted with a stick during their interrogation.
17 April 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked a police officer in Ruhande, Gitega. The officer escaped.
18 April 2019. During the night, an unidentified armed group killed a CNL party member in his home in Musenyi, Bubanza. Police later arrested Imbonerakure and CNL members.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Nyarusange, Kayanza after he showed someone a picture of Rwasa.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 April 2019. A fight erupted between Imbonerakure and CNL party members in Rukira, Muyinga. The Imbonerakure had come to the home of the CNL members to assault them when the CNL members fought back. Police arrested several of the CNL members. Two of the CNL later died from their injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 22 April 2019. CNDD-FDD militants tortured a CNL party member in Tangara, Muyinga.

22 April 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked the police station in Gihanga. Sources differ on the fatalities, with some reporting only one civilian fatality and other sources indicating two police officers and one attacker were killed during the clash.
21 April 2019. An unidentified armed group ambushed a vehicle in Rugombo, Cibitoke. Police responded and repelled the attackers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a Tutsi man in Jimbi, Makamba. Following the assault, they took the man to prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 24 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted three FRODEBU supporters (including a woman) in Mabanda, Makamba.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Mabanda, Makamba for being out at night. They also stole money from the victim.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted the Butaganzwa CNL party leader in Nkango, Kayanza. The assailants also stole beer and goods from the man's shop.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 April 2019. Two Imbonerakure militants beat a CNL party member in Kiremba, Muyinga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Nyagumba, Cibitoke (no coordinates available). The assailants accused him of domestic abuse, but the victim's wife refuted this and reported the assailants attacked her husband because he left the Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 April 2019. Imbonerakure killed a man in Rutegama, Bujumbura Rural after the victim caught them stealing. The perpetrators were arrested.
29 April 2019. An unidentified group killed two women accused of witchcraft in Buyongwe, Cankuzo. Two suspects were arrested.
29 April 2019. An unidentified group attacked a man accused of witchcraft in Mirombero, Cibitoke. Police intervened and took the victim for medical treatment.
30 April 2019. Three minors were tortured by police after they escaped from the prison in Murwi, Cibitoke. The victims were originally arrested for theft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two men, including a CNL party member, in Cimba, Gitega. The assailants accused the victims of holding an illicit meeting.

01 May 2019. Police arrested, tied-up, and tortured a man in Caratsi, Kayanza. The police accused the victim of trafficking goods from Rwanda, but local sources indicate he was detained for refusing their extortion attempts.
02 May 2019. An unidentified group severely assaulted an elderly woman accused of witchcraft in Maramvya, Karuzi.
02 May 2019. Members of the Batwa ethnic group demonstrated in front of the Cibitoke public prosecutors office demanding justice, after the body of a murdered Batwa was discovered. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 03 May 2019. An Imbonerakure and local CNDD-FDD leader assaulted a man in Kayogoro, Makamba.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service; CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 May 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a SNR informant and CNDD-FDD supporter, as well as 2 Imbonerakure, from Kagwema hill (Gihanga, Bubanza). The 2 Imbonerakure were released shortly afterwards.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 05 May 2019. CNDD-FDD elements severely assaulted three CNL party members in Kinama, Muyinga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted three CNL party members, including a woman, in Randa, Kayanza. The assailants also stole money from the victims.
05 May 2019. An unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a home in Musha, Ruyigi. No one was injured.

06 May 2019. Members of the Batwa ethnic group demonstrated in front of the Cibitoke public prosecutors office, demanding justice in the case of a Batwa man who had been murdered. A scuffle broke out between a journalist covering the demonstration and a local administrator. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 May 2019. Imbonerakure tied up and tortured a man accused of stealing in Kayogoro, Makamba. The assailants detained the man in a store owned by a local administrator for one night.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 May 2019. A body was discovered in Rukana, Cibitoke. According to police sources, Imbonerakure accused the victim of being a thief and killed him with machetes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Rwibikara, Kirundo after accusing the victim of holding a political meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
