column17: 09-10 May. Imbonerakure members attacked and detained 10 supporters of the FNL party in Biyorwa, Ruyigi. Imbonerakure use machetes and iron bars to intimidate the civilians, cutting the ear of two civilians before turning them over to the police.
09 May 2019. An unidentified armed group threw a grenade at a home in Muramvya, Muramvya. Minor damage was done to the property.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 May 2019. An unidentified armed assailant shot and killed an Imbonerakure member who was walking home in the Mirango neighborhood of Kamenge, Bujumbura Marie. Another civilian was also injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two off-duty police officers in Muramvya, Muramvya with clubs. Two of the perpetrators were later arrested, while others fled.

10 May 2019. Members of a coffee cooperative demonstrated in Kumasanganzira (no coordinates available, in the Kiremba district) over salary payments from 2018. Police forces shot at the demonstrators, injuring two. Some sources indicate one of the demonstrators was targeted due to his role with the former armed forces. [size=no report]
11 May 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked a woman accused of witchcraft in Masha, Cibitoke. The victim was seriously injured.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 May 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked an Imbonerakure patrol at a check-point in Rubira, Mpanda (no coordinates available). The attackers clashed with police and Imbonerakure for one hour, killing one Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 May. Imbonerakure members forced civilians supporting CNL to attend a CNDD-FDD meeting in Nyamurenza, Ngozi province. The group beat 25 civilians who refused to attend.

11 May 2019. During the night, two grenades were thrown into a home in Kavomo, Kirundo. One man was killed and his wife was seriously injured. Locals suspect family members were behind the attack, due to a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 12 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted and injured FRODEBU opposition party members who were holding a meeting in Muramba, Makamba.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Butare, Ngozi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 May 2019. Imbonerakure tortured and injured an elderly man in Mukingo, Kayogoro (no coordinates available). The assailants accused the man of illegally making alcohol. The victim was then taken to prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 May 2019. Imbonerakure and police officers, armed with clubs and machetes, went to the homes of CNL members in Martyazo, some of whom they detained and tied up. At least one person was injured by the assailants.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted approximately 25 CNL party members with clubs in Nyamurenza, Ngozi. One victim was left in critical condition.

14 May 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked a former journalist with machetes in Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Marie. The former journalist had previously faced judicial prosecution for covering the activities of armed actors in Burundi.

column9: Former CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Former FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Farmers (Burundi); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 15 May 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a rice farmer who was a former FNL rebel and CNL supporter in or near Muregeza (Mpanda, Cibitoke). The farmer had recently left the CNL to join the CNDD-FDD.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Former FNL: National Forces of Liberation
column17: On 15 May 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a former FNL Major and CNL supporter in Nyamabere (Mpanda, Cibitoke).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted five CNL party members in Kivoga, Ngozi. The assailants also stole the belongings of the victims before taking them to the communal prison. The assailants accused the victims of holding an illicit meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 17 May. Imbonerakure beat up a civilian teacher and member of CNL in Murungurira, Ntega.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 May. Imbonerakure members attack civilians who support the CNL party in Gasorwe commune of Muyinga, killing 2 civilians and injuring others.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 May. A group of Imbonerakure, accompanied by police, disrupted a political meeting and attack five civilians associated with CNL in Murungurira of Ntega commune.
19 May. A police officer shoots and kills another police officer in Bwambarangwe of Mukenke.
20 May. A group of police officers shoot and kill another police officer in Kabuyenge of Mukenke, suspected to be a retaliatory killing for killing another officer the day before.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 May. Imbonerakure members attacked and injured a civilian, a member of UPRONA, in Buzirasazi area of Buhayira of Rugano.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 22 May. CNDD-FDD militants beat a CNL supporter, as well others who tried to help him, in Butambara. They took his money and released him after a communal administrator intervened.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Second half of May. Imbonerakure destroyed an UPRONA party office on Rushimabarimyi, Ruziba.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 May. Four Imbonerakure members attacked and injured 4 civilians associated with the CNL party in Runini, Tangara.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 May. Imbonerakure members destroyed. the crops of a CNL party representative in several locations in and near Kiringanire of Kananira, Ngozi province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 May. Imbonerakure members attack a CNL party member in Yaranda, for hosting a meeting to support Rwasa in his home.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 May. An unidentified armed group kills an Imbonerakure member guarding the Ijenda Post Office in Mugongomanga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 May. Three Imbonerakure members attack a civilian member of the CNL party on Gatwe Hill of Kizuka district in Rumonge.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 May. Imbonerakure members attacked and injured a civilian in Gashanga, Bugenyuzi. Imbonerakure members accused the man of beating his wife while they were in a bar.
28 May. An angry mob burned ten homes of Batwa civilians in Kigamba following the rape and murder of a young girl by two Batwa men. [size=no report]
Near 28 May. An unidentified armed group kills a taxi-moto driver and leaves the body in the Kigwena forest reserve in Rumonge.
29 May. 4 civilians killed by an unidentified armed group in Kanga area of Kinama in Bujumbura. Some from local security committees may have been among those killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 May. A CNL party activist is arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure and the communal administrator in Kigina of Nyamurenza in Ngozi. The activist is held in prison in Nyamurenza.

29 May. Military forces fired live rounds at farmers in Cabiza area of Gihanga, Bubanza to prevent them from reaching their fields. Farmers claim the soldiers are keeping them from their crops to pressure them to sell the crops and give money to the soldiers.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 May. Imbonerakure members attacked civilian members of UPRONA and demanded a ransom to their father to keep them out of jail. The civilians escaped, but Imbonerakure members followed them home to demand the ransom.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 June. Imbonerakure members attacked 3 CNL supporters for political propaganda in support of Agathon Rwasa in Nyabikenke, Kigina.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 June. Imbonerakure members attacked a CNL supporter for leaving the CNDD-FDD to support Rwasa in Karama, Rango.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 June. Imbonerakure members kidnap a civilian member of CNL in Bikanka area of Mukike commune ahead of his appointment as the head of the CNL in the Bikanka area.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 June. 2 Imbonerakure members attacked 3 CNL party members in Gihinga, Gitobe for holding political meetings.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 June. Imbonerakure members attacked an off-duty soldier on Santunda, Gitobe, in Kirundo province.

02 June. The chief of Nyabitsinda and two others tortured a goldsmith by taking needles to his genitals, accusing him of gold theft. Eventually, the chief released the goldsmith, who was taken to a hospital.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 02 June. A communal party leader of the CNDD-FDD attacked a civilian of the Batwa ethnic group for smoking hemp in Gisekuro.

04 June. Police forces clash with an unidentified armed group of 8, who had kidnapped a woman near the Tanzania border, in Gisuru. Police forces kill 3 of the armed group in the fighting and arrest the others.
On or before 04 June. An unidentified armed group abducted a woman from Gisuru, Ruyigi.
04 June. An unidentified armed group attacks two civilians with machetes, leaving severe injuries in Bugera of Gikuyo.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 06 June. An unidentified armed group burned the home of a CNDD-FDD party member, killing a man, woman and child inside.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 June. Imbonerakure members beat 7 civilians associated with the CNL party, as well as destroying and looting some of their property, on Muhororo hill of Mageyo zone in Mubimbi. Other civilians fled following the attacks.
07 June. An unidentified armed group clashed with a soldier in Kinyinya, Rukaramu near the airport, injuring the soldier.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate in Gitega city of Buraza against French media sources coverage of news in Burundi, especially their coverage of human rights violations and violence against women. [size=4000]

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 08 June. A group of 6 armed men attacked and injured a civilian member of CNDD-FDD party in Nderama, Bumba area.

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Cibitoke city of Cibitoke province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Bubanza city of Bubanza province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Kirundo city of Kirundo province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Muyinga city of Muyinga province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Undisclosed Source; Radio Television Nationale du Burundi
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Ngozi city of Ngozi province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Kayanza of Kayanza province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Karuzi city of Karuzi province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Bururi city of Bururi province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Undisclosed Source; Radio Television Nationale du Burundi
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Rumonge city of Rumonge province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Undisclosed Source; Radio Television Nationale du Burundi
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Cankuzo city of Cankuzo province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Muramvya city of Muramvya province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Undisclosed Source; Radio Television Nationale du Burundi
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Ruyigi city of Ruyigi province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Undisclosed Source; Radio Television Nationale du Burundi
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Mwaro city of Mwaro province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Undisclosed Source; Radio Television Nationale du Burundi
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Rutana city of Rutana province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

column16: Radio Television Nationale du Burundi; Undisclosed Source
column17: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi in Makamba of Makamba province during nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

08 June. Protesters, organised by Aime-Pascal Nduwimana of African Ministry of Compassion, demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi along the 28 November road in Bujumbura. [size=thousands]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 06 September. Imbonerakure extorted money from bicycle taxis in Bujumbura for CNDD-FDD party contributions. Civilians faced physical threats or bicycle confiscation for non-payment.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 09 June. An unidentified armed group attacked a CNDD-FDD party leader on Rugenge, Butanuka in Bubanza by shooting at his home. No casualties were reported.

09 June. Three unidentified bodies are found in the river at Nyamusasa hill of Kinyinya, Ruyigi province. These may be in connection with armed activity around Nduta refugee camp across the border in Tanzania.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 09 June. Imbonerakure and other CNDD-FDD members attacked and injured CNL supporters at Gitwenzi, Ntega commune.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 June. CNDD-FDD members tortured 3 Imbonerakure members for not alerting them about an attack the day before in Mpanda, Gahwazi in Bubanza province. After being tortured, the Imbonerakure were transferred to the police.
10 June. Police forces shoot and kill a civilian in Kinanira area of Bujumbura. While the chief claims this was a thief, others claim he was shouting for help.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 June. Police arrest 3 Imbonerakure members and the chief of the hill as suspects of the attack against CNDD-FDD leader on Rugenge hill, torturing them in prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 11 June. Six Imbonerakure members tied up and beat 2 CNL members in Gatakazi, Musongati for joining the CNL party.
12 June. Police arrested and assaulted 4 civilians for a curfew violation in Gihanga of Bubanza province. 1 civilian was tortured and sent to the hospital.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 June. Imbonerakure members assaulted a civilian secondary student in Rutonganyikwa of Buhiga for his father's CNL party affiliation.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 June. Imbonerakure members burned the meeting house of the CNL party in Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 June. 3 civilians leaving a bar in Buhiga of Karuzi province were attacked and beaten by Imbonerakure members for singing songs which reflected poorly on the CNDD-FDD party. The 3 civilians are also Imbonerakure members.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 June. Imbonerakure members assaulted a civilian in Kirundo city of Kirundo province following a dispute over the ownership of his bicycle.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 June. Imbonerakure, under order from the Muremera neighborhood chief, attacked, beat and arrested a civilian supporter of the CNL party in Muremera, Giharo. They released him later the same day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 June. Imbonerakure members attacked and beat CNL supporters for holding a political meeting in Mura, Giharo.
14 June. An unidentified armed group clashed with military forces near the Tanzania border in Muka, Gisagara commune.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 June. Imbonerakure capture, beat, and sexually torture a man after an altercation at a bar in Buhiga, Ngayane.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 June. Imbonerakure members beat a truck driver on the road between Vumbi and Kirundo communes in Kirundo province for a traffic incident.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 14 June. The CNL party leader of Nyabiyogi was attacked and injured by Imbonerakure members in Nyabiyogi, Kayanza province.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: 14 June. Police arrest and beat civilian supporters of MSD in Kirambi of Bweru, Ruyigi province. The MSD supporters were injured in the attack.
14 June. UFR-Abahizi members clashed with 20 soldier in Bumba, Rukoyoyo near the Tanzania border. Military forces retreated due to being outnumbered.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 June. Imbonerakure members clashed with police forces at the CNL party residence in Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural. Imbonerakure were firing at the CNL residence, which they had burned a few days before, where they were repelled by police. However, some claim the police were working alongside the Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 15 June. Imbonerakure members attacked and beat 2 CNL supporters in Nkango, Butaganzwa.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 June. Imbonerakure beat CNL supporters in Kibuye, Isale after they were returning from the opening ceremonies of a party building.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 June. Imbonerakure members interrupted a CNL party meeting in Mura, by throwing stones at the attendees. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 16 June. Imbonerakure members attacked CNL supporters who were all teachers with clubs in Bubogora, Murwi, leaving the CNL members injured. Imbonerakure members claim the CNL teachers were in possession of rifles.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 June. An unidentified armed group clashed with police and Imbonerakure members in Gihanga commune of Bubanza, near the Rukoko nature reserve. 3 Imbonerakure and 2 police are wounded in the fighting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 June. Two Imbonerakure and the sub-hill chief assaulted a civilian in Rwibaga, Ijenda for being a political opponent.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 17 June. Imbonerakure members continued attacks on CNL supporters and teachers in Bubogora, Murwi, leaving the CNL members injured. This is an ongoing event from the previous day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 June. Two civilians were attacked for crossing the river to Rwanda by Imbonerakure and the hill chief in Kigaga, Ntega. After holding them overnight, they were taken to the police station.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 June. The hill leader of the Imbonerakure attacked and seriously injured a civilian in Nyabigina, Nyarutuntu.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 June. Imbonerakure assaulted a civilian CNL mobiliser for supporting Rwasa. The assailants destroyed his fields and took him to the police in Kireka, Gikuyo.
19 June. A civilian was beaten into a coma by police forces after an arrest for violence against his spouse and refusing to pay a bribe in Nyarusange, Musigat.
20 June. Police searched residents, and arrested 80 people for not having an identity card. They also beat a moto-taxi driver in Makamba city, Makamba.
20 June. Moto-taxi drivers protested over police brutality, following an incident involving on the same day in Makamba, Makamba province. [size=no report]
21 June. A CNL member was strangled and killed by an unidentified armed group in Kigoma, Bugabira. The body was left in the Gacamirinda river.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 June. Residents of Kibavu, Ruganza clashed with an Imbonerakure militant, after the militant killed his wife and child.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 June. Imbonerakure attacked a CNL supporter in Bucana, Kirundo. Police arrest two of the Imbonerakure following the attack.
23 June. An unidentified armed group burned three homes in Karera 1, Musongati over a land conflict.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: Women (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: 23 June. A female CNL member was beaten and detained by Imbonerakure in Rutana city. She was taken to prison and held for switching political parties.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 June. Imbonerakure and the hill chief beat a woman in Rwingoma, Buhiga over a family dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 June. Imbonerakure assaulted and looted goods from a civilian supporter of CNL in Kibago hill of Makamba, after the CNL supporter was accused of going against a referendum and collecting food from rebels.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 June. Imbonerakure beat a CNL supporter in Rubimba, Kibago for supporting the CNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 June. Imbonerakure and the hill chief clashed with a police officer in Nkonyovu, Rutegama. Some suspect it may have stemmed from the Tutsi ethnicity of the police officer.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 June. Imbonerakure members attacked 2 members of the CNL in Susa, Murungurira.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 June. 4 Imbonerakure abducted and tortured a CNL supporter on Kaninga hill in Butanuka, Bubanza. The victim was found on 29 June arrested at the police station.
28 June. A taxi-moto driver is found dead in the Kigwena forest reserve in Rumonge, killed by an unidentified armed group. This is the second taxi moto corps found in this location within a month.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 June. Dozens of Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters on Nyakibande and Gishingiro (no coordinates available) in Nyambuye, Bujumbura Rural. Afterwards, the CNL supporters were taken to the police station
28 June. A senior government army minister was abducted from Bujumbura by an unidentified armed group.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 29 June. An unidentified armed group severely beat a civilian CNDD-FDD member and school director on Buhindo hill, Murwi, Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 June. Imbonerakure members, under the instruction of the Rurambira hill chief, beat two students of Tutsi ethnicity in Gishiha, Vugizo. Imbonerakure members told the students the country does not belong to Tutsis anymore.
29 June. An unidentified group killed a civilian in Nyamiyaga, Gihogazi over witchcraft accusations.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 June. Imbonerakure members attacked a CNL supporter in Rukago, Gahombo, Kayanza before taking him to prison.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 29 June. CNDD-FDD supporters protested in Bujumbura against Human Rights Watch and International Crisis Group. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: 30 June. The CNDD-FDD head of the zone in Kirundo assaulted a woman, when a local teacher intervened to stop the attack. The head of the zone then had the intervening teacher detained by Imbonerakure members in Gitobe quarter, Kirundo city.
30 June. A group of CNL supporters attacked and beat the hill chief in Karamagi, Kirundo during the opening of the provincial party headquarters.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 June. A group of Imbonerakure detained and beat civilian supporters of CNL in Gitobe, Butihinda during the opening of the provincial party headquarters.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 June. A group of Imbonerakure attacked a civilian on Gitongo, Gitega.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 June. After a group of Imbonerakure attacked a civilian on Gitongo, Gitega (coded separately). During the night, victim's family retaliated and beat one of the Imbonerakure assailants.
30 June. Two civilians were found dead, killed by an unidentified armed group in Rusiga, 1 km from the Cibitoke city.
01 July. A woman was arrested and then killed by police forces in Kanyosha, Mboza.
01 July. Two refugee returnees attacked a civilian on Buheka, Nyanza-Lac over a land dispute between several families in the area.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Between 01-04 July. Imbonerakure abducted and raped a young girl in Monge-Kiramata, Ntega. She was captured on the 1st and released by the 4th of July, but prevented by authorities from seeking medical treatment.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 01 July. Police forces kill a civilian member of CNDD-FDD on Ruziba, Bukinanyana.
01 July. A soldier killed a civilian on Gahoma hill, Mabayi.

02 July. Police forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in Gatumba, Mutimbuzi near the DRC border. The assailants were attempting to abduct or steal from a vehicle, when security forces intervened and killed one assailant.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 July. Imbonerakure abducted and beat a civilian in Nyabigina, Nyanza-Lac.
02 July. An unidentified group set fire to the fence of the CNL party leader in Rutegama commune, Muramvya. Some suspected police and Imbonerakure may be behind this incident.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 July. A FNL militant shot and injured an Imbonerakure in Busongo, Gihanga.
03 July. Police forces beat and arrested a woman in Busongo, Gihanga in Bubanza. Police accused the woman of hiding her husband who they suspected of attacking Imbonerakure.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 July. A group of Imbonerakure clashed with 4 CNL supporters in Nderama, Bukinanyana.
Near 03 July. A woman is found dead, it is suspected she was killed by police forces, in Kajiji area of Kanyosha, Mboza.
03 July. A civilian is found dead in Rusiga, 2 km from Cibitoke city, killed by an unidentified armed group.
04 July. An unidentified armed group detonate an explosive in Makamba city, Makamba. No casualties were reported in the explosion.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Rapid Mobile Intervention Group
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 July. Police Rapid Mobile Intervention Group arrest an Imbonerakure suspect of planning an uprising against a fourth mandate of the president in Gitega. The Imbonerakure is transferred to Bujumbura and cannot be found since.
05 July. Police shoot a taxi bicyclist in the knee for consuming an illegal drink in Mugerama, Nyanza-Lac.
05 July. A CNL party member and FNL party member fought each other in Butamuheba, Gitega. The FNL party supporter was severely injured. [size=no report]
05 July. An unidentified armed group beheaded a civilian in Buhoro, Mabayi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 July. Imbonerakure armed with clubs blocked roads and prevented CNL supporters from attending a political meeting in Butare, Kayogoro.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 July. A CNL secretary was killed by Imbonerakure in Kigarama, Kayanza province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 July. 2 Imbonerakure abducted and tortured a young civilian, who was later released by a police officer in Buhiga, Ngayane.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 July. A group of 7 suspected Imbonerakure attacked a CNL party member and 2 other civilians in Rugabano, Mwakiro.
08 July. A mob threw rocks at the communal CNL party building in Rutagage, Ngozi. [size=no report]
08 July. An unidentified armed group killed a civilian in Gabiro-Ruvyagira, Rugombo.
On or before 09 July. Police arrest the political party leader of the RANAC, Aloys Baricako, and hold him at the main prison in Ngozi.
On or before 10 July. Police forces shot and arrested a civilian in Bugarama, Muramvya. The attack is suspected to be connected to an assault by Imbonerakure.
10 July. A hill chief raped a woman in Ruvyagira, Ruyigi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Government of Burundi (2005-)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Farmers (Burundi)
column17: On 11 July 2019, Imbonerakure with a CNDD-FDD party leader and local government administrator attacked and killed 2 civilians, a farmer and a CNL supporter, in the Kinama area of Bujumbura (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).
11 July. Police arrested and publicly killed two civilian CNL members accused of theft in Buramata, Gihanga. Others who took photos of the execution or who were near the victims have been arrested.
12 July. An unidentified armed group burned and destroyed homes at the displaced persons site in Musenyi, Ngozi province.
On or before 12 July. An unidentified armed group killed a civilian in Nyarwumba, Cibitoke province. The body was found near the Kibira forest with two bullet wounds in the head and chest.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 13 July. A CNDD-FDD and CNL supporter clashed with each other with machetes in Kabasi, Bitare over a political argument concerning the 2020 election.
On or before 13 July. A civilian is found dead, tied up and wrapped in a mosquito net in Nyarwumba, Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 July. Imbonerakure attacked civilian supporters of the CNL in Gasenyi, Rusamaza, Karuzi. The CNL supporters were then arrested by the police and held in jail.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 July. Imbonerakure beat civilians associated with a local CNL representative on Nyungu, Muyinga. The CNL representative was beaten and taken to prison for three days.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 July. Imbonerakure beat and injured two CNL supporters, provoking clashes between CNL and Imbonerakure in Gitanga area of Gashikanwa. Police intervened to make arrests with one police officer injured by a machete by a CNL supporter.
14 July. The walls and doors of a CNL party building were vandalized in Muhanga commune, Kayanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 July. Imbonerakure attacked, looted and destroyed property of the CNL leader in Muyinga, Mushikamo, Muramvya.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 14 July. CNDD-FDD supporters beat a civilian member of CNL and accused him of spying on their meeting on Mutobo, Mukike.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 July. Imbonerakure beat a group of CNL supporters for holding a meeting in Murungurira, Ntega. Police intervened and arrested the CNL supporters.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 July. CNL and Imbonerakure clashed in Rwaniro, Murago, injuring one Imbonerakure. Police arrested CNL members following the clash.
15 July. The CNL party building was destroyed by unidentified armed group in Minago, Rumonge.
15 July. An unidentified armed group attacked and injured a civilian in Buhiga, Karuzi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On Jul 16th, in Bugera, two members of the CNL were attacked and seriously injured by Imbonerakure. No fatalities reported.
17 July. A communal administrator was attacked by a member of an unidentified armed group armed with a gun and grenade in Mutaho, Gitega.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On Jul 18th, Imbonerakure caught and beat suspected bandits in Gihanga. One person died and another was injured.
19 July. An unidentified armed group shot and injured two civilians in Bunyerere, Gisagara. This armed group operates near the Tanzanian border.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: Women (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: 19 July. Imbonerakure attacked and assaulted CNL supporters, including a woman before turning them over to the police for arrest in Gatete, Busoni.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 July. Police and Imbonerakure attacked and killed 3 civilians and wound 1 other accused of cattle theft in Mikoni.
19 July. An unidentified armed group killed two traders in Bumba, Rukoyoyo in Cankuzo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 19 July. Imbonerakure attacked and tortured civilians accused of theft, killing one and injuring six others in Gihanga, Bubanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure abducted a CNL representative after he questioned forced election contributions on Borera(no coordinates available), Kayogoro.
20 July. An unidentified armed group beat and injured a man accused of witchcraft in Masha, Murwi, Cibitoke. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 20-21 July. CNDD-FDD and government administration at the hill level forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign several areas in Makamba II, Makamba.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure and government administration at the hill level forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign throughout Muramvya province. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those that refused. Some reports say that opposition and neutral political supporters were avoided.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure erect barriers and force civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign throughout Muyinga province. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those that refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure and government administration at the hill level forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign throughout Ruyigi province. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those that refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure and government administration at the hill level forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign in Tenga, Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those that refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. An Imbonerakure communal leader beat the CNL zone leader of Giheta on Muzumure, Rango.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure and government administration at the hill level forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign in Butamuheba, Gitega. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those that refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 20 July. CNDD-FDD leaders forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign throughout Mugaho commune. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those that refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure and government administration forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign throughout Buhiga commune in Karuzi. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those that refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure and government administration forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign throughout Kayanza. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those who refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 July. Imbonerakure beat and looted property from a group of female displaced people at a displaced persons camp in Mubanga, Ruhororoi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 July. 2 Imbonerakure beat a CNL party supporter on Gitanga hill, Buhiga.

column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 21 July. A group of demonstrators threw stones at a bar belonging to a FRODEBU member in Cibitoke. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 July. Imbonerakure and government administration at the hill level forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign throughout Ruyigi province. These forced contributions were reported to be associated with violence for those that refused.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 22 July. CNDD-FDD and government administration at the hill level force civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign in Murama, Higiro.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 July. Imbonerakure and government administration at the hill level forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign on Bucana hill in Gitobe, Kirundo.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 22 July. CNDD-FDD party members attacked and severely injured a civilian in Buhiga, Karuzi.
22 July. An unidentified armed group attacked and injured a civilian with machetes in Kinzanza, Gitanga.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 22 July. A CNDD-FDD mobiliser beat and threatened a CNL member for their political affiliation. Others intervened.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 July. An Imbonerakure raped a young girl in Kibasi, Buhinda.
22 July. An unidentified armed group clashed with police officers at the police station on Bunyerere, Gisagara. The armed group stole goods before retreating to Tanzania.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On or before 23 July. SNR agents abduct a CNL supporter from Mutanga Nord, Bujumbura Mairie. SNR beat the CNL supporter into a coma and left him in Bujumbura, found on the 23rd of July.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 July. CNDD-FDD with Imbonerakure supporters and CNL supporters blame one another for vandalizing buildings of one another in Murungira, Ntega.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 July. Imbonerakure threatened, stole telephones and took recording equipment from journalists in Makamba city, Makamba in order to prevent their coverage of events in the area.

Week of 24 July. An unidentified armed group tortured civilians on Kanenga hill in Mpanda, Bubanza. The civilians were accused of sorcery following the local government posting a list of 16 names of allegedly involved in witchcraft. Several of the civilians flee following the attack. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 July. An Imbonerakure beat and severely injured a civilian in Ntega, Kigaga in Kirundo province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 July. An unidentified armed group, likely Imbonerakure, destroyed the CNL party building in Kizuka, Kagongo in Rumonge province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 25 July. Imbonerakure severely beat a civilian on Butare hill in Ruvumu, Ngozi for being a CNL party member.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 July. Imbonerakure attacked CNL party members and destroyed the CNL party building in Minago, Rumonge.
On 27 July 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a CNL supporter from Nyambabere (Mpanda, Bubanza).
27 July. An unidentified armed group vandalized a CNL party building in Benga, Isale the day before an inauguration ceremony.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 July. Imbonerakure and government administration at the hill level forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 political campaign on several areas around Matongo, Kayanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 July. Two Imbonerakure raped a young girl in Gituma, Karwa. Police arrested the two Imbonerakure following the rape.
27 July. An unidentified armed group wearing military uniforms attacked and injured civilians in the Kagoma quarter, Kayokwe. The group was armed with machetes and stole money from the civilians.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 July. Imbonerakure beat a group of 5 women living in an IDP camp in Mubanga, Ruhororo .

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 27-29 July. Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD party members force civilians to contribute to CNDD-FDD election campaigns for 2020 in ongoing operations across the country. Several cases of violence and prohibition from activities or public venues have been reported for those who refuse to contribute.
28 July. Two unidentified armed groups with machetes and rifles in military uniforms attack and rob civilians in Gihinga, Mwaro province. Police attempted to intervene but the attackers had fled.
28 July. Police officers arrested and tortured a young girl in Mukoni, Giteranyi. The girl was accused of stealing by the family she was working for.
On or before 28 July. A soldier was found dead after an unidentified armed group clashed with the soldier in Ngagara, Ntahangwa.
29 July. Seventh Day Adventist church members demonstrated after CNDD-FDD members attempted to place their party members into church leadership. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 30 July. A group of 5 Imbonerakure beat a CNL party member and director of a local school in Kirungu, Ngozi.
30 July. An unidentified armed group burned and destroyed property at the Gatete CNL party building in Rumonge.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 July. An Imbonerakure sexually tortured a civilian to death on Musama hill in Muhanga, Kayanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 August. Imbonerakure beat 4 civilians for being part of opposition political parties.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 02 August. Imbonerakure tortured and killed a civilian member of UPRONA in Muhanga commune, Kayanza.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 02 August. Fights erupted between CNDD-FDD and CNL supporters in Nyarugengeri, Buhinyuza, leaving several injured. Police intervened and arrested several CNL members involved. [size=no report]
03 August. Police forces beat a civilian to death for breaking curfew in Bubanza city, Bubanza.
03 August. An unidentified armed group threw a grenade at civilians in Mutaho town, Gitega, seriously injuring a private security guard.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 August. A group of Imbonerakure tied up a man and robbed a restaurant in Cibitoke, Bujumbura Mairie.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 August. Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian CNL member in Rama, Kayanza for his political party affiliation.
03 August. A police officer beat a civilian to death in Gihanga commune, Bubanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 August. Imbonerakure armed with clubs broke into the home of a CNL party leader in Cibitoke city, Cibitoke. After breaking down the doors and windows, neighbors were alerted and the Imbonerakure fled.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 06 August. CNDD-FDD members abduct two CNL supporters and beat them at the CNDD-FDD party building in Butihinda, Kamaramagambo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 August. Imbonerakure beat up at least 3 civilians supporting CNL in Rweza area of Kanyosha, Bujumbura Rural.

On or before 08 August. An unidentified armed group kills 3 Rwandan civilians and leaves them in Kibira forest near Nderama, Cibitoke. Rebel groups frequently operate in the Kibira forest, which may have been connected to the killing.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 August. Imbonerakure attack and kill a well-known female musician in Musaga area of Bujumbura.
08 August. An unidentified armed group from Tanzania attacked civilians in Cankuzo province with heavy artillery fire.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 August. Imbonerakure and CNL clashed in Masasu, Muyinga province. Several Imbonerakure were injured. Police intervened and arrested CNL supporters.
On or before 13 August. 2 civilians were killed by an unidentified armed group and found on Sehe hill, Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 August. The CNL party building was burned down in Muyira, Bujumbura Rural. This is likely ongoing destruction of CNL property by Imbonerakure .
On or before 13 August. A civilian was found killed by an unidentified armed group in Masango, Cibitoke province.
14 August. A civilian was killed by police forces in Kabeza hill, Cankuzo following the arrest of three civilians in connection with a former CNDD-FDD leader.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 August. Two CNL supporters were beaten up by Imbonerakure on Shaka hill, Makamba province. They were accused of holding a secret meeting and then arrested by police forces.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: On or around 14 August. A driver for the MSD political party was abducted by an unidentified armed group. Although he was driving to Muramvya, his vehicle was found near the port of Bujumbura.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: 14 August. Police SNR forces arrested and disappeared the Kamenge area leader for the MSD party in Bujumbura. Some sources indicate he has been killed. Coded conservatively as a forced disappearance.
Between 13 and 17 August. An albino was killed by an unidentified armed group, likely linked to witchcraft, and found dismembered near the Ruzizi river in Rugombo, Cibitoke.  [size=no report]
On or before 17 August. A civilian was found killed by an unidentified armed group in Kibaya, Cibitoke province.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On or before 18 August. An unidentified armed group killed a civilian teacher and supporter of the CNL party. The body was found in Murungurira, Ntega. CNL leaders confirmed that the person was a CNL supporter.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On or before 18 August. An unidentified armed group killed a civilian teacher and supporter of the CNL party. The body was found in Rushubije, Ntega.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: 18 August. Police and Imbonerakure attacked civilian supporters of the CNL, including a women's group, in Gasenyi, Muyinga following the opening of a CNL party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 August 2019, Imbonerakure and CNL supporters clashed in Kanyosha, Muha commune after Imbonerakure set up blockades to prevent the opening of CNL party buildings in this quarter. 10 are injured following the clashes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 August. Police beat and dispersed civilians in Gasenyi, which instigated clashes between Imbonerakure clashed with some CNL members in Rugari, Giteranyi. Police intervened to disperse the fighting. Several unarmed CNL supporters were wounded in the clash and one was killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 19 August 2019, Imbonerakure vandalized and destroyed property of the CNL party building in Kanyosha, Muha commune. This comes after clashes the day before between CNL and Imbonerakure in the same area.
On or before 22 August. 5 civilians were killed by an unidentified armed group and found dead in the Kibira Nature Reserve in Gafumbegeti, Cibitoke province.
On or before 23 August. Two bodies were found decapitated by an unidentified armed group in Ruhagarika, Cibitoke. 7 bodies were found in this area in the last few months, with 26 found last year.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 24 August. The mayor of Bujumbura, a CNDD-FDD member, organised a protest against Rwanda for the use of Burundian drums on the show East Africa's Got Talent. [size=thousands]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 26 August. A CNL supporter was killed by Imbonerakure in Kirundo commune, Kirundo.
On or before 28 August. 5 civilians working as miners were found killed by an unidentified armed group on Ndemera, Cibitoke province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 August. Imbonerakure and CNL members clashed in Mayanyagwa, Mubimbi. The local leader of the Imbonerakure died in the clash.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 30 August. Imbonerakure attacked civilian supporters of CNL in Buringa, Gihanga during the opening of a party building. Two were injured in the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 September. 4 Imbonerakure members apprehended 12 CNL activists and beat up one on Mutara, Karuzi. The other CNL members were threatened and then released.
On or before 01 September. A civilian was killed by an unidentified armed group and found in Ruseseka, Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Government of Burundi (2005-); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: 02 September. 3 female CNL supporters were beaten by Imbonerakure and the communal administrator, a CNDD-FDD supporter, in Bwambarangwe, Kirundo province at the communal administration office.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 06 September. An unidentified armed group attacked and killed the Kagazi hill leader of Imbonerakure. He was found dead in the river in Rusiga, Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 September. Imbonerakure burned fences and intimidated IDPs and refugees around the refugee/IDP camp in Mwaro-Ngundu, Makebuko.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 September. Imbonerakure attacked IDPs at the refugee/IDP camp in Mwaro-Ngundu, Makebuko. No casualties reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 September. Imbonerakure attacked fishermen on Lake Rweru in Giteranyi, Karugunda. 10 were injured and 2 were killed in the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 08 September. Imbonerakure assaulted several CNL supporters in Kayogoro commune, Makamba because they left the CNDD-FDD party. Police then arrested the CNL supporters.
09 September. Residents demonstrated in Kigeri, Kabarore by conducting a sit-in in front of the office of the Ombudsman against a large land expropriation of 780 families. [size=more than 300]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: 09 September. Imbonerakure threw a grenade into the home of a FRODEBU supporter in Bukeye commune, Muramvya. 1 civilian was killed in the attack.
09 September. An unidentified armed group from Giteranyi attacked and killed 3 civilians in Busoni commune, Kirundo.
11 September. Military forces abducted a civilian CNL supporter from Nyeshenza, Cibitoke. Family members of the CNL supporter do not know the location of the victim.
On or before 11 September. An unidentified armed group raped and killed a woman on Nyavyamo hill in Ndora, Nyamyeha.

11 September. Local residents demonstrated and fought with police over new regulations on building codes. Police had attempted to arrest a civilian over a violation and hit them in the head which ignited the violence. One police officer was injured. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 September. Imbonerakure and the chief of the commune looted goods and forced the closure of a local sewing shop producing CNL clothing.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 September. Imbonerakure beat up civilians in Kizuka, Rumonge for not joining the CNDD-FDD party. Many CNL party members were targeted in the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 September. A civilian CNL supporter was tortured by Imbonerakure in Mwaro city, Mwaro.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 September. Imbonerakure destroyed property in Rumonge city, Rumonge after a Presidential visit to the city. This was likely in retaliation against low civilian interest in the Presidential rally. Police and military forces also blocked access to the market, prevented bus travel and may have been involved in the destruction of property.

21 September. Police forces broke into a 7th Day Adventist church and beat up a woman in the Rubuye area of Ngozi city, Ngozi. This may be part of ongoing political tension between the CNDD-FDD and the 7th Day Adventist Church who are accused of being politically supportive of the CNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: 21 September. Imbonerakure beat up a woman who supports the CNL party in Rutabo hill, Kirundo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 September. Imbonerakure and CNL supporters clashed in Buhurika zone, Musigati commune. Police arrived to break up the fighting. No casualties were reported in the fighting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 September. Imbonerakure and CNL supporters clashed in Bukinga zone, Musigati commune. Police arrived to break up the fighting. No casualties were reported in the fighting.

On or before 22 September. A Pentecostal Church pastor was abducted by an unidentified armed group after leaving Kirundo for Bujumbura. Many suspect he was abducted by CNDD-FDD members for raising money for Burundian refugees in Rwanda, though this has not been confirmed.
22 September. The Mugongomanga communal administrator attacked a woman in Jenda zone, Mugongomanga.
23 September. A communal armed group from Mutambu destroyed banana plantations in Raro area of Nyabiraba commune, Bujumbura Rural over a land dispute.
23 September. Students from DRC demonstrated in Bujumbura against the arrest and deportation of 138 DRC students by Burundian police forces for not having proper residence paperwork. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 23 September. A CNL supporter was attacked and killed by Imbonerakure on Mushikanwa hill, Gihogazi. Imbonerakure claim the CNL supporter was involved in sorcery.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 23 September. CNDD-FDD zone leader beat up several CNL supporters and looted livestock in Kibezi, Kiremba. The CNDD-FDD zone leader says that he does not want any CNL supporters in Kibezi.
On or before 27 September. 4 soldiers were found dead in the Rusizi river in Nyamitanga, Cibitoke following a clash with an unidentified armed group.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 September. 6 Imbonerakure attacked 2 CNL supporters in Rango, Kayanza for participating in the opening of a CNL party building.

28 September. Police forces assaulted a group of 7th Day Adventists praying together in their church building in Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie. This is part of ongoing violence against 7th Day Adventists for not supporting the CNDD-FDD party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 September. Imbonerakure destroyed a bridge connecting Nonwe and Kibazi to prevent CNL supporters from crossing over a river to open a new party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 September. Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters in Kagari zone, Muyinga for attending the opening of a CNL party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 29 September. Imbonerakure attacked several civilians during a political rally by the Imbonerakure in Rugombo, Cibitoke. 2 civilian is in critical condition.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Early in the month of October. 4 Imbonerakure beat up a CNL supporter in Nyarusange, Ngozi. Police arrested the Imbonerakure following the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 01 October. Imbonerakure destroyed the crops of a CNL zone leader in Kamira hill, Ngozi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Month of October 2019, an Imbonerakure raped a 16 year old female student in Kivoga zone, Rutana. The Imbonerakure then went on the run from authorities.

01 October. An unidentified armed group destroyed the CNL party building in Kagongo, Rumonge. Imbonerakure or CNDD-FDD supporters are likely behind the destruction of property, though neither have been confirmed.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Near 1 October 2019. A CNDD-FDD and zone leader abducted a civilian from Kigoma zone, Buhiga. The location of the civilian is unknown since the disappearance.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: Students (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: On October 3, A secondary school student and CNL supporter was attacked by Imbonerakure at a school in Nyamurenza commune, Ngozi.

02 October. A UPRONA supporter was attacked by an unidentified armed group in Rugari, Karugunda near his home. He was hit over the head with a piece of concrete. This event occurred near the same location as the destruction of a bridge by Imbonerakure in the same week to prevent a CNL meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 03 October. Imbonerakure beat up a CNL supporter in Rushubije, Ntega.

On or before 04 October. A government minister, Jean Marie Vianney Rugerinyange, in the Ministry of Culture and Sport was killed by an unidentified armed group at his home in Kinanira 4 neighborhood in Musaga, Bujumbura Mairie.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 05 October. Civil society organisations and CNDD-FDD supporters demonstrated in Gitega city, Gitega against the extension of the mandate of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Nyamurenza, Ngozi against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. Civilians were forced not to work by Imbonerakure upon seizure of tools or imposing fees. [size=no report]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 October. An unidentified armed group killed an Imbonerakure in Munyange, Busiga. 14 CNL supporters have been arrested as suspected perpetrators.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Students (Burundi)
column17: 05 October. Civil society organisations, CNDD-FDD supporters and students demonstrated in Ngozi city, Ngozi against the extension of the mandate of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=""not a large number""]

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD, Imbonerakure and many government administrators demonstrated in Karuzi city, Karuzi against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi and recent political statements made by Burundian Catholic church leaders. [size=no report]

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Students (Burundi)
column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD, Imbonerakure and many students demonstrated in Cankuzo city, Cankuzo against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi and recent political statements made by Burundian Catholic church leaders. [size=no report]

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD, Imbonerakure and many students demonstrated in Muyinga city, Muyinga against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi and recent political statements made by Burundian Catholic church leaders. [size=no report]

column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Rumonge city, Rumonge against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]

column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Bubanza city, Bubanza against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]

column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Ruyigi city, Ruyigi against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]

column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Makamba city, Makamba against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]

column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Mwaro city, Mwaro against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]

column16: Inzamba; Humura; Radio Publique Africaine; VOA Radio
column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Bururi city, Bururi against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column16: VOA Radio; Humura; Inzamba; Radio Publique Africaine
column17: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Rutana city, Rutana against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]
07 October. Students demonstrated in Rumonge city, Rumonge against the closure of their secondary school. Students demanded that the principle find another school for them to study. [size=no report]

column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 0n or before 10 October. Several Imbonerakure members including the provincial leader of Ruyigi are arrested and tortured in Ruyigi city prison during detainment by police forces and SNR. They are suspected to have attempted the assassination of the CNDD-FDD provincial leader in Ruyigi.
10 October. University students demonstrated in Gitega city, Gitega over lack of government stipends to support them. [size=no report]

10 October. An unidentified armed group destroyed the CNL party building in Nyabiraba commune. The CNL blames the CNDD-FDD for this attack after the chief of the commune vowed that no CNL party buildings may exist in the commune. This is the second CNL party building to be destroyed in Nyabiraba.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 October. Imbonerakure beat up CNL supporters in a bar in Kirundo city. A police officer intervened to stop the attack, but was also beaten up and accused of being a CNL supporter. 5 were injured in the attack and property destroyed at the bar.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On or before 11 October 2019. 4 Imbonerakure tortured a civilian CNL supporter by burning plastic on his body in Nyamurenza commune, Ngozi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 October 2019. Imbonerakure infiltrated into the prison in the main prison of Bujumbura, and attacked prisoners who were arrested for political reasons. 1 prisoner was killed in the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 October 2019. A man and wife who left the CNDD-FDD party for the CNL party were beaten up by Imbonerakure in Mutara, Kirundo.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 October. A CNL party building was destroyed by Imbonerakure and the zone leader in Gasenyi zone, Buganda.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: 13 October 2019. A civilian accused of supporting rebels in DRC was arrested by SNR and killed by the prison guards at the SNR office in Ndava, Buganda. His body was dumped in the Rusizi river.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 13 October 2019. Imbonerakure and CNL members clashed in Cewe zone, Kirundo during the inauguration of the CNL party building. Two Imbonerakure were injured in the clash. Local administration barred the opening of the CNL building following the clash.
14 October 2019, a student was kidnapped by an unidentified armed group near Musaga, Bujumbura.
15 October 2019. An unidentified armed group destroyed a CNL party building in Mutumba, Karuzi. CNL members blame the Imbonerakure for the destruction of property.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
