column17: In the month of October 2019, CNL and CNDD-FDD clashed in Nyamurenza commune, Ngozi, following the opening of a CNL party building. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 15 October 2019 (weeks before 7 November 2019), Imbonerakure attacked and killed a member of the CNL in Burenza (Marangara, Ngozi).

On or before 15 October 2019. An unidentified armed group destroyed a CNL party building in Muhuta commune, Rumonge. Police arrested CNL leaders and accused them of destroying their own building to blame it on Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 October 2019. An Imbonerakure attacked a civilian member of the CNL with a machete in Mutara, Kirundo. Local residents were able to intervene to stop the attack and take the civilian to the hospital.
16 October 2019. An unidentified armed group destroyed the CNL party building in Butahana, Gitobe.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 16 October 2019. A CNL supporter and teacher were arrested and beaten by SNR and police forces in Buhiga commune, Karuzi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 October 2019. A CNL party building was destroyed by Imbonerakure in Murwi, Cibitoke.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On or before 16 October 2019. SNR agents arrested 43 people suspected of having links to CNL and RED-TABARA in Cibitoke province. They are being held at the prison in Cibitoke.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 October 2019. Imbonerakure destroyed the CNL party building in Gitaza, Muhuta.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Twa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
column17: 18 October 2019. Imbonerakure attacked three Batwa civilian supporters of the CNL on Shoza hill, Nyamurenza for participating in CNL meetings. No casualties were reported in the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 October 2019. Imbonerakure destroy the home of a CNL party representative in Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 21 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU militants enter the Kibira forest in Musigati commune [coded at geoprecision 2], Bubanza in two separate groups.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: 22 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU militants clash with military forces, police and Imbonerakure in Musigati commune, Bubanza near or in the Kibira forest [coded at geoprecision 2]. Following the fighting, the RED-TABARA/FOREBU retreated to Kibira to join two other groups of RED-TABARA/FOREBU already in the forest. 14 RED-TABARA and 1 policeman killed, as well as several wounded and weapons seized.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 October 2019. Imbonerakure destroyed a CNL party building on Mutara hill, Karuzi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 22 October 2019. The demobilized Buramata hill leader of the Imbonerakure was killed by other Imbonerakure on Buramata hill, Gihanga, for collaborating with RED-TABARA.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 22 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU militants abducted 20 civilians including the hill chief in Mitakataka, Bubanza commune. They were later released on Ruziba hill, Musigati commune.
23 October 2019. ""Many"" people are arrested by police forces in Musigati, Bubanza and taken to undisclosed locations following clashes between RED-TABARA/FOREBU and Burundi security forces.
Week of 23 October 2019. An unidentified armed group destroyed property at the Kirundo commune CNL party building two times during the week of 23 October. CNDD-FDD supporters are likely behind this.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 23 October 2019. Imbonerakure abducted and killed a civilian CNL supporter in Gihanga commune, Bubanza [coded at geoprecision 2]. His body was found in Gihanga commune on 23 October. This may be part of broader operations against CNL members by police with the help of Imbonerakure for collaborating with RED-TABARA.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: 23 October 2019. Imbonerakure, a CNDD-FDD secretary and hill chief beat up a CNL supporter in Kigaza, Kayogoro for spreading CNL ideology.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 23 October 2019. The RED-TABARA and FOREBU coalition move forces into the forest of Magufa, Bururi commune [coded at geoprecision 2].

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 23 October 2019. Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD members attacked civilian supporters of the CNL party in Nyamarobe, Kiremba during the opening of a CNL party building. One CNL supporter was hospitalized but no casualties were reported.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column16: Iyakure TV; Radio Publique Africaine; Twitter
column17: 24 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU militants clashed with military forces on Masare hill, Musigati. 1 soldier was killed during the clash.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On or before 24 October 2019. Police forces clashed with RED-TABARA and FOREBU in Matongo commune, Kayanza. 1 RED-TABARA was arrested by police before RED-TABARA and FOREBU retreated back to Kibira.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 24 October 2019. An attack continued for the second day as Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD members beat up civilian supporters of the CNL party in Nyamarobe, Kiremba during the opening of a CNL party building.

25 October 2019. An unidentified armed group shot and wounded a local administrator on Muyira hill, Bujumbura Rural. Several CNL members were arrested following the attack, and are accused of carrying out the shooting.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: Night of 26 October 2019. Burundi military forces with Imbonerakure clashed with the RED-TABARA and FOREBU coalition in Buzirasazi, Murwi. No casualties were reported.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Night of 25 October to 26 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in several locations in Bubanza commune from 11 pm to midday. 4 rebels, 2 military forces, 1 policeman, and 6 Imbonerakure were killed in the clashes in Murwi, Bukinanyana and Bubanza communes. Coded across the 3 events with fatalities dividided.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Night of 25 October to 26 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in several locations in Bubanza commune from 11 pm to midday. 4 rebels, 2 military forces, 1 policeman, and 6 Imbonerakure were killed in the clashes in Murwi, Bukinanyana and Bubanza communes. Coded across the 3 events with fatalities dividided.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Night of 25 October to 26 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in several locations in Bubanza commune from 11 pm to midday. 4 rebels, 2 military forces, 1 policeman, and 6 Imbonerakure were killed in the clashes in Murwi, Bukinanyana and Bubanza communes. Coded across the 3 events with fatalities dividided.

Night of 26 October to 27 October 2019. Local residents of Gihanga, Cibitoke witnessed a large movement of an unidentified armed group from DRC to Gihanga, Cibitoke province. These are likely RED-TABARA and FOREBU joining other militants in Kibira in ongoing fighting with state military forces.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 October. Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL members in Masare zone, Musigati for partnering with RED-TABARA.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 October 2019. Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters during the opening of a party building on Nyenkarange hill, Rugazi. 3 CNL members were injured in the attacks on Rugazi commune on this day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 October 2019. Imbonerakure beat up CNL supporters during the opening of a CNL party building in Karambira, Rugazi. 3 CNL members were injured in the attacks on Rugazi commune on this day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 October. Imbonerakure attacked and stole money from a CNL supporter in Muyebe, Musigati. The Imbonerakure believe the CNL supporter was partnered with the RED-TABARA.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 October. 4 CNL members were attacked and injured by Imbonerakure in Ruce, Rugazi. They were accused of hiding RED-TABARA.
28 October. An unidentified armed group threw a grenade into the house of a CNL member, killing one child and injuring two others.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 28 October. Police and Imbonerakure destroyed the home of a CNL supporter they believe was among those who shot the chief of Muyira zone a few days before.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 30 October 2019. 4 SNR agents abducted a former RPA journalist from Gaturungu area of Bujumbura. After the abduction, the vehicle was in a car accident in Bujumbura and the journalist was let go. However, the journalist may have been abducted again.

01 November 2019. Police and military forces killed 3 civilians and injured others at a bar in Rohero, Bujumbura. The state forces carried out targeted killings and then threw a grenade into the bar as they left.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 1 November 2019, Imbonerakure and CNL fought one another in Marangara commune (Marangara, Ngozi). No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 1 November 2019, Imbonerakure and CNL fought one another in Nyamurenza commune (Nyamurenza, Ngozi). No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

On or before 02 November 2019. 6 civilians were killed by an unidentified armed group, and their bodies found in Rusiga, Cibitoke. Local sources suspect the SNR, as the bodies were buried quickly before an investigation.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 03 November 2019. Imbonerakure tortured a CNL communal leader in Busoni, Kirundo. When the CNL supporter took the case to a local judge, the judged sentenced the CNL supporter to prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 04 November, 2019. Imbonerakure attacked 5 CNL supporters in Rusengo, Ruyigi. The CNL supporters were later imprisoned.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 November, 2019. Imbonerakure destroyed a CNL party building under construction in Rugari, Muyinga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 05 November, 2019. An Imbonerakure leader and school teacher raped a female student in Nyamurenza commune, Ngozi.

column9: Christian Group (Burundi); MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
column17: 05 November 2019. A Protestant pastor and MSD party member was killed by an unidentified armed group in Rukago, Gahombo.

05 November 2019. Heavily armed police and military forces arrested more than 80 civilians in Rugombo, Cibitoke, including 10 Rwandans, in ongoing operations against rebel groups and illegal border crossings.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 November 2019. Imbonerakure attacked a CNL party member in Muhuta, Rumonge, accusing him of partnering with RED-TABARA.
06 November 2019. An unidentified armed group burned a CNL party building in Magamba, Mwaro.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 06 November 2019. Imbonerakure destroyed a CNL party building in Mariza zone, Murambi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 November 2019. Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL supporter near a police station in Buterere, Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 November 2019. Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters and stole one of their phones in Gasibe, Matana.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 07 November 2019. CNL supporters clashed with Imbonerakure during the opening of a CNL party building in Bugege, Butaganzwa. The CNL party building was destroyed during the fighting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 9 November 2019, Imbonerakure, under the direction of the CNDD-FDD commune leader, attacked the Imbonerakure commune leader in Murwi town, Cibitoke, for devising a plot to assassinate a CNDD-FDD commune leader. Police SNR later arrested the Imbonerakure and he has been held in prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 November 2019, CNL and Imbonerakure fought one another in on Shoza hill, Nyamurenza commune following an Imbonerakure attempt to block the road to the CNL party building opening ceremonies. Sources say CNL ""overpowered"" Imbonerakure, with several injuries reported on both sides.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 November 2019, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL supporters in Musagara, Rango, after returning from a CNL party meeting. Across the attacks on this day in Rango, 4 CNL supporters were injured and 6 CNL supporters were arrested by police following the attacks.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 November 2019, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL supporters in Nyabiyogi, Rango, after returning from a CNL party meeting. Across the attacks on this day in Rango, 4 CNL supporters were injured and 6 CNL supporters were arrested by police following the attacks.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 November 2019, CNL and Imbonerakure clashed in Gashikanwa commune, Ngozi, which left 1 CNL supporter dead, and 4 Imbonerakure injured. Police arrested several CNL supporters following the clash.
10 November 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed the Cagizo zone chief in Butihinda commune, Muyinga. Police forces blame CNL supporters for the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 November 2019, CNL and Imbonerakure clashed on Gakobe hill, Rutana. 2 Imbonerakure were seriously injured and hospitalized following the clash.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: 11 November 2019, prison guards allowed Imbonerakure to enter the prison and torture prisoners in Rumonge city. Imbonerakure accused prisoners of sharing information with journalists.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 12 November 2019, Imbonerakure clashed with CNL supporters in Kibingo, Rumonge after the Imbonerakure had ambushed the CNL provincial representative. The CNL supporters were arrested by police following the clashes. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
12 November 2019, military forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in Muhenga, Bubanza. 2 were killed and another 2 were captured by military forces.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 12 November 2019, military forces clashed with the RED-TABARA and FOREBU coalition in Mabayi commune, Cibitoke. 4 RED-TABARA were killed, 3 police were injured and many RED-TABARA were arrested following the fighting.

column9: Women (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: Night of 11 November 2019, an unidentified armed group raped and killed a woman who was the deputy leader of the CNL women's wing. Her body was found the next day in the Nyavyamo river in the forested area of Gahweza, Kiganda commune.
13 November 2019, CNL supporters demonstrated in Ngozi city against oppression by CNDD-FDD party members. [size=hundreds]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 November 2019, Imbonerakure destroyed a CNL party building in village 3, Gihanga commune, Bubanza. 11 CNL party buildings have been completely or partially destroyed in Gihanga.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 15 November 2019, Imbonerakure attempted to attack a group of soldiers, but were repelled by the soldiers and another group of Imbonerakure who fought to defend the soldiers in Musaga, Muha commune. The injuries and reason for the infighting among Imbonerakure is unclear.

column9: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 15 November. Police forces arrested around 150 civilians in Bujumbura, along with nearly 500 around the country, who are accused or partnering with RED-TABARA.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 15 November 2019, Imbonerakure were deployed to fight in DRC by Burundian military forces following military training with SNR in Cishemere, Rugombo.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 16 November 2019, Imbonerakure demonstrated in Mugendo, Kirundo, against the CNL party presence in the area. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 17 November 2019, Imbonerakure beat up a former soldier in Makamba commune, Makamba before taking him to a local jail to be arrested.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: SOS Medias; Inzamba; Radio Publique Africaine
column17: 17 November 2019, an unidentified armed group from Rwanda clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure at a military position at Twinyoni, Mabayi in the Kibira forest. 69 soldiers were missing after the attack, several injured and 17 dead bodies of soldiers, civilians and Imbonerakure found in the following days. The military major leading this group of soldiers was killed in the attack.
17 November 2019, an unidentified armed group shot and injured two civilians in Ngagara, Bujumbura. One of the civilians is a government administrator working at OBR. 1 died following the attack.

After 17 November 2019, civilian men and boys over 16 were forced to form a communal militia to patrol at night alongside military forces in Ruhororo and Gasebeyi hills, Mabayi. This follows an armed attack from an unidentified armed group from Rwanda.
18 November 2019, police forces beat up a CNL supporter in Nyamurenze commune, Ngozi. Police forces broke his arm before placing him in jail.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 18 November 2019, Imbonerakure attacked 2 CNL supporters in Kiremba commune, Ngozi. 1 was killed in the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 November 2019, some Imbonerakure and the head of the sub-hill attacked, tied up and injured three judges and a judicial clerk in Mudahandwa, Bururi. Police intervened to release the civilians and arrest the head of the sub-hill. The attackers were upset by a court ruling against a CNDD-FDD party member.

On 19 November 2019, police forces tortured 3 CNL supporters in Bujumbura and took them to an unknown location. They were accused of partnering with rebels and having illegal party meetings. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

20 November 2019, police arrested around 150 civilians, some from DRC, accused of partnering with rebel groups in the country. They were required to pay in order to leave the prison or face deportation.
20 November 2019, a civilian was kidnapped by military forces between Karama, Kayanza and Gatanguru, Cibitoke. The civilian was close to the leader of CNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 20 November 2019, Imbonerakure clashed with RED-TABARA in Bukinanyana commune, Cibitoke. ""Several"" (Coded as 3) Imbonerakure and 3 RED-TABARA killed, with others injured.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 20 November 2019, a vigilante group attacked and killed a CNDD-FDD member accused of witchcraft on Nyarutovu hill, Karuzi. [size=no report]
On 20 November 2019, military and police forces abducted a CNL member from Gatunguru area of Bujumbura and took him to an unknown location.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 20 November 2019, Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters, some of whom are teachers, in Matana commune, Bururi.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: 20 November 2019, a former soldier and CNL supporter was abducted by military forces. Their current location is unknown.

column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 20 November 2019, military forces clashed with the RED-TABARA in Rumonge province, leaving 14 soldiers killed.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 20 November 2019, a former police officer threw a grenade at a group of Imbonerakure before killing himself with another grenade. This occurred after the man was followed and chased on foot by Imbonerakure and police forces. 6 Imbonerakure were wounded by the grenade.

21 November 2019, 2 CNL supporters have been forcibly disappeared by police forces following their transfer from Mabayi prison to Bujumbura. These two CNL supporters were part of a larger arrest of 7 people in Mabayi, accused of partnering with rebel groups in the area.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 21 November 2019, Imbonerakure and the town's chief administrator destroyed a CNL party building in Gihanga commune, Bubanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: 23 November 2019, the CNL women's group leader was beaten up and hospitalised by Imbonerakure on Susa hill, Ntega.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Former FNL: National Forces of Liberation
column17: 24 November 2019, an Imbonerakure and former FNL fighter was abducted by an unidentified armed group in or near Mutakura, Bujumbura.
On or before 24 November 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed 3 civilians, where the bodies were found in Bwiza, Bujumbura, with wounds on the bodies.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 24 November 2019, Imbonerakure and military forces beat up a CNL supporter in Bibara, Karuzi, for collecting money for the CNL party.
25 November 2019, a civilian was abducted by an unidentified armed group while returning to Bujumbura city from Muzazi, Mubimbi.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: Near 25 November. An unidentified armed group attacked and killed a woman supporting the CNL party, with her body found on Ruhororo hill, Kayanza.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 25 November 2019, 4 people were tortured by Imbonerakure in an unofficial prison in Buyengero commune, Rumonge. The unofficial prison was set up by the chief of the commune.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: 26 November 2019, a CNDD-FDD member of parliament beat up a teacher who is a CNL supporter for refusing to leave the CNL party in Kirundo commune, Kirundo.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 27 November 2019, the hill leader of the Imbonerakure was abducted by an unidentified armed group near Buramata, Gihanga.

column9: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-); Former FNL: National Forces of Liberation
column17: 27 November 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a police officer and former-FNL member near Gatumba, Bujumbura Rural.
27 November 2019, 2 civilians from Bujumbura were abducted by an unidentified armed group near Rukoko, Gihanga, where their vehicle was found.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 28 November 2019, Police SNR abducted 6 CNL supporters from Karindo, Rutana. They were accused of trying to acquire weapons and taken to an unknown location.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 28 November 2019, the CNDD-FDD deputy communal representative raped his 15 year old maid in Mutaho, Gitega. Other women have come forward saying this CNDD-FDD leader and communal education director raped them as well.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 29 November 2019, a civilian was abducted by police SNR in Mukaza, Bujumbura and has not been found.

1 December 2019, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade at police officers in Rutana city, Rutana, but the grenade did not explode. Police fired back but the group escaped, leaving other unexploded grenades behind.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: 1 December 2019, Imbonerakure and the commune secretary of the CNDD-FDD attacked and injured 2 CNL supporters on Mukingo hill, Kayogoro. The CNL supporters were arrested following the attack.
1 December 2019, a crowd came together to beat up a police officer in Tenga zone, Mutimbuzi after the officer attempted to shoot civilians in a bar. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 1 December 2019, Imbonerakure destroyed the CNL party building in Mago, Nyabitsinda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 1 December 2019, Imbonerakure destroyed the CNL party building in Ndago, Nyabitsinda.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: From 02 December to 16 December 2019, police SNR attacked and injured repatriates in the refugee reception centre in Rutobo, Ngozi. 3 refugees were abducted in the ongoing attacks.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 2 December 2019, SNR and police forces abducted 5 CNL members on Kibande hill, Cibitoke. They are accused of collaborating with the Rwandan military forces, who are suspected to be behind the 16-17 November incursion in the same province. Their current location is unknown.
2 December 2019, military forces arrested and tortured 3 CNL supporters in Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura city. 1 CNL supporter died after the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 December 2019, imbonerakure destroyed homes and killed livestock of CNL supporters in Nyagisozi, Kirundo.

On 3 December 2019, an unidentified armed group cut the legs on a cow owned by a CNL supporter in Sigu, Kirundo. The group later sent a message to the owner of the cow this was a warning for threatening the CNDD-FDD communal vice-president.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 3 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL supporters in Nyabihanga commune, Mwaro after they refused to leave a bar.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 4 December 2019, Imbonerakure forcibly took a CNL supporter to police SNR forces in Mudende zone, Rumonge. Nobody knows where he is now.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 December 2019, Imbonerakure and the hill chief beat up a civilian CNL supporter in Kanyinya hill, Kirundo province. They accuse him of switching from the CNDD-FDD political party.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 December 2019, police SNR and Imbonerakure abducted a CNL supporter in Migera (Kabezi, Bujumbura Rural). The CNL supporter has not been seen since the abduction.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 9 December 2019, two groups of Imbonerakure clashed against one another on Rukere hill, Kabarore. The communal vice president of the CNDD-FDD was leading one group of 80 Imbonerakure to sell coltan minerals in Rwanda, when another group of Imbonerakure tried to stop them. Civilian fields were destroyed during the fighting. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
9 December 2019, taxi drivers demonstrated in several communes of Cibitoke against police restrictions on transporting luggage in their vehicles. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 10 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL members in Mubone, Kirundo. Imbonerakure demand the CNL members leave their political party.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Farmers (Burundi)
column17: On 10 December 2019, an unidentified armed group cut down banana plantations and killed livestock of CNL supporters in Sigu, Kirundo.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 11 December 2019, an unidentified armed group destroyed the crops of a CNL supporter on Nyagatovu hill, Ngozi. Imbonerakure are suspected to be behind the atttack as they also engage in similar activity elsewhere)

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 11 December 2019, Imbonerakure and police forces beat up 3 CNL party members in Gakere zone, Ngozi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: 11 December 2019, Imbonerakure and SNR agents abducted a CNL member from Ruziba area of Kanyosha, Bujumbura Mairie. His wereabouts are unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On the week of 11 December 2019, CNDD-FDD members attacked 2 CNL members in Bigina, Makamba. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
12 December 2019, an unidentified armed group shot and killed the communal leader of the CNL on Musenyi hill, Nyabiraba. Some testify he had been receiving threats from CNDD-FDD members.
13 December 2019, police forces arrested and abudcated a Rwandan civilian in Cibitoke area of Bujumbura city. The location of the civilian is unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: 14 December 2019, Imbonerakure tortured a CNL member in Mudende zone, Rumonge province. The chief of the commune was present during the attack.

column9: UPRONA: Union for National Progress; FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Between 7 and 21 December 2019, an unidentified armed group destroyed a political party building of either UPRONA or FRODEBU in Rugombo commune, Cibitoke. Another party building was destroyed in Buganda commune, but it is unclear if this was the UPRONA or FRODEBU party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 December 2019, Imbonerakure and CNL supporters clashed in Marangara commune after the opening of a CNL party building, with injuries reported by both sides. Several CNL members have been arrested by police following the clash.
On 15 December 2019, a police officer beat up 2 CNL supporters in Kiyange, Ngozi. As the police officer hit the civilians with his gun, he accused them of supporting the CNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 15 December 2019 (month of), Imbonerakure abducted a CNL member in Giteranyi commune (Muyinga).

column9: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
column17: On 15 December 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a the local head of the youth wing of UPD-Z who was on his way to a meeting in Cibitoke city, Cibitoke from Kaburantwa hill.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 15 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters in Mparamirundi, Ngozi, after the Imbonerakure had painted red crosses on their homes. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 15 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters in Rukeco, Ngozi, after the Imbonerakure had painted red crosses on their homes. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On or before 15 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters in Mihigo, Ngozi, after the Imbonerakure had painted red crosses on their homes. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 December 2019, police and Imbonerakure attacked and arrested some CNL supporters in Musigati commune, Bubanza, for painting a CNL party building. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 December 2019, Imbonerakure beat up a CNL supporter in Tonga, Kirundo, and then took him to be arrested by the police.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 15 December 2019, an unidentified persons (assumed CNDD-FDD) attacked and injured a CNL supporter with a machete in Mwenya, Kirundo province. The attackers accused the civilian of leaving the CNDD-FDD party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL supporter in Mukerwa, Kirundo, under the direction of the hill administrator. He was severely beaten and left near Bombanzira.

On or before 17 December 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian, who was found dead on Gasenyi hill, Rumonge near the Murembwe river. Local authorities did not conduct an investigation and buried the body immediately after its discovery.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 17 December 2019, Imbonerakure and their communal leader tortured a CNL leader in Gitobe commune, Kirundo, before police arrested the CNL member.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL supporter in Gasenga, Makamba.
On 20 December 2019, police forces arrested 37 people in Makamba province who boycotted a meeting of the provincial governor.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 December 2019, an Imbonerakure beat up a civilian in Kabondo, Makamba, using bats and acid during the attack. The Imbonerakure owed money to the merchant.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked some civilians working as night guards in Muremera, Ngozi for refusing to take part in the evening activities of the Imbonerakure. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Between 21 and 26 December 2019, police SNR arrested and tortured 2 CNL supporters in Ndora, Cibitoke. The CNL supporters are accused of forming a rebellion.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On 22 December 2019, a police officer attacked and injured two CNL supporters, one of them a teacher, in Kiyange, Ngozi. This attack took place in the presence of the chief of the quarter.
On 22 December 2019, butchers demonstrated in Makamba city, Makamba against the forced reduction in the price of meat by the government. [size=no report]
On 22 December 2019, CNL members abducted another CNL supporter in Musema zone, Kayanza, accusing him of raising awareness of CNL persecution of Imbonerakure and sharing this information on Whatsapp.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL supporter in Ntega commune, Kirundo, accusing them of opposing the Saturday public works.

On 23 December 2019, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade at civilians in Ngozi city, Ngozi. 3 civilians were killed and 7 were injured. A former CNDD-FDD combatant was arrested in connection with the event.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Between 9 and 23 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked and persecuted CNL supporters in Marangara commune, Ngozi, for participating in the inauguration of a CNL party building. ""More than 100 CNL supporters"" have fled the commune since the attacks.

On or before 24 December 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian in Makamba commune, Makamba. The body was found in a river with the limbs cut off, but the communal chief ordered the body be buried without an investigation.

On 25 December 2019, violence erupted when police tried to stop a Christmas day celebration in Kinyinya, Ruyigi. Police forces injured one person and the residents fought with police, injuring the police chief. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 25 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters in Giteranyi commune, Muyinga for refusing to change their political party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked 4 CNL supporters in Ntega, Kirundo, because one of them brought a court case against some Imbonerakure who had attacked him in July. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 27 December 2019, police officers abducted a CNL supporter in Muturirwa, Rumonge and took him to an unknown location. Some witnesses say they left in the direction of Bujumbura.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 December 2019, CNL and Imbonerakure clashed in Marangara commune, Ngozi, following the opening of a CNL party building. Injuries were reported on both sides.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column17: On 29 December 2019, police SNR and military forces attacked and arrested 3 CNL members in Rukaramu zone, Bujumbura Rural. They were accused of partnering with the FNL rebel group led by General Aloise Nzabampema.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked CNL members in Megera zone, Gitega while they were celebrating the opening of a party building. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked 2 CNL members in Ntega commune, Kirundo, for insulting the president by not leaving the CNL party. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked the CNL vice-president of the hill in Rutanga, Ngozi. The CNL member was seriously injured with a machete.

On 30 December 2019, police forces shot a CNL supporter in Kiremba commune, Ngozi, but unclear if the CNL member was killed (coded as an injury). Police arrested others on Kiyumpu, Ciri and Masasu hills involved in the opening of a CNL party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 31 December 2019, Imbonerakure beat up two Christian students returning from a prayer meeting in Rwingoma, Karuzi. The Imbonerakure also stopped and robbed other people in the same place.

On 31 January 2019, a soldier was killed by an unidentified armed group and found on Nyabututsi hill, Gitega province. It is unclear if the soldier was killed in this location or the body left in this place.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 31 December 2019, Imbonerakure attacked a civilian in a CNDD-FDD party building in Gihanga commune, Bubanza, before taking him to be arrested. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 1 January 2020, CNL and Imbonerakure clashed in Biniganyi, Makamba. Several CNL members were arrested the next day but no fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 2 January 2020, police forces beat up a CNL supporter in Biniganyi, Makamba, for being involved in a clash with Imbonerakure the day before. The CNL supporter was arrested and taken to an undisclosed location.
On 3 January 2020, military forces abducted a military sniper assigned to General Prime Niyongabo on the way to Ruyigi province. The soldier has not been seen since this time.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 January, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a catholic priest in Rutana city, Rutana. He was accused of partnering with enemies of the CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a Catholic priest in Birongozi, Rutana. They accused him of criticizing Imbonerakure during a Christmas sermon. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 January 2020, Imbonerakure beat up and injured 2 CNL supporters in Gatare zone (Busoni, Kirundo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL zone representative in a rural area outside of Kirundo city, Kirundo. The CNL member was badly injured with machetes.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 January 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the banana plantation of a CNL supporter in Tangara commune, Ngozi.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 6 January 2020, police SNR abducted a woman who is a CNL member in Nyabihanga commune, Mwaro. She is accused of being a secret investigator for the CNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian CNL supporter in Nyabihanga commune, Mwaro. He was attacked because his son is a member of the CNL.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 January 2020, Imbonerakure and military forces clashed in Buringa zone, Bubanza. Both soldiers and Imbonerakure were injured in the clash, and 2 soldiers were arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL supporter on Kibungo hill, Mwaro. He was accused of giving his house to be a party building for the CNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: Students (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: On 8 January 2020, Imbonerakure beat up a student CNL supporter at the University of Burundi, Mutanga campus in Bujumbura.

On 8 January 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNL supporter and injured his wife in Gisitwe (Ntega, Kirundo). Some suspect Imbonerakure as they had threatened the family before.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: Students (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: On 9 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a student member of CNL at the University of Burundi-Mutanga campus in Bujumbura.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: Students (Burundi); Former Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 9 January 2020, police SNR abducted two secondary school students and a retired police officer in Mugamba, Bururi. They were taken to an unknown location and cannot be contacted.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 10 January 2020, two CNDD-FDD members strangled a female CNL supporter sometime between the night before and that day in Rusagara (Mugina, Cibitoke). The CNDD-FDD members were arrested following the discovery of the body at the home of the CNDD-FDD supporters.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 11 January 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL supporters clashed at a bar in Nyabihanga commune (Mwaro). Imbonerakure accused the bartender of only serving CNL members before the clashes broke out, leading to several injuries on both sides. Some CNL members were arrested following the clash. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 11 January 2020, police SNR abducted 4 civilians in Gitega (Gitega, Gitega). They have not been seen again since the abduction.

On 12 January 2020, military forces clashed amongst themselves while guarding the presidential palace in Gitega city (Gitega). 12 Tutsi soldiers were arrested following the clash. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL supporter in Mwakiro commune (Muyinga). The CNL supporter and another Imbonerakure were injured in the clash.

column9: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi)
column17: On or before 13 January 2020, an unidentified armed group killed a Tutsi, ex-FAB soldier in the Nature Reserve of Rukoko (Gihanga, Bubanza). Conflicting testimonies say he was killed by other military forces or by a hippo. Captain Francois Niyonkuru is accused to have ordered the killing.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 14 January 2020, CNL and Imbonerakure clashed on Kimeza hill (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo). 10 CNL supporters were injured in the fighting. [size=at least 10]
On 14 January 2020, a mass grave was discovered at an old market in Kamenge (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie) with 270 bodies from the civil war between 1993 and the years following.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 14 January 2020, Imbonerakure demolished the CNL party office in Muramba (Buhinyuza, Muyinga).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 14 January 2020, Imbonerakure, the hill president of the CNDD-FDD, and the deputy hill chief attacked CNL members in Kibazi (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo). CNL members were severely injured in the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL supporter and stole their bicycle on Kibazi hill (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 January 2020, Imbonerakure beat up the CNL hill leader on Nyabisiga hill (Nyagisozi zone, Busoni, Kirundo). They demand that he leaves the CNL.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 15 January 2020 (month of), Imbonerakure burned and destroyed the home of a woman who refused to pay financial contributions to the CNDD-FDD in Giteranyi commune (Muyinga).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 January 2020, Imbonerakure and a police officer attacked CNL members with machetes and guns in Muramba (Buhinyuza, Muyinga). This occurred the day after the destruction of their party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On 15 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL supporter and teacher on Cishwa hill (Bugendana, Gitega). He was accused of holding an illegal CNL party meeting before being arrested by police and taken to Gitega city.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 January 2020, Imbonerakure beat up CNL members in Bihogo (Gasorwe, Muyinga). One CNL member seriously injured.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 18 January 2020, a CNDD-FDD member and the head of zone administration beat up a CNL member on Budahunga (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo).

On 18 January 2020, the administrator of Nyamurenza commune beat up civilians and hill administrators in Mushonge (Nyamurenza, Ngozi). The communal administrator carried out the attacks because the hill administrator and local population did not raise enough money for a tree plantation.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 19 January 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the plantation of a CNL member in Karambo (Busoni, Kirundo).

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 19 January 2020, there was a violent confrontation between CNDD-FDD and CNL members in Mutaho Commune (Mutaho, Gitega). 4 CNL members were arrested. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 January 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL members clashed with machetes in Bihogo (Gasorwe, Muyinga). 2 Imbonerakure were injured.
On 20 January 2020, Police forces arrested 50 civilians in Bwiza (Mukaza, Bujumubura Mairie). Men and youths were targeted during arrests, and some were released on payment of money.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked CNL members in Cendajuru (Vumbi, Kirundo) for using greetings specific to the CNL party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 January 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the plantation of a provincial secretary of the CNL youth and his father's plantation in Gihosha (Kirundo, Kirundo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 January 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the plantation of a CNL member in Gihosha (Kirundo, Kirundo).
On or before 22 January 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed an ex-FAB soldier, leaving the body in Busumanyi (Mishiha, Cankuzo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked 2 CNL members in Ruhororo commune (Ruhororo, Ngozi). Imbonerakure accused them of teaching CNL party ideology, leaving one severely injured after the attack.
On 24 January 2020, an unidentified armed actor threw a grenade into a bar full of civilians in Kaburantwa (Buganda, Cibitoke). The device did not explode and there were no fatalities.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 25 January 2020, Imbonerakure attacked 3 CNL members in Ruhororo commune (Ruhororo, Ngozi). The CNL were injured in the attack when they were inaugerating a CNL party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 25 January 2020, Imbonerakure and hill administrators destroyed a tea plantation in Bisha (Rusaka, Mwaro).
On 25 January 2020, an unidentified armed group burned down the CNL party building in Muruta Commune (Muruta, Kayanza).
On 27 January 2020, 7 mass graves was discovered in Bukirasazi (Shombo, Karuzi). Around 7,000 bodies were found in these graves.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 January 2020, Imbonerakure beat up CNL members in Gashoho commune (Muyinga) for refusing to join the CNDD-FDD party. Police forces arrested the CNL members.
On 29 January 2020, a mass grave was discovered in Nyamirambo hill (Muyinga, Muyinga). 3 CNL members were found in the grave presumed to have been killed last year.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 January 2020, an angry mob attacked 3 Imbonerkaure in Kiramira (Rugombo, Cibitoke), following a theft carried out by the Imbonerakure. 1 Imbonerakure died and 2 Imbonerakure were imprisoned. [size=no report]
On 30 January 2020, police forces arrested more than 40 people in Mukaza neighborhood (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie) for not carrying their ID cards.
On 30 January 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked 18 CNL members in Gatare zone (Busoni, Kirundo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 30 January 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into the home of a civilian in Bihanga (Matana, Bururi). The victim was severely injured.
On or before 31 January 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNL member, leaving the body on Ruvumu hill (Muruta, Kayanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 2 February 2020, the Imbonerakure attacked four CNL members in Muyange (Bugenyuzi, Karuzi). The four civilians were returning from a CNL party gathering when they were attacked.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: From 31 Jan 2020 to 6 Feb 2020, several groups of military forces and Imbonerakure crossed the Rusizi river in Buganda commune (Cibitoke) into Sud-Kivu, DRC in a military operation against RED-TABARA. Some were sighted in operations in the high plateau of Uvira.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 February 2020, there was a violent confrontation between Imbonerakure and CNL members in Nyanza-Lac commune (Nyanza-Lac, Makamba). Imbonerakure attempted to burn down a CNL party building. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 February 2020, Imbonerakure and local administrators destroyed the CNL party building in Nyaruhinda (Gitaramuka, Karuzi).

On 5 Feb 2020, police forces beat up and publicly humiliated a teacher and two street traders on Buhiga hill (Buhiga, Ngozi). They were accused of not respecting a street closure before the president passed by this area.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 Feb 2020, an unidentified armed group armed with machetes seriously injured the Jabe III leader of Imbonerakure in Mukaza (Bujumbura Mairie).

column9: Hutu Ethnic Group (Burundi); Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi)
column17: On 2 June 2020, 300 bodies of Hutus and Tutsis were found by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission in mass graves in Marangara and Ntega communes of Ngozi from the conflict in 1988 which affected the northern provinces of Kirundo and Ngozi.

On 7 February 2020, an unidentified armed group burned down the CNL party building in Nyamunazi (Kinyinya, Ruyigi). 3 CNL were arrested by police and Imbonerakure following the burning of the building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 Feb 2020, Imbonerakure beat up civilian street traders at the Gatwe market on Sampeke hill (Kayogoro, Makamba). Imbonerakure accused them of using witchcraft to attract customers and then took them to the police station to be detained.
On 9 Feb 2020, an unidentified armed group shot and killed a civilian and injured another accused of witchcraft in Magara zone (Bugarama, Rumonge).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 February 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian in Nyamurenza commune (Nyamurenza, Ngozi). When the victim and his wife complained to the local chief, they were both arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 Feb 2020, Imbonerakure attacked 6 CNL members in Rushubije zone (Ntega, Kirundo). The CNL members were arrested by police following the attack. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 11 Feb 2020, Imbonerakure attacked CNL members in Kabarore commune (Kayanza). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 11 Feb 2020, police forces and Imbonerakure clashed in Kabarore commune (Kayanza). Police forces attempted to arrest Imbonerakure following an attack on CNL members in the same location when Imbonerakure resisted. 3 Imbonerakure were eventually arrested.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: In the week of 12 Feb 2020, Imbonerakure beat up a teacher in Ruhororo commune (Ngozi) for violating a curfew imposed by the youth wing of the ruling party.

column9: UPRONA: Union for National Progress; Government of Burundi (2005-); JRR: Rwagasore Revolutionary Youth
column17: On 12 Feb 2020, police forces arrested 2 prominent members of UPRONA in Gitega city (Gitega). Amedee Habimana is the advisor to the vice president, and Evode Bihiza is the provincial head of the JRR youth wing of UPRONA. These 2 are among the candidates considered for upcoming legislative elections.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 12 February 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNDD-FDD member in Myugaririo (Muruta, Kayanza). 8 people including 5 CNL members have been arrested in connection with the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 15 February 2020, the CNDD-FDD party members forced civilians from all political parties to contribute to the CNDD-FDD 2020 campaign in Makamba province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On 15 February 2020, Imbonerakure beat up a teacher and CNDD-FDD member in Kinama (Gasorwe, Muyinga), for not attending a recent party march in Gasorwe.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 February 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and robbed CNL members in Kabezi (Kabezi, Bujumbura Rural) as they attempted to attend the inauguration rally of Agathon Rwasa as candidate for the CNL in the presidential election. Imbonerakure also barricaded main roads leading to the rally, beating and stealing from CNL members who attempted to pass the barricades.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 February 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Rwerambere (Gisuru, Ruyigi). The CNL member was accused of not joining the CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 16 February 2020, Imbonerakure raped female CNL members, amid the wider kidnapping and beating of CNL members in Kiyenzi (Kanyosha, Bujumbura Rural) as they attempted to attend the inauguration rally of Agathon Rwasa as candidate for the CNL in the presidential election. Imbonerakure also barricaded main roads leading to the rally, beating and stealing from CNL members who attempted to pass the barricades.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: On 18 February 2020, prison guards allowed CNDD-FDD members to torture political prisoners in Mpimba prison in Muha (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 February 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed a CNL party building in Busoni commune (Busoni, Kirundo).
On 18 February 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into the home of a woman in Mugina (Mugina, Cibitoke). The woman was injured by the grenade and two were arrested by police.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 19 February 2020, police SNR abducted two civilians in Rohero (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). They have not been seen since the abduction.

On 19 February 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with police and military forces in Isale commune. Many CNL members were arrested following the clashes. 22 were killed in clashes in Bujumbura Rural between 19 and 23 February, with 11 of these in Kinama. (11 fatalities split across other clashes in Bujumbura Rural on the same day).

On 19 February 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with police and military forces in Kirombwe (Kanyosha 1, Bujumbura Rural). 22 were killed in clashes in Bujumbura Rural between 19 and 23 February, with 11 of these in Kinama. (11 fatalities split across clashes in Bujumbura Rural on the same day). Some report that the armed group claimed to be CNL or FNL, while CNL claim that it was thieves. 23 CNL members were arrested.

On 19 February 2020, an unidentified armed group of around 50 people clashed with military forces on Kinyovu hill (Mubimbi, Bujumbura Rural). 5 from the unidentified armed group were arrested. 22 were killed in clashes in Bujumbura Rural between 19 and 23 February, with 11 of these in Kinama. (11 fatalities split across other clashes in Bujumbura Rural on the same day).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 19 February 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL party member in Runini (Tangara, Ngozi) for not joining the CNDD-FDD party.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 20 February 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed the head of the CNDD-FDD's women's league in Kizingwe (Muha, Bujumbura Mairie).

On 20 February 2020, police forces beat a CNL supporter to death in Mubimbi (Mubimbi, Bujumbura Rural). The CNL supporter was suspected to have been part of the armed group who had clashed with police the day before in Bujumbura Rural.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 20 February 2020, SNR officers attacked and killed a civilian in Rugombo commune (Rugombo, Cibitoke).
On 20 February 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed a CNL party building in Munago (Nyabihanga, Mwaro).

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 20 February 2020, an unidentified armed group shot and killed a CNDD-FDD party member in Kizingwe area of Bujumbura (Bujumbura Mairie).
On 21 February 2020, police forces confiscated a cache of illegal grenades held by an active police officer at his home in Gitega city (Gitega, Gitega).
On or before 21 February 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian whose body was found in Mparambo 2 (Rugombo, Cibitoke). Police refused to allow the victim to be identified.

On 22 February 2020, an unidentified armed group in 2 vehicles attacked a hospital in Kibuye (Bukirasazi, Gitega). Police intervened and killed 1 from the unidentified armed group, who is a police colonel. An American doctor was stabbed and injured. A sum of money was also stolen from the hospital.

column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: Twitter; AFP; IWACU; SOS Medias; RFI
column17: On 23 February 2020, police, Imbonerakure and military forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in Kinama (Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural). Between 11 and 14 were killed including 2 police. Some fatalities occurred when state forces and Imbonerakure executed those captured. Police had arrested more than 20 CNL members following clashes with an unidentified armed group throughout Bujumbura Rural, but unclear if these were CNL killed.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 February 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into the home of an Imbonerakure in Kagazi (Rugombo, Cibitoke). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Fishermen (Burundi)
column17: On 23 February 2020, military forces and Imbonerakure abducted a civilian fisherman and CNL member from on the RN5 road from Bujumbura to Cibitoke in Bubanza province.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Between 20 and 26 February 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL member in Kiziba (Mubimbi, Bujumbura Rural). The CNL member had been arrested by police when the Imbonerakure beat him up. He died after a few days in jail.

On or before 24 February 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian, leaving the body in Ruzira (Matana, Bururi). His belongings were not taken and it is unclear if this was connected to the other clash with Imbonerakure in Matana on the same day.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 24 February 2020, Imbonerakure clashed with an unidentified armed group in Mahango (Matana, Bururi). 1 Imbonerakure was killed, another wounded. 18 CNL and some former military members were arrested following the clash.
On 24 February 2020, military forces abducted a civilian in Kagwema (Gihanga, Bubanza).

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 26 February 2020, CNL members attacked a local CNDD-FDD leader in Jani (Gasorwe, Muyinga). The group used machetes and left injuries to the CNDD-FDD leader's head.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 February 2020, police SNR abducted an Imbonerakure from Buringa (Gihanga, Bubanza). The Imbonerakure had refused to participate in an attack in Bujumbura Rural on February 23.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 26 February 2020, an Imbonerakure abducted a CNL member in Muyange (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). Imbonerakure took her son and neighbor at the same time, but left these two at the local jail in Rubirizi.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 February 2020, Imbonerakure attacked the household of a CNL member in Jani (Gasorwe, Muyinga), leaving 1 dead and 2 injured. This attack was a response to an attack carried out the same day in Jani against a local CNDD-FDD leader.

On 27 February 2020, 400 households from Kivoga demonstrated in front of the Ombudsman office in Bujumbura city (Bujumbura Mairie) against state appropriation of their farming land. [size=400 households]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 1 March 2020, around 30 Imbonerakure attacked CNL members in Gacokwe (Gisuru, Ruyigi). Imbonerakure injured a dozen CNL members across the commune on the same day and attempted to stop the opening of a local party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 1 March 2020, around 30 Imbonerakure attacked CNL members in Itahe (Gisuru, Ruyigi). Imbonerakure injured a dozen CNL members across the province on this day and attempted to stop the opening of a local party building.
Between 29 February and 1 March 2020, an unidentified armed group strangled and killed an ex-FAB civilian, leaving the body in Musaga (Muha, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 1 March 2020, Imbonerakure tortured and injured a CNL party leader in Ndemeka (Gisuru, Ruyigi). The arm of the CNL leader was broken in the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 2 March 2020, a CNDD-FDD member attacked and killed a CNL member in Bandaga (Matongo, Kayanza). The CNL member was killed for providing a house for a CNL party building.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Between 3 and 4 March, police arrested 36 military AMISOM forces including 5 officers at the Bujumbura Airport (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). They were accused of making mistakes during their mission in Somalia.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On or before 4 March 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed a CNDD-FDD party building in Ruringanizo (Rutovu, Bururi). 6 CNL members were arrested following the destruction of property.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 March 2020, Imbonerakure threw two grenades into the bedroom of some civilians in Kirundo commune (Kirundo). 1 was killed and another injured. They were accused of witchcraft by the Imbonerakure.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Between 4 and 8 March 2020, police SNR tortured and injured 2 Rwandan prisoners in the jail in Cibitoke (Cibitoke province). They are accused of partnering with rebel groups in Kibira Forest.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured several people from three families supporting the CNL party in Kiravumba (Busoni, Kirundo). During the attack they burnt a house and a motorcycle, and stole goods. Imbonerakure accused the CNL of witchcraft relating to the death of a CNDD party member days before.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked civilian members of opposition parties in Kabingo (Gisuru, Ruyigi). Imbonerakure were exercising together when they attacked others. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 March 2020, Imbonerakure beat up a CNL member in Mukerwa (Busoni, Kirundo). The Imbonerakure also destroyed fields of CNL party members following the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured some CNL members in Ngoma (Butihinda, Muyinga), for attending a CNL meeting.

column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 9 March 2020, police, military and SNR attacked and killed a civilian in Gakaranka (Mugamba, Bururi). The deceased was accused of belonging to a rebel group, and two pistols were found in his home. The police also arrested three people connected to the deceased.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 10 March 2020, Imbonerakure and police beat up some CNL members in Kaburantwa (Buganda, Cibitoke). The Imbonerakure also destroyed the CNL party building.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
