column17: On 11 March 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed property and stole goods from a CNL hill leader in Buheka (Nyanza-Lac, Makamba). One of the Imbonerakure was the chief of a neighboring hill (Kideredge hill).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 11 March 2020, Imbonerakure burned down the homes of two CNL members in Gashirwe (Cendajuru, Cankuzo). The destruction came after an Imbonerakure meeting where members were urged to harass and oppress political opponents.

On 11 March 2020, an identified armed group attacked two civilians, killing one and injuring another with machetes in Kiruhuru (Cendajuru, Cankuzo). This may have been an attack by Imbonerakure who carried out looting and destruction in the same commune the same day.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Christian Group (Burundi); Students (Burundi)
column17: On 12 March 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a student CNL member, also a 7th Day Adventist, near Carama-Gahahe (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). The 7th Day Adventist Church has been accused of being against the CNDD-FDD.
On 13 March 2020, police arrested 50 civilians in Nyakabiga (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). During the arrests, police sealed off the neighborhood but the reason for the arrests is unclear.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 13 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Rutanga (Gashikanwa, Ngozi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On 14 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured two CNL civilians, one of them a teacher, in their home in Taba (Gisuru, Ruyigi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 14 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member leaving his house in the Gihosha area of Bujumbura city (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 15 March 2020, Imbonerakure and police robbed and abducted a CNL local leader in Karehe (Rango, Kayanza). The location of this CNL leader is unknown.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL party member in Bigera (Mutaho, Gitega). He was arrested afterwards, accused of attempting to stop Imbonerakure from chanting CNDD-FDD chants and forcing themselves into his home. He is also accused of injuring an Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked, stole goods and injured 4 CNL members in the Gitara area of Mugerama (Nyanza-Lac, Makamba).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 15 March 2020, Imbonerakure and a CNDD-FDD leader attacked and injured two CNL members in Ndemeka zone (Gisuru, Ruyigi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 March 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the plantations of a CNL party member in Muvyuko (Busoni, Kirundo).

On 16 March 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a local CNL leader in Migera (Kabezi, Bujumbura Rural). He had recently received threats from the Imbonerkaure, and local witnesses reported a meeting with local administrators and Imbonerkaure to plan the attack days before.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 17 March 2020, Police SNR arrested, tortured and injured a civilian taxi driver in Rohero (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). He was accused of being a spy for the Rwandan government.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Former CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 March 2020, Imbonerakure, under the supervision of a CNDD-FDD leader, attacked and injured a CNL party member in Nyamugari (Cendajuru, Cankuzo). The civilian was accused of leaving the CNDD-FDD for CNL party. After being beaten by clubs, he was left overnight then arrested the next day by police. The day before, the CNDD-FDD leader had met with the Imbonerkaure and ordered them to beat to death any CNL party member they find.
On 17 March 2020, police and military forces arrested 33 civilians in Mparambo 1 and Mparambo 2 (Rugombo, Cibitoke). The arrested were accused of being ""irregulars"".

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 March 2020, Imbonerakure killed the cows and pigs of a CNL party member in Kigoma (Bugabira, Kirundo).

As reported on 19 March 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNL party member, with his body discovered in the Murago river near Rubirizi (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). He had been missing for 2 days, and his eyes were removed when the body was found.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Former CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 19 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a member of the CNL in Ruzingati (Gahombo, Kayanza). He was accused of leaving the CNDD-FDD party for the CNL.

On or around 21 March 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a soldier, leaving the body in the Rusizi river in Nyamitanga (Buganda, Cibitoke). The details are unclear if this was part of a clash between the groups or if the soldier was off-duty (assumed off-duty).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 March 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the homes of three CNL members in the Cendajuru commune (Cendajuru, Cankuzo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Students (Burundi)
column17: On 22 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured four student members of the CNL in Mpanga near Jene (Kabarore, Kayanza). They were then held in the home of the local Imbonerakure leader.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured five CNL members in Mugoyi (Kabarore, Kayanza). They are now hospitalized.
On 22 March 2020, the government of Burundi suspended flights and closed all borders in order to stop coronavirus.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 March 2020, Imbonerakure and a deputy hill chief attacked and injured two CNL members in their homes in Mubira (Ruhororo, Ngozi). When they were taken to the hospital, they were denied care due to their political affiliation.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Ntega commune (Ntega, Kirundo). He was accused of greeting a CNDD-FDD leader.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 March 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the house of a CNL member in Nyagisozi (Busoni, Kirundo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 24 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a member of the CNL in Ruvyagira (Mutambu, Bujumbura Rural). He is now in the hospital.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy; Prisoners (Burundi)
column17: On 25 March 2020, SNR officers arrested and tortured an MSD party member in Mwiruzi (Mishiha, Cankuzo).

On 26 March 2020, police forces attacked and killed a civilian in his home in Gisenyi (Burambi, Rumonge). Police were conducting searches and arrests for those involved in rebel groups. The deceased carried an illegal firearm.
On 26 March 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted and killed a CNL member in Bujumbura. He was found dead on 6 April in Karindo (Kiniyinya, Ruyigi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 28 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a civilian in Gasura (Vumbi, Kirundo). The man was arrested by police before being handed over to Imbonerakure, who were ordered to kill him.
On 28 March 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and injured a CNL member in Gahwazi (Mpanda, Bubanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 March 2020, an Imbonerakure, who teaches at a local secondary, attacked and injured a student in Rugari (Muyinga, Muyinga).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 March 2020, Imbonerakure abducted 4 Congolese civilians in Kajaga (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). They are accused of partnering with rebel groups.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 28 March 2020, Imbonerakure raped and beat up a female CNL member, also assaulting her husband, in Kirambi (Butaganzwa1, Ruyigi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 CNL members in Nyaburondwe (Butaganzwa1, Ruyigi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 March 2020, Imbonerakure clashed with each other in Muramvya (Mutambu, Bujumbura Rural). One was injured following the clash. This follows the Imbonerakure sweep of the area of CNL supporters.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL member in Mahwa (Ryansoro, Gitega).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 March 2020, Imbonerakure and a hill chief attacked and injured a woman accused of sorcery in Rwingoma (Buhiga, Karuzi). Police intervened to take the victim away from the Imbonerakure.

On 29 March 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and injured civilians in Rugenge area of Musenyi (Mpanda, Bubanza). Witnesses say the group used heavy artillery and looted goods during the attack.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 March 2020, CNL members beat up and hospitalised an Imbonerakure in Muramvya (Mutambu, Bujumbura Rural). [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and severely injured a CNL member in Rumonge province. The Imbonerakure were arrested then released. The injured man's arm was amputated.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL members in Kinyovu (Ntega, Kirundo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL members in Rutovu (Mutambu, Bujumbura Rural).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Students (Burundi)
column17: On 31 March 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member and student in Ruvyagira (Mutambu, Bujumbura Rural).

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column9: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: As reported on 31 March 2020, a group of CNDD-FDD members attacked and injured the youth representative of the FRODEBU party in Mugano (Giteranyi, Muyinga). [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 31 March 2020, Imbonerakure abducted a CNL member in Bujondi (Kayogoro, Makamba) for collecting CNL party contributions in the area.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 31 March 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a former military and current Imbonerakure member in Muha commune (Mukaza, Bujumbura Marie).

On 2 April 2020, police forces looted goods including money and cell phones from civilians in Kibezi zone (Mugamba, Bururi). Police took advantage of a search for another person with illegal weapons, making several arrests as well.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 2 April 2020, Imbonerakure killed two civilians, including a student, in Minyago (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo) for violating the coronavirus quarantine. The civilians, a father and son, had just returned from Tanzania.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 3 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL member and looted his home in Giteranyi commune (Giteranyi, Muyinga).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On 4 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured teachers, who are also CNL members, and destroyed their homes in Marembo (Gitobe, Kirundo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member and destroyed his home in Bwokerezo in Kivumu (Gitobe, Kirundo).
On 4 April 2020, the body of an (assumed off-duty) soldier was found dead, killed by an unidentified armed group, in the Rukoko Natural Reserve (Gihanga, Bubanza).

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 April 2020, Imbonerakure fought with CNL members over the opening of a CNL building in Buterere (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). No fatalities or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and severely injured CNL members in Buterere (Nthawanga, Bujumbura Mairie). The attack followed a fight between Imbonerakure and CNL members earlier that day. At least 6 CNL members were injured. At least 6 other CNL members were arrested. One Imbonerakure was injured.
As reported on 4 April 2020, military forces abducted an ex-FAB from Makamba province. Police forces arrested several who tried to find the ex-FAB after his abduction.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 April 2020, Imbonerakure, a CNDD-FDD party leader and the sub-hill chief attacked and injured 2 civilians in Kinama (Gasorwe, Bururi) over a land dispute.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 CNL members in Bigina (Kayogoro, Makamba). They were accused of making political propaganda for their party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Maramvya (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 April 2020, Imbonerakure and local government administrators attacked and injured CNL members in Mwarangabo (Mugina, Cibitoke).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 April 2020, 6 Imbonerakure attacked and killed a pastoralist in Gitaramuka (Gitaramuka, Rutana). 3 Imbonerakure were later arrested by police.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 April 2020, Imbonerakure fought with CNL members after the destruction of a CNL building in Cunyu (Buganda, Cibitoke). 2 CNDD-FDD were injured and 6 CNL members were arrested. [size=at least 8]
On 7 April 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and injured 2 civilians near Bugera (Ndava, Mwaro).

Betweem 6 April and 7 April 2020, a mob attacked and killed an alleged thief in Cumva (Kirundo, Kirundo). The thief was with others and had just killed a watchman while stealing chickens. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL members in Ntega commune (Ntega, Kirundo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL member by burning them in Rutana province. It is unknown if the CNL member survived.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL members in Buhogo (Nyabihanga, Mwaro). Police arrested 9 CNL members following the attack.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 April 2020, Imbonerakure fought with a dozen CNL members in Mufunya (Butaganzwa, Kayanza). 1 Imbonerakure was killed and 2 CNL were reported as injured. A CNL party building was destroyed. Imbonerakure left when police forces arrived. [size=dozen]
On or before 8 April 2020, a corpse of a CNL member was discovered in Kinyinya (Mutumba, Karuzi) after having been arrested by police. It is unclear if police killed the civilian.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Ruhororo commune (Ruhororo, Ngozi). The Imbonerakure attempted to persuade the CNL member to join their party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 April 2020, Imbonerakure killed cows belonging to civilians in Muramyva hill, Burambi (Rumonge). Police then arrested 2 people from one of the victimized families.
On 9 April 2020, police forces arrested 30 CNL members in Muyunya (Butaganzwa, Kayanza) following fighting between CNL and Imbonerakure the day before in this location.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a journalist from Radio Isanganiro and their driver in Rukuba (Kanyosha1, Bujumbura Rural). The journalist was going to cover persecution against CNL members.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: As reported on 9 April 2020, Imbonerakure looted goods and money from a CNL communal representative in Buganda commune (Cibitoke). One Imbonerakure arrested and quickly released.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: As reported on 10 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Gatete (Rumonge, Rumonge). This attack occurred after a CNDD-FDD party building was vandalized and CNL members were blamed.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 11 April 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNDD-FDD local party secretary in Gahororo (Kiremba, Ngozi). At least 10 CNL members were arrested following the attack.
On 11 April 2020, an unidentified armed group killed 2 civilians, their bodies found in Ndava (Buganda, Cibitoke). The communal administrator buried the bodies quickly without an investigation.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Farmers (Burundi)
column17: On 11 April 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed the crops of an Imbonerakure in Ruhande (Kayanza, Kayanza).

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 12 April 2020, police SNR arrested 39 civilians in Mugina (Mugina, Cibitoke). They were later taken to SNR police cells in Cibitoke city and local witnesses suspect the group to be opposition party members.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 April 2020, Imbonerakure and the hill chief attacked and injured 3 CNL supporters in Muyange (Bugenyuzi, Karuzi). The CNL supporters were arrested following the attack accused of having an illegal party meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member and destroyed the home of another in Burwana (Gitobe, Kirundo). They were attacked for refusing to leave the CNL party to join the CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 13 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 CNL members in Gahinga (Gisuru, Ruyigi). The CNL members were arrested after the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 13 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL member in Mwibanda (Ruhororo, Ngozi). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 13 April 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed several CNL party buildings in Nyabihanga commune (Mwaro).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 13 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL supporters in Giteranyi commune (Muyinga).

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Prisoners (Burundi)
column17: On 13 April 2020, Police SNR arrested and tortured several CNL members in Nyabihanga commune (Mwaro) who allowed the CNL to use their buildings as CNL offices.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 14 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 CNL members in Nyamurenza commune (Ngozi). They were accused of giving drinks to CNL members and then were put in prison.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 April 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL members fought each other in Nyabihanga commune (Mwaro) after Imbonerakure attempted to disrupt a CNL party meeting. 1 CNL has been missing since the confrontation. [size=no report]
On 16 April 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a CNL youth leader in Bugiga (Bukemba, Rutana). He was found alive the next day in Giharo commune on the crossroads of Muzye and Giharo.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 April 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL members fought each other in Buhogo (Nyabihanga, Mwaro). Several injuries were reported on both sides and 4 CNL were arrested. [size=at least 4]

column9: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); Prisoners (Burundi); Labour Group (Burundi)
column17: On 16 April 2020, police force attacked and killed an ex-FAB along with 2 domestic house workers in Rubanga (Matana, Bururi). The 3 civilians were killed after being arrested and some living nearby were also arrested. The president of the Senate had given a reward for ""the head"" of the ex-FAB killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 17 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a female CNL supporter in Kagombo (Mwakiro, Muyinga).

On 17 April 2020, overnight Interahamwe and military forces clashed in the Kibira forest area of Mabayi commune (Cibitoke). No fatalities and/or injuries reported, but 25 Imbonerakure, hill chiefs and CNDD-FDD members were arrested in the following days in this area.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 April 2020, Imbonerakure fought against CNL members during the inauguration of a CNL party building in Cihonda (Gashikanwa, Ngozi). 10 CNL members were arrested. [size=at least 10]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 4 CNL members in Karambo (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo).

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 19 April 2020, CNDD-FDD members with a local zone chief fought with CNL members in Ntega (Ntega, Kirundo) when CNL members were returning from a meeting at their party office. 3 were injured following the fighting. [size=at least 3]
On 20 April 2020, CNL members abducted and later released a civilian in Burengo (Matongo, Kayanza). The group abducted six others on various locations on this day.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 20 April 2020, CNL members abducted and subsequently released 5 CNDD-FDD members near Gashikanwa (Gashikanwa, Ngozi). The group abducted others in various locations on this day.
On 20 April 2020, CNL members attacked, injured and abducted a civilian on the road between Ngozi and Gitega. The group abducted six others in various locations on this day.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL party member in Budahunga (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo). The civilian was attacked because he joined the CNL party.

column9: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy; CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: On 20 April 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted two political party leaders from MSD and CNL parties in Buringa zone (Gihanga, Bubanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Kireka (Gisuru, Ruyigi). Several CNL fled the area in the following days.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Nyabitaka (Gisuru, Ruyigi). Several CNL fled the area in the following days.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 21 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Gihororo (Rango, Kayanza). He was attacked after the inauguration of a CNL building.
On 21 April 2020, mass graves from the conflict in 1972 were discovered in Bwoga (Gitega) and Mutobo (Giheta).

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 April 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL members fought in Mugara (Mugara, Rumonge). Four CNL members were arrested. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=at least 4]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 8 CNL members in Burarana (Vumbi, Kirundo). CNL members were doing campaign preparations just before the attack at their party office in Burima.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured several CNL members, kidnapped one, and burned three houses of CNL members in Mutumba (Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural).

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column9: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 24 April 2020, police SNR abducted a tax collector and former soldier in Rugajo (Mugina, Cibitoke).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 24 April 2020, Imbonerakure, along with a sub-hill chief, attacked and injured a CNL member in Ruhata (Gitaramuka, Karuzi). CNL were accused of holding a secret, illegal meeting.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 26 April 2020, Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD supporters abducted a CNL mobilizer in Gisovu (Kanyosha1, Bujumbura Rural).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 4 CNL supporters in Gakana (Kirundo, Kirundo). They were accused of carrying out electoral activities after hours because they wore CNL shirts at night.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Musenyi hill (Nyabraba, Bujumbura Rural). He was forced to give them his voter's card, as well as his wife's, after returning from a CNL gathering.

On 27 April 2020, police attacked and injured a journalist in Mparambo 1 (Rugombo, Cibitoke). The journalist was researching a case regarding armed thieves who had stolen from and attacked civilians. The journalist works for Radio Isangario and Iwacu Newspaper.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 4 CNL members in Kabanga (Busoni, Kirundo) when they were returning from a campaign meeting.

column9: Teachers (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: On 28 April 2020, police forces abducted 3 civilians, one of whom was a CNL member, in Cankuzo city center (Cankuzo, Cankuzo) and held them in an unknown location. Another was a representative for the Union of Educational Workers of Burundi (STEB).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 CNL members in Buganda commune (Cibitoke).

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 29 April 2020, a group of CNL beat up and injured a CNDD-FDD member in Rushubije zone (Ntega, Kirundo). [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 April 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed and confiscated CNL party campaign materials in Bucana (Gitobe, Kirundo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 29 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a woman supporting the CNL party in Burarana (Vumbi, Kirundo). She was hospitalized following the attack.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 April 2020, at least 17 CNL and Imbonerakure fought each other with knives and stones in Gakungwe (Kabezi, Bujumbura Rural). 17 were injured in the fighting. [size=at least 17]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Muturirwa hill (Burambi, Rumonge).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 April 2020, Imbonerakure killed 2 cows belonging to CNL members in Gatare zone (Busoni, Kirundo).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 April 2020, military forces clashed with Imbonerakure in Kigwati I within Rukaramu zone (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). One Imbonerakure was injured. Military forces were dispersing Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD members who attempted to attack CNL members in the area when an Imbonerakure tried to take a gun from a soldier, leading to a retaliation by the soldier.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL supporter in Ruhehe (Bugabira, Kirundo). Imbonerakure also looted goods from the CNL member.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 1 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 CNL members in Kibungere (Nyabihanga, Mwaro).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 2 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Kibungere (Nyabihanga, Mwaro). One CNL member was detained and later found killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 2 May 2020, a group of Imbonerakure destroyed 4 houses belonging to CNL members in Kinyovu (Nyamurenza, Ngozi). This destruction followed a large political gathering of the CNL in this place and the communal administrator directing the Imbonerakure to retaliate.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 3 May 2020, CNL and CNDD-FDD fought each other in Rukore hill (Ntega, Kirundo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 3 May 2020 (as reported on), Imbonerakure and CNL members fought one another in Kibonobono (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo) during the election campaign. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 3 May 2020 (as reported on), Imbonerakure and CNL members fought one another in Rutabo (Busoni, Kirundo) after Imbonerakure lifted a CNDD-FDD party flag in a CNL election meeting place. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 3 May 2020, 10 Imbonerakure attacked a CNL member in Bugabira commune (Kirundo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 4 May 2020 (from 3 May to 4 May), Imbonerakure and CNL clashed with machetes, bows and arrows in Ndaro (Ntega, Kirundo). 7 were injured. Conflicting reports suggested either no fatalities or one. [size=at least 7]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 4 May 2020 (3-4 May), Imbonerakure and CNL clashed with machetes in Buhomba (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). Around 10 injuries reported. [size=at least 10]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 May 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL supporters fought one another in Kigamba commune (Cankuzo) during a CNL election campaign meeting. 2 CNL were injured. [size=no report]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 May 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL supporters fought one another on Mugerera hill (Kiremba, Ngozi). 4 CNL and 2 Imbonerakure were injured, and 3 CNL members were later arrested. [size=at least 4]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked the local hill leader of the CNL in Gahemba (Ruyigi, Ruyigi). The CNL leader is now in the hospital due to injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 4 May 2020, Imbonerakure abducted and killed a CNL member in Mbogora (Nyabihanga, Mwaro). Imbonerakure also injured his wife during the attack. The body of the CNL member was found on 5 May in the Ruvyironza river.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 May 2020, Imbonerakure and the zone administrator beat up and injured a CNL member campaigning in Jarama zone (Buhinyuza, Muyinga). The zone administrator and Imbonerakure also looted money and CNL party materials.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Around 6 May 2020 (between 30 April and 11 May), police forces, aided by SNR and Imbonerakure, arrested at least 30 CNL members from Mubone, Migera and Kabezi in Kabezi commune (Kabezi, Bujumbura Rural). They are now all imprisoned in Mpimba prison. They were accused of inciting rebellion.

On 7 May 2020, police forces arrested Cathy Kezimana, the CNL running mate of the primary opposition leader Agathon Rwasa in Bujumbura Rural province. She was arrested for allegedly inciting insurrection.
Around 7 May 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed 4 people at Cahi hill (Mwumba, Ngozi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: Women (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: On 7 May 2020, Imbonerakure tortured an elderly woman in Ruhororo commune (Ngozi) due to her son's support for the CNL party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Matana commune (Bururi). He was beaten up for leaving the CNDD-FDD party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL communal leader in Gashoho commune (Muyinga).

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: On 7 May 2020, SNR attacked and injured a CNL member in Rugombo commune (Rugombo, Cibitoke).
On 8 May 2020, Burundian and Rwandan soldiers clashed on Lake Rweru in Busoni commune (Busoni, Kirundo). 1 Burundian soldier was killed.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
column17: Around 8 May 2020 (from 24 April-8 May), police forces arrested around 50 people, members of both CNL and FRODEBU, throughout Makamba province (Makamba, Makamba). The arrests took place in Makamba, Nyanza-Lac, Kayogoro, Kibago, Vugizo and Mabanda during the election campaigns.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 May 2020, Imbonerakure tortured a CNL member in Ruramba (Kayokwe, Mwaro).

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 May 2020, police forces clashed with a member of the Imbonerakure in Kinyinya commune (Ruyigi), killing the man. He had attempted to take the police officer's gun before the clash. The police officer was arrested following the event.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 May 2020, Imbonerakure beat up and injured a regional representative of the CNL party in Kibuye (Kiremba, Ngozi) for disturbing public security. Police then arrested the CNL member.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 9 May 2020, Imbonerakure beat up and injured a CNL supporter in Masasu (Gasorwe, Muyinga) for allegedly disturbing order in a market.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 10 May 2020, Imbonerakure and police attacked and injured 10 CNL members in Kiremba (Kiremba, Ngozi). Police arrested the CNL members after the attack.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Labour Group (Burundi)
column17: On 11 May 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a bar owned by an Imbonerakure member in Kamenge (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). 2 people were killed. Reports varied from 8 - 12 injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 11 May 2020, 3 Imbonerakure attacked and injured a woman supporting the CNL in Buhiga (Buhiga, Karuzi). She was later taken to the police station for arrest.
On 11 May 2020, police arrested the Songa communal head of the election observation committee in Bururi province (Bururi, Bururi).

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 12 May 2020, police SNR abducted, then subsequently killed a forex trader in Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie).
On 12 May 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a CNL member from a bar in Kamenge (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-); Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 13 May 2020, Imbonerakure with police and the communal administrator destroyed 27 houses of CNL members in Kigina (Nyamurenza, Ngozi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Labour Group (Burundi); Farmers (Burundi)
column17: On 13 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL members in Kanzanganya and Ruyogera hills in Rutongo zone (Muhuta, Rumonge). They also destroyed the crops and businesses of the CNL members.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 13 May 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed property of CNL members in Higiro hill (Muhuta, Rumonge).

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 13 May 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL members fought each other in Kabumba (Kanyosha1, Bujumbura Rural). Imbonerakure came to destroy the CNL member's homes when the CNL members retaliated. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

Around 14 May 2020 (bodies found on), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed 2 civilian traders on their way from Ndora market (Bukinanyana, Cibitoke). Their bodies were found in Kabira forest. This area has been the site of rebel and military fighting in recent months.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL members as they were campaigning in Rubira hill, Mpanda commune (Mpanda, Bubanza). Police were alerted to the attack but did not intervene.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 16 May 2020, a group of at least 17 CNL members destroyed CNDD-FDD offices by smashing windows and doors, party signs, cell phones and stealing flags in Nyagasaka (Rumonge, Rumonge). 17 CNL members were arrested the following morning. [size=at least 17]

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 16 May 2020, a group of at least 17 CNL members destroyed CNDD-FDD offices by smashing windows and doors, party signs, cell phones and stealing flags in Murambi (Rumonge, Rumonge). 17 CNL members were arrested the following morning. [size=at least 17]

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 16 May 2020, a group of at least 17 CNL members destroyed CNDD-FDD offices by smashing windows and doors, party signs, cell phones and stealing flags in Muhanda (Rumonge, Rumonge). 17 CNL members were arrested the following morning. [size=at least 17]

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 16 May 2020, a group of at least 17 CNL members destroyed CNDD-FDD offices by smashing windows and doors, party signs, cell phones and stealing flags in Gitwe (Rumonge, Rumonge). 17 CNL members were arrested the following morning. [size=at least 17]
On 17 May 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a bar in Bwiza (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). Only a car was destroyed.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 17 May 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed CNDD-FDD party buildings in Buruhukiro Zone (Buyengero, Rumonge).

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 17 May 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL members fought in Kanyosha1 (Bujumbura Rural). The Imbonerakure began the fighting by attacking the CNL at night. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 19 May 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL member in Budahunga (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo).

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 19 May 2020, a mob attacked and killed an Imbonerakure in Budahunga (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo). They killed him after he had attacked and killed a CNL member earlier the same day (coded separately). [size=no report]
Around 19 May 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNL supporter, leaving the body in the Ruvubu River in Gatara commune (Kayanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 19 May 2020, an Imbonerakure raped a young girl in Gakoni (Giteranyi, Muyinga).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member at a voting station in Kabondo (Nyanza-Lac, Makamba). The victim was hospitalised after the attack.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 21 May 2020, CNDD-FDD and CNL members fought in Kanyosha neighborhood of Bujumbura city (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). The fighting happened because the CNDD-FDD members were attempting to prevent CNL members from publishing the results from the election. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: Around 21 May 2020 (as reported), a prison guard attacked and injured a prisoner in Musigati prison (Musigati, Bubanza). The prison guard was detained and the victim was hospitalised. He was attacked for refusing to pay a fine.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 May 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the homes of 2 CNL members in Nyamakarabo Zone (Mugina, Cibitoke).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 22 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a female member of the CNL in Ruziba (Mugina, Cibitoke). She was attacked because she refused to leave the CNL party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Nyanza-Lac commune (Nyanza-Lac, Makamba). They were attacked because the CNL were prohibited from gathering together.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 May 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed a CNL party building in Mugina commune (Mugina, Cibitoke).

On 22 May 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted and tortured a former technician for Radio Bonesha FM in Bujumbura city (Bujumbura Mairie) near Kanyosha neighborhood. He was released alive on 30 May 2020.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: Around 22 May 2020 (between 21 May and 22 May), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNDD-FDD supporter in Rugendo (Mugina, Cibitoke). Several CNL supporters were arrested following the attack.

column7: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Twa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 May 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL members of Twa ethnicity fought in Buhoro zone (Mabayi, Cibitoke). The Imbonerakure initiated the fighting when they attacked the CNL members, leaving 1 member of the CNL severely injured. [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Buganda commune (Buganda, Muyinga). The CNL member was accused of recruiting members for his political party.
On 23 May 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked a CNL member with a machete in Gitaramuka (Muha, Bujumbura Mairie). No fatalities reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL supporters in Kaburantwa (Buganda, Cibitoke).

Around 25 May 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNL member, leaving the body in the Ruzibazi river which separates the towns of Magara and Rutumo (Bugarama, Rumonge). 2 arrests have been made.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; UPRONA: Union for National Progress
column17: On 25 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured CNL and UPRONA members in Ngoma (Mabayi, Cibitoke).

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 25 May 2020 (week of), police and Imbonerakure arrested more than 100 CNL members in Gatara and Matongo communes in Kanyanza Province (Gatara, Kayanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service; Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 26 May 2020, Imbonerakure, police and SNR attacked and injured some CNL members in Kayanza province (Kayanza, Kanyaza). Some were arrested following the attack.
Around 27 May 2020 (between 26 May and 28 May), an unidentified armed group burnt down the houses of 3 CNL members in Giharo commune (Giharo, Rutana).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 CNL members in Songore (Kabarore, Kayanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 CNL members in Randa (Kabarore, Kayanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a journalist from Radio Isanganiro in Buhiga (Buhiga, Karuzi). Imbonerakure accused him of taking pictures and recording an off the record conversation.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 May 2020, Imbonerakure and the local hill chief attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Rukere (Kabarore, Kayanza).

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 May 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with Imbonerakure in Mudaturwa (Mabanda, Makamba). 1 Imbonerakure was killed in the clash.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 28 May 2020, Imbonerakure and a CNDD-FDD leader attacked and injured a CNL member on sub-hill Jimbi, Kavumu hill (Kanyosha 1, Bujumbura Rural). He was beaten severely for not giving the names of his CNL associates who helped supervise the recent elections.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Students (Burundi)
column17: Around 28 May 2020 (as reported on), police officers arrested 55 CNL supporters, some of them students, in several areas of Bubanza province. They were accused of disturbing elections and disrupting national security.
On 29 May 2020, CNL members fought police forces when the police attempted to take election result documents from them in Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). [size=no report]

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 May 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed the banana plantation of an Imbonerakure in Gikingo (Kabarore, Kayanza). CNL members are suspected to be behind the destruction of property.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 May 2020, Imbonerakure and CNL members fought each other in Kavumu (Kanyosha 1, Bujumbura Rural). The fight happened in response to an attack on CNL member the evening before (coded separately). The military were eventually called in to help break up the fight. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]
On 30 May 2020, an unidentified armed group burnt down the home of a CNL member in Gakungu (Giharo, Rutana).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 May 2020, Imbonerakure killed a CNL member in the Kinama area of Bujumbura (Bujumbura Mairie).

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 May 2020, a police officer shot and injured an Imbonerakure in Runyonza (Kirundo, Kirundo). When police attempted to intervene among disputing Imbonerakure, the Imbonerakure tried taking the gun of the police which led to a shot that injured the Imbonerakure.
Around 31 May 2020 (reported on), an unidentified armed group burned down 2 homes of CNL members in Giharo commune (Rutana).

On 31 May 2020, a local security militia attacked and injured a CNL member with a spear in Sanzwe (Muyinga, Muyinga). The CNL member crossed a security barrier held by the local militia when they speared him through the shoulder.

column7: Vigilante Group (Burundi); Twa Ethnic Group (Burundi); Refugees/IDPs (Burundi)
column17: On 1 June 2020, a suspected bandit was beaten to death with clubs by a group of IDPs of Twa ethnicity in Gisovu (Kanyosha1, Bujumbura Rural). The bandit was part of a larger group attempting to rob the group of Twa IDPs. [size=no report]

Around 1 June 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed 3 civilians, leaving their bodies in Bunywana (Muyinga, Muyinga). Local administrators quickly buried the 3 bodies into a mass grave.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 1 June 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 CNL members in Kanihira near Muhuta (Muhuta, Rumonge). Police later arrested the CNL members.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 2 June 2020, Police SNR abducted a CNL member in Muramvya (Muramvya, Muramvya). Those close to the CNL member were not told where he was held by the SNR and they cannot find him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Street Traders (Burundi)
column17: On 4 June 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured several street traders that were also CNL party candidates in Rumonge commune (Rumonge). The Imbonerakure also tried to prevent these CNL members from trading in the Rumonge market.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 June 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured one person on Kibenga hill near Muzinda (Rugazi, Bubanza). 2 CNL attempted to stop the attack, but were arrested by police.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 June 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL member in Ruhama (Kiremba, Ngozi). He was accused of being a spy and was declared 'a sacrifice for the CNDD-FDD party' upon his death.

column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 6 June 2020, CNL and CNDD-FDD members fought each other in Gashikanwa commune (Ngozi). 10 people were injured. [size=at least 10]

Around 7 June 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian, leaving the body in Rusororo hill (Rugombo, Cibitoke). This border area frequently receives attacks from rebel groups in DRC.
On 8 June 2020, a group of locals attacked and killed a suspected thief in Munyika (Rugombo, Cibitoke). [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 June 2020, a group of Imbonerakure clashed with another Imbonerakure member in Rugajo (Mugina, Cibitoke). 1 injury resulted in the clash. Sources claim fighting broke out when one Imbonerakure refused to take part in looting activities in the area.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 June 2020, Imbonerakure stole goods from civilians in Nyakabiga (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). 3 Imbonerakure were arrested.

On 9 June 2020, the president of Burundi died in Karuzi (Buhiga, Karuzi). Varying sources report the cause of death as a heart attack, poisoning or coronavirus. The recently elected Evariste Ndayishimiye of the CNDD-FDD was chosen to assume the office of president and will be inaugurated in the coming weeks.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 11 June 2020, SNR agents abducted the former hill chief on Kansega hill (Buganda, Cibitoke).

column9: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Around 11 June 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed an SNR agent, his body found in Lake Tanganyika near Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
column17: On 11 June 2020, Imbonerakure beat up and injured a CNL member, who is also a teacher, in Rukamba (Buhiga, Karuzi) and then put them in prison. The CNL member was accused of speaking ill of the late president Nkurunziza.

On 13 June 2020, a hill chief beat up and injured a CNL supporter in Nyagatobo-Businde (Gahombo, Kayanza) for spreading CNL ideology. CNL members raised the issue with the commune administrator, who told them opposition members are to be eliminated.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 13 June 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL supporter in Mukoni (Muyinga, Muyinga). The CNL member was accused of sorcery.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 14 June 2020, police SNR abducted a CNL supporter in Gihosha neighbourhood of Bujumbura (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

On 15 June 2020, a police officer killed a civilian for playing secular music at a bar in Gihimbiri, in the zone of Musenyi (Mpanda, Bubanza). Only Christian music was permitted nationwide during a period of mourning after the death of the president.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 15 June 2020, police SNR abducted a CNL supporter in Buterere neighbourhood of Bujumbura (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 15 June 2020 (as reported), Imbonerakure attacked and injured political opponents in the prison of Rumonge (Rumonge, Rumonge). Lawyers and prison guards confirmed the attacks.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 15 June 2020 (as reported), Imbonerakure attacked and injured political opponents in the Mpimba prison in Bujumbura (Bujumbura Mairie). Lawyers and prison guards confirmed the attacks.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 16 June 2020, an unidentified armed group, directed by the communal administrator of Kayagoro, destroyed a home and confiscated land from a widowed CNL member in Kayagoro town (Kayagoro, Makamba). The communal administrator said the property destruction and confiscation was for voting for the CNL instead of the CNDD-FDD.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 16 June 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the home of a CNL member in Gatabo (Matana, Bururi). Subsequently, the owner of the house was arrested with her grandchildren and then released.
On 18 June 2020, Evariste Ndayishimiye was inaugurated as the President of Burundi in Gitega city (Gitega, Gitega).
On 18 June 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with police officers at the home of the Rutana chief of police in Rutana province. One police officer was injured.

column9: Private Security Forces (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column17: On 19 June 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a private security guard who supported the CNL in Ngozi province (Ngozi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 19 June 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed property of a civilian in Rubuga (Gitaramuka, Karuzi), over an ongoing land conflict.
On 20 June 2020, a police officer attacked and killed a student in Burarana (Bururi, Bururi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 June 2020, Imbonerakure assaulted and injured a CNL member in Mugomera (Ngozi, Ngozi).
On 21 June 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a CNL member in Gabiro quarter of Ngozi city (Ngozi, Ngozi).

On 22 June 2020, 7 workers of ASEC security demonstrated over mistreatment by their boss in Bujumbura province (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). Police intervened and arrested them after accusing them of disrupting security in the country. [size=7]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 June 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed 3 gold miners on the border of Congo and Burundi at Kaburantwa (Buganda, Cibitoke).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 23 June 2020 (as reported), 3 bodies were found with knife wounds, killed by Imbonerakure, in Nkaramanyenye in Gatabo zone (Kayagoro, Makamba). Those killed were attempting to cross the border at the river due to the national border closings associated with the coronavirus outbreak.
On 23 June 2020, an unidentified armed group burned down a CNL party building in Buhogo (Nyabihanga, Mwaro).

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
column17: On 24 June 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed a CNL building in Buhogo (Nyabihanga, Mwaro).
On 25 June 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed property at a CNL party building in Gikwiye (Muyinga, Muyinga). Imbonerakure are suspected to be behind the attack.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 26 June 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed 3 miners in Kaburantwa (Buganda, Cibitoke). The Imbonerakure also stole money and gold from the civilians.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 June 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a civilian in Musagara (Muramvya, Muramvya).

Around 27 June 2020 (as reported), 2 bodies were found decapitated by an unidentified armed group and hung in a tree in the Kabira forest area of Ruhembe zone (Bukinanyana, Cibitoke). This area has been the location of ongoing fighting between Burundian forces, rebel groups and Rwandan military.
On 28 June 2020, police abducted a CNL member in the Nyagatoke area of Kiyenzi (Kanyosha I, Bujumbura Rural). The CNL member was forced into an unmarked car and has not been found in any prison.
On 28 June 2020, an albino child was abducted in Burambira (Gashoho, Muyinga). He was believed to have been taken for use in witchcraft.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 June 2020, an Imbonerakure attending the University of Burundi attacked another university student in Mutanga area of Bujumbura city (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie).
On 28 June 2020, an unidentified armed group kidnapped and killed a civilian businessperson in Mahande (Murwi, Cibitoke).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: Teachers (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Pastoralists (Burundi)
column17: On 29 June 2020, Imbonerakure and the local hill chief stole a cow from a teacher and CNL supporter in Murago (Gatara, Kayanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 29 June 2020 (as reported), Imbonerakure stole goods and money from civilians crossing the border in Kayogoro commune (Makamba).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 29 June 2020 (as reported), Imbonerakure stole goods and money from civilians crossing the border in Bigina, a locality within Mabanda commune (Makamba).

column7: Christian Group (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
column9: Christian Group (Burundi); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 29 June 2020, violence erupted at a Seventh Day Adventist Church over a leadership dispute between members supporting the CNL and others supporting CNDD-FDD in Kirundo province. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

On 1 July 2020, Rwandan military abducted 2 Burundian fishermen on the Cohoha lake in Kiri hill (Bugabira, Kirundo). Shots were heard but no bodies were found in escalating tension between the two countries.

Around 4 July 2020 (as reported), an unidentified body was discovered in Lake Tanganyika near Mukungu (Nyanza-Lac, Makamba). The local administration ordered the body be buried quickly without an investigation.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Prisoners (Burundi)
column17: On 5 July 2020, Imbonerakure and some CNDD-FDD members beat up and killed another civilian supporter of the CNDD-FDD in Giharo (Giharo, Rutana). The Imbonerakure had taken the civilian to the local prison, where the civilian was beaten and killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 July 2020, Imbonerakure destroyed the home of a civilian in Rwegura zone (Muruta, Kayanza).

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 July 2020, a police officer and an Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian in Musigati town (Musigati, Bubanza). The police and the Imbonerakure attempted to strangle the civilian, but other local civilians and a military officer came to disperse the attackers.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 7 July 2020, police SNR abducted a member of the CNL in Rumonge province (Rumonge, Rumonge). The victim was accused of opposing the plan of the CNDD-FDD to alter the election results.
On 7 July 2020, communal or provincial government administrators attacked and raped a 14 year old girl in Gakoni (Giteranyi, Muyinga).

On 7 July 2020, an unidentified armed group threw two grenades into the home of a CNL member in Ijenda (Mugongomanga, Bujumbura Rural), resulting in serious injuries. The CNL member was a former hill chief and likely targeted for his political affiliations.

On 8 July 2020, military soldiers shot and injured 3 traders in Muremera (Kigamba, Cankuzo) as they went by on their motorcycle. When the motorcycle crashed, the soldiers stole the traders' bags and money.
On 9 July 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted and raped a female lawyer in Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie).
On 9 July 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a group of civilians in Buterere (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). 1 person was killed and 9 were injured.
On 10 July 2020, locals demonstrated in Matongo commune (Matongo, Kayanza). Police arrested hundreds of demonstrators, but it is unclear the reason for the demonstration. [size=hundreds]
Around 10 July 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and injured 3 street traders in Ruvubu National Park (Mutumba, Karuzi). The attackers also stole 30 million Burundi francs.

column9: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
column17: On 11 July 2020, an unidentified communal group attacked and killed a CNDD-FDD member over a land dispute in Muramba (Bugenyuzi, Karuzi).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 July 2020, Imbonerakure with a hill chief beat up and injured a CNL supporter in Rwingoma (Buhiga, Karuzi). The CNL supporter was arrested after the attack.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Around 13 July 2020 (from 6 - 20 July), the police SNR arrested 66 civilians including 7 CNL members in Rumonge province just before the senatorial elections. Some claim these arrests were to prevent this group from voting.
On 14 July 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into the home of a CNL supporter in Mutakura (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). No casualties and/or injuries reported.
On 14 July 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed a CNL party building in Rugari (Muyinga, Muyinga). It is suspected this was destruction was carried out by CNDD-FDD supporters.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Students (Burundi); CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 July 2020, roughly 15 Imbonerakure students attacked and injured two students at University of Burundi Mutanga campus (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). They were attacked for being on campus without residency cards.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 July 2020, Imbonerakure attacked, injured and stole from some civilians in Busaga (Burambi, Rumonge).
On 17 July 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and injured a CNL supporter in Cendajuru (Vumbi, Kirundo). The CNL member had been threatened by Imbonerakure before this attack.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: On 18 July 2020, police prison guards shot and killed a prisoner in the prison of Ngozi city (Ngozi, Ngozi). The prisoner was trying to escape when he was shot.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 July 2020, Imbonerakure attacked a CNL member in Kiyonza (Bugabira, Kirundo). This CNL member was a candidate for local hill chief.

On 19 July 2020, an unidentified armed group burned the home of a former East African community parliamentarian in Mitakataka (Bubanza, Bubanza). No fatalities and/or injuries reported. The reason for this destruction of property is unclear.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 19 July 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 6 CNL members in Kwisigu (Busoni, Kirundo). The 6 CNL members were running for local elections.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: IWACU; Radio Publique Africaine; SOS Medias
column17: On 20 July 2020, Interahamwe clashed with Burundian military forces and Imbonerakure in Kabira forest near Torero and Gafumbegeti hills in Butahana zone (Mabayi, Cibitoke). 7 Burundian soldiers were killed and at least 4 were injured. 5 from the Interahamwe were captured and sent back to Rwanda. The hill chief of Gafumbegeti was arrested on accusations of collaborating with the Interahamwe.

Around 22 July 2020 (as reported), the bodies of 5 soldiers were found in the Kibira forest area of Gafumbegete (Mabayi, Cibitoke), killed by an unidentified armed group. This province has been the site of ongoing recent clashes with rebel groups.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 July 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Munyinya (Busoni, Kirundo). The member later died from his injuries.
Around 23 July 2020 (as reported), police forces arrested 110 CNL members in Kiremba commune (Ngozi) during the electoral period.
Around 23 July 2020 (as reported), the body of a CNL member was discovered after being attacked by an unidentified armed group in Buringa (Gihanga, Bubanza).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 24 July 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and injured a journalist in Mugina commune (Mugina, Cibitoke). The attack occurred during an election for communal administrator.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 25 July 2020 (as reported), a group of at least 7 people fought with Imbonerakure in Bitezi (Matana, Bururi). Police arrested 7 people following the fighting. The motives for this were unclear and no fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=at least 7]

On 26 July 2020, a group of locals attacked and injured a woman who previously killed her husband in Mugera (Mishiha, Cankuzo). After the woman had been beaten by the mob, she was arrested by police. [size=no report].

Around 28 July 2020 (as reported), 4 Burundian soldiers' bodies were discovered on Myave hill (Bukinanyana, Cibitoke). This area has been the location of ongoing clashes between Burundian military and armed groups from Rwanda.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 July 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Mibanda (Rumonge, Rumonge). The Imbonerakure was subsequently arrested.
On 30 July 2020, police arrested 50 people after searching for weapons in Muha area in Bujumbura city (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie).
On 30 July 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed four homes and stole eight goats of CNL members in Nyamugari (Mugongo-Manga, Bujumbura Rural).
On 4 August 2020, teachers protested outside the teachers' bank in Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie), against an increase of their monthly contributions. [size=no report]

Around 6 August 2020 (as reported), 12 bodies of Burundian soldiers were discovered in the Barikore valley area of Gafumbegeti (Mabayi, Cibitoke). Some may have been civilians or Imbonerakure in civilian clothes. During this week, locals heard shots coming from the Kabira forest and some fled the area. This province has been the site of ongoing recent clashes with rebel groups.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 8 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian in Mugera (Mishiha, Cankuzo). The victim was a launderer who was late on cleaning the clothes of an Imbonerakure, so they severely beat him up.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 10 August 2020, police SNR abducted a CNL supporter in Ngozi (Ngozi, Ngozi). The CNL supporter has not been seen since the abduction.
