Around 10 August 2020 (between 1 and 21 August), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a student, his body found near the Jiji River in Bururi province.
Around 10 August 2020 (between 1 and 21 August), an unidentified armed group beheaded a 12 year old boy in Kanyabitumwe (Buyengero, Rumonge).
Around 10 August 2020 (between 1 and 21 August), 5 people, including 3 children, were injured by the detonation of a grenade found by the children in Gifurwe (Mpanda, Bubanza).
Around 10 August 2020 (between 1 and 21 August), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a man. His body was found in a tree plantation in Ndagano (Vyanda, Bururi).
On 11 August 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a CNL member from Buterere area of Bujumbura (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian at a bar on Sarongo hill, Ruyaga zone (Kanyosha, Bujumbura Rural). He was drinking with his friends when he was accused of speaking against the ruling party.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 12 August 2020, Imbonerakure and a local hill chief attacked and injured a CNL member in Karagara (Rumonge, Rumonge).

On 13 August 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a salon, killing 3 children in Gahahe, Kinama zone (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). 8 others were injured. One Imbonerakure has been arrested as a potential suspect.

On 14 August 2020, police abducted a CNL member in Kabumba (Kanyosha, Bujumbura). As of one week later, he had not been located in any jails. The man had twice previously avoided assassination attempts due to his outspoken political opinions.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 15 August 2020, Imbonerakure threw a grenade into the workplace of a CNL member, injuring 4 people, including a child, in Rubirizi sub hill, Bukemba commune (Gitanga, Rutana). The attack is believed to be aimed at the CNL member who is a candidate in the next hill elections.
Around 15 August 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian in Muheka (Songa, Bururi).
On 16 August 2020, an unknown armed group from Tanzania attacked, killed and looted from a Burundian civilian, injuring 2 others along the border in Cekenya village, Mayange zone (Kayogoro, Makamba).
Around 17 August 2020 (as reported), 3 police attacked and killed a civilian in Maramvya zone (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural).
On 17 August 2020, Burundian military shot and killed a farmer in Rukoko Nature Reserve (Gihanga, Bubanza). A curfew of 5pm had been imposed in that area due to recent rebel movements.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 17 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a judge during his arrest in Matongo commune (Matongo, Kayanza).

Around 19 August 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a taxi driver, his body found in a state of decomposition behind the University of Burundi in Nyakabiga (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). He had been abducted the previous week.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a civilian in Kigaga (Ntega, Kirundo). The civilian was found to be in possession of a child's head, so the Imbonerakure killed him.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed 2 civilians in Maramvya zone (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural).

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: Radio Publique Africaine; Reuters; SOS Medias
column17: On 23 August 2020, Red Tabara clashed with police and Imbonerakure in Gitaza zone (Muhuta, Rumonge) across two days of fighting. At least 5 Red Tabara rebels, 9 police, between 10 and 20 Imbonerakure, and 11 civilians, who were previously abducted, were killed. Fatalities split across 2 events.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 23 August 2020, between 70 and 100 Red Tabara abducted at least 11 civilians in Gahuni zone (Bugarama, Rumonge). They also looted belongings.

column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 August 2020, military and Imbonerakure clashed at the stadium in Rubombo commune (Rugombo, Cibitoke). More than 100 Imbonerakure were doing paramilitary exercises, dressed as military, when the Burundian military discovered them, stripped, beat and injured them. Military forces reported this was done in an effort to dismantle all groups that replace the police and military. No casualties reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 August 2020, 3 Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 fishermen on Cohoha lake, Bugabira commune (Bugabira, Kirundo). The fishermen were told that they were not allowed to fish since they are not CNDD-FDD party members.

On 23 August 2020, police fought against rioters when they attempted to arrest a CNL member and the population resisted the arrest in Ndava zone (Buganda, Cibitoke). 1 person was injured. [size=no report]

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: Radio Publique Africaine; SOS Medias; Reuters
column17: On 24 August 2020, Red Tabara clashed with police and Imbonerakure in Gitaza zone (Muhuta, Rumonge) across two days of fighting. At least 5 Red Tabara rebels, 9 police, between 10 and 20 Imbonerakure, and 11 civilians, who were previously abducted, were killed. Fatalities split across 2 events.
On 24 August 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade inside the house of a civilian in Nyantakara (Kayogoro, Makamba). The man was injured.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 25 August 2020, Red Tabara clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Ku Nyoni, a location on the border between Mugamba commune (Bururi) and Burambi commune (Rumonge). 2 Imbonerakure and 1 Burundian solider were killed. 2 hostages were released. Rebels continued in the direction of Buyengero.
On 28 August 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked Ndayi (Mukike, Bujumbura Rural). 2 civilians were killed, 3 injured and 10 abducted.

On 28 August 2020, an unidentified armed group, between 12 and 40 in size, took 4 men hostage in Masare (Musigati, Bubanza) to help transport food to Kibira nature reserve. No fatalities/injuries reported.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 August 2020, an unidentified armed group, between 12 and 40 in size, clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Masare (Musigati, Bubanza). The group had abducted civilians in this location the day before. 13 members of the armed group, 5 Imbonerakure, 2 military, and 2 civilians were killed. Fatalities split across 9 events, in the locations of Masara, Dondi and Muyebe from 29 August - 31 August.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 August 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Dondi (Musigati, Bubanza). 13 members of the armed group, 5 Imbonerakure, 2 military, and 2 civilians were killed. Fatalities split across 9 events, in the locations of Masara, Dondi and Muyebe from 29 August - 31 August.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 August 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Muyebe (Musigati, Bubanza). 13 members of the armed group, 5 Imbonerakure, 2 military, and 2 civilians were killed. Fatalities split across 9 events, in the locations of Masara, Dondi and Muyebe from 29 August - 31 August.

column17: On 29 August 2020, military forces, Imbonerakure, police and a CNDD-FDD member clashed with an unidentified armed group in Kayange zone (Musigati, Bubanza). An Imbonerakure and a CNDD-FDD member were killed.

On 29 August 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians in Busimba (Muramvya, Muramvya). This group is likely linked to broader RED-TABARA attacks in recent days in this area and the group was wearing military clothing. 1 man was killed and 2 wounded.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 30 August 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Dondi (Musigati, Bubanza). 13 members of the armed group, 5 Imbonerakure, 2 military, and 2 civilians were killed. Fatalities split across 9 events, in the locations of Masara, Dondi and Muyebe from 29 August - 31 August.

On 30 August 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces in the Sunzwe forest area (Kiganda, Muramvya). This group is likely linked to broader RED-TABARA attacks in recent days in this area. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 30 August 2020, military forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in Mukike commune (Bujumbura Rural). 1 soldier died. This unidentified group may be part of ongoing violence with RED-TABARA.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 31 August 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Dondi (Musigati, Bubanza). 13 members of the armed group, 5 Imbonerakure, 2 military, and 2 civilians were killed. Fatalities split across 9 events, in the locations of Masara, Dondi and Muyebe from 29 August - 31 August.

column17: On 31 August 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Masare (Musigati, Bubanza). 13 members of the armed group, 5 Imbonerakure, 2 military, and 2 civilians were killed. Fatalities split across 9 events, in the locations of Masara, Dondi and Muyebe from 29 August - 31 August.

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 31 August 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Muyebe (Musigati, Bubanza). 13 members of the armed group, 5 Imbonerakure, 2 military, and 2 civilians were killed. Fatalities split across 9 events, in the locations of Masara, Dondi and Muyebe from 29 August - 31 August.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: On 1 September 2020, the SNR abducted 2 civilians, one who was associated with the CNL, in Namande (Rusaka, Mwaro). 5 total were arrested, but 3 of the men have been found in jail. The other 2 men's whereabouts are unknown. They were accused of collaborating with rebel movements.

On 1 September 2020, police arrested 40 civilians in Buganda (Buganda, Cibitoke) who are accused of having connections to the RED-TABARA attacks and clashes in the days preceding the arrest. Many were young people and former military.

column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 1 September 2020, police and SNR abducted 2 CNL members in Muramvya (Muramvya, Muramvya). They have not been found since this time.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 2 September 2020, police SNR attacked, injured and imprisoned 3 young men in Namande (Rusaka, Mwaro) who were accused of being rebels.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 2 September 2020, police SNR attacked, injured and arrested a civilian in Gisagazuba (Burambi, Rumonge). The civilian was accused of partnering with rebel groups.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 2 September 2020, police and Imbonerakure abducted 10 Tutsi civilians from Mugamba commune (Bururi).

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 3 September 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted an Imbonerakure in Kagaragara, Buringa zone (Gihanga, Bubanza). He has yet to be found.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 3 September 2020, a group of Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Rugombo commune (Rugombo, Cibitoke). He was beaten for 2 hours because he refused to join the CNDD-FDD party. The victim's family and other CNL officials were arrested this morning.

Around 3 September 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed an unknown number of civilians (coded as 3) in Mukike commune (Bujumbura Rural). Other civilians were kidnapped. This group may have been linked to RED-TABARA, operating in this location in recent days.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Kinama (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). The CNL member was attacked for leaving the CNDD-FDD to join the CNL. He is now in the hospital.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 September 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL member in Mukenke (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo). Police then arrested several Imbonerakure.
On 6 September 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed 1 civilian in Gahuni (Bugarama, Rumonge). The attackers also stole the victim's cows.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 6 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Imbonerakure in Kagano (Bukeye, Muramvya). 1 person was killed and others were injured. 1 Imbonerakure was abducted by the rebels.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi)
column16: Arib; SOS Medias; Radio Publique Africaine
column17: On 6 September 2020, Red Tabara attacked and killed 3 civilians in Maramvya (Burambi, Rumonge). At least 2 other people were injured. Of the three people killed, one was the Imbonerakure leader of that hillside. He was unarmed in his home when the attackers came and killed him. Of the injured civilians, one was the director of a school and also a CNDD-FDD activist.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: On 7 September 2020, Imbonerakure and SNR attacked, injured and arrested a CNL leader in Murambi (Muramvya, Muramvya).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 7 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 judges while they were visiting a disputed piece of land in Ntahangwa (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).
On 10 September 2020, an unidentified armed group threw 2 grenades at homes on Kinogono avenue in Buyenzi (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). 1 civilian was killed and 4 were injured.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: Radio Publique Africaine; SOS Medias; IWACU; Reuters; Arib
column17: On 10 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Imbonerakure in Nyarumanga (Matongo, Kayanza). Between 6 and 7 Imbonerakure and civilians were killed, including 2 children; 3 to 5 civilians and Imbonerakure were injured; between 1 and 4 Imbonerakure and civilians were abducted.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 11 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with police and military forces in Gahuni (Bugarama, Rumonge). 4 Red Tabara and 1 civilian were killed. 2 police were injured. 1 Red-Tabara was arrested by police.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 12 September 2020, Red Tabara and Burundian military clashed in Muhuzu (Rumonge, Rumonge). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 12 September 2020, an unidentified armed group and military forces clashed in Kwibambo, Bugarama commune (Bugarama, Rumonge). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 12 September 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces in Ruteme (Bugarama, Rumonge). 5 people were killed.
On 12 September 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces in Kayombe (Bugarama, Rumonge). 1 person was killed and 3 were injured.
Around 12 September 2020 (between 11 - 13 September), an unidentified armed group beheaded an ex-FAB soldier in his home in Gatsinga (Ndava, Mwaro). The motive remains unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
column17: On 13 September 2020, SNR agents attacked and killed an ex-FAB soldier, and abducted 2 others from Shombo zone (Muramvya, Muramvya). They were accused of illegal weapon possession. The remaining 2 abducted civilians have not been found.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 13 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Burundian military in Bugarama commune (Bugarama, Rumonge). Between 1 and 2 rebels were killed. Fatalities split across 2 events in Rumonge on this day.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 13 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Burundian military in Gisagazuba (Burambi, Rumonge). Between 1 and 2 rebels were killed. 1 Imbonerakure was injured. Fatalities split across 2 events in Rumonge on this day.

Around 14 September 2020 (from 7 - 20 September), police and military forces have arrested more than one hundred civilians in Rugombo and Buganda communes (Rugombo, Cibitoke). Those arrested are suspected to be involved in illegal weapon possession and not having identity cards. Arrests took place during house searches, where the police and military also looted homes and used ""abusive force"" against some of the civilians. Arrests split between two events.

Around 14 September 2020 (from 7 - 20 September), police and military forces arrested more than one hundred civilians in Rugombo and Buganda communes (Buganda, Cibitoke). Those arrested are suspected to be involved in illegal weapon possession and not having identity cards. Arrests took place during house searches, where the police and military also looted homes and used ""abusive force"" against some of the civilians. Arrests split between two events.

On 14 September 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade at a local fisherman in Nyagisozi (Busoni, Kirundo). The man was seriously injured. A policeman and soldier were arrested. The motive is unclear, although some sources report continual conflict between police and fisherman regarding the management of fishing equipment on Lake Rweru.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 14 September 2020, Red Tabara attacked and looted Ntabandwa sub-hill, Rubungu hill (Rango, Kayanza). The rebels shot a local pharmacist (it is unclear if he died) as they raided the pharmacy and stole medicine and money. They also looted from civilians and local shops.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 14 September 2020, Red Tabara and Burundian military clashed in Musigati commune, in the Kibira forest (Musigati, Bubanza). The population there was displaced. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 15 September 2020, police SNR attacked and injured 2 CNL members as they arrested them on Raro hill, Nyabiraba zone (Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural). The 2 CNL members were accused of involvement with armed groups.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: IWACU; SOS Medias; Radio Publique Africaine
column17: On 15 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Imbonerakure in Gisagazuba (Burambi, Rumonge). The clash began when Red Tabara attacked Imbonerakure on night patrol. The rebels had disguised themselves as Burundian police. Between 3 and 4 Imbonerakure were killed in the clash. 3 others were wounded. 2 civilians, including a teacher, were kidnapped. The teacher was found alive the next morning. Fatalities split across 2 events in Rumonge on this day.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column16: IWACU; Radio Publique Africaine; SOS Medias
column17: On 15 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Imbonerakure in Kiganza (Burambi, Rumonge). The clash began when Red Tabara attacked Imbonerakure on night patrol. The rebels had disguised themselves as Burundian police. Between 3 and 4 Imbonerakure were killed in the clash. 3 others were wounded. 2 civilians, including a teacher, were kidnapped. The teacher was found alive the next morning. Fatalities split across 2 events in Rumonge on this day.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 15 September 2020, Red Tabara and Burundian military clashed in Musigati commune, in the Kibira forest (Musigati, Bubanza). Locals are forced to help the military forces at night. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 16 September 2020 (week of), Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian in Ruhango, Shombo zone (Muramvya, Muramvya).

column9: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 16 September 2020 (week of), police arrested 145 Congolese traders and refugees in Rugombo commune (Cibitoke). These arrests may be linked to ongoing fighting with RED-TABARA who have been crossing over from DRC.

column9: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 16 September 2020 (week of), police arrested 31 Congolese traders and refugees in Buganda commune (Cibitoke). These arrests may be linked to ongoing fighting with RED-TABARA who have been crossing over from DRC.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 16 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Burundian military in Donzi (Burambi, Rumonge). Civilians reported gunfire. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured Tutsis who were participating in a funeral procession in Maramvya zone (Burambi, Rumonge). The funeral was for the Imbonerakure killed earlier in a clash with Red Tabara. The Imbonerakure injured one civilian.
On 16 September 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces in Kagongo (Mugamba, Bururi). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 16 September 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces in Mutobo (Mugamba, Bururi). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a civilian in Ruvumu (Musigati, Bubanza). He was killed for being found in a restricted area past curfew.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 16 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured civilians who were accused of working with Red Tabara in Burambi commune (Burambi, Rumonge). Many others have left their homes or have been arrested by the Imbonerakure.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 17 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked, injured and abducted 3 Tutsi civilians in Rumonyi (Burambi, Rumonge). Other members of the targeted households fled.
Around 18 September 2020 (as reported), police forces publicly tortured prisoners accused of being rebels in Mugamba commune (Bururi). 1 prisoner was killed.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 20 September 2020, Imbonerakure shot and injured 2 civilians in Gatwaro (Muramvya, Muramvya).

On 21 September 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a bistro in Nyagisozi (Busoni, Kirundo). 3 people were injured. This is the second grenade assassination attempt in 2 weeks against a fisherman who lives there.
On 21 September 2020, Burundian military abducted the CNL chief of Rukoma hill in Matongo commune (Matongo, Kayanza). The location of this CNL leader is unknown since the abduction.

On 21 September 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a civilian in Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). He was abducted just after a call with police, who accused him of being in contact with rebel groups. He has not been seen since this time.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 21 September 2020, SNR abducted a member of the CNL and 3 other civilians in Mbuye commune (Mbuye, Muramvya). The location of these CNL members is unknown since the abduction.

On 21 September 2020, a group of contractors demonstrated in front of a government office in Makamba commune (Makamba, Makamba). They were protesting because the were not paid for their work. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 22 September 2020, SNR abducted 6 civilians during home searches in Janda (Bugarama, Rumonge). They have not been found since. Ongoing abductions of suspected rebels have been taking place in this area.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 22 September 2020, SNR abducted 2 civilians during home searches in Saga (Bugarama, Rumonge). They have not been found since. Ongoing abductions of suspected rebels have been taking place in this area.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 22 September 2020, Imbonerakure abducted 2 CNL members in Gitega commune (Gitega, Gitega).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 civilians from DRC in Rusiga (Rugombo, Cibitoke) before taking them to the police station. The victims were local cloth vendors and were accused of association with rebel groups.
On 23 September 2020, an unidentified armed group shot and killed a young student in Rurtyazo (Kayokwe, Mwaro).

Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a taxi driver in Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie), the body of the victim was found outside the Regina Mundi Cathedral covered in wounds, having been tortured and his tongue cut out. Police took the body to an undisclosed location.

column7: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 25 September 2020, police and Imbonerakure abducted 6 members of the CNL in Kwigere (Isale, Bujumbura Rural). They have not been found since the abduction.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 25 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Burundian military in Tondero (Kaborore, Kayanza). The area borders the Kabira forest, where there has been ongoing fighting between Red Tabara and Burundian military in recent weeks. 1 civilian was killed, 1 was injured and between 1 and 2 others kidnapped. 7 goats were killed.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 26 September 2020, Red Tabara and Burundian Military clashed near Kabira forest in Rugazi zone (Rugazi, Kayanza). No injuries and/or fatalities reported.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 26 September 2020, RED-TABARA clashed with military and local communal militia members in Bukinanyana commune (Cibitoke). 12 military and 7 local militia members were injured in fighting over 2 days in this location.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Around 27 September 2020 (between 24-30 September), police SNR arrested and killed 3 civilians in Buganda commune (Cibitoke). The 3 men were originally from Nyamurenza, Ngozi.
On 27 September 2020, military forces abducted a civilian in Nyakirwa (Gisozi, Mwaro). He has not been found since this time.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 27 September 2020, RED-TABARA clashed with military forces in Kabarore commune (Kayanza). 1 civilian was killed and livestock stolen. RED-TABARA then retreated back across the border to Rwanda.

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 27 September 2020, RED-TABARA clashed with military and local communal militia members in Bukinanyana commune (Cibitoke). 12 military and 7 local militia members were injured in fighting over 2 days in this location.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL supporter in Nyagatovu (Vumbi, Kirundo). The CNL member was attacked for wearing a CNL shirt.

column6: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column8: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 27 September 2020, Imbonerakure clashed with FDLR in Gafumbegeti (Mabayi, Cibitoke). FDLR killed 1 Imbonerakure and injured his son for diverting their supplies.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column7: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: Around 28 September 2020 (between 26-30 September), Imbonerakure and Police SNR attacked, injured and abducted 2 CNL supporters, found near the Busoro valley of Kanyosha (Muha, Bujumbura Mairie). They were arrested on the 26th of September and found again on the 30th.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 28 September 2020, Imbonerakure and police forces abducted a CNL supporter in Bukinyana commune (Cibitoke). He was suspected of supporting rebel groups. Imbonerakure took the CNL supporter to the police, but has not been found.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 28 September 2020, Imbonerakure and police forces abducted a CNL member in Runyonza (Kirundo, Kirundo). He has not yet been found, and family of the victim believes he was murdered.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 29 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 Twa youths in Nyamirinzi (Vumbi, Makamba). They were accused of collaborating with rebel groups and taken to the police station.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 2 October 2020, the SNR abducted 2 civilians in Mutimbuzi (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). No one has seen them since.

On 5 October 2020, more than 200 coffee farmers demonstrated due to the delaying of their payment in front of the governor's office in Kayanza (Kayanza, Kayanza), demanding their payments for coffee supplied. [size=more than 200]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 5 October 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian in Burambi commune (Burambi, Rumonge).

column9: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 7 October 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed an Imbonerakure in Butahana (Mabayi, Cibitoke). The Imbonerakure was accused of embezzling money.

Around 7 October 2020 (as reported), 2 bodies were found having been killed in Gasenyi (Buganda, Cibitoke). It is the third time dead bodies have been found there is less than 4 months, near the sight of ongoing fighting with RED-TABARA.
On 8 October 2020, police and military forces arrested 53 civilians for not having identity cards and collaborating with rebel groups in Nyabingina (Kibago, Makamba).

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
column17: On 8 October 2020, SNR agents abducted 7 CNL activists in Mwaro city (Kayokwe, Mwaro). They have not been found since.

column9: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Government of Burundi (2005-)
column17: On 9 October 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a CNL elected official in Isale commune (Isale, Bujumbura Rural).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: Around 9 October 2020 (as reported), an Imbonerakure raped 4 young girls, some students, in Kivoga (Rutana, Rutana). The Imbonerakure was later arrested by police forces.

Around 10 October 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed 3 civilians; their bodies were found in Bujumbura Mairie. The government refused to allow the population to identify the bodies.
On 11 October 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian in Kagombe (Mwakiro, Muyinga).

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 11 October 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured civilians in Gihungwe zone (Gihanga, Bubanza). They were attacked because they were out after the 9pm curfew.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 11 October 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured civilians in Buringa zone (Gihanga, Bubanza). They were attacked because they were out after the 9pm curfew.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 11 October 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and killed a civilian in Kigoma (Bugabira, Kirundo). The victim was killed for having a Rwandan accent.
On 11 October 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian in Kinazi (Muyinga, Muyinga).
On 12 October 2020, an unidentified armed group dressed in police uniforms attacked and killed a CNL member in Muyange (Burambi, Rumonge). He was beheaded, and the motive is not yet known.

column6: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
column17: On 13 October 2020, police attacked and killed a prisoner being held in a Mwaro prison (Koyokwe, Mwaro). He was beaten badly, and then taken to the Kibumbu hospital where he died due to his injuries.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 14 October 2020, Imbonerakure and police attacked and injured a civilian and then arrested him in Kabezi zone (Kabezi, Bujumbura Rural). Although he required medical treatment, the civilian was denied access to medical facilities.

column9: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 October 2020, police forces arrested more than 30 Banyamulenge refugees in the center of Gatumba (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). The police were looking for people speaking Kinyarawanda, as they are suspicious of people collaborating with Rwanda and RED-TABARA. In the previous 2 weeks, more than 110 Congolese Banyamulenge have been arrested and taken to Congolese refugee camps.
On 15 October 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian in Mihigo (Kayanza, Kayanza).

Around 15 October 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian in Mparambo 2 (Rugombo, Cibitoke). The body was found along the Rusizi river separating Burundi and DRC.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 17 October 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian accused of collaborating with rebels in Gisagazuba (Burambi, Rumonge). The civilian was arrested and released several times.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 17 October 2020, the chief of the hill and the Imbonerakure attacked and injured civilians while watching a football match in Murehe (Nyabitsinda, Ruyingi). 2 people were seriously injured.

Around 17 October 2020 (as reported), six bodies were discovered near Ndava hill (Buganda, Cibitoke) floating in the Rusizi river. There have been more than 15 bodies found in the past month in the same area following ongoing border attacks from DRC and fighting with rebel groups.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 18 October 2020, Imbonerakure attacked members of the Free Methodist Church in Munyika zone (Rugombo, Cibitoke). An SNR officer was appointing CNDD-FDD leaders of the church when the Imbonerakure beat up and injured 4 members of the church.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 21 October 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 civilians in Nyamaboko (Kanyosha, Bujumbura Rural). The 2 injured were later arrested and put in prison.

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 21 October 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a Tutsi civilian in Gishubi commune (Gishubi, Gitega). The victim was attacked because he was a Tutsi.
On 21 October 2020, a group of locals attacked and killed a 60 year old woman accused of witchcraft in Gisebyi (Gashoho, Muyinga). [size=no report]

column6: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
column17: On 23 October 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian in Nyamaboko (Kanyosha, Bujubmura Rural). The population in that area says they are regularly terrorized by the Imbonerakure.
Cocoa farmers protest over the imposition of a traditional ruler in Manyus big cocoa and coffee producing Kembong sub-district and recent arrests against them.

Bakassi rebels kill two police officers and kidnapped twelve other government officials in an apparent kidnap for ransom operation, which the government of Cameroon pail 320,000 Euros for their release.
A dozen hostages are taken by an extremist group. The 12 were released several days later when their ransom is paid.
An AMC rebel and a soldier are killed in an attack. A civilian woman is hit with a stray bullet during the violence.
A teenage boy is killed by an unknown group or gang.
Thieves kill seven during a bank heist.
A French journalist is kidnapped in the north and freed a week later, April 5th. The man was beaten and denied food.
A journalist is arrested in the north.

Arrests: Authorities arrest a group of 37 food activist protesters seeking a food output boost and a curb on food imports, as well as an increase of infrastructure spending so that farmers can transport their goods to market.

Authorities arrest a group of 37 food activist protesters seeking a food output boost and a curb on food imports, as well as an increase of infrastructure spending so that farmers can transport their goods to market.
Five dead a 60 injured with a criminal gang clashes with a neighborhood vigilante group.
Seven heavily armed assailants boarded a Cameroonian ship with 150 people on board off the coast of Nigeria and took its captain hostage. The others were released, unharmed.
Gunmen of a opposition group opposed to Cameroons long-time leader traded fire with police after they stopped traffic on a bridge. Five wounded.

On 23 December 2011, residents of the Nsimeyong neighborhood captured a group of bandits that have recently been terrorizing them and attempted to bring them to vigilante justice before police rescue them.
Residents continue to gather to protest the killing of a local man. The protest began on December 31st 2011.
Residents protest enters its third day.
Residents protest enters its forth day.

Cameroon security forces dispersed rioters in a neighbourhood of the economic capital Douala on Wednesday, after at least two people died during fighting triggered by the suspected murder of a local man.
Rioting residents continue their clashes with police.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 10 April 2012, Boko Haram fighters attacked the border town Banki (Mayo-Sava, Extreme-Nord), killing 15 Nigerians (no Cameroon nationals were victims). The Cameroonian government responded with more security placed along the border of the two nations.
Movement of forces: The Cameroonian military increases their presence along the border with Nigeria (opposite Banki) following a Boko Haram attack April 10th along the border (in Nigeria)
Protesting taxi drivers announce a strike for the following Monday.
Opposition parties, including the social democratic front, boycott a parade of ""national celebration"" for unknown political reasons.
Rebels opposed to CAR president Francois Bozize attack a Cameroon border post killing two, including a young boy. One rebel is killed and two others arrested when Cameroon forces retaliate.
Police forces fire tear gas and water to disperse opposition protesters as President Biya celebrates 30 years in office
An explosive device attack takes place against Press Book Communications premises in Yaounde
Seven French tourists from one family, including four children, were kidnapped in Cameroon on Tuesday by suspected Islamist militants.

Seleka members attacked the town of Kentzou in eastern Cameroon, 10 km from the border with CAR, to free some fellow militants arrested the day before by the authorities. A Cameroonian soldier was held in hostage
Five persons who were natives of Efut Obot Ikot village in the Bakassi Peninsular have been killed by Cameroonian gendarmes who invaded the area and sacked more than 1,000 Nigerians
No fewer than five Bakassi natives, who resisted forcible eviction from the ceded peninsula, were allegedly killed by Cameroonian military authorities.

column8: Former Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
column17: Weapons seizure: Cameroonian authorities last night [12 April] launched a widespread operation to disarm Central African soldiers who are living as refugees on the Cameroonian soil after the fall of ex-President Francois Bozize. The objective of the operation that was carried out in the Garoua Boulaye District last night is to recover the arms that infiltrated Cameroon following the coup d'etat in Bangui.

Road blocks were mounted at the Cite de la Paix junction. The entire student population of the Institute Secondaire de Technologie at Cite de la Paix in the nations economic capital went to the streets yesterday in protest against deprivation of lessons.

Workers in Cameroon joined their peers in the world on Wednesday May 1, 2013 to commemorate the 127th edition of the International Labour Day. The day was marked by a grand march past at the May 20 Boulevard in Yaounde.

column9: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion; Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Gendarmerie
column17: Riot after one policemen killed a man, violent intervention of the army.
Military operation to kill elements of CAR military forces who found refuge in Cameroon and regurlarly loot villages and attack the Seleka Coalition
Two families got into a fight and destroyed the church, accusing the priest to have abducted one of their daughters

Cameroonian troops have clashed with the Seleka rebels of the Central African Republic on the border of the two countries. ""There were shots, gunshots, from both sides of the border"" between Tuesday and Wednesday, a salesman working in the eastern Cameroonian border-town of Garoua-Boulai said. ""People panicked and fled.""
Clashes between elements of the Seleka and the Military Forces of Cameroon in the village. Only exchange of shootings
Three Cameroon students were injured in clashes between police and striking students in Buea.
Student protest inside the university and clashes with the police forces while they tried to make them leave the building.
Clashes between elements of the Seleka and the Military Forces of Cameroon in the village. Only exchange of shootings
Taxi drivers protested, driving around town, against the lootings by Central African Refugees
Property desrtruction: The gay rights association Alternatives for Cameroon offices have been burned down
A prominent gay rights activist in Cameroon was tortured and killed just weeks after issuing a public warning about the threat posed by ""anti-gay thugs,"" Human Rights Watch said.
Villages from Gari-Gombo destroyed the border barrier between Cameroon and Central African Republic
Seven men from Mbororo village, armed with machetes attacked two buses of civilians in Bana.
Brutal intimidation over a journalist by the police forces while he was looking into a children traffiking affair
Cameroon takes control in disputed Bakassi

column9: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
column17: An activist of the MRC political party killed at his house
A police officer in Toktoyo was shot by an armed group attempting to free one of their members
Attack of the border by Seleka elements, one Cameroonian soldier was killed. 2 arrested
The killing of a Cameroonian police official has prompted the country to shut its border with Central African Republic, officials said Wednesday.

The rally organized Wednesday by the Association of Cameroonian Youth called for stricter enforcement of anti-gay law: More than 100 young men and women in Cameroons capital posted anti-gay signs on bars suspected of being gay-friendly
Weapons seizure: 5,400 AK-47 rifles were seized in Marou, believed to be intended for transport to Nigeria

column8: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic
column17: Arrests: Lead member of the FDPC, Miskine, was arrested in Cameroon.
Protesters demand their wages be paid. Riot police blocked protesters from entering the banks.
A group supported by military forces attacked, pillaged & destroyed settlements in Douala

Rumours of a man who transformed into a python and swallowed a girl in his hotel room in Molyko, Buea, spread like wildfire, resulting in a mob descending on the hotel. The mob threw stones and damaged hotel property, and later was dispersed by police and gendarmerie with tear gas.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram, in coordination with Ansaru, have kidnapped a French priest in northern Cameroon. It is suspected that he has been taken to Nigeria.

Clashes between attackers from CAR and the Cameroonian army in the village of Gbiti. The violence has killed seven people (five attackers, a Cameroonian military official and a civilian) while a dozen prisoners were arrested. Seleka believed to be responsible, although this has not yet been formally announced.
BIR soldiers & armed assailants from CAR clashed in Bombe-Bakary (on the Kentzou road), near the CAR border.
BIR soldiers & armed assailants from CAR clashed in Oundiki (in Kette near Gbitti). 3 soldiers were injured.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacked a home in Kousseri, resulting in the death of a resident and the death of a member of Boko Haram.
BIR soldiers & armed assailants from CAR clashed in Kana (near Oundiki, Beke & Kette). 1 armed assailant was killed.
Ex-Seleka from CAR attacked an army base in Ondiki village, Kette district. Seven dead: two Cameroonian soldiers, four ex-Seleka, and a leader of the Muslim community in the village.

column9: Aid Workers (Cameroon); Civilians (International); Aid Workers (International); UN: United Nations
column17: ""Two UN staff members were held against their will by refugees who believed the presence of the UN would prevent an attack by local villagers (the refugees feared a retaliatory attack as there was an altercation between the two parties on 1 January 2014). One UN staff member was released on 3 January 2014, and the other on 4 January 2014.""
A witchhunt led to the burning and looting of several buildings and shops in Buea.

column9: UNHCR: United Nations Refugee Agency; Aid Workers (Cameroon)
column17: Refugees from CAR took two UNHCR workers hostage on January 4th in Bertoua in order to to protest a lack of needed aid. They were released January 7th after negotiations. The refugees involved may be rebels, but as yet unconfirmed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Fighting between Nigeria's army and Boko Haram spilled into a border town in Cameroon. The Cameroonian army tried to repel Boko Haram. At least one woman killed on Cameroonian soil and five others wounded. Nigerian officials deny that the fighting entered Cameroonian territory.

Residents say that ex-Seleka entered the town of Garoua Boulai, where they set off explosives and fired shots indiscriminately until the Cameroonian army arrived. Cameroonian officials deny that this attack occurred in Garoua Boulai, but say it instead happened on CAR soil in a zone called Cantoneer.
Cameroonian troops kill two ex-Seleka rebels and one Anti-Balaka element in clashes near Garoua-Boulai district in Cameroon.
Anti-Balaka & Seleka forces clashed on Garoua-Boulai. 15 Seleka were killed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suspected of kidnapping & killing a village chief in Goumouldi

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Recruitment :Boko Haram has recruited around 200 young people from the area around Kolofata since February primarily from the Kanuri ethnic group

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian military clashed with Boko Haram insurgents in the Far North region. 6 insurgents & 1 soldier were killed.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian military clashed with Boko Haram insurgents in Fotokol. 1 insurgent & 1 soldier were killed.
People blocked a road leading to important agricultural land in Mangoule, in protest over a land dispute between 2 people

column6: Military Forces of the Republic of Congo (1997-)
column17: 4 Cameroonian soldiers & 4 'Ecogardes' were mistaken for poachers & kidnapped in Socambo by Congolese soldiers, released 5 days later.
People who were forcibly evicted from settlements protested over lack of compensation & resettlement at the Wouri prefecture in Douala

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram was suspected of attacking a market near Kousseri.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram was suspected of attacking a market near Kousseri. At least 1 soldier was killed.

The Mbororos of Bamenda resisted efforts by the CATUC to begin expanding the university, which involved demolishing some of their homes, by destroying a construction vehicle, which led to clashes that ended up destroying other vehicles, killing livestock and injuring some people
Two Italian priests and a Canadian nun were abducted from their parish in Tchere; Boko Haram is suspected to be behind the kidnapping
Mbororos protested in front of the Archdiocese of Bamenda over plans to expand the Catholic University Cameroon

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 11 members of Boko Haram robbed a cooperative and tried to kidnap three Colombian nationals from the Ouzal parish but were forced to leave them behind when security services arrived
Clashes between ""heavily armed"" Nigerian Fulani herdsmen and Cameroonian farmers near the border left 20 people dead and forced 1000 people out of their homes
Clashes between ""heavily armed"" Nigerian Fulani herdsmen and Cameroonian farmers near the border left 20 people dead and forced 1000 people out of their homes
Clashes between ""heavily armed"" Nigerian Fulani herdsmen and Cameroonian farmers near the border left 20 people dead and forced 1000 people out of their homes

The car of an investigative journalist from Radio France Internationale in Cameroon exploded outside his house, causing no injuries; it appears to be in connection with his coverage of the Cameroonian security forces
Clashes between ""heavily armed"" Nigerian Fulani herdsmen and Cameroonian farmers near the border left 20 people dead and forced 1000 people out of their homes

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian gendarmes seized a vehicle filled with ammunition and arrested one Boko Haram fighter

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 30 Boko Haram militants attacked a territorial brigade outpost, killing one officer and seriously injuring two prisoners; they also released an imprisoned Boko haram member and seized some arms and ammunition

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 10 Chinese nationals were kidnapped during a raid by Boko Haram on a Chinese company operating in the town of Waza; one Chinese national was also injured and taken to a hospital in the Chadian capital of NDjamena; they are believed to have been conveyed to Nigeria by Cameroonian police sources

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Cameroonian soldier was killed during the military's response to a raid by Boko Haram on a Chinese construction company and their kidnapped 10 Chinese nationals
On 16 May 2014, a vendor with alleged Boko Haram affiliation was attacked by an unknown group in Cameroon. Local police report that Islamists may have been behind the attack.

A water treatment plant was attacked by unidentified armed individuals; offices were vandalized and material damages have been cited as being enormous; officials of the Cameroon Water Utilities Cooperation (CAMWATER) believe have been done by workers angry over wage arrears
Movement of forces :Cameroon has deployed at least two thousand troops to its Extreme North region around the area of Waza where 10 Chinese nations were kidnapped last week

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three soldiers were wounded after coming under attack by Boko Haram fighters ""just a few kilometres from the Nigerian border""; a group of soldiers had been taking in suspected Boko Haram militants for questioning when they came under attack

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 40 heavily armed Boko Haram fighters were killed in fierce fighting between the Cameroonian military and Boko Haram fighters after Cameroonian forces ambushed them; at least one vehicle of the Cameroonian security forces was destroyed; some sources quoted 60 Boko Haram fighters being killed

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The government of Cameroon secured the release of two Italian priests and a Canadian nun from Boko Haram; the negotiations leading to their release were not disclosed; it is believed those who kidnapped the religious personnel may be an independent off-shoot from Boko Haram
Kotoko and Musgum groups clashed in Kousseri, reportedly over land claims. 1 person was killed and many injured.
Truck drivers began a work stoppage in protest over the murder of a colleage in CAR, on June 5. They wish to draw attention to the issue of drivers' security.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Armed men believed to be Boko Haram members attacked Gorsi Tourou, causing villagers fled the area. Cameroonian military later intervened.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column16: Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Alwihda (Chad)
column17: The Cameroonian army reportedly killed 118 Boko Haram members during fighting in Tourou, near Mokolo. 2 soldiers were also killed.

Opposition Social Democratic Front (SDF) lawmakers walked out of Parliament and Senate in protest over the governments 'heros welcome' for Ivorian ""warlord"" Mr Guillaume Soro, Speaker of the Cote dIvoire House of Assembly.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian military engaged Boko Haram militants near the Nigerian border for two days; two vehicles transporting Boko Haram militants were destroyed and ammunition and weapons were seized

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian military engaged Boko Haram militants near the Nigerian border for two days; two vehicles transporting Boko Haram militants were destroyed and ammunition and weapons were seized

Arrests: The Cameroonian gendarme cordoned off a market suspected of hiding arms for Boko Haram, and arrested around 48 people in connection, primarily Nigerians; of the total arrested, 17 suspects have been retained

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Eight alleged members of Boko Haram were killed by Cameroonian security forces during a joint police/military patrol; about a dozen Boko Haram fighters were attacked by the Cameroonian forces

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Thirty Boko Haram members arrived in Zina by motorcycle and surrounded the residence of the sub-prefect; they released their comrades imprisoned there, wounded a sergeant on duty, and stole weapons and ammunition

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian soldiers clashed with Boko Haram militants on a cross-border on Bonderi village for about half an hour, during which one Cameroonian soldier and ""a number of militants"" were wounded; the militants retreated back to Nigeria afterwards. An army vehicles and a number of weapons were stolen.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 10 heavily armed men believed to be Boko Haram members ransacked the home of an influential Cameroonian Muslim spiritual leader and kidnapped two of his teenaged children

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A policeman was killed and another injured in the Far North region; the attack was attributed to Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two Cameroonian soldiers were killed during a clash with Boko Haram when they attacked a border village.
Movement of forces: A major detachment of troops, supported by armoured vehicles, was reportedly recalled from Kolofata three days before an attack by Boko Haram on July 27.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian military forces clashed with Boko Haram in the northern region of the country, resulting in the deaths of at least 4 soldiers.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column9: Government of Cameroon (1982-); Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
column17: At least 14 people were killed when a large number of attackers (100+) assaulted Kolofata with semi-automatic weapons and rocket launchers. During the assault, Boko Haram members stormed houses of notables in Kolofata and took between 17 and 50 people hostage, including the traditional Muslim spiritual leader of the city, its mayor, his wife, some retired gendarmes, and the Deputy PM of Cameroons wife. 2 police officers were among those killed during the kidnappings.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian military forces clashed with Boko Haram fighters in Kolofata. 2 Boko Haram members were killed and 1 injured. 7 soldiers were injured.
Movement of forces: The Cameroonian military has deployed increased troops in the northern part of the country following multiple Boko Haram attacks over the past weekend.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 9 civilians were killed in an attack on a bus, and 2 soldiers was killed on an attack on their jeep. Both were believed to be carried out by Boko Haram. They also kidnapped two children of a local chief, and the elder brother to the chief of Waza, as well as a police officer. Two Boko Haram fighters were also killed.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram militants attacked the police station in Bonderi with rockets. Subsequent fighting resulted in 6 Boko Haram fighters killed and several Cameroonian police vehicles seized by militants.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Heavily armed Boko Haram fighters killed 11 during a cross-border raid.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fighters clashed with Cameroonian military forces after they interrupted their raid. Seven police officers and a gendarme are believed kidnapped, and a soldier and commander of the Bonderi gendarmerie were also seriously injured.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 3 people were killed and 15 abducted after a raid by Boko Haram on a northern border village. They also stole supplies and burned down the villages primary school.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian troops engaged with Boko Haram militants after they drove the Nigerian military out of Gambaru Ngala. Cameroonian forces also took control of a bridge in Gambaru that marks its border with Nigeria after Boko Haram militants attempted to blow it up. 30 Boko Haram fighters were reported killed over the two days of fighting around Fotokol, heavy weapons seized, and at least one vehicle destroyed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Heavy fighting was reported in Kolofata. The Cameroonian forces were forced to retreat but allegedly managed to repel Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Fighting was reported around Ashigashiya. The city was said to be partially occupied by Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian soldiers repelled an incursion by Boko Haram fighters into Fotokol. 30 Boko Haram fighters were reported killed over the two days of fighting around Fotokol, heavy weapons seized, and at least one vehicle destroyed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian forces clashes with Boko Haram fighters near Keraoua.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian forces dislodged Boko Haram fighters in the vicinity of the border communities of Keraoua and Ashigashiya after clashes.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian army has reportedly killed 40 Boko Haram insurgents in a battle that lasted three hours after they tried to enter Cameroon through Fotokol.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Cameroonian military sources report that they have killed over 100 Boko Haram fighters during a raid across the border into Fotokol from Gamboru-Ngala, including shelling by Boko Haram fighters. Cameroonian forces responded with ""intense gunfire"", and with the assistance of mortar fire, pushed Boko Haram forces out of Gamboru-Ngala on the Nigerian side of the border.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: Cameroons defense ministry has said that over 300 Boko Haram fighters have surrendered to the countries armed forces over the past three weeks.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 4 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters in Gans, leading many others to flee into the bush.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following an attack on Ashigashiya, Boko Haram fighters and Cameroonian soldiers clashed. 2 Boko Haram fighters were killed and 1 Cameroonian soldier was injured.
A rich Cameroonian merchant was killed by a militia group from CAR.

column6: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic
column17: Fighters from CAR kidnapped 15 Cameroonians and are demanding a prisoner exchange for ransom. Originally, it was unclear which group made the kidnappings, but later it was revealed to be the FDPC.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 20 people (19 civilians and 1 policeman) were killed by Boko Haram militants on an attack on a village market in Tourou.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 20 people (19 civilians and 1 policeman) were killed by Boko Haram militants on an attack on a village market in Tourou.
Clashes took place between militia groups from CAR and Cameroonian defence forces in the region of Ngaoui Adamawa.
Cameroonian soldiers were dispatched to free hostages taken by anti-Balaka fighters from eastern Cameroon. 4 were freed. It is unclear whether this operation took place within Cameroon or CAR.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 8 people were killed by a rocket attack fired by Boko Haram from Banki, Nigeria, into a crowded market in Amchide, Cameroon. Many more were injured.
Cameroonian soldiers killed 3 members of a Central African armed group reported to be composed of anti-Balaka fighters after they attacked the border town of Garoua Boulai.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: 27 hostages were released by Boko Haram, including 10 Chinese nationals kidnapped on May 16, 2014 at Waza and 17 Cameroonians (including the Deputy PMs wife) kidnapped on July 27, 2014 from Kolofata. The announcement was made by President Paul Biya on state radio, and no further details were given.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian government said that its army killed 107 Boko Haram fighters and lost 8 of its own soldiers during fighting between Oct.15-16 in Amchide and Limani. 30 civilians were also killed by Boko Haram fighters before the army arrived.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian government said that its army killed 107 Boko Haram fighters and lost 8 of its own soldiers during fighting between Oct.15-16 in Amchide and Limani. 30 civilians were also killed by Boko Haram fighters before the army arrived.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian government said that its army killed 107 Boko Haram fighters and lost 8 of its own soldiers during fighting between Oct.15-16 in Amchide and Limani. 30 civilians were also killed by Boko Haram fighters before the army arrived.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian government said that its army killed 107 Boko Haram fighters and lost 8 of its own soldiers during fighting between Oct.15-16 in Amchide and Limani. 30 civilians were also killed by Boko Haram fighters before the army arrived.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian government said that its army killed 107 Boko Haram fighters and lost 8 of its own soldiers during fighting between Oct.15-16 in Amchide and Limani. 30 civilians were also killed by Boko Haram fighters before the army arrived.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian government said that its army killed 107 Boko Haram fighters and lost 8 of its own soldiers during fighting between Oct.15-16 in Amchide and Limani. 30 civilians were also killed by Boko Haram fighters before the army arrived.
An unidentified armed group from the Central African Republic kidnapped the chief of Dole.

An unidentified armed group from the Central African Republic ambushed two trucks near the village of Yokosire between Oct.24-25, kidnapping 7 Cameroonians. While on their way back to CAR, they also kidnapped a shepherd.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 12 Boko Haram fighters, 4 Nigerian civilians and 1 Cameroonian soldier were killed during an attack by Boko Haram on the village of Glawi near Fotokol, in the Far North, and a subsequent pursuit of Boko Haram forces carried out by Cameroonian soldiers which followed the militants to the border.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Around the same time as a separate attack, 2 groups of Boko Haram fighters attempted to attack the villages of Limani and Amchide but were intercepted. 5 Boko Haram vehicles were destroyed and 27 Boko Haram fighters killed. 8 Cameroonian soldiers were killed and 11 others injured.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Around the same time as a separate attack, 2 groups of Boko Haram fighters attempted to attack the villages of Limani and Amchide but were intercepted. 5 Boko Haram vehicles were destroyed and 27 Boko Haram fighters killed. 8 Cameroonian soldiers were killed and 11 others injured.
Cameroonian defense forces clashed with an unidentified armed group from the Central African Republic and freed four hostages taken earlier that day.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 1 Cameroonian soldier was killed and another injured when their car hit a mine between Fotokol and Kousseri. The mine was reported to have been laid by Boko Haram fighters.
Clashes occurred between unnamed ""insurgents"" and Cameroonian troops, during which 5 civilians were killed.
Arrests: A former Ivorian minister and government spokesman under Laurent Gbagbo, Ahoua Don Mello, was arrested in Douala. Abidjan issued an international warrant for his arrest in 2011.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Islamist extremist group Boko Haram attacked a border town in Cameroon on Saturday, leading to six hours of fighting that killed a soldier and several insurgents, authorities said.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fighters attacked six communities in northern Cameroon almost simultaneously using armoured personnel carriers, including Fotokol, Kolofata and Talamade. The other locations were not reported. At least 3 civilians were killed in the attacks at Fotokol and the village chief of Talamade is killed. Cameroonian military sources have claimed 187 Boko Haram fighters were killed during the attacks by military forces.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fighters attacked six communities in northern Cameroon almost simultaneously using armoured personnel carriers, including Fotokol, Kolofata and Talamade. The other locations were not reported. At least 3 civilians were killed in the attacks at Fotokol and the village chief of Talamade is killed. Cameroonian military sources have claimed 187 Boko Haram fighters were killed during the attacks by military forces.

Cameroonian military sources have claimed 187 Boko Haram fighters were killed during the attacks by military forces.

Cameroonian military sources have claimed 187 Boko Haram fighters were killed during the attacks by military forces.

Cameroonian military sources have claimed 187 Boko Haram fighters were killed during the attacks by military forces.

column17: Boko Haram fighters attacked six communities in northern Cameroon almost simultaneously using armoured personnel carriers, including Fotokol, Kolofata and Talamade. The other locations were not reported. At least 3 civilians were killed in the attacks at Fotokol and the village chief of Talamade is killed. Cameroonian military sources have claimed 187 Boko Haram fighters were killed during the attacks by military forces.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian army has reportedly killed around 100 Boko Haram militants and destroyed their training camp in the far north.

column6: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic
column17: Agreement: The Government of Cameroon freed a rebel leader from CAR and secured the release of the 15 Cameroonians kidnapped by FDPC in September, along with a Polish priest and 10 civilians hostages from CAR.
A confrontation between the Bamukumbit and Baligangsen villages of the Balikumbut sub-division led to 1 fatality and the destruction of four houses in Baligangsen.
Associations claiming to represent Cameroonian civil society have demonstrated against a proposed anti-terrorism law they perceive of as draconian.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian military announced that it has been carrying out major operations in the north near Lake Chad and Ngouma since Dec.6, which have led to 7 Boko Haram fighters killed and 25 detained, as well as the seizure of military equipment.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian military has announced that 180 Boko Haram fighters were killed when 400 fighters attacked Amchide. No casualties were reported on the Cameroonian side.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram has reportedly started making more use of landmines, and 8 Cameroonian soldiers have been reported killed by explosive devices of this kind over the last 10 days.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian military has reported that 116 Boko Haram fighters were killed during an hour of fighting around Amchide. A Cameroonian soldier was also killed, and another is missing. They said this was a particularly intense attack involving almost 1000 Boko Haram fighters.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Cameroonian military says it has dismantled a Boko Haram training camp in the Far North region. 84 children being trained there were freed. About 100 people suspected of having links to Boko Haram were also arrested over the weekend.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: Africa Info reported that the President of the Cameroon Natonal Assembly went under heavy guard to the Safari locality near Kolofata, triggering an attempted hostage taking by Boko Haram which evolved into a significant offensive. The elite Rapid Intervention Battalion fought off the Boko Haram fighters. Specific casualties were not reported.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: Boko Haram attacked a number of Cameroonian villages starting on Dec.26 and continuing over the weekend, including: Amchide, Limani, Makari, Chogori, Doble, and Waza. The Cameroonian military opposed them, including the air force of Rapid Intervention Battalion. 41 Boko Haram fighters were killed in total, but they took their worst losses in Chogori at 34 killed. 1 Cameroonian soldier was killed on the Waza-Mora highway and 3 air force pilots were seriously injured.

The Cameroonian military opposed them, including the air force of Rapid Intervention Battalion. 41 Boko Haram fighters were killed in total, but they took their worst losses in Chogori at 34 killed. 1 Cameroonian soldier was killed on the Waza-Mora highway and 3 air force pilots were seriously injured.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 23 civilians were killed and Mbaljuel village in the Mozogo area burned down allegedly by Boko Haram militants.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: Boko Haram attacked the village of Achigchia, forcing the Cameroonian military to retreat. They also took the nearby military base.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: The Cameroonian military, including elements of the Rapid Intervention Battalion, took back the military base near Ashigashiya with the help of air strikes. 8 soldiers have been reported missing since they took back the camp.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: A vehicle of the BIR hit an improvised explosive device, killing 2 soldiers and injuring 2 others.
At least 15 people, including 12 security personnel, were wounded in a clash with residents of Bamali while police attempted to receover firearms allegedly stolen from Bamali palace.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fighters attacked a bus on the Waza-Mora road, killing 11 passengers and injuring 6 others. The fighters then took the remaining passengers hostage and transported them away using the bus.

Recruitment: Cameroon has said it is recruiting 20,000 more defence and security forces to fight Boko Haram following reports that the militant group, based in Nigeria, is recruiting young Cameroonians to fight for them.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fighters attacked a Cameroonian military base in Kolofata, killing 1 soldier. The Cameroonian military claims it killed 143 Boko Haram fighters and repulsed the attack at the military base and other strategic areas around the locality over 5 hours.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
