column17: At least 4 people were killed, including 3 bombers, in a suspected Boko Haram suicide attack at Double market in the Far North near the Nigerian border. Other sources estimated as many as 16 had died. Many of those injured were taken to Mora hospital.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 3 February, two women Boko Haram suicide bombers attempted to launch a suicidal attack in Kerawa: one exploded herself under the pressure of militia and the second was killed by the militia.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: On 4 February, Boko Haram men attacked Goumouldi, as a retaliation against cattle dealers. 4 houses were burned down.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 4 February, Cameroonian soldiers ambushed Boko Haram forces in Gakara, Kolofata. 6 soldiers wounded and 7 BH killed.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 6 Cameroonian soldiers were injured in a clash with Boko Haram fighters at Gakara.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 6 February 2017, Kerawa Communal Militia ambushed Boko Haram men in Bakeresse, Kerawa. 1 AK47 and a motorcycle were recovered.

Unidentified assailants allegedly used physical intimidation to prevent students from returning to classes during continued dead city strikes in Bamenda. Unidentified individuals also set fire to an administrative block in Bamenda during continued dead city strikes. A bus used by the bilingual Nitop high school was also vandalized.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Looting: On 7 February, Boko Haram soldiers attacked Bakaresse, Kolofata: mobile phones, money, cloth and food were seized.
A French school was set on fire in the Ndop during ongoing unrest in Cameroon's northwestern Anglophone region.

2 protesters were killed and 10 others injured when police opened fire on them as they tried to storm a police station in Ndop in Cameroon's northwestern Anglophone region. The protesters were demanding the release of those accused of setting a French school on fire. After the deaths, the protesters allegedly kidnapped the families of the area brigade commander and police commissioner and demanded the release of all detained youths from the area.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 11 February, vigilante militia intercepted 4 Boko Haram fighters in Waramide, close to Sandawadjiri: 1 BH killed.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 12 February, Cameroonian soldiers ambushed Boko Haram men in Bia, Mora: 2 motos seized.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Minister of Communications reported that at least 60 Boko Haram fighters were killed (4 fatalities reported in other events), a stronghold destroyed and a large stockpile of weapons seized during an offensive by Cameroonian army forces in the Mandara Mountains area since Jan.26. The minister also reported more than 5,000 people had been freed from captivity by Boko Haram. 20 suspected Boko Haram fighters were also arrested.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 3 Cameroonian soldiers were killed when their vehicle hit a mine planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters at Gouzda Vreket in Mayo-Tsanaga.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 17 February, 12 Boko Haram men attacked Doudo, Bogo: 4 motos and other goods seized. They were caught by Cameroonian soldiers. 4 dead.
The National Center for Youth and Sports Bamenda was the target of an attempted arson attack.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 21 February, Boko Haram forces were repelled from Ganse, Kolofata by Cameroonian soldiers.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 2 people were killed (including a bomber) and 2 wounded in a suicide attack by suspected Boko Haram militants in Amchide.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 24 February, Boko Haram fighters attacked Kouyape, Mayo Sava. One local militia member was killed, three shops were raided and motos seized.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

At least half a dozen schools in Cameroon's two English-speaking regions have been burned in the past week. It is the latest sign of deepening tensions as the ongoing strike in Cameroon's two English-speaking regions enters its tenth month. Residents say schools are being targeted for failing to respect the call to strike until all anglophone activists are released from detention.

Violent unrest broke out in northwestern Cameroon after gendarmes shot dead a teenage boy on Monday. The unrest points to the continued tensions in the country s two English-speaking region. Hundreds of people shouted and ran to seek refuge Monday evening at the cathedral in Cameroon s northwestern town of Kumbo amid the unrest. A school and government buildings were burned in protest.

In an official statement, Cameroon's defense minister, Joseph Beti Assomo, said that a boy was shot accidentally after villagers attacked gendarmes with locally made guns, wounding one of the gendarmes. The defense minister said the gendarmes were in Kifem on an anti-drug operation and that they opened fired in self-defense. Residents say the gendarmes seized the teenager s corpse and paraded it through the streets.
Local media report that a second person was killed early Tuesday as violence continued.

Two civilian deaths were recorded in Mamfe on 22 September.

Several thousand demonstrators took to the streets in English-speaking parts of Cameroon in protest at perceived discrimination in favour of the country's francophone majority. Several state officers were wounded and state buildings were plundered in several areas of Southwestern region. A protester was gunned down when they stormed the residence of the mayor of Buea, Ekema Patrick Esunge. Other deaths were reported in Limbe, Santa, Kumbo, Bamenda, Ekona, Bamenda and Ndop.
On 22 September, armed men raided Talamade: two civilians killed, one wounded and 8 kidnapped.
On 22 September, a farmer was hit by a landmine while going to his field in Zelevet, Mayo Tsanaga. One wounded.

During anti-government demonstrations, people shot at the security forces in Mamfe, wounding a police officer. Two civilian deaths were also recorded in the town. Another demonstrator was gunned down when they stormed the residence of the mayor of Buea, Ekema Patrick Esunge. Other deaths were reported in Limbe, Santa, Kumbo, Bamenda, Ekona, Bamenda and Ndop.

During anti-government protests, Bernard Okalia Bilai, governor of the south west region told the state daily Cameroon Tribune that protesters shot at the security forces in Mamfe, wounding a police officer. Two civilian deaths were also recorded in the town. Another protester was gunned down when they stormed the residence of the mayor of Buea, Ekema Patrick Esunge. Other deaths were reported in Limbe, Santa, Kumbo, Bamenda, Ekona, Bamenda and Ndop.

5 prisoners were killed by police as they attempted to escape from Kumbo's prison, seizing the occasion prompted by Sunday's demonstrations. Two were wounded by bullets and are at the hospital.

column17: A total of 38 identified demonstrators were killed as a result of live bullets by the defence and security forces in North-West and South-West regions of Cameroon in independence protests. 4 fatalities recorded on 28 September, remaining 34 fatalities divided between events on 1 October in Mamfe, Balikumbat, Limbe, Oku, Akwaya, Ikiliwindi, Kumba, Tombel, Eyumojock, Fontem, Muyuka, Bafut, Ekona Mbenge, Ashong, Ndop, Ndu, Bamenda, Kumbo and Beau. Arrests: Police maintained a tight grip in English-speaking Cameroon on Monday a day after the anglophone minority declared symbolic independence. In Buea, police carried out overnight arrests in one of the city's districts, and left with individuals who were in handcuffs.

column6: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: In Kumbo, soldiers shot and wounded two demonstrators around midday who had raised the blue and white flag of the Ambazonia separatist movement in the town. Later in the day, a man was killed later attempting to do the same at the local chief's palace.

column6: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: A total of 38 identified demonstrators were killed as a result of live bullets by the defence and security forces in North-West and South-West regions of Cameroon in independence protests. 4 fatalities recorded on 28 September, remaining 34 fatalities divided between events on 1 October in Mamfe, Balikumbat, Limbe, Oku, Akwaya, Ikiliwindi, Kumba, Tombel, Eyumojock, Fontem, Muyuka, Bafut, Ekona Mbenge, Ashong, Ndop, Ndu, Bamenda, Kumbo and Beau. Catholic bishops have denounced the ""barbarism"" and ""irresponsible use"" of force against demonstrators in Cameroon's English-speaking regions last weekend. ""In Bamesing, in the archdiocese of Bamenda, some young men were caught and shot on the legs,"" they added, adding that many people were arrested and ""taken away to where we do not know.""

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Double suicide bombing in Mozogo. 3 dead (2 kamikazes and 1 civilian) .

column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: Detonation: A home-made device exploded overnight near a police station in Cameroon's restless English-speaking region, where separatist leaders have launched a campaign for independence. The bomb detonated near a police unit called the Mobile Intervention Group in Bamenda. Another device nearby was safely defused by police. There was no claim of responsibility by late afternoon.

Four homemade bombs exploded in the night of 12-13 November in Bamenda, the regional capital of northwestern Cameroon, without casualties. One of the bombs exploded shortly after 9:00 pm near the mobile intervention group (GMI), a police unit often targeted in recent weeks. The other three explosions occurred at regular intervals between 3am and 4am on a commercial avenue. These different explosions did not make a victim.

column17: 6 men killed by Boko Haram in Hitawa. 100 houses, 1 church and 4 shops burned.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An IED explosion wounded 7 soldiers
A soldier was killed in Bamenda.

column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: 6 BIR soldiers and 2 civilian guides were killed during a clash with heavily armed poachers.
10 February. Military forces stormed a funeral in Meli during a search for separatists. They shot and killed one civilian at the funeral.
Security Measures: Cameroon imposed a week-long night curfew from Saturday in its restive English-speaking west citing fears of an ""imminent"" attack by separatists.
11 February. Ambazonian Separatists and military forces clashed in Ekok throughout the night.

On 11 February, during Youth Day celebrations, riots erupted in Buea when prisoners who were brought out to swell the marching ranks disappeared and Francophone Cameroonians mounted pressure on the authorities to call for payments.

On 11 February, Youth Day celebrations were disrupted in most areas in West Cameroon to protest the crisis in the Anglophone region. In places like Bali, Mamfe, Mundemba, Ndop and Muyuka, angry youths sympathetic to the detained leaders of Cameroon Anglophone Civil Society Consortium disrupted government activities planned for the day. In Mutengene, people protested with placards. In Bamenda, Buea, Kumbo, Tiko, Limbe, Kumba and Ekona, people responded to a massive civil disobedience call made by the Consortium.

In Mutengene, people protested with placards. In Bamenda, Buea, Kumbo, Tiko, Limbe, Kumba and Ekona, people responded to a massive civil disobedience call made by the Consortium.

Three soldiers were killed in the southwestern village of Kembong, during some ""scattered attacks"".

In places like Bali, Mamfe, Mundemba, Ndop and Muyuka, angry youths sympathetic to the detained leaders of Cameroon Anglophone Civil Society Consortium disrupted government activities planned for the day. In Mutengene, people protested with placards. In Bamenda, Buea, Kumbo, Tiko, Limbe, Kumba and Ekona, people responded to a massive civil disobedience call made by the Consortium.

In places like Bali, Mamfe, Mundemba, Ndop and Muyuka, angry youths sympathetic to the detained leaders of Cameroon Anglophone Civil Society Consortium disrupted government activities planned for the day. In Mutengene, people protested with placards. In Bamenda, Buea, Kumbo, Tiko, Limbe, Kumba and Ekona, people responded to a massive civil disobedience call made by the Consortium.
The deputy head of the anglophone Batibo region, Namata Diteng, had been kidnapped after his burnt-out car was found in an isolated area.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 1 Boko Haram militant killed by the army, the other died when his charge exploded.
12 February (on or before). A chief in Mundemba was killed by separatists, he was accused of supporting military forces.
12 February. Ambazonian Separatists attacked the Gendarmerie base in Toko and set fire to the mayor's home. 'Several' separatists were killed (coded as 10).
15 February. A soldier was stabbed to death by unidentified assailants in Kumba.

In February, two civilians from the mostly francophone Bamileke ethnic group in Meme were allegedly beaten with guns and machetes by Ambazonian separatists accusing them of being pro-government. One of them was left bleeding.
26 January- 26 February (sometime between). Military forces attacked Kwa Kwa (no coordinates available) and burned the village. An elderly woman was killed in the fires.
18 February. Ambazonian Separatists attacked a Gendarmerie patrol in Babensi. One soldier was killed.
Students from Bafoussam Classical High School, pushed by their professors, marched to draw attention to their poor results.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram militants killed five civilians and wounded five others in northern Cameroon after crossing the border from Nigeria.
20 February (on or before). Military forces clashed with Ambazonian Separatists in Ekok.

column9: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: 20 February. Ambazonian Separatists attacked the Gendarmerie base in Mundemba, BIR forces arrived to provide additional military support. 2-4 attackers were killed.
20 February. A doctor was shot and injured by security forces in Bamenda after her cab driver failed to follow their instructions.
20 February. Suspected separatists abducted a traditional leader in Ikiliwindi. The leader was believed to be collaborating with the military. There are also reports of a demand for a ransom.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: One dead and 150 houses burned in Vourkaza.
21 February. The body of a woman whose breasts had been cut off was discovered in Buea.
Armed men killed an education clerk and kidnapped the traditional chief and son staff in Etam.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: On 21 Feb 2018, Boko Karam/ISWAP fighters attacked Tchebe-Tchebe (Mayo Moskota). They burnt 40 houses.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 3 civilians were killed in Baljoel by Boko Haram.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 3 people killed in Kordo.
24 February. Separatists attacked a gas station and Gendarmerie base in Njinikom. A shopkeeper was killed in the cross fire and two fighters were also killed during the clash.
24 February. Ambazonian Separatists attacked military and Gendarmerie bases in Munyenge. One soldier was killed during the attack.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 5 civilians killed between Bourvare and Goumouldi. No further information.

column6: SCACUF: Southern Cameroons Ambazonia Consortium United Front
column17: A state officer was kidnapped by presumed separatists.
26 February (on or before). Soldiers attacked Bombele, suspecting separatists of hiding in the village. They burned homes in the village and destroyed property.

Movement of forces: Cameroon deployed additional troops to its English speaking regions after another wave of attacks on public buildings and the kidnapping of military and government officials by suspected armed separatists. It also imposed a month-long curfew on nighttime driving in the South-West due to the insecurity.
26 February (on or before). Soldiers attacked Boa, suspecting separatists of hiding in the village. They set fire to the village. An elderly woman who could not flee was killed in the fire.
26 February (on or before). Military forces attacked Ngumu (Mbonge, Meme), looking for Ambazonian Separatist. They burned homes and destroyed property.
Demonstrating teachers were dispersed by policemen.
28 February. The home of SDF candidate John Fru Ndi was burned down. Separatist are believed to be behind the attack after Ndi ignored their ban on the SDF congress in Bamenda.
03 March. Gendarme soldiers fire rounds in Afab village near Mamfe, Manyu, killing a child.
07 March. Ambazonian Separatists attacked a naval base in Mana. One soldier and a dozen separatists were killed (coded as 13 total fatalities).
On 7 March, one soldier was killed and three civilians wounded by suspected armed separatists in Batibo.
08 March. The Governor of the Nord Ouest issued a ban on motorcycles in Batibo, Widikum and Balikumbat. The ban is in response to the use of motor bikes by separatists.
08 March. A soldier shot and killed a motorbike rider who drove through a military post while the national anthem was being performed.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Looting: Boko Haram incursion at Chepouri village in Kolofata. Several houses were looted.
A soldier was killed in an attempted kidnapping of students by separatist militants from a school in Batibo.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 10 March soldiers clashed with BH forces in Sagme as they went to recover a herd. 4 BH men were killed in the clashes.
On 11 March, two student gendarmes were killed in an assault on the Nsongwa gendarmerie , North West, by separatists. Four others were wounded.
On 13 March, the commander of the Nguti gendarmerie and two gendarmes were killed when its brigade went under attack by suspected separatists.
On 14 March one soldier was killed by armed separatists in Kumba.
1-30 March. A curfew was imposed for the month of March throughout the Sud Ouest, with the exception of Fako.
15 March (on or around). Ambazonian Separatists burned three vehicles that attempted to travel along the Kumba-Ekombe road near Kake.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 15 March, BH kidnapped the chief of the Charack village (between Makari and Hile Alifa).

On 15 March, two Tunisians and two Cameroonians working on a public construction site were kidnapped by Ambazonian Separatists. One of the Tunisians was killed by the group. The rest of the hostages were rescued by military forces on 20/03.
In March, Ambazonian separatists tortured and killed a man in Bakundu Foe, Mbonge, accusing him to be a government informant.
17 March. A seminar in Lewoh (no coordinates available) was burned down.
17 March. Classrooms were set on fire in Bomaka (aka Womaka).

17 March. Ambazonian Separatists abducted Professor Tambo, a member of the board of education, while on his way from Alou to Menji. The perpetrators also shot the former mayor. The professor was later released.
18 March. During the weekend, a taxi driver was abducted by suspected Ambazonian Separatists while driving by Diffa (no coordinates available), near Kake.
On 17 March 40 people were abducted by ADF men while going to a political meeting in support of president Biya in Fontem.
On 17 March 4 people were wounded by ADF while going to political meeting in support of president Biya in Menji.
18 March. The home of Minister of Economy and Planning Paul Tasong in Mmockbie (no coordinates available) was burned by an unidentified group.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 20 March, a man was killed and twenty cattle heads were seized by BH men in Mayo Holta, Mayo Tsanaga.
On 20 March, security forces attempted to free the four hostages kidnapped on 15 March by supposed Ambazonian Separatists. ""Four terrorists"" and one civilian died during the operation.
On 22 March, a government official was killed and a district administrator wounded in an ambush blamed on anglophone separatists on the Azi-Alou axis.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Looting: On 23 March, BH men attacked (and presumably looted) Samana village, Bargaram. Herders had to flee.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: On 23 March, men of the Cameroonian elite Rapid Reaction Battalion have arrested 31 suspected members of Boko Haram in Kolofata.
On 23 March, security forces raided Bole village, Meme, burning houses and killing at least one civilian.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 25 March, two travellers were killed by Boko Haram men around Gassama, Logone and Chari.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 25 March, a woman was killed by Boko Haram men in Krawa-Mafa in Mayo Moskoto.
25 March. Ambazonian Separatists attacked a Gendarmerie base in Konye. One separatist was killed.
On 25 March, secessionist fighters attacked a police post and a poll station in Bangem on the Senate election-day. They were repulsed in the two cases by police. Two killed.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 26 March, the FMM post was attacked by Boko Haram in Fotokol. 2 soldiers dead, one missing and 3 wounded.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: On 26 March, Cameroonian forces arrested six Boko Haram fighters and 25 female accomplices while transporting ammunition, food, material to fabricate explosive devices, torches, drugs and medications to other Boko haram fighters in Nigeria.
26 March. Separatists clashed with security forces outside of the of the DO officer's home in Kumba. One separatist was killed.
On 26 March, Ambazonian separatists attacked the Widikum high school dormitory, killing a student.
27 March. Ambazonian fighters attacked a military base in Ikassa. Three separatists were killed.
On 30 March, a group of separatists attacked a military post in Moundogo, Ekondo Titi. 15 separatists died, 7 soldiers were wounded (2 severely)

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 30 March, a Boko Haram kamikaze was killed by the Cameroonian army in Doulo.
On 30 March, clashes between military and separatists were reported in Konye, Kumba. Houses are reported to have been reduced to ashes. Unconfirmed sources talk of military casualties.
30 March. Military forces razed homes in Big Ngwandi.
30 March. A soldier was killed during clashes with Ambazonian Separatists in Dadi.
31 March. Ambazonian Separatists abducted three chiefs from Widikum. The chiefs were accused of supporting government efforts against the separatists. The chiefs were released on 04/04.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 1 April, Cameroonian soldiers organised a military operation against BH in the Gomaram Island, Chad Lake. 10 BH men dead.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 2 April, BH elements attacked a military post in Sagme, Fotokol. 5 soldiers and 15 BH men dead; 3 soldiers wounded. The attacked soldiers were those who participated in the Gomaram operation.

On 2 April, suspected ADF separatists and government troops clashed in the bush of Nguti. The government claims that soldiers freed 12 tourists ""kidnapped"" by separatists, whereas the tour operator denied this circumstance.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 2 April, the Cameroonian army post in Amtalia, Waza, was attacked by BH men and kamikazes. 2 kamikazes dead and 1 soldier wounded.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Looting: On 1 April, BH men seized 254 cattle heads and 193 sheep in Matakaya, Amchide.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 2 April, a man was killed by BH men following an attack in Mogbere, Limani.
On 3 April, the Cameroonian army allegedly attacked the Mungo Vendeur village, Nguti. One civilian died as a result of fire, while 6 were shot down.
On 4 April, suspected ADF separatists and government troops clashed in Belo, Northwest region. At least one separatist dead.
Property destruction: Around 4 April, suspected separatists destroyed a number of houses and property in the Mbonge subdivision, including in Bakumba, Masaka, Ngwandi villages.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: On 5 April, BH elements set fire to twenty houses in Zamga, Mayo Tsanaga.
On 4 July, Magou's Pygmies, 45 km from Lomie, Est, demonstrated against the expolitation of the forest and the lack of public services in their village.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 7 April, Cameroonian forces ambushed BH men at Double bridge (Mora): 1 dead among BH men. Bikes and food were seized.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 8 April, Boko Haram men attacked the village of Alagarno (Kolofata) killing 2 people and injuring 2 others.
08 April. Ambazonian Separatists abducted a retired judge in Ewelle. The judge was released on 11/04.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 9 April, Boko Haram elements kidnapped 2 truck drivers between Mada and Zigague.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 9 April, a Boko Haram suicide bomber was arrested by police forces before triggering his explosives.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 11 April, Boko Haram elements attacked Amichde: 2 people wounded.
11 April. Ambazonian fighters ambushed a military escorted Pamol convoy in Ekondo Titi. Three soldiers were injured and three separatists were killed.
On 12 April, Cameroonian army dispersed Ambazonian elements blocking the Kumba-Buea road, after some short clashes in Kumba
During the 12 April week, Ambazonian gunmen are suspected to have kidnapped the President of a credit union in Ndian division bringing him to an unknown destination.
On 13 April, the Kumba village was attacked by Ambazonian separatists. Army repulsed them.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 16 April, 2 fishermen were killed by Boko Haram in Ngame, Waza.
On 17 April, separatists and military clashed in Ajin, North-West region: the village was burned down and several dead were reported.

Around 17 April, villages near Ajin in Nord-Ouest including Anyajua village (which is located in the Belo district), were set on fire either by Cameroonian soldiers or separatists following their clashes. Toll unknown.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 18 April 2018, Zigague vigilantes tracked Boko Haram elements and killed 4, arrested 1. They recovered also 150 cattle heads, seized by Boko Haram.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 18 April, Boko Haram men attacked Zalala, Zigague and seized a cattle herd. One wounded.
On 20 April, clashes were reported between Cameroonian soldiers and Ambazonian separatists in Lebialem: 4 Cameroonian soldiers and 15 Separatists dead. 3 Cameroonian soldiers wounded.

On 20 April, a Cameroonian military vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Ambazonian separatists in Eyumedjock nearby Menji, while going to support their fellow-soldiers engaged in a battle nearby. 2 dead and 4 severely wounded.

Around 20 April, the governor of the North-West region was attacked while going to the inauguration ceremony of an administrative officer in the Momo department. Cameroonian security forces repelled the attack. Toll unknown.
20 April. An armed group attacked a police station in Widikum. Two people were injured during the clashes.
21 April. During the weekend, an armed group attacked a naval base in Manja. 'Several' fatalities were reported .

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Looting: On 21 April, Boko Haram men looted and burned down Matakaya village, Amchide. BIR intervention later allowed to recover the cattle stolen.
On 24 April, 2 Cameroonian civilians were kidnapped by armed men in Mbalangi, South-West.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 24 April, 2 Boko Haram elements were killed by Cameroonian soldiers in Cherif Moussari, Kolofata.
On 25 April, a teacher was killed in Kumba (South-West) by a secessionist armed group. A student was also wounded.
On 25 April, Mbouda students took the street to protest the missing payment of a 3000 CFA school fee. Police was deployed.
In late April, footage recorded shows 13 soldiers setting fire to a house in Azi, Lebialem.
On 25 April, Cameroonian forces and Ambazionian separatits clashed in Kumba (South-West) after the assassination of a teacher. Toll unavailable.
On 25 April, a soldier was killed in Andek (North-West) by a presumed ambazionian armed group.
On 28 April, a teacher was gunned down after suspected separatist assailants fired gunshots at a school in the town of Muyuka, South-West.
On 28 April, two Cameroonian gendarmes were killed in Bali-Nyongha, Mezam (North-West) by armed separatists.
On 29 April, footage recorded shows the centre of the Munyenge, South West, ablaze. Government forces reportedly destroyed it and killed civilians

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 29 April, Boko Haram men attacked Bia, Kolofata: 1 dead and cattle seized.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 29 April, Boko Haram men attacked Blabline, Kolofata: 1 dead and cattle seized.
On 30 April, armed separatists attacked the Ashing school, Belo (North-West), abducting the principal and the chaplain. The chaplain was later released but the principal has not been found.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Looting: On 30 April, Boko Haram elements attacked Benesoue locality, Fotokol, seizing several cattle heads. They planted landmines to cover their retreat.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 30 April, Boko Haram elements attacked Amchide, Kolofata: 1 dead.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Around 1 May, the village chief of Kalama, Makary was kidnapped by Boko Haram. He was freed on 6 May after a ransom was paid.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 1 May, a truck was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram men in Madina, Makari. Severe material damages but no physical harm.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 2 May, groups of BH fighters attacked Mabanda village, close to the Sambisa forest, executing some villagers accused of failing to inform BH when Cameroon army arrived. The intervention of the Cameroonian army prompted BH men to retreat after some clashes. 14 civilians were executed, and 7 BH men killed when the army intervened. Dozens were wounded.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 2 May, groups of BH fighters attacked Mabanda village, close to the Sambisa forest, executing some villagers accused of failing to inform BH when Cameroon army arrived. The intervention of the Cameroonian army prompted BH men to retreat after some clashes. 14 civilians were executed, and 7 BH men killed when the army intervened. Dozens were wounded.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 3 May, a man was killed during a Boko Haram incursion in Tcherive, Mayo-Sava. 20 huts burned.
Property destruction: On 4 May, the office of Divisional Officer of the locality Nkongho, in Belo, North-West, was burnt down by unidentified men.
In early May, a video posted on social media showed the village of Kuke Mbomo, South-West (25 km north of Mount Cameroon - approx. coordinates used) destroyed by alleged Cameroonian soldiers.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 5 May, a man was killed at his field in Krawamafa by Boko Haram men.
Looting: On 5 May, some armed men burned down 40 houses at 18km from Kolofata, Mayo-Sava.
On 6 May, a gun battle between supposedly separatists and military forces took place in Mbalangi, between Kumba and Muyuka.
Around 6 May, a gun battle between separatists and military forces took place in Muyengue, close to Belo, North West. One soldier was killed.
Non-violent activity: On 6 May, gunshots were heard in Buea.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 7 May, a man was killed by Boko Haram men in Krawa, Mayo-Tsanaga.
On 7 May, a gun battle between separatists and military forces took place in Mbengwi, close to Belo.
Property destruction: On 8 May, the Government High Schoolin Bafut was set on fire by unidentified men.

On 8 may, 7 anglophone detainees attempted to walk out of the Yaounde military court during trial to express dissatisfaction at the proceedings and the bad living conditions of anglophone prisoniers. They were blocked by security forces.

Around 10 May, Cameroonian soldiers reportedly attacked Kuke, Meme: the people had gotten wind of the arrival of the soldiers and all disappeared into the nearby bushes. Military forces set the entire village on fire.
Around 10 May, Cameroonian soldiers reportedly attacked Baba Mbonge, Meme, killing 10 civilians before setting some houses ablaze.
On 10 May, 4 detainees at the Muyuka police station, South-West region, escaped after an attack on the building by unidentified men.
Property destruction: On 11 May, alleged separatists attacked Nafut's high school, North-West, causing important material damage.
On 11 May, a man not respecting the ""dead city"" day imposed by separatists was kidnapped by unidentified men in Widikum, North-Ouest.
On 12 May, Cameroonian security forces tortured an Ambazonian separatist following his arrest.
On 14 May, the Fue-Bakundu village, Meme, was attacked by the Cameroonian army, who opened fire on civilians, as some insurgents were deemed to shelter there: 37 civilians dead and 400 wound.
On 14 May, separatists and the Cameroonian army clashed in the Boa Village, Meme. 16 dead and several houses burnt down.
Month of May. Military forces raid Etoko village, near Mamfe, Manyu, searching for Ambazonian separatists and force civilians to flee.
Between 15 and 17 May, three days of clashes between Cameroonian soldiers and Ambazonian separatists in Kwakwa Kombone, Meme. 27 Cameroonian soldiers allegedly killed.
Non-violent activity: On 15 May, sounds of gun shots were heard in Buea. It is unclear whether it was a military drilling exercise or clashes between separatists and the Cameroonian army.
On 15 May, clashes between separatists and gendarmes were reported in Ekona, South-West region.
Between 15 and 17 May, three days of clashes between Cameroonian soldiers and Ambazonian separatists in Kwakwa Kombone, Meme. 27 Cameroonian soldiers allegedly killed.
On 16 May, three armed separatists exchanged fire with two Cameroonian soldiers in Buea, wounding one.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: On 17 May, Boko Haram men and security forces clashed in Wouro, Mayo Sava, as BH men attempted to seize cattle.
Between 15 and 17 May, three days of clashes between Cameroonian soldiers and Ambazonian separatists in Kwakwa Kombone, Meme. 27 Cameroonian soldiers allegedly killed.

On 14 August, some armed men attacked a convoy transporting the CPDM Member of parliament for Ngoketunjia Njingum Musa, in Babungo, Ngoketunjia Division. At least 7 separatists, 4 soldiers and one civilian were killed, several others injured.
On 14 August, clashes between soldiers and unknown gunmen were recorded in Bamenda, North West region. One dead.
On 14 August, suspected separatists tortured a Cameroonian soldier in Ediki. A video of his killing emerged online, showing him brought to a mass grave.
On 15 August, a shootout was witnessed around Muea, in Buea, South West region, as gunmen attacked soldiers leading a convoy of trucks out of the region.
On 15 August, a shootout was witnessed in Tole, Buea, between armed men and security forces. One civilian injured and residents fleeing to the bushes for safety.
On 16 August, the first assistant mayor of the Ndop council, Nkoketunjia Division of the North West region was reportedly abducted by unidentified armed men.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 17 August, 2 people were killed in Hayabe Arabe, Mora, during a raid by BH.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 17 August, a trader was killed by BH men between Tolkomari and Bornori Gana, Kolofata.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 20 August, a man was killed by BH men in Fadje, Fotokol.
On 21 August, the President of the Court of First Instance in Wum was kidnapped on the Bamenda-Wum highway by suspected separatists.
On 22 August, separatits attacked the Cameroonian army in its Furu-Awa, Menchum, camp and seized an important number of weapons. Several soldiers were wounded.
Report of massive arrests and ""torture"" by soldiers in the Wum area in reprisal for the kidnapping of the President of the Wum High Court on 21 August by suspected separatists. Toll unavailable.
On 24 August, at least two gendarmes were killed by suspected separatists in Zhoa, Wum, during clashes.
24 August. The military reported killing 10 Ambazonian Separatists in Bekora and Lipenja. The fatalities were disaggregated between the villages.
24 August. The military reported killing 10 Ambazonian Separatists in Bekora and Lipenja. The fatalities were disaggregated between the villages.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 24 August, BH men and Cameroonian soldiers clashed in Nguetchewe: no available toll.
24 August. 49 plantation workers were attacked and tortured by Ambazonian separatists in Mafange of Tiko. No casualties reported.
28 August. In retaliation for the deaths of two soldiers the week prior, military personnel attacked the village of Zoa, 20km from Wum, burning down houses.
28 August. A retired soldier was killed by separatists who suspected he was providing support to soldiers in Guzang.

column6: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column7: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Presidential Guard
column17: Recruitment: 28 August. The Ministry of Defense announced the recruitment of 2,600 new troops to join the Rapid Intervention Battalion and the Presidential Guard.
29 August. Women gathered in the streets of Buea to call for peace and negotations.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 30 August. Boko Haram attacked the town of Fotokol and looted shops in the town. One fatality was reported.
30 August. Judge Ekambi Alexander of the Ndop High Court was kidnapped from his home in Buea. Ambazonian Separatists are believed to be responsible for the kidnapping.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 30 August. Boko Haram attacked Matakaya. One person was killed.
Security measures: 31 August. The mayor of Buea banned motorbikes within the municipality in an effort to curb kidnappings and insecurity.
01 September. During the night, the Director of Bamali school was killed by unidentified armed men.

01 September. Military forces reportedly attacked the town of Pinyin in Santa subdivision (Nord-Ouest) - specifically the Kwindegli, Hausa, Ndanpang, and Ngali neighborhoods. Unconfirmed reports have put the death toll at 5.
01 September. The body of a local radio employee was found. He had reportedly been detained by security forces the day before.
02 September. A police officer was kidnapped in Kumbo. Ambazonian Separatists are believed to be responsible for the abduction.

02 September. Ambazonian separatists and the military reportedly clashed in the village of Mukanga in Muyuka. Clashes also occurred at the center of Muyuka on the same day (coded separately). No fatalities reported.
02 September. The army clashed with Ambazonian separatists in Muyuka. Four separatists were killed and three soldiers were reportedly injured.
03 September. A Principal and seven students were kidnapped by an armed group. The assailants amputated two of the principal's fingers before he was later released, along with two of the students.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 03 September. Boko Haram attacked Fotokol/Djabrali and killed two persons.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 04 September. Two persons were killed when Boko Haram attacked Gouzoudou.

04 September. The military launched an attack against Ambazonian separatists in the town of Yemngeh, 10 km from Zhoa in Menchum Division (North West) (approx. Coordinates used at 10km from Zoa). According to the army, 27 separatists were killed.

04 September. The Military reported operations against Ambazonian Separatists in Ndop, Bamessing, and Bambalang. The Separatists camps were destroyed. A 'dozen' fatalities were reported (coded as 12 then disaggregated between the three locations).

04 September. The Military reported operations against Ambazonian Separatists in Ndop, Bamessing, and Bambalang. The Separatists camps were destroyed. A 'dozen' fatalities were reported (coded as 12 then disaggregated between the three locations).

04 September. The Military reported operations against Ambazonian Separatists in Ndop, Bamessing, and Bambalang. The Separatists camps were destroyed. A 'dozen' fatalities were reported (coded as 12 then disaggregated between the three locations).

04 September. Ambazonian Separatists reportedly entered Bamenda in the morning and went to the hotel where the Minister of Education was staying. The group then clashed with military forces in the city. The government reports three fatalities, while other sources have indicated five.
04 September. The Fon of the Bafut kingdom was kidnapped by separatists who alleged he was supporting military efforts against the group. He was released by the assailants a few hours later.
Weapons seizure: 05 September. The military announced the seizure of over 800 firearms from armed separatists in Nord-Ouest.
05 September. A civilian car hit a landmine in Zourou. No indication of fatalities.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: 05 September. Boko Haram ambushed a Rapid Intervention Battalion vehicle with a rocket in Malloumri (Kolofata). Five military personnel were wounded in the attack.
07 September. Hundreds of women protested in Bamenda. The women protested against the continued conflict in the region.
07 September. A father and his three sons were shot by the military. They were reportedly mistaken for secessionists.

08 September. Separatists launched an attack on a road construction site at the entrance to Bamenda. During the attack at least one civilian was killed (some sources indicate two fatalities). The separatists used the equipment to dig a large hole in the road, effectively cutting off the transportation route to Bamenda.

Arrests: 08 September. Security forces detained 40 armed individuals sailing on three boats off the coast of Limbe. It is believed they were sailing from Nigeria to Cameroon to provide arms and combat support to Ambazonian Separatists.

column6: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 08 September. Boko Haram attempted to loot a shop in Gouzoudou but were repelled by BIR forces.
09 September. Separatists attacked the police station and gendarmerie barracks in Oku. Three police officers were reportedly abducted during the attack. No indication of fatalities.
09 September. Two youths were killed in Ekona, reportedly by the military.
09 September. The Russian ambassador to Cameroon was reportedly attacked at a hotel in Yaounde by unidentified armed men.

11 September. Military forces reportedly killed 15 separatists and captured two others during a raid on a hideout in Chomba. They also recovered arms and ammunition. Two soldiers reportedly sustained injuries.
11 September. Separatists reportedly attacked military forces at mile 16 in Muea. One police officer and three separatists were reportedly killed during the clash.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Joint Task Force
column17: 11 September. Boko Haram ambushed a multinational task force in Limani, killing one.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 11 September. Local residents reported an attack on Dyounde by Boko Haram. The attackers were repelled by a local militia group. Coordinates were approximated based on 15km from Double and near Ngalbiwa.
12 September. The traditional leader of Wututu was kidnapped by armed men. The military freed him on 14 September, however, he sustained a bullet injury during the military's attack on his captors.
12 September. Guards at state-owned telecommunications corporation Camtel's office in Limbe demonstrated in front of the building to demand unpaid salaries.

12 September. Ambazonian separatists and military forces have reportedly been clashing around Tadu. Locals reported fatalities on both sides (coded as 10). The coordinates for Tadu are approximate, based on its proximity to Kumbo within the Bui district.
13 September. Separatists launched an attack on a military base in Nkwen. The military forces repelled the attackers, killing six of the separatists.

Property destruction: 14 September. Following clashes against Ambazonian separatists in the area, military forces reportedly burned homes in Tadu. Residents have reportedly been displaced, seeking refuge in the bush. Location coordinates are approximate.
14 September. Ambazonian separatists and military forces reportedly clashed in Bafut. According to local sources, civilians accounted for the majority of the 'half a dozen' fatalities (coded as 6).

September 2018. Verified video depicting Ambazonian separatists holding the decapitated head of a police officer. The date of the incident and the precise location are unclear, although the location is believe to have occurred in Belo.
Month of September. Residents protest poor energy provision in Dimako, stopping traffic on the RN 10 from Yaounde to Bertoua. [size=crowds]
16 September. Military personnel reported seizing control of an Ambazonian Separatists camp in Ekona Mbenge, without a violent confrontation. The military seized weapons and destroyed the camp.
16 September. The traditional ruler of Bojoke was kidnapped by an unidentified armed group. The coordinates for Bojoke are approximate, based on its location near Bonjongo.
16 September (on or around). A civilian was killed by a stray bullet at a check-point that was intended for unidentified gunmen.
16 September (on or around). Security forces reportedly shot and killed a teacher in Bali. The forces checked the man's phone then proceeded to shoot him.

16 September. Separatist forces stormed the Saint Joseph's College near Buea. Government sources reported 20 injured during the attack. According to local sources, the separatists demanded the school send pupils home by September 19.

17 September (on or around). A man was killed by soldiers near the Ndu Tea Estate, an area patrolled by security forces. The soldiers then dropped the body off at the Tatum Council. No further details on why the man was killed.
17 September. Military forces reportedly seized control of an Ambazonian camp in Njikwa. Approximately 30 separatists were killed during the attack and two soldiers were injured.
17 September. Separatists and military forces clashed in Oku. No indication on fatalities.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 17 September. The military killed two members of Boko Haram in Zelevet.
17 September. Military forces attack Acha Tugui village, killing two men and injuring one other.

18 September. The state government in Nord-Ouest has implemented new requirements for anyone traveling outside of the state. Travelers must disclose why they are leaving and where they are going, failure to do so will result in being prohibited from leaving. This measure comes as many civilians in the Nord and Sud Ouest are fleeing from the on-going conflict between military forces and Ambazonian Separatists.
18 September. The Mayor of Kumba's son and driver were kidnapped by unidentified armed men while driving on the Matoh road. They were released after several hours.
19 September. Military forces reportedly killed two men in the village of Babanki

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 19 September. Boko Haram attacked the village of Goreya, killing four IDPs and injuring one other person. The coordinates are approximate, based on location being 18km from Blangoua in Blangoua commune.

column8: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
column17: 20 September. A BIR vehicle hit an IED near Amchide. Six soldiers were injured.

20 September (on or around). Military forces entered the neighborhood of Boh Kamadoh in Bali looking for separatists and beat five women in an effort to get information. They also reportedly killed a disabled man and 'molested' another man.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 20 September. Boko Haram looted the Goudjimdele health centre.

21 September. The Minister of Defense signed an order placing Anglophone areas of Yaounde under military surveillance until the October 7th elections. The neighborhoods named in the order were Obili, Biyem-Assi, and Etoug-Ebe.
21 September. Military forces and separatists have reportedly clashed in Bafut. No indication of fatalities.
21 September. Military forces raided a separatist hideout and killed an Ambazonian leader known as ""Commando"" in Kumba.

22 September. The military reportedly mistook a group of civilian men loading a truck for separatists and opened fire on them. Seven fatalities were reported. Coordinates for this location are approximate, based on location a few kilometres from Kitiwum at the outskirts of Kumbo town.

22 September. An unidentified group destroyed a bridge along the Ndop-Bamali road to prevent military reinforcements from entering the area. A temporary bridge has been constructed but it cannot support large vehicles.

column7: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
column17: 23 September. A member of the MRC assaulted an SDF supporter before a political rally, tearing his t-shirt apart.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On September 24, between Djabire town in Dargala district (Diamare, Extreme Nord), Boko Haram killed six people.
24 September. Soldiers killed two men in Ndop and burned down two houses. Residents fled to the bush.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 24 September. Boko Haram entered Yegoua and looted a local shop.
24 September. Ambazonian separatists attacked a military base in Essu. Locals reported 10 fatalities, including seven soldiers.
24 September. Ambazonian separatists attacked a military base in Bonjongo ,leaving one soldier injured. The separatists stole weapons during the attack.
24 September. Soldiers reportedly killed two civilian male youths in Buea.
24 September. Security forces reportedly killed two young men who tried to flee when they saw the soldiers approaching in Kumba.
25 September. Armed men entered the village of Wangara and killed two civilians. The group also stole goats which were later retrieved by BIR.
26 September. Ambazonian separatists attacked the district police station in Limbe, killing two police officers and wounding another. The separatists then stole weapons from the station.
19 September - 3 October. Military forces took over the Balikumbat health centre and turned it into military barracks.

column8: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
column17: 26 September. Armed men stormed a prison in Wum, freeing at least 80 inmates.
27 September (on or around). Military forces and separatists exchanged fire in Bamenda. No indication of fatalities.
27 September. Military forces stormed the house of a man in Bachuo Ntai and killed the man and his two sons. Another man was also killed by the soldiers.
27 September. Soldiers shot and killed seven men in Buea. It is unknown if any of the victims were separatist, but according to witnesses none of the victims were armed.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 27 September. Boko Haram attacked seven civilians in Tala Malabrahim, four were beheaded, two escaped and an elderly man was spared.
28 September. The military launched an attack on a separatist camp in Ndop. Six separatists were reportedly killed.
28 September. A student was beaten to death by a police officer at Yaounde University, for failing to comply when a faculty member asked him to remove his hat.
28 September. Military forces and separatists exchanged gun fire for hours in Bali-Nyonga. At least one civilian death confirmed at time of reporting.
